Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just took my 2nd injection yesterday. Week one was rough with the nausea but I had zofran for that but at times it didnt work. The nausea kicked in like day 4. I lost 7 lbs. My doctor weighed me last Thursday I was 265. I am currently 258. I am not really thinking about sweets like I use to. I dont get up at night for that 4 pack reese cup. When I eat I only eat a little because #1 I'm afraid to overeat and get sick. #2 I just don't have that desire to overeat. I really think it is working forme.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: On my 4 th week of .25 injection. Unbelievable how this medicine makes me feel like I can stop eating when I’ve had a normal serving and don’t go back for seconds. I snack off and on during the day and have a nutritious meal in the evening. Drink water and take fiber supplements. Try to eat low fat or I get acid reflux. Started at Nov 18 @289.9lbs. Now Dec 13 @278lbs. Female 5’7” -58 yrs old
Lost 2 stone in 10 weeks. Over the moon with the results

I was on Victoza (liraglutide) for 5 years and my DBII numbers stayed healthy for my age.  I remember noticing in the first 2-3 months of taking Liraglutide that my appetite went down and I did loose some weight.  But after that period my old appetite returned and so did my weight (180 +15 lbs).
When the study I was on for liraglutide was over I switched to Ozempic (about a year ago) The A1C numbers actually improved and my weight went down similar to the liraglutide.  However, after 1 year, I still maintain the 10-15 lb drop in weight and my appetite is similar to when I started on the medication!  For me, absolutely no side effects.  A matter of fact my ischemic heart condition seems to have improved too (physically I can do more exercise)  Thus for me, a 76  year old male, I can't say enough good for the medication!

I took this on recommendation of my physician. It screwed my kidneys! I took it for 3 years, my numbers were always in range irregardless, she told me it would help lose weight, hogwash! I changed my diet (to the zone) and lost 60 lbs. I quit taking all my diabetic meds as I felt so good. I weaned my self off this garbage and my doctor said I would gain all my weight back! Nonsense! I have even lost more weight! The whole time I was on this drug I felt it playing with my kidneys. Understand my numbers were never to the point of causing kidney problems and I know there’s more to it than that. Just my experience!

Oh,Oh,Ozempic … Taking this for type 2 diabetes and it was terrible!!!! 8 weeks in and I am able to eat 1 meal a day with nausea 1 week after my last shot of .50mg . 2 days after the shot sulfur burps and diarrhea. Everything I eat I burp up great feeling. I am not using  Ozempic to take off weight but it sure has done that. I just want to eat like a normal person again and have my life back. I can barely bike 10 miles I am burping most of time. This stuff should not be on the market. Save yourmoney if you want to take off weight just stop eating because that’s all ozempic is going to do for you. Stock up on loperamide and adult diapers you will need them. Pepto for the sulfur burps. I am not using Ozempic again I am not able to keep my high blood pressure meds in me.  Again stop eating, loperamide, pepto and most importantly ADULT DIAPERS!! Good luck you will need it!!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am on Ozempic 10 weeks and I lost 30lbs. I can’t believe it. I am at 1mg and having spouts of nausea and vomiting. I also have heartburn but it subsided. I am still learning what I can and cannot eat. If I have too much food it sits in my stomach I wind up throwing up. In the morning I am the most nauseous. Coffee makes me more nauseous. But this medicine does work! It reduces your appetite where it makes you conscious of what you are eating. You must limit your eating to small portions.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Using for weight loss and it is working… 30 lbs in 2 months but i have another 70 to go. Im 62. I can now eat for simple enjoyment and not need to fill up, very freeing. The S/E though are a drag. Im on the full weekly dose and now have the sulfur burps and diarrhea that i understand will settle down in a few weeks. I got myself fat so this is my payback and will hang on. I feel cold and a bit tired as well so my temper is short i hear from my wife. But, i like the results and will stay with it.My Doc is watching my pancreas with blood tests.  Find a close bathroom as you move around during the day. Never trust a wee fart.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: My initial weight was 237lbs. I am down 65 lbs in 7 months to 173lbs. The medication was so effective that I stayed on .25mg and then .5mg for longer than typical and have been on 1.0mg for 6 weeks. No negative symptoms for me. I've had hypoglycaemic symptoms (low blood sugar) since I was a teenager (I'm 52), but no medical tests would affirm this. Since taking Ozempic these lows are now gone, and I cried because now I finally know what just being hungry feels like. I am paying close attention to hunger cues now as my trigger to eat. I don't eat a lot in a day, but the food tastes better to me than pre-Ozempic. I feel so much better - arthritic knees don't hurt, inconvenience gone, congestion improved. I have gone from a size 20 jeans to a 10. I know my results are not typical, but for me it is an absolute miracle drug.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I was in the pre diabetic range when I started to use this medication. It was given to me for two reasons. One to help me manage my sugars better and to help me lose weight. But personally it did not help me lose weight but it did help me bring my A1C from 6.0 to 5.9. My A1C was at 6.0 before I started Ozempic. I started to use this medication somewhere in July or August of 2021, and had to stop it July of this year because I have gallbladder stones and my doctor said Ozempic is known to cause that. 
Now here is where my worry and question comes in, I question how dependent does your body become on this medication. I say this because I stopped it like I said July of this year and my sugars were ok and my A1C in August was 5.9 but November came and my A1C spiked to 7.2. How and why did this happen in 2 or 3 months? I know I was in prediabetic range but I could probably expected a rise maybe of 6 or 6.1 but 7.2? So now they said I am diabetic. 
So has this happen to anyone else? I also am going to get my gallbladder stones checked and see if I don't need surgery. Thanks Ozempic.

I started three weeks ago, weightloss for overweight but not obese person, mostly to help with arthritis in my knees and for vanity. I also have high cholesterol but has been unaffected by my weight loss or gain (I have weighed from 52kgs up to 70kgs with no chance, also have been vegan for 7 years with no change - so I'm not hopeful here). Relatively easy to use although the syringe system is a bit fussy and having to buy the higher doses as the lower ones are unavailable in my country, and then adjusting the syringe hasn't been simple. First time I took it, in the evening and could not sleep that night, also very badly for the following 5days. Have returned to normal now. Very strong appetite supressant effects the first five days (on 0.25) then fell to relatively normal appetite again, so I was quite stressed. On my second dose, no 'nervous feelings' but the appetite suppressant effect has stronly diminished - I just don't feel like snacking, but can eat otherwise normal meals. Had diarrhea the first couple of days, nothing since. No palpitations, no nausea, no constipation, maybe a little more gas than usual. Have taken my third dose now, same feeling - no side effects but only a minimal appetite suppressant effect, let's say 20% less which is still great, but not as reported by others (not being able to eat fatty foods, not feeling hungry at all). Maybe I should up my dose.

I've been on ozempic since June I was wearing 278 lb and now I'm 210 I'm pleased with the results but the side effects are killing me the stomach pain the throwing up feeling full all the time taste buds change can't sleep at night feeling sick and tired all the time but far as the weight loss I'm pleased with that

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This medication WORKS to reduce your appetite. It’s certainly not immediate, but within 10-14 days you notice a significant reduction in cravings. By the 3rd week, I was having to convince myself to eat. I have been on every medication out there to reduce my appetite (Wellbutrin, phentermine, topiramate, etc), but nothing has helped except Ozempic. The first few doses definitely caused side effects like headache, nausea, general malaise and discomfort. I almost gave up because the side effects were overshadowing the weight loss, but eventually I got accustomed to it. This certainly works so I wouldn’t hesitate to try it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person

Trying to lose weight for my knee condition and my BMI was high .I read about all of the side effects so i keep my dose at 0.25 and stayed there - I have only lost 8lbs but my gut has shrunk considerably-my diet changed from a lot of bad foods to now enjoying Soups and salads daily -smaller portions and many restaurant items i take home for leftovers .I do get a bit backed up from time to time  but it usually corrects itself in a day -My entire got to for food has changed dramatically-Hard boiled egg for breakfast and canned tuna for lunch .I’m staying on this at .025 for another 8 weeks and see where it takes me -If nothing else it taught me how to re eat at every meal and i’ve gone from 2-3x clothes to xl - 2x ..So we will see where min dose takes me ??

Again I’m not sure I got a dose, but thepen did click back down to zero, which just may be a quark of the pen it’s self
I use a pen to control my cholesterol. You have a pen, you put it on your skin, you hit the button, you’re done. It’s as easy as pie and this pen is absolutely not.  By the way all the little needle things came flying off the cardboard and landed all over the floor. I’m assuming it won’t matter which needle I use on any given week.

Needless to say I will not be taking this drug any longer.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

Have been on Ozempic for weight loss for 10 months now. It's been an interesting journey, I definitely lost weight, about 18 LBS over this time period, but I also have to say that I do not enjoy my meals as much as I used to before starting the medication. That said it is highly effective in what it is supposed to do. 
A lot of doctors might be reluctant to prescribe it for weight loss because technically only Wegovy is approved for weight loss by the FDA. 
It took me a while to find somone to prescribe Ozempic, but currently getting it from QuickMD. Wegovy is backordered anyway, so cannot get it even if I was willing to pay the additional price for it. 
Speaking of, the reason I am not fully satisfied with it is the crazy high price, about 900 a month for Ozempic.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve lost 35lbs….  I started in July, now October. The side effects have diminished, yes they were unpleasant but worth it.  Key to continue using this is the understanding your body.  Most importantly drink! drink! drink! Water ?? I’ve remained on 1 mg, just picked up my third month on the 1 mg. The nausea has gone away, heartburn, and the constipation.  The constipation was the hardest hurdle.  Just give your body the time to get used to the medication.

Push past the initial upset tummy folks, its worth it! Give it 3 months and you will be amazed. Yes, at first horrible side effects like nausea, tiredness and diarrhea (with metformin- I stopped metformin and the diarrheas' stopped). Be aware this will change how you see food, we can no longer really eat red meat often as it makes you feel heavy or nausea; that goes for pig too. A diet high in veggies and chicken and fish is our future so find some recipes to try out. Also, I found homemade broth soups like egg drop soup are easy and easy on the tummy. I have lost 30lbs in 6 months and my A1C is down from 10 to 5.1, I rarely see above 160 even after eating!
Just feeling sick... otherwise ok..

I suffer from chronic gastritis.  I have been on Ozempic at .25 for 5 weeks and doctor is finally listening to me about the SEVERE stomach pain.  Taking me off this.  I have never felt so sick from a med before.  I have no quality of life due to the stomach pain.  It did help my blood sugar come down to normal range but I feel like my stomach is being attacked and this med is HORRIBLE.  And I did not lose any weight.  I wish I had found these reviews before starting this med.

I started the Optifast (liquid protein) program for weight loss on 6/21/2022 and my doctor then introduced me to Ozempic about a month later.  I started taking .25 and stayed on that dose for about 6 weeks and stopped the Optifast since my appetite went down tremendously...no cravings, I then increased it to .50.  and remain on .50 right now.  My A1C went from 8.3 to 5.8 after 3 months.  My fasting sugar was 183....it is now 78.  I eat salad and vegetables with occasional chicken or fish.  The rest of my bloodwork is excellent.  Ozempic has given me the gift of low appetite and has improved a lifetime of insulin resistance.  I am currently down 77 lbs...OZEMPIC is a Godsend for me.  I had some mild side effects in the beginning that went away after my second dose.  My primary care doctor even told me that these new drugs will wipe out obesity and type II diabetes in our lifetime.  Thank you!!!!!

I have only been on for two months but have lost ten pounds and, most significantly, gained one to two hours per day back because I no longer crash in the afternoon and need to nap. It's amazing how my glucose levels stablized and my sugar-food cravings disappeared. Was apprehensive about side effects but did not have any until I stepped up to a 1 ml dose and experienced two days of naseau and one unpleasant episode of throwing up. I may either drop my dose to .75 or .5. I would like to stay onthis because the effect on my energy level has been profound and the .5 dose has been working great.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Male, age 33, weight 94 kg, height 179 cm. Started Ozempic 0.5 on Sep 18 2022 at the recommendation of my doctor, following these blood test results:
- Uric Acid: 8.2 mg/DL (reference interval: 3.5 - 7.2 mg/DL)
- Total Cholesterol: 226 mg/DL (reference interval: Attention! - 200 - 240 mg/DL)
- Triglycerides: 173 mg/DL (reference interval: Attention! - 150 - 199 mg/DL)
All others were within the parameters.

Day one: 94 kg.
One week after first dose: 91 kg.
One week after second dose: 90 kg.
Oneweek after third dose: 88 kg.
One week after fourth dose: 86 kg.

Symptoms during first month: Feeling a little tired from time to time.
Benefits during first month: loss of appetite for junk food, sweets, sodas; Sleep is better; Constant energy throughout the day (with few exceptions).

During this time, I am doing low/medium-intensity exercise and I am eating a little healthier than before.

Amazed after my personal experience that this drug is allowed on the market. When i went on the full dose stomach aches diarrhea, vomiting No wonder people lose weight when you are too ill to eat.
Seen some other reviews that state terrible side effects but still give it high marks because they have lost weight ! . Of course you  will lose weight if you are too ill to eat .WAKE UP PEOPLE.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Update from review posted on Sept 20th. It's been approximately 3wks since I last reviewed, and I said I would update as I'm not feeling as enthusiastic. I've been on the higher dose of 0.5mg for 3wks and I'm feeling quite ill most of the time. My tummy is upset every morning, I have nausea every day, and I'm vomiting every couple of days it seems. I can't understand why I've been vomiting but I can only think it might be due to the food having a slow-release from the stomach and anything that hasn't had a chance yet to digest, goes bad and therefore you've no choice but to vomit. I've also noticed that my libido is now non-existant. I've read reviews on other websites and it looks like I'm not the only person experiencing this. This isn't listed as an official side effect so maybe the side effects list needs to be updated? As a result of the always feeling ill, I've become house-bound because I no longer have the energy to go for walks and meet up with friends and I know this is very unhealthy. Anyway, I'm going to give myself another week of this and, if things don't improve, I'm going to ask my doctor to reduce the dosage back down to 0.25mg for the foreseeable.

Started with .25 then .50 then 1. now I am on 2. Blood sugar is avg. 170 every morning.

I'm going to cease using this medication as I cannot live my life feeling this way. I was to understand the side effect would decrease after approx 4 weeks. they did not they got worse. Taking only 0.25mg

Textual Review:
loosing weight, 8.5lbs off in 2 weeks.I am so tired with it. I can hardly eat anything as I feel full all the time (bloated) but happy with that as I really want to loose weight. 
I did feel as tho I was pregnant but I deff not at the age of 61 lol with all the symptoms. Also I cannot drink alcohol, the thought of it want to make me be sick.

I began taking Ozempic at .25 mg and went up to .50mg. Minimal side effects at .25 mg. When I started .50 mg., I began experiencing lightheadedness, heart racing with palpitations and weakness. Went to the emergency room and the said I had orthostatic hypotension which is when you go from standing to sitting your body drops more than 20 pts. Told me to stop taking Ozempic immediately. Come to find out orthostatic hypertension occurs to 10% of people taking this. That’s a pretty high percentage and should be listed openly (not in small print) as a possible side effect. Stopped taking the weekly shot and the bp is back to normal as is the heart rate. If you take it, be aware this could possible happen to you. I did regulated my insulin and lost weight in the 4 months I took it, but it’s not worth it to me to continue this.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I am based in Ireland and Ozempic is €150pm here, or free if you have Diabetes. I don't have diabetes so I pay €150pm. I know the Govt are trying to reduce the price because Ozempic is half the price in France and Poland! 

I am on my fifth week of using Ozempic. The first four weeks, I was on 0.25mg, and now I'm on 0.5mg. I will increase to 1mg in a couple of weeks and stay on that for the foreseeable. 

I have lost 14.5lbs so far and I am ecstatic about that! I have PCOS and so it's been verydifficult for me to lose weight the traditional way but Ozempic makes it so easy for me. I have been feeling quite ill every morning. It starts in the early hours of the morning and lasts right through until about 10am. That's nausea, acid reflux, and an upset tummy. In the two days since increasing the dose to 0.5mg, I have been feeling these side effects a bit more. I read loads of the reviews below where some people were saying the experienced fecal incontinence. I thought I was lucky because I hadn't had that side effect since I started taking Ozempic but I actually experienced this for the first time this morning. A bit embarrassing! But, I think taking everything into consideration, it's not enough to deter me from continuing to take Ozempic. Seeing the reductions on my scales is enough to make me want to continue. 

To try and reduce the side effects, my doctor advised that I eat as low fat as possible because it's the fat the exacerbates the side effects. She's right because I can see the difference between if I eat really low fat vs. a "normal" meal. 

My starting weight was 260lbs and I'm 5ft 6.5". My current weight is 246lbs and I'm feeling so much more confident in myself. My husband and I are taking a trip to Vienna in a month and I look forward to finally being able to take a proper photo of the both of us without worrying about what I look like! Yes, Ozempic can be expensive, but the confidence I now feel is priceless :)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Was getting nauseous when taken in the day time but I switch to night time before bed and all symptoms went away

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I have been taking Ozempic for 8 weeks and have lost 26 lbs.
My starting weight was 202 lbs and I am 5'4"
I am now at 176 lbs.

I started at the .25 dose for two weeks and went up to .50 only after two weeks.
Next week I am going up to 1 mg weekly dose.
I felt slightly neauseaus at first but gravol helped with that.
I still carry around the gravol ginger shews and eat a few of those when I feel slightly nauseous. 
Gravol helps!
Aside from a slightly upset stomach, my only other complaint has been remembering to not eat too much!
When I eat too much, I don't feel well, and the one time I ate way too much, I vomited...

My typical day of eating is one boiled egg and coffee with cream for breakfast...one cup of salad and a about 2-3 oz protein for lunch and a small dinner like half a chicken breast and a few pieces  of broccoli.
If I eat more than this I feel crappy.
Sometimes I only have a cup of popcorn for dinner....
It is amazing how little I care about food now that I am taking Ozempic once a week.  
This medication has been my saving grace and I recomend it to anyone needing to loose weight.

Started June16 with 1/4 unit shot. Felt less craving for food within days. Noticed weight loss a week or so in. Continued weekly for 4 weeks, then went to 1/2 unit. Ongoing weight loss and eating a smaller portion makes hungry feeling go away so less food intake. Switched to 1 unit after 8 weeks. Had "heavy transit" for one day during week 9, then normal again. Also, in the same week, i had a really bad day = feeling very sleepy and skin that was feeling sensitive. Weight loss from day one tillSept 16 = 26 lbs. The weight loss in my case is like a seesaw it will be at a certain weight for 3,4 days or so, then go down a pound, then stay again for 3,4 days then go down again liek a seesaw stock market situation. My blood glucose numbers have dramatically gone down, monitoring with CGM. Following this development, some other diabetes indicators such as pain in hands and feet have disappeared without flare ups. It's been,and hopefully will remain, a positive treatment in my situation.

A few side effects starting with the 0.25 mL dose and, naturally, progressing with the 0.5 and 1.0 mL doses. The side effects (GI upset, fatigue, brain fog) can be devastating. I do believe the manufacturer recommendations regarding timing of step up doses, for most, is optimistic at best. But, here's the thing; there is no set standard, or real medical necessity, for the manufacturers step up dose timing. It is entirely possible to stay at the 0.5 mL dose for longer than a month if needed withno ill effect. My doctor agreed and prescribed me the 1.0 mL dose and recommended very incremental increased dosing. Just because you have a 1.0 mL pen, doesn't mean you have to use the entire 1.0 mL dose. From the 0.5 mL dose, I stepped up to 0.6 mL, then 0.7, 0.8, etc. This absolutely helped manage side effects and allowed a far more realistic adjustment period than the manufacturers recommended jumps of 0.25 to 0.5 to 1.0 mL.

So many serious side effects (January 2022 - September 2022), Headaches, er pain level abdominal pain radiating to back, crazy dreams fatigue and more  After 3 ER visits, Multiple GI and Endo visits not one Identified this drug as a potential problem.   After self research and discussing with my Primary I stopped taking and feel so much better so fast. I would never recommend this drug.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Semaglutide has not helped me lose even one pound (I weigh 300+ pounds) during the first 4+ weeks.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started on .25 end of June beginning of July went to .5 after 4 weeks I just upped to 1mg today… to date I’ve lost 25 pounds in just over 2 months without much effort…I have nausea the day I take my shot and the day after… I’m super happy with the results so far!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I began taking this medication about 4 months ago. I started at the lowest dose of .25mg and then moved up monthly. I'm currently at 1mg and will be moving to 2mg next week. I'm so pleased with this medication. I've lost approximately 35lbs so far. I've been on a strict diet and also go to the gym when I can, as well. But, I attribute most of the loss to this drug because nothing was moving the needle, until I started using it. I have barely no appetite and have to force myself to eat. I never really realized how much my life revolved around food until I didn't depend on it for comfort anymore. The only side effect I have is constipation, which I take stool softeners for. You can't expect to eat large meals with this and feel well. You really have to pretend like you just got bariatric surgery and can only digest small portions and nothing heavy. I feel this is why a lot of people report getting sick with GI issues. They continue to eat like usual. This MUST be a full lifestyle change to be effective and if you can power through some of the side effects and make the necessary healthy changes, you will be so pleasantly surprised. This changed my life for the better and I feel like a new person.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I’ve been taking Ozempic for 10 weeks, started at.25 then increased every 4 weeks to my current dose which is 1mg per week. The only side effects I’ve noticed are slight constipation, acid reflux and tiredness. I have no appetite at all and try to eat two healthy meals per day but to date I’ve not had ANY weight loss. ???? 
What am I doing wrong? I don’t understand. It just doesn’t seem to be working for me. I’m going to increase my water intake which is something I haven’t really been doing andcontinue for 4 more weeks if still no weight loss then I’ll stop taking it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Started in June. At first I loved how the weight would slowly come off. Then I started to have weird side effects such as heavy menstrual bleeding with clots, so long and heavy that I had to go to OB GYN to start oral contraceptives to stop the bleeding after 30 straight days of bleeding. OBGYN did ultrasound and said that I shouldn’t be bleeding as my endometrial tissue was very thin. 
I have had very low blood pressure reading of 80s/60s, calf cramps, and a random frozen shoulder that I had togo to orthopedics for. Never these issues before starting medication. Very bizarre. 
HSV 1 that started after many years of being dormant. 
Not sure the weight loss is worth the side effects?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been taking .25 for two weeks and have had mild nausea and headaches along with fatigue. During this second week I have had horrible joint pain in my knee after using my thigh as an injection site. I have lost 0 pounds. My appetite is gone my cravings are gone but the scale does not move. Trying to power through the side effects in hopes that this will work for me. It’s hard to move and exercise with such horrid pain in my knees.

Type 2 diabetes has been hard to control. Started with 25 for four weeks and had to stop. Felt weak, lightheaded and blacked out three times. My blood pressure began dropping dramatically. I had no appetite. Wasn’t a right fit for me. I don’t have weight to lose. Can’t have blood pressure dropping and have risk of injury or worse.
Started taking the 0.25 started feeling sick after i had eggs. So i'm going to see what food works best and skip one that don't work.

I have a BMI of 50.5 and am on the border of type II Diabetes.  A1c of 6.2.  I am taking Ozempic as a first line treatment for the impending diabetes and the obesity.  I have other issues related to auto-immune disease such as hidradenitis suppurativa, atopic dermatitis, and IBS.  I also have asthma, elevated cholesterol, and high blood pressure.

The first thing I noticed about taking Ozempic is that my IBS was immediately relieved but I started getting mood swings and irritability.  The effectof 0.25mg wore off within 3 days and I immediately got rebound diarrhea and felt lethargic.  After increasing to 0.5mg per week, the effect lasted 5 to 6 days and then began the IBS rebound and feeling bad.  On 1mg per week, everything seems normal and I only loose control of my appetite on the 6th and 7th days, no other effect noticed.

This medication actually makes me feel normal at a full dose.  I have a bowel movement every 36 to 48 hours and have good control over my eating habits.  The only thing I have a hard time giving up are the grains, especially wheat, that seem to cause a lot of inflammation in my body.  I notice that I feel good when I especially avoid wheat. But sadly, I like bread a lot.

The hardest thing to get over is psychological dependency on eating as a way to find happiness in life and to deal with my emotions.  I am free to enjoy other things now besides eating.  My whole life seemed to revolve around eating and the planning of meals.

My experience seems to be different from others I have read here but I hope this helps.  God bless you all.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Sunday Sept 4. Type II. Average blood sugar was running @ 180-220, weight 328. So I needed to do something to address these issues. Started Ozempic Friday morning. Immediate result was a decided lowering of my blood sugar, which read 149 Saturday Morning, and 128 this (Sunday) morning. Appetite gone. however this morning minor stomach cramps - and unusual number of Bowel movements, - usually 1, this morning 2 and diarrhea, but nothing major. Look, with these kinds of positives, I'ma stick with it through the (for me) minor negatives.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: It did take a little while to get past some stomach aches but we’ll worth the results. I started in 2020 weighing 230 pounds. Now with the help of ozempic I am down to 168 pounds and feeling great.

So many horrible side effects,  abdominal pain radiating into back, headaches, extreme fatigue, ... You may be one with no side effects, good for you!  If  one has nor taken I suggest the severity of these side effects are not worth the risk

It's a good treatment and looks good. Weight loss good  but not enough meds in the pen to last full month.  At first I thought I messed up becauee I was taking. 50 twice because doc had just upped my dosage.  But 1mg pen only lasted 3 weekd..pretty hard to screw up ..this is second pen to do this. My copay isn't cheap..I can't get discount.  Please help

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been taking ozempic for about two months. I'm down 40lbs. Appetite is absolutely gone. I am never hungry. I also believe ozempic could be the reason I drink a lot less alcohol than I use to. The day after my .5 injection is still the toughest and I just feel weird for a day or two but then I'm back to normal.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I just finished 8 weeks on Ozempic and about to start week 9 with the 1.0 dose.  I started with .25 dose and lost about 5 pounds without really trying. Increased to .50 after 4 weeks and lost another 5 pounds. Side effect have been minimal.  Mostly troubled by constipation and acid reflux. Nausea not a problem. Not really thirsty so don’t think I am drinking enough water.  Will make and effort next 4 week and getting ready to start an exercise plan.  I started at 170 lbs and today I weigh 156 lbs. Overall happy with drug.  Reduces my appetite and has allowed me to effortlessly reduced the amount of food I eat in a day.

I haven’t been on Ozempic long, but I’m not thinking it’s doing anything for me, beside the constipation, headaches, nausea, dizziness, and exhaustion.

I’ve been on it long enough to take 5 once-a-week doses now,  four at 0.25 and one at 0.5. Each week, I’ve had different side effects. The first week, there was mild nausea, diarrhea, dizziness, and exhaustion, Second week brought stronger nausea to the point of vomiting. Doc prescribed something for it, but it didn’t really help. Third week, the nausea went away, but there was severe constipation. Fourth week, I had sharp abdominal pains (probably due to the continuing constipation) and some dizziness. Fifth week (upped dose to 0.5), I had the first migraine that I’ve had in years, along with more nausea again, and still with the constipation.

The reason that I’ve stuck it out this long is because the doc and my mom (who has been on this med for a while) told me that the side effects would dissipate and the weight loss would be worth it. I was also told that I would lose interest in eating and I would feel full almost all of the time. Neither has been true for me. I still have the same late-night snacking urges that helped me put on the weight. The only thing that I’ve noticed is that I can’t eat as much, because I start feeling nauseous after eating about half of what I used to. The bad thing about that, though, is that I had a sleeve gastrectomy, so I was already eating about half of what a non-sleeved person eats.

I plan to try to stick it out until my next A1c (which was 9.3 at my last appointment), to see if it makes any change there. If it makes enough of.a difference there and I do actually see a dissipation of side effects, then I’ll stay on it. If the A1C doesn’t come down significantly, then I don’t see a point to the suffering that this medicine is causing me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I had my first dose yesterday starting with 0.25mg. I read many scary comments here but keeping my fingers crossed and hoping I don't get any of those. 24 hours now, I can feel the hunger but do not have crave for food. I am hoping this will continue till I lose the extra 15 pounds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: 4 weeks at 0.25 dose; a bit of nausea and stomach bloating and acid reflux.  Manage it with pepcid and omeprazole; drink cold water.  YOU MUST EAT HIGH QUALITY PROTEIN AND VEGETABLES.  You will want to eat less, make sure it's proper building blocks.  I lost all sugar cravings! down 10 pounds in 6 weeks. Get your walking or biking in - read the insert!  do the 150 minutes per weeks exercise.  Ozempic works to support changes I have been making, nothing is a miracle cure - but this one helps nudge all your work in the right direction - you will lose weight.  If the nausea gets bad eat a graham cracker, use ginger ale with sugar.  Don't be afraid of foods any longer - just eat better since you will not feel like eating much.  Start tracking your calorie intake - you will be amazed.  If you are not motivated to lose weight then don't use the medication.

I started this med beginning of April 2022 and have lost 40 lbs. Here's the thing. I started on 0.25 mg for 4 weeks. Not realizing it, but I got so sick, I couldn't eat, had to force myself, dizzy, vomiting, diarrhea (which I have IBS, so was used to that) severe stomache pain, nausea. I missed 2 weeks of work, couldn't drive because I was so dizzy, didn't do anything around my house. At the end of 2 weeks, my husband took me to the hospital. My blood pressure was 66/55 (I have high blood pressure, and on meds for it) blood tests showed my kidneys were not happy (Doctors words) they gave me 2 bags of Saline and my blood pressure went up. I was very dehydrated. I went and seen my GI Doctor, she did some tests on me and my white blood cells were high, my potassium low, she actually called it Anorexic. After 5 months I'm happy that I've lost 40 lbs, but all of the symptoms are still there. I've missed way too much work. I have one more dose in my pen for 1.0 mg that I'm not going to take. My doctor has given me the lower dose pen. They suggest not to quit cold turkey so I will do a 0.25 shot tomorrow. But if I'm still feeling this way, I have come to the conclusion it's not worth it. My son gets married on September 10th and I want to enjoy myself. I just hope I don't gain much weight back and these symptoms go way soon.
Well tolerated medication with dose 0.25 4 weeks, then 0.5 4 weeks, then 1 mg till now, perfect levels of blood sugar, 8 months later HbA1c level of 5,6%, lost 25 kg weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I take for weight loss. I have other medical issues that make losing weight impossible. Was on Phentermine and lost like 50lbs (220 to 170) but then it stopped working. Over the course of a few months I got back to 198. Started ozempic at .25 doses... did this for 2 weeks...typical side effects (sleepiness, nausea and direahea) stayed at .25 for 2 weeks. As side effects were not that bad I moved to .50 on the 3rd week. Side effects were about the same. Today I'm taking my 3rd dose on .50 (5th over all dose)... I'm down to 170!! Woot woot! 20ish pounds in about a month. I am super happy and hope this continues. 

I am noticing that I'm barely eating.. like I'm technically anorexic based on my calorie intake... I'm just not hungry and if I do eat it's cramps and direahea.... I've also had a few instances lately were I felt something like hypoglycemia shock.. that is scary of course but when this happens I just eat some chocolate or something and I feel better. ?? 

I'm curious if anyone else has similar side effects?

I know those side effects might seem harsh but really I'm feeling pretty normal most of the time and the weight loss makes up for it!

Also my dog said I wouldn't even lose weight in the first 1 to 2 months as this is time for your body to get used to medicine and for the medicine to build up in your system, so I was very surprised to be losing weight immediately. 

I have not change the way I eat or added exercise either.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started 2 weeks and 2 days ago and I’ve lost 21lbs.  But I’ve also made changes to my diet since being diagnosed with type 2 diabetes.  But I’m happy with the results.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: just started been two weeks at .25 dose. heartburn and acid reflex is my side effect but managed with nexium. I am very disappointed at how the medical field classifies this medication. covered under a drug plan if you are a diabetic but if you are not and medical need to lose the weight for surgery it is not covered. this is super expensive for the amount of months/years that I will be having to take this with no guarantee that this will be successful. I surely hope I am not wasting the $260. amonth on this. feel like it will be another kick in the face. Put me back into depression and disappointment.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Pens do not last the full month as stated. Having to take Metamucil for diarrhea then sometimes I’m constipated for days. I have Medicare part D and have been on ozempic for about 5 months and now I’ve used up all of my prescription money for the year so having to pay full price for all of my medication. My doctor did fill out a form with ozempic and they are going to give me 4 free months thank goodness because I cannot afford it. I’ve only lost 12 pounds since I’ve been on it and get very nauseas after taking it. It’s working though so I’m happy. It’s frustrating though that other insurance companies pat ask but $25 and people on Medicare have to pay a fortune. I still think Medicare, deductibles, prescriptions etc should be free. People never work a day in their lives get free Medicaid we work and still have to pay. Good luck to all of those on it because for me it’s slowly working. I move up to 2mg next week.

As far as blood glucose levels no difference really . As far as weight loss none . Not sure it works at all . Started at .25 the upped to .5 now 1 . I would say this drug works the way advertised for very few people .

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Used Ozempic specifically for weight loss. I lost 20 pounds in four weeks tapering from the .25 those to the .5 dose.   Extremely impressed with the results.  Only downside after stopping as I have the sense my thyroid levels have been tweaked or affected and I’m having it tested.

4 weeks .25 dose on second dose @ .5 mg. A1C is better from 8-9 in morning to 7-7.5. As for weight loss,ZERO pounds!!! I exercise and eat healthy. Why NO weight loss.
Very annoying when will I see the weight loss?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just went from .25 mg to .5 mg today so I've completed a full two weeks on this medication.  I've lost 5 pounds to date which doesn't feel like very much considering how little I'm eating.  I haven't felt hunger in two weeks and my cravings are significantly less.  I'm hoping that as I go up in dosage that my weight loss will accelerate. I take other medications that increase my blood sugar levels so I'm hoping that this medication will counteract that leading to weight loss.  overall I'm veryhappy, but hoping for better results with the increased dosage.  I'll post an update as I (hopefully) progress!

I used the .25 for 4 weeks then .5 for 4 weeks, I've been increasingly tired and fatigued as I increase the dosage. My wife has been insisting that I get off of the Ozempic shots. My glucose levels have not decreased since using the Ozempic shots. Ozempic has cost me a lot of money since I had to pay the Medicare Part D deductible.
Lightheadedness.  Diarrhea.  Dehydration.  Nausea.
Lost 20 pounds since may but lost most of my long thick beautiful hair. Not worth it. Very sad.

I'm on week 7 overall, 3rd week on the .5 dose. So far I've lost 6 pounds, which although nice to see...isn't impressing me. I eat very healthily, been vegan for many years and don't eat grains at all (no bread, rice, pasta...none of that.)
I've been lucky to have experienced  few side effects. The doctor's  goal is to get me up to a maintenance dose of 2.4. Hopefully  I begin to see better results by then.

I just gave myself the last .25mg dose. Next week I will move to .5mg. Overall I feel great. My appetite is drastically less. I do not snack between meals and am lucky to get in 2 meals a day. I have been doing some light exercise but nothing dramatic. As of today, I am down 9lbs. I do not have any side effects luckily. I highly recommend this medication to anyone struggling with weight loss or high blood sugar numbers.

Started on 0.25 for 4 weeks with the only side effect of fatigue.. than I was up dosed to 0.5 my taste buds have changed, vomiting and can hardly get out of bed that I am that exhausted.. I cannot stand the smell or sight of food at all.. I was taking trulicity prior to ozempic and comparing them both, trulicty had harsher side effects.. I have another 3 weeks of 0.5mg of ozempic and pray the side effects ease.. 1 cup of coffee and I am struggling to get through that .. will come back for an update in a few weeks time

Ozempic is worse than cholera. 2 weekly 0.25 doses = Liquid diarrhea for 15days and counting + extremely painful cramping & vomiting. 0/10. Make sure your doc knows how -exactly- it is affecting you in real time as there is no antidote. Antihistamines and corticosteroid can help per UCLA Med Center.

After 8 weeks still on .25 MG  stomach pain ,constipation and diarrhea. Have your stools changed consistency? I know that is a weird question  but I haven't had solid stool. Also what is the most weight lost in a month,  I seem to be losing fast which concerns me. I have lost 13 lbs in 2 months. Is this normal

Just started 2 weeks into treatment and I have to say no side effects. I was scared to start and held off due to all the reviews but as far as I am concerned  nothing noticeable.  I am on it to help get past a plateau lost 50 pounds and cannot seem to go any lower. I will update if anything changes but so far so good

I just started taking it 9beginning of July) and after my first dose I started having a heavy period, passing clots.  After week 4 I am still bleeding.  I had to stop taking it as I feel tired and drained.
2nd week of .25 and I Live on the toilet. Diarrhea and cramping. No appetite (which I don't mind) but is it worth it?

I finally found something that stopped the constant desire to eat . I never felt full. I’m insulin resistant, obese on glycemic chart, always showed high glucose on blood work. Diabetes is hereditary in my family. I did ALL the diets . Started WW at age 12. Lost weight yes slowly plateaus for months and months then I’d eat and gain back the weight. A friend told me about metabolic clinic through our hospital and she had tremendous success. I was psyched!
I qualified for the rx and my insurance paid for a lot of it but I paid $190. A syringe which lasts 6 weeks.
Painless injection. 
So nauseous like most here. Urge to eat gone. Maybe too gone. I couldn’t eat. Was losing weight like crazy and that felt great. My dx prescribed zohran which is a life saver for me.( 4 mg maybe once a day or 5 days out of 7).
After a month I was supposed to go up to .50 but .25 was working and finally I was able to eat a little because not eating isn’t the way i
Wanted to go. My doctor said if 2.5 is working stay on it so that’s what I did it’s been about almost 3 months and I’ve lost 22 pounds I feel great weight wise but the nausea continues here and there. My doctor said to watch the carbs and sugar because that could activate the nausea and when I did that I less nausea but the thing is I really don’t want to give up things like watermelon, blueberries and some other fruit. So I’ve been staying on .25 and it still helps me to tell me when I’m full I’m still eating a fraction of what I used to eat and the good part other than the weight loss is that my blood pressure medication has been cut in half and then actually then cut in half again so for me that’s fabulous to have those meds tapered my heart doctor is thrilled with weight loss and she’s OK with this Way to go to lose weight I’d to have questioned whether I wanna keep living like this in order to stay sinner or less fat and I don’t know how long I can do this it’s a nausea doesn’t ever subside . Many days I feel just fine so I really have to probably start watching what I’m eating to see what the reaction is and I’m finding that if I eat watermelon at night and I feel fine I don’t feel fine the next morning I am so thankful for this medication and somebody finally addressing the fact that we overweight people need some help as well I plan on going back to Weight Watchers only to get the camaraderie and I’d like to listen to the strategies of a diet plan. sometimes though I’m so tired I can’t exercise it’s weird I have normal days and then days where I’m just really tired. My doctors are taking blood frequently and keeping eyes on what’s going on which makes me feel good I don’t blame anybody for not being able to continue on this medication because it is a little rough but if it’s not that bad it’s a miracle drug I wish it wasn’t so incredibly expensive and The drug manufacturers would stop overcharging us crazy prices if you find that your pen doesn’t deliver the correct amount you can contact them which is what I did when my pen didn’t give me the correct doses and they actually gave me a coupon for a free pan which was great because it cost me $190 a pen they said they would send me an envelope to get the pan to see what’s wrong with it but I waited for weeks and they never sent it so I threw out the pen . One thing I don’t understand is the pen clearly states that after six doses even if you have more medication left in the pen you must throw it out I don’t understand why especially since it cost so much money why that’s something that you have to do it makes me feel like maybe the company is just trying to get more money out of us and of course that’s not right.

I've been on Ozempic for 4 months. My doctor tiered the dosage from .25 mg for 4 weeks, then .50 mg for 4 weeks, then increased to 1 MG for the remaining time. I've just gone in for a check up, and increased to the 2 mg dose beginning this week. 
Each dose I experienced some stomach knots, but they resolved after the first day of the adjustment. I did initially have some very mild nauseum but all I needed to do, was take a sip of cold water to take care of it. I stress, the nauseum was very verymild. I do have a bit of constipation, but I balance with stool softeners and strict keto (high fat). 
I've lost 21 pounds to this point and this medication is the first thing that's controlled my appetite. I used to feel hungry all the time but now I don't feel like I need to eat all the time. I don't snack all the time like I used to.
I was doing everything I was supposed to, I was working out and strict keto. But, I was stuck and couldn't lose any more weight. The medical community doesn't treat obesity like a medical condition, they just look at us like we can't control ourselves and we're lazy. 
I'm happy that I haven't had the severe side effects that others have, Ozempic has been a valuable tool in my weight loss journey. I hope to continue on it.
I’ve been taking Ozempic for a few months now & since I moved up to 5 mg/week I haven’t had a single pen that has lasted through the full six doses. Has anyone else been shortchanged?

I have been on Ozempic for 6 weeks. I guess I am lucky because the only side effect I have had is maybe tiredness - none of the terrible problems some have reported. I am still on the .5 dose since it is still working for me. My doctor left it up to me to decide if I want to go to 1.0 dose. He told me to just watch carbs and keep them under 100 gm a day. I have had no problem doing that even though I used to be a carb addict. I have lost 20 lbs in the past 6 weeks. I log all my food on an app. Istarted this for weight loss -- I am a Type 2 diabetic, my A1C is 7.3 when I started. My finger sticks are now in the 90s.

If you don't mind constant nausea, and constipation so bad it causes bleeding hemorrhoids, and constant fatigue so you can't lead a normal life, plus getting sick because you are eating NOTHING and not getting nutrients, then this drug is for YOU! I stopped taking it after 5 weeks. Only lost 5 pounds. Not worth the terrible side effects.

My mother started taking Ozempic for her T2 Diabetes about 2 yrs ago and had a tremendous weight loss as a side effect with little effort, along with an excellent result in her A1C being lowered. I approached my weight loss doctor about the possibility of using Ozempic/Wegovy for weight loss (I have a BMI of 38, 240Lbs at 5' 4"). I have been on it for 4 months now with tremendous results. I have tried many other plans, including every diet imaginable, WW, Gastric Banding, Gastric Bypass, etc, with temporary success. But nothing would ever remove the feeling of being "hungry" and wanting to binge. Ozempic has done the trick. 

Yes, there are side effects that can be uncomfortable. If you are nauseous, ask your doctor for Zofran (an anti-nausea medication that really works). If you have gas, use simethicone 250mg. 

I realize I may need to remain on this for the rest of my life, but that is a small price to pay to reduce the risk of heart disease, diabetes & stroke, which all run in my family. Thank you, Novo-Nordisk!

I have taken Ozempic now for 5 weeks, I just up my dose 3 days ago to .5mg, and the last 2 injections within 48 hours I was waken through the night with the worst cramps in my life, the first time it lasted about 30 minutes and I spent that time on the toilet, and it wasn’t pretty… however this time, which I am still recovering from, started around 4am, and the excruciating pain lasted for an hour or more, too the point I was ready to call an ambulance, I literally thought I was going to die, the pain was so intense that it made me vomit, I’ve never experienced anything like this before. After consulting with my dr a few minutes ago, we have decided I will no longer take this drug, as it is no way to live, even though I have seen some success weight loss wise, but the matter at hand regarding the amount of pain really is just unbearable. I am still laying in my bed, my husband had to take the day off of work to watch the kids, as I am in no way capable of doing so because of the aftermath of what I went through, my body is exhausted, and my stomach is still very sore, and my energy is depleted, I hope others have a more pain free experience, as I would not wish this on my worst enemy.

I have had nothing but nausea, excessive fatigue and heart burn with burping alot. I was only taking .25 and I had to stop it on my 3rd week as I truly felt HORRIBLE on it. Way too many awful side affects for me!

I started at .25 and experienced terrible nausea and vomiting. I increased to .5 and the nausea is worse. I have lost 30 pounds in the short amount of time but not sure if it's worth it. Going back to .25 before I decide to stay on it or not.
I had shortness of breath, literally could not walk! I blame it all on Ozempic but i have chronic Pneumonia!

I began taking .5mg in Feb 2019. A1c has been under control and I lost 30+ lbs. After 3 years, I noticed my numbers being higher and gaining 15 lbs. Increased Ozempic to 1mg and it's lowering my numbers and weight again. I've felt tired and had an upset stomach then I remembered those are side effects of Ozempic which should resolve in 2 or 3 weeks maximum.

I am T2 diabetic and in 2021 my Dr prescribed Ozempic to help shed some weight.  After one month I couldn't cope with the side effects any longer and told my Dr I wasn't taking them.  No weight was lost.  She then prescribed another diabetic drug.  That was in October 2021.  Since then I have had no appetite and when we go out for a lovely meal I get halfway through and cannot eat another bite, not even to force myself.  Breakfast is the only meal I am hungry for and can eat but come lunch and especially dinner I have no motivation or desire to eat or even cook for the family.  I'd love to know how to reverse this situation so I can go back to feeling "normal" again.  All my Dr can say is Oh really, that's no good.

I am now on week 6. I have followed the dosage schedule  0.25mg x 4 weeks  and now 0.5mg. Not one pound lost. Is this normal? Everyone I know on this medication has lost 8-10 klbs by week 6. I am happy that it brought down my HBA1C to a normal level. Has anyone experience no weight loss? Did moving up to 1mg assist?

Update... I am now on the 3rd week at the 1.0mg dose and I have been so very sick ever since I moved up to 1.0mg.
I was due to have my 4th dose two days ago, but am too afraid to take it. I've had no further weight loss, actually gone up a few pounds. Have been so sick, had to call into work and have had such pain and many sleepless nights because I have to stay in the washroom. I wanted this to work so badly, but I am going to give up on Ozempic now, as I cannot tolerate the 1.0mg dose.

I have tried two different times over a period of several weeks to get to 1ml. The sides effects have been horrendous. Ended up in emergency for prolonged vomiting and diarrhea. Lower left quadrant pain as well. Oh I lost weight. But it was not worth the decline in the rest of my health. It has taken me a long time to feel healthy again.

Started taking this medication due to insulin resistance, and I took the .25 mg for 6 weeks before moving up to the .5. Besides the occasional bout of nausea and fatigue when moving up a dose, it’s been fine thus far, apart from my most recent dose change. I took the .5 for 5 weeks, since on the fifth week I didn’t have access to the 1 mg pen yet, and I took my first dose of 1 mg just the other day and I have been violently ill since. I just wish there was a .75 mg marking instead of it being strictly a 1 mg pen, because doubling your dose like that really sucks. I’ve gagged countless times, can’t stay fully upright for long due to stomach problems, appear to have gastroparesis, and nearly all the contents of my stomach are liquefied, but haven’t passed on to the intestines yet. I’ve also had gas pain through the roof and also have burped a lot more than normal, despite me having GERD regardless of the Ozempic. Because of the nausea, that burping nearly makes me throw up every single time. I’ve been stuck in a recliner unable to move because of surgery before, and had a laparoscopic gallbladder removal, but nothing has ever really affected me this bad, apart from COVID-19. I’m seriously considering going to the emergency room if this doesn’t let up. The 1 mg pen also isn’t near potent enough; because of the sheer volume of the 1 mg dose, it pooled in the injection site and was extremely uncomfortable. I just wish you could get the same dose while injecting less fluid into yourself.

Help! I have a pen - administered two .25 doses and now on my third one nothing is happening. The .25 isn't going down to zero? Am I doing something wrong or is the pen malfunctioning? It's an expensive malfunction if so!

This is week 11 on Ozempic. I am 65, female, type 2 diabetic. My starting weight was 144, I am now at 136. Starting A1c - 6.5. I started with 2 weeks at .25, followed by 2 weeks at .50, then 4 weeks at 1.0, 2 weeks at 1.5 and now on 2.0 dose. My morning fasting numbers have dropped from the 140’s to the 110’s. I went from taking 2000 mg Metformin and 6.25  mg of Alogliptin daily to just the Ozempic. I have had some minor side effects, loss of appetitive, slight constipation, some fatigue. I havecontinued my daily walking which I have done for over 12 years and eat anything I want,(within reason as I still watch my carbs). I have found that eating small amounts of food several times a day has kept me from having any nausea and vomiting. I inject into my thighs. I do have occasional minor cramping in my intestines. Ozempic has taken me from the overweight range to the normal weight range and am looking forward to seeing the decrease in my A1c.
I been taking .5 once a week and getting real sick to the point where I can't function. Bad stomach ache and nausea

I started using Ozempic as I was showing symptoms of pre-type 2 diabetes and had elevated blood sugar levels. This medication has changed my life. I have dealt with weight issues due to PCOS since I was a teenager. Ozempic has helped curb my cravings and I have steadily lost 1.5-2 lbs a week. I did have side effects when I started but the ability to turn away food and know when my body was full far outweighs any discomfort. It is an injection which is a little unnerving but the needle is super small. 
I just had my lab work done and all my levels were fine. I have been doing a .5 ml but will be switching to the 1 ml next week. I still exercise everyday and eat right, it’s not a miracle drug, but Ozempic has given me that little extra boost to get my weight loss journey started.

Once on the 1mg dosage became very ill after a couple of months .Really bad stomach problems. First pain in stomach followed by constipation ,then really bad  diarrhea , then later in the  day vomiting. This was going on for nearly 3 weeks. Saw the  diabetic nurse and she agreed for me to stop taking it. Three or four days later felt better ,three weeks later right as rain .I feel this is a dangerous drug after my experience.

Switched from Wegovy due to supply problems making getting the script filled impossible. More side effects with Ozempic for some reason. A lot of belching and passing of incredible amounts of gas (not frequently, but each episode is enormous!). Easy to use.

I am taking this medication to help with weight loss, as I am not diabetic. 
I started with the usual .25 dose for 4 weeks and it didn't do anything in terms of weight loss or for hunger. I felt mild symptoms, mostly just tiredness but nothing too terrible. When I increased the dose to .50, the tiredness increased as well and I felt a little discomfort at times, but again nothing major. I did not lose any weight and it did not help with hunger. I am now on my second week at the 1.0 dose and my hunger is completely gone. I have no cravings for food and I find that I am for needing my tell myself to eat. I started a low calorie diet(Noom) on June 01/22 as well, and I am happy to say that in since then(17days ago) I have lost 13lbs. I think the combination for Ozempic at 1.0 dose and the low cal diet is the magic wand and is working for me. I have bouts of dizziness, still very tired but the lbs are melting off almost effortlessly. I encourage people to give it some time and press on through the ill effects, it gets better and I have much hope that this medication will help me towards my goals in weight loss. Good luck all, hope this helps?? 
I will try to post in the future with updates.
I started Ozempic on June 7, 2022. It is now June 15th and have lost 10 lbs. My 2nd injection was yesterday and I'm noticing a weird taste in my mouth. It isn't bad enough to cause concerns.

I have lost almost 60lbs, started at .25 increased to .50 and then to 1mg.  No real side effects to speak of other than constipation so I take Miralax daily. A1C went from 8.3 to 6.7, Dr. increased me to 2mg and I experienced nausea, so am going back to 1mg as that seems to be my sweet spot. Still steadily losing weight which is a blessing and I eat when I am hungry, but small portions as not real hungry and making better choices.
Started .25 for 2 months. Have been on .5 for 6 months. Started ozempic at 265 current weight 229. Extremely happy with results. Slim fast twice a day and 1 meal
im now up to 1mg on my ozempic and ive pretty much lost my appetite and the weight is just dropping off so easily

For reference, I really work closely with my endocrinologist to take control of my health and here are my results so far.  Just dosed 8th week on Wed.  First four weeks 2.5 now using.5.  Only problems I experienced at .25 was moderate bloat and foul burping.  Did not lose weight or experience any nasty nausea or constipation.  Past four weeks at .50, drastically different effects and results.  So nauseaus, throwing up frequently, like 2-3x per day, bad constipation which leads to more vomiting.Or if i begin to heat up and start sweating.

I've read enough of these reviews to know what can occur so I'm roughing it out until my follow up next week with my Dr.  I've lost ~15bs these past four weeks.  My blood sugar went low for the first time in my life so I've discontinued Humalog 20 units x2 daily and I'm testing good range glucose-normal for 2 weeks now. Dr also took me off Januvia to start so I'm taking .50 ozempic and Jardiance only now.  Honestly I don't think I can keep this up unless the nausea and tiredness subsides which I hate to think of stopping since it is working.  Just some nasty nausea and constipation, very little appetite. My urination has drastically been reduced, too. I've read where people say that's because the sugar isn't needing to be flushed as frequently frequently and I know I'm not drinking enough water because I'm always full.

I started this medication in early February with typical instructions. Four weeks of 0.25mg followed by four weeks of 0.5mg and 1mg thereafter. It is now early June and I have lost 35 pounds. I am feeling more confident and and am relieved to not see the number on the scale steadily increasing anymore. I highly recommend trying it.

has done nothing after a few months, is a nuisance to use, will likely stop taking this
no weight loss
no reduction of A1C - I have stead 6.5
no side effects

I took my first dose. The day after I had a rash on my back, then stomach, around my eyes are swelling. My legs have a rash and on my upper inner thighs. Wound up in emergency room getting treatment for an allergic reaction!  Very disappointed! It took away my appetite and seemed like it would have worked for weight loss. I don’t know about diabetes though, only took one dose and had the awful allergic reaction.

Zero side effects so far. I'm on 1mg a week now. My weight is steadily going down and I have lost 21 pounds with zero effort. I am unable to eat even a quarter of what I used to. Sweets have lost their luster and I have no desire to eat sweets like I used to. I don't obsess over food either. This is a wonder drug.

I have just taken my 12th dose and I am down 35 pounds. Easy to use and minimal side effects. I take vitamins also daily, b13, d3, c, biotin, collegan and fiber chews. I follow my dr direction for food intake. Low carb 50 grams per meal or less and water. Long way to go to reach my goal weight but Ozempic will help me get there :)

Ozempic has stabilised my blood glucose levels and increased my weight loss target to a better health since I commenced using it in conjunction with a healthy portion diet and exercise. It’s an appetite suppressant as it slows down gastric function. I found constipation can be a side effect and no appetite.

Just started a few days ago. Had a lingering headache, and some constipation. My headache came back today -maybe because I ate a heavy-sugar snack?  As others previously mentioned, I have that "weird" feeling in my tummy. lol, it's not even something you can identify with to be honest, it's just weird. The feeling of not needing to eat is there, the mental part is the difficult part- I KNOW that Nanaimo bar tastes good... do I really want it-- or just recall that it tastes good.. weighing in whether to tackle it or not...yet side tracked in any way takes me away from the memory of good food. So that's good!
Gas-- yes biggest gassy noises ever- glad I can go outside quickly to pass. Needle is not worth mentioning- simple, no pain, just sit on skin, press button, count and release. Simple. 
I do not know of it's effectiveness yet, however I know my daughter lost 16lbs in two weeks. The cost is not covered for me, but it is so important for me to take the weight off my knees that it's worth scrimping for- plus I will buy less goodies! Win-win. I will touch base as my body decides what it's going to do.. Way too many diets, too silly to have surgery and risk my life- this could be a real God-send to so many of us that have been on the yoyo dieting train for too many years to count! Good Luck to all.

I have been using this drug for about a year now.  I had very mild nausea the first week.  No issues since then.  My A1C is now 6.0.  I eat pretty much what I want and I have lost over 50lb.  I might be a rare exception, but I am getting ready to talk to my doctor about reducing the dosage.  I am now losing unwanted weight.  I was 215 lbs and now I am 160.

I started on .25 m  and it was okay.  I went to .5 and I felt really ill and missed far to much work (2 days a week).  I dropped back to .25.  My symptoms were nausea, but also feeling extremely tired, and headaches.  I didn't vomit (phew) but I wasn't able to function effectively.  Dropping back to .25 has helped a lot, but it doesn't bring the sugars down as much as I would like.  I will keep trying to up the dose to .5.  In the meantime I'm sticking with .25.
I am on Ozempic 7 weeks feeling good except for the nausea , I have 16 pounds lost and I am very happy , I used to drink a lot of Coke Zero but I can’t handle the taste anymore , , thanks for reading

Absolutely discusted it didn't work for me I tried 0.25 lost 11lbs then was put on 0.50 put on weight made Me very tired kept me awake used the toilet a lot at nite and for €150 pm it's a joke made me constipated too didn't supress my appetite so wasn't impressed waste of money at all am going to have gastric sleve

I’m not going to lie, reading some of these reviews made me very scared to try Ozempic. I’m so glad I took the plunge!  I have had zero side effects so far ab I just took my 3rd dose of .25. In 14 days I have lost 9.8 pounds and can’t wait to loose more!!  I definitely don’t eat nearly as much but with diet and a little exercise. I’m finding Ozempic to be a life saver.

I have been a diabetic2 for 30 years, on the same medication, but doctor advised the meds were being phased out and put me on Ozempic .0.25 for 4 weeks.
I consider myself to me of very high tolerance, but the side effects were horrible, fatigued, nauseous, lightheaded, stomach cramps ,daily diarrhoea no matter what I ate, and just feeling off. My doctor said to persevere, it gets better, and I did just that ,it has now been 14 weeks, and still on 0.25. and I am still no better, not much weight loss, but sugars have lowered somewhat. I haven’t been out of the house for weeks. I don’t think this medication is for me..
I have lost 60 pounds in 12 months. Now I’m afraid to stop using it. Any one else stop using and maintained wright?

I have been on this medication for weight loss, let me tell you, I immediately saw a difference in my thoughts of food and my need for food all the time! 

So far I’ve lost about 10lbs, my need for food is way less than it was and I can totally go without food for a while, and when I do eat I only eat a tiny bit then I’m completely full!

The use of the pen is super easy and I like how it comes with the needles. 

I’d recommend this to anyone who wants to lose weight as this is the best injection that I’ve come across! 

Very happy with Ozempic!

I was placed on this medication due to type 2 diabetes. Aside from finally having my blood sugars regulated and losing about 10lbs since starting this, i must say the constipation, stomach discomfort and sulfuric belching are terrible.

Besides having a weird tummy feeling, the medicine seems to be working.  I lost two pounds in one week, I'm never really hungry and have much better control over my eating. I don't craze sugar snacks as they tend to make me feel back so i stay away from them.

I have lost 17 pounds in less than 2 months.  This drug has freed me from constant hunger and thinking about food all the time.  I have had some stomach issues but nothing I can't handle.  It helps that I work from home so I don't have to worry about the stomach issues so much.  I was on .25 for 6 weeks - increased to about .33 for the past two weeks instead of going to .5.  The increase definitely made my stomach issue worse but it is better in a day or 2.  As an older woman, I felt it was timeto take drastic measures but I prefer not to have any surgery so I tried this instead.  It is a miracle.  Never has losing weight been easy and this was so easy!  It is exactly what I need to take the right road back to healthy.

OMG its a magic drug, ive been on similar and got horrid side effect but this one just makes u full with in minutes of beginning to eat, im learning to only make half the size meal now.. the old me still wants the large. ive lost 7kg(15lbs) in 3 weeks and im not dieting.. im not even trying. sweet food taste too sweet and im happy after a few bites. im only on .5mg as not in a hurry to experience the side effects. soon i hope to be off insulin as well as its working so well.hope it lasts

I had all the side effects, and have not taken an injection for 2 months, and I still have a taste side effect. A numbness in my mouth and tongue. Very unpleasant. Make sure your Dr covers side effects with you, my didn't even thought she said she did in her notes of my visit, I guess that's CYA...

I have a terrible needle phobia but my Husband has done the injections for me and I’ve used numbing cream. I’ve lost 2kg in the first week (on .25mg). I’ve been really lucky and haven’t had any side effects. Have zero appetite so have been a bit picky with what I eat but Dr not worried about that. Usually if I don’t eat I feel nauseous and have headaches, but haven’t experienced that either. Very happy and it’s much cheaper in Australia so feeling positive.

I have mixed reviews on Ozempic. It has made a significant impact on my blood sugar levels and my weight. I have gone from an average of 7.8 to 6.2 and have dropped from 216lbs to 188lbs in a matter of 5 months. I’m currently taking .5. A disadvantage to being on Ozempic is the nausea, feeling of undigested food in my stomach, surfer burps and irregular bowel movements. I’ve had to lower my dose from .75 to .50 because the side effects outweigh the results of the drug. I am considering fully going off the drug if I continue to feel so terrible.
I lost 20 pounds in 6 weeks and my insulin medication dose dropped from 22 to 8 with better results on blood sugar levels.

Had my first .25 dose last Monday. Noticed a decrease in appetite and fasting numbers are lower. Have not noticed nausea, but definitely a weird feeling in my gut...almost like a minor burning sensation like indigestion. Not experience the constiparion others have shared.tried a piece of oven "fried" chicken! asparagus and brown rice for dinner and couldn't finish it. Just sharing my early  experience more than a review. Will check in after 1 month

I started Ozempic at 285 pounds (I had lost 65 pounds on my own) and newly diagnosed as a Type 2 diabetic with an A1C of 7.2.  I’m down to 245 pounds and an A1C of 5.3 less than a year later.  I am at 1 mg weekly.  It’s been such a success that I am going to try it for the weight loss component to see if I can lose the last 45 pounds I want to leave.  I’m nervous because I’m going from 1 mg to 2 mg right away.  I remember the bloating diarrhea and cramping from all of the previous increases in dosage.  I’ll post more as I go along!

Im on my 2nd week. 
Have had a horrible time using this dreadful instrument of torture.  Im ised to using a syringe and mixing my own meds for fertility treatments,which had a very logical flow and process.
The instructions for this unholy device are ridiculous anddo not have a logical flow.
I keep treating the pen like my hgh shots,which I mixed and measired myself.   Math ( eg measiring preciselh on one"s own) doesnt lie. This pen thing is a joke.
The instructions are obtuse. I wonder how muchthe team of engineers was paid to develop this piece of crap.
I took this to lose weight after 6 weeks of using i put on over 1kg so i tossed what i had left.  I had irregular heart beats when taking this.

My glucose levels started going down quite a but after the second week. My side effects were nausea and bloating for a day or 2 .first 2 weeks I took.25 second 2 weeks .5 . I am on my 4th week now. It has been a life changer.  My fasting level has been 5.00 or lower ( I am in canada) and after meals I never go over 8. And for me that's miraculous . I don't have the huge spikes anymore

I am in my second week of using ozempic and still at 0.25 mg dose and the results have been nothing short of miraculous. It’s like someone turned a switch on in my brain that was accidentally shut off. I now feel full after eating even half a sandwich or a small bowl of oatmeal. I can’t actually believe it because it’s so strange to just be able to walk away from food because I’m full. I don’t think I’ve felt this since I was a child. I’ve lost about 7 lbs. I have definitely experienced some vomiting but mostly at night which is similar to what I had from reflux. Definitely had some constipation and the burps are miserable- but again with my weight gain I had terrible reflux so I was sort of used to it- I’m praying it keeps working because I finally feel like I can have a normal relationship with food.

I was on the trial for Ozempic.   Took one injection at LMC and took the second at my home.  Really back diarrhea and then stomach pains.  Stopped taking the injection because I felt worse than ever.  Two weeks or so later I broke out into a rash and welts all over my body.  Doctors at LMC said it was psoriasis and had nothing to do with the Ozempic.   I am 73 years old.  Psoriasis at my age?  Really?  Then my family doctor referred me to a dermatologis who said not Psoriasis but performed a biopsy to be sure.  Lab came back with not psoriasis and could not rule out Ozempic.   After 72 years of no allergies, I now have an allergy to semiglutide.

I thought once my breakout cleared up after medicating topically for more than 3 months, I actually have a worse reaction to Ozempic.  My Thyroid started failing.  Their list of side effects said Thyroid tumors or cancer.  They didn't say anything about Thyroid slowing down.  I now have to take medication to try and fix my Thyroid. 

What did Ozempic do for me?  It slightly lowered my blood sugar. It gave me an allergy to semiglutide.   Affected my Thyroid Stimulating Hormone and put it higher than it should be which now caused me severe weight loss; muscle loss; fatigue; extreme difficulty climbing stairs.  No strength at all.  Also, the Thyroid issue causes problems with swallowing.  Not just food, but water as well.

This was the worst experience I ever had with a drug.  It looks like I'm going to being paying for it for as long as I live.

ive been on Ozempic for 2 months. i start my 1.0ug dose this week. i have lost 30lbs and dropped my a1c from 5.9 to 5.4. Its been wonderful. I did have some nausea the first week. i do take omneprozole for GERD so im sure that helps. 
Im a mid 40s female who 60lbs in the last several years. ive always ate well, never drank sodas, but the weight started creeping on and nothing helped. This was a game changer. i am so very happy. I dont CRAVE anything. im not hungry. i drink lots of water and juices. i do eat small portions. that would be the worst thing, if i eat too much, oh my tummy hurts!

I’m 5 ft 8 and starting weight was 256 lbs. Pre diabetic, my Dr prescribed Ozempic. I had 4 weeks of .25 with minimal side effects. Some tiredness, burping and constipation. I increased to .50 last week and within 24-48 hrs was violently throwing up and diarrhea. It lasted for a day then I started to feel better. Through the week I didn’t eat much and felt full all day.
