Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: As of this writing, I've been on Saxenda for 10 months. I worked up to full dosage as directed. Symptoms were a little nausea at first, but it went away within a month or two. It worked great at first, I wasn't hungry in the least and would forget to eat. I've lost 25 pounds but the last few weeks have gained back 3. The loss was slow. I feel at this point my body is used to Saxenda. I've discovered I eat b/c I'm bored or just because I think it's time (like lunch at noon, etc) not because I'm actually hungry. I think it's still helping with hunger some, but because I keep eating when I'm not hungry I'm gaining some back. This has me very concerned as to whether or not I'll be able to keep the weight off. My insurance has me pay $30/month and with the rebate card you get from drug maker they take $5 off so my monthly cost is $25 at Walmart. I believe my insurance will only pay for 1 year, so I'm on a time limit. I find I'm feeling bad about myself for eating when I'm not hungry. My old eating habits have crept back in, snacking on candy/chocolate/ice cream and larger than needed portions and I'm sure that's to blame for the weight gain. I might mention I'm female with life long weight issues of being 20-40 pounds overweight most of my adult life. I'm 49, I work from home, am sedentary and I'm now entering menopause (yay me - not- the hot flashes suck!) Another side note however I'm not sure it's directly related to Saxenda is that my blood pressure went through the roof after being on it for 5 months. I couldn't find any info that said that was a symptom. But after losing the initial 20 pounds I'm now on BP meds. My Dr. says she thinks it's birth control pill related combine with my age. I'm off BC and still on BP meds. I am curious to know if anyone else had issues with BP with this drug. I've never had BP issues until now. Maybe it's just time? Hopefully this helps future users.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Saxenda for 9 days and have lost 5 pounds already. I have experienced some intermittent queasiness but feel full and have almost no appetite at all. I am now curious as to whether I should be taking a vitamin supplement to ensure I am getting sufficient nutrients?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have lost so much weight, I would say just stay to your plan and you will see results.. I'm very excited about this weight loss...

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I've just finished my 2nd pen, so in about 6 weeks, i've lost 20 lbs, felt dizzy, nauseous , generally unwell, so I waited 3 days before starting 2nd pen and started back at .6 again, and have not had any issues these past 3 wks. My 3rd pen will start on the 1.2 dosage and go up to 1.8 half way thru, hope to continue to lose 10lbs per pen.  also drinking alot of greentea and water, and eating 2-3 small, light meals which i serve myself on a 7" salad plate, no seconds, no meat, lots of eggs. Feelreally good lately.  Keep it up! If you eat big and or heavy meals, you will feel sick to your stomach, or eat sweets, drink soda, i dont do well eating meat either, so i just pass it up. Listen to your body! Keep a diary, what you ate, dosage and how you felt. I seem to lose the most on the .6 dosage, will see these next couple pens starting at 1.2 then 1.8 - but i am not pushing the dosage.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have only been taking for a week and a half.  I haven't lost any weight although my appetite is virtually non existent. It's still early so I am hopeful that the reduced appetite will show up on the scale soon.  I am however experiencing many side effects.  So tired, acid reflux with lots of burping, bloating and just simply feeling not myself.  I hope to see results soon as the side effects are not helping me to stay positive.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started saxenda since 2 months and I am on 3 dose since almost two weeks, I didn't loose any weight at all even my appetite still high, only the first week I felt dizzy and tired but then I believe I developed resistance to the drug, I hope to find related blood tests to find out the reason behind such bad result.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been using this for exactly 11 days and I have lost 14 pounds!  I am 5.8 and began at 208.  My only complaint is the feeling of nausea the first two days I took it and since I bumped up to 1.2, again I have been nauseated for two days.  I think that is just one of the downfalls, but with this kind of weight loss, I'll deal with it.  I drink more water than I ever have and do not really crave anything.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on the medication for 40 days. I have lost 17 pounds and was doing fine until two weeks ago. I started feeling nauseated most of the time. Then I started burping what seems like an egg taste/smell. After that came vomiting. I was at 2.4 so I cut back to 1.8. That worked well for about two weeks so I increased it. The same series of events occurred - twice, two days apart. It's almost like if I eat anything, later that day or night, I am going to be sick. The stomach pain, vomiting, and diarrhea sent me to the ER yesterday where they did an ultra sound and CT scan looking for gall bladder problems, etc.  I have a doctor's appointment later today and will see what he says. I know I can't continue with these side effects but hate to give up with the medicine working.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Sexenda for 1.5 weeks now and have felt nothing, except for the first day I have had no appetite and got a bit burpy.  I am a bit worried that this could be my last hope and it may not work for me.  So many people say they loose their appetite and have to force themselves to eat, still waiting for this "full feeling".  Could it be that I am a vegan and already eat low fat and few calories, thats why I have no symptoms?  I am the enigma that no one can figure out, I count calories1000 - 1400 cal/day, eat whole foods, never fast food and my blood work looks good.  I look at food and gain weight.  I am the only " healthy fat vegan".  I really need this to work, I can only hope that I will progress and lose weight as I increase my dose. FINGERS CROSSED

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: At first this worked really well.  It did curve my appetite.  I got really concerned when I reached 3.0 cause I started having stomach pains and severe constipation.  I told my dr. about it but all should could say is reduce the dosage and drink plenty of fluids.  I did and I didn't get better until I took the dosage back to 1.2. I was also concerned with the size affects that was of this drug.  Thyroid cancer and heart problems and stomach problems. I am gradually weaning myself off this drug.I haven't lost weight for3 months so to me I don't need to be on something that cost and to be honest I have to do this on my own anyway.  All the medicine does is curve the appetite. It's not worth me having thyroid cancer or other side affects down the road.

Gender: On medication for 6 months to less than 1 year
Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started this medication in March of this year and have loss 21lbs..I was a bit doubtful early on because I wasn't seeing signs of weight. Maybe 1 or 2lbs or I would lose 5lbs then gain it back. By the time I reached the maximum dose of 3mg I started on my and have had no side effects to mention besides heartburn. My only hope is I keep it off. Exercise for me is minimal because of my sciatica so I manage my meals and stay hydrated. I worry if I stop the injections the weight will return

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started .6 on Oct 20; week later 1.2; week later tried to increase to 1.8.  Immediately began having headaches and extreme exhaustion.  Very sad - don't know how I'm going to get past this point.  First few weeks lost 14 pounds.  Now not losing and maybe it's because I can't increase without side-affects.   Not everyone reacts the same.  I will say that I still do not have the cravings for sugar that I had prior to beginning the program.  So that's good news.  I ride a recumbent bike and lift light weights about 4-6 times a week.  Sometimes walk my dog for about 1/2 mile during the week too, but exercise is not new to me - always exercise.  I plan to attempt increase again hoping side effects go away.  Life does not allow for extreme exhaustion.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Tried Saxenda for 1 week. Supressed appetite for sweets, however it made me bloat up from my breast all the way down to my stomach, and I felt ill. After, rereading Saxenda drug info, I did not notice that it specifically states, not to be used as a weight loss or appetite suppressant. It is used for diabetic patient's. So, I wasted 180.00 USD( out of pocket) for 5 weeks of injections. I fault myself for not reading thoroughly and researching info properly.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am mid-way through week two (at 1.2 mg) and since upping the dosage, experience mild upset tummy in late afternoon.  My doctor recommended I take my pantoprazole twice a day rather than just in the morning to mitigate this side effect. I have lost 7.2 lbs since I started logging my food intake, maintaining a 1200 calorie/day diet and using Saxenda.   Excited to see results in a few months :)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Starting my 5th week on this today. I have lost 10.4 lbs so far. I am very happy with it. It helps reduce my appetite and I get full faster. I have had virtually no side effects either. This has given me hope! Started at 198.6lbs. (and I'm 5'4")

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I've been on this for 2 weeks. I'm 65 years old. Now up to 1.2 mgs and not feeling any bad side effects. Losing appetite very slowly and lost 2 lbs this week. Seems to have kicked in once I went up to 1.2. I take it in the evening. I am also Diabetic. I have around 20 lbs to lose but I do have concerns about gaining it back after going off the script. Has anyone had any experience with this? My dr only wants me on it for 1 month...maybe to kick me into overdrive, LOL. Good luck everyone!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am using Saxenda since October 2016. In 12 weeks, I am down 17lbs. Got used to the nausea around week 7 or 8. No other symptoms. I plan to lose 30+ lbs by springtime. In general, easy to use and tolerate.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Saxenda for just under two weeks and I am already down 9 pounds! The whole needle thing for me was causing me so much anxiety at first, I was almost going to quit but after a few days it got easier. I am on 1.2mg dose right now and no side effects since upping from .06. Cant wait to see my progress after a few months! From my current weight, I would like to loose 51 pounds to total 60 pounds!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

No side effects. No nausea, nothing. So no weight loss. I think when this works, it works by making you feel crummy (nausea, constipation) so no side effects, no effect. Phooey. I had been hoping...

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity

In fact, I think my body is used to it now. I feel if I exercised I would have lost more weight as well. Its worth a try. I didn't want to do the gastric sleeve.

A week into this medication, I lost 3 lbs. My goal is to get down to 200 lbs. My side effects include heartburn and a little nausea.  Nausea isn't too severe but the heartburn is not fun.
July test Live

I started using this in 2023, had sever stomach pain over time, No weight loss. After stopping i kept having major pain. My gallbladder stopped working all together. They said it was linked to me using the shot in stomach. I wanted to use this after but they are not recommending it due to other issues it could cause to my spleen and other areas.

I started 16 days ago at 0.6 at day 16 increased to 1.2. I have been experiencing horrible middle to upper back pain. The back pain feels like stabbing sharp pain that even with Tylenol and other pain relief medications doesn't go away. It suppress appetite really well which I like. My goal is to lose weight. I am trying hard to eat healthy and exercise, however, some of the side effects makes me feel really tired and not motivated. I pray to GOD that it can be successful with no major issues.
I have changed my diet, exercise more and having a very hard time keeping weight off. Would not recommend.
I've been on Voctoza for about 10 years. The first few weeks was weird. Dizzyness, nausea and  diarrhea. Once these minor things passed I can only say the drug has helped me immensely.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on this medication for 5 months and have lost 60 lbs so far. I have integrated exercise bike riding every day. Minimal side effects, like stomach discomfort. I don't use the toilet except every 4 to 5 days, which i'm okay with. I like the feeling of being full but love that my food compulsion and obsession switch has been turned off. I am happy with my results. my goal is another 20 to 30 lbs. Good luck everyone.

I started Victoza for lowering blood sugar and with hopes of weight loss and change in eating habits. Ive been an overeater for most my life. Been on Victoza for about 3 to 4 months now and have more energy, lost about 15+ lbs. Only hard part for me has been using needles in general. It is quick and easy to use. I've noticed a change with blood sugar with my mental state. I only do A1C's and have a check coming up soon to see how well it has been working.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm 163cm tall and 176 kgs. I've been on Victoza for a month and I've lost 12kgs. Most will say that it's mostly water weight but it makes me feel so full and I hardly eat. I intermittant fast 7 to 11 and exercise 45 mins everyday. I love it. My blood sugar levels are back to normal.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am a 52yr old female, 5'6" 197lbs, on Victoza for almost 3wks, heartburn, a little nausea in the first week only..I feel full and don't have much urge to eat..I just worry about the side effects long term with a newer drug. My weight hasn't changed but I am maintaining under 200 and have a weight loss goal of 40lbs, them I won't need it anymore! :)
It worked, but I developed pancreatitis and had to have my gallbladder removed.

Currently taking victoza, started week 1 with  doses at 0.6 increased to 1.2. Couldn’t take Metformin caused horrible side effects. Placed on Tradjenta which did nothing at all. Now, victoza which seems to be alright for the first month. Numbers were ideal and appetite was suppressed. No real weight loss but my numbers looked good. Unfortunately. I caught COVID and had been really sick. Nausea, vomiting and burning diarrhea. I don’t know if I should stop taking the medicine.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started this medication in 2018 with a weight of 256 lbs. With this medication combined with metformin along with a very good diet, intermittent fasting four days per week, and exercise, my weight is now 187 lbs. My blood sugar is 82. My H1AC is 5.1. I have no side effects at all using Victoza.
I have been taking Victoza for just over 1 year. My last A1C was 6.1 with little to no stomach upset, although I do have some diarrhea.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I originally started out using Saxenda which s just a higher dose of Victoza. Insurance ceased covering Saxenda. I have been using Victoza for about a year. It has worked miracles!!! Weight is down over 40 lbs.  Glucose is now 82. Insulin reading has gone to 6! Was previously 25. I have experienced NO side effects.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: The med works great for weightloss but on my 7th pen I started breaking out in a rash that turned purpl/red and looked horrible.it turned out I was having a reaction to it. I'm very bummed because it was the only weightloss drug that worked for me.

Very happy with Victoza.  Makes you feel much better, seems I have more energy. Blood sugar was 646, took victoza several days and watched what I ate and it was down to 145. Not happy with the price, did pay full price 3 times. Now new insurance covers it. Price $35.

Have had excellent results- A1C down to 5.6 from 7.0. Unfortunately, my insurance no longer will pay for this medication. Please help, anyone else having this happen? What medication are you taking now and how is it effecting your A1C?  Thanks for your help!!!

I was placed on this medication in June of last year. First several months were horrible.  Nausea was terrible but I stuck it out.  My most recent labs were excellent.  Hgb A1C was 4.5 all other labs were in good range and I have lost 82 pounds to date.  I would highly recommend this if you can stick out the beginning.  My starting A1C was 12.8 and my weight was 233.
I loved Victoza. It helped with hungry control too. Unfortunately my insurance won’t cover it and I can’t pay over $600/month.
The first time I went from .06 to 1.2 I felt sick to my stomach. My doctor had be wait a little longer to change. Worked well and I've lost 30 pounds, very happy about that.

This medicine made me very sick at 0.6 starting dose.  I started at 0.3 and moved up a little each week.  I have now been on 1.2 dose for 4 weeks.  Take the shot at 6:00 pm. I am usually too sick with nausea to do anything the rest of the evening. I have not lost any weight, nor seen any results of blood sugar owering.  It about the same. Medcine is SUPER EXPENSIVE. It covered by my insurance, but for $400  per month I would expect it to actually work

Was told to start at .6 for two weeks. Started at .3 to check for allergies.  That has made me so sick and nauseated I am going back to .1 and will try to work up to a decent size dose,but its going to take a while.  Injecting was way less painful than testing blood sugar
It seems to have caused insomnia and can't get to sleep before 4am

This medicine dropped my fasting blood sugar from the 200s to 150-190 during the six weeks I was on it and I saw readings as low as 73 during the day.  However, from the first dose I had trouble sleeping more than 4 hours a night and my personality underwent a major change.  Belching was a major problem as well so after a month the doctor switched me to the 1.2 dose which helped with the gas but still not sleeping well. Before Victoza I was eating healthy and exercising 30-60 minutes a day, twoweeks in I had to quit exercising because I didn't have the energy and my diet became 75% junk food.  Doctor is finally taking me off of it and going on insulin, will see if it does the trick.

I have been on this drug for approximately 3 months, it has really reduced by blood sugar.  This medication has really put a halt to my old eating habits.  I have to remind myself to eat, the smell of food can fill me up.  I've learned to add more protein to my diet.

Began 10 days ago with the lowest dose and side effects are dizziness and headache. Bumped it up to 1.2 now I have diarrhea and couldn't even go to work today. How long does this side effect last and can I take Imodium to control the diarrhea?

Been using Victoza for over 2 years. Weight loss was minimal, but blood sugar and A1C are normal and looking great. I have a fear of needles, but after the first few days, no problems. Two plus years later, injections are a non-issue.

I have taking 1.2 dose of victoza for a year now, I was taking junuvia but it didn't do nothing for me and metforim gave me a severe diarrhea so my dr. switched me to lantus and victoza I'm very happy with the victoza I've had no side effects and I've lost 53 pounds in the last year
After  taking for 3 months I started feeling nauseous..started loosing weight.. by the 6 month I wound up in the hospital I wound up with pancreatitis in the hospital for a week

Took Victoza and it brought my levels down to a more normal level right away.  As time went on, I just couldn't eat, and had stomach pains.  By the end of the first month I was in the hospital for an intestinal blockage.  5 days with a plastic tube up my nose and I was released from the hospital.  Very dangerous side effects they forget to mention

Victoza worked very effectively at reducing my A1C but it destroyed my taste buds making most foods, except sweets, taste terrible. I quit taking it because I wanted to enjoy the taste of food again.  Since quitting it, food again tastes OK.  I suspected that people lost weight because they experienced the same thing. I may try to go back on it intermittently because it does lower my A1C.

I was totally satisfied while taking Victoza. My A1c was staying around 6.1. It also kept my weight down.  Unfortunately after 2 years it had caused my Liver Function levels to elevate and go out of range and I had to come off of it.  It is very sad and stressful since now I have to try something new.

Was introduced to this miracle drug and while on samples from my docs, I wanted to step up and give it a real try.   Beyond belief!   Instant B.S. drop from mid to high 400's to LOW 200's within the first week. In six weeks have 18 pound weight loss but severly increased edema.   All with NO insulin!   Sad ending------- Stopped due to unreal copay{ to the tune of $286}.  Would LOVE to be back on it as it was THE ONLY med, ever, to affect my blood sugar at all.  So it is back the the 4-500's andupcoming weight gain thanks to big pharma.  ONLY in America!
I have been taking this for 2 months at the 1.2 dose. I have not had any side effects at all. I have lost weight and my numbers are good. I can't wait to find out what my A1C is!

Diabetic for 23 years and in insulin with oral medications to.  Gained weight constantly unable to lose.  Than, on Nov 2015 I was taken off insulin because of extreme low blood sugars.   Continue with ActosPlusMetormin 3 X day, highest dose.  Tuesday June 21,2016 decrease to 2 pills a day getting lower blood sugar   Just taking Victoza since May 2014 it had help to achieve coming off insulin and losing 70 pounds   I am so happy with the results using Victoza, hadn't known about not injecting my2 X day and now no insulin.

I was diagnosed with polycystic ovarian syndrome (POS) years ago. Last year, I was referred to a doctor that specializes in this disease; at the time I first met him, I weighed a whopping 387 pounds (I’m 5’10’’). Of course, the first thing he told me was that my POS would get better if I lost weight. I was totally discouraged! I told him that I was very active and had been on EVERY diet… nothing seemed to work. I was so frustrated and asked if there was anything he could do to jump start my weight loss from a medical stand point. This is when he told me about Victoza and about the study that demonstrated that individuals suffering from POS, not from Type 2 diabetes had lost weight on this medication but there were some serious side effects to consider. I was so desperate that after reading on the matter for a few days, I decided to try it out. The first months were pretty horrible because I had severe nausea and vomiting (in the morning upon waking I would throw up stomach acid – I know erk!) but I decided to continue. The reason I kept up with it is that, for the first time in my life, I could sense that I was full when I ate. For some reason, this message was not making its way up to my brain when I ate before… I thought it was awesome. The medication no only killed every craving I normally had but it stopped me from overeating. I have been on Victoza for one year now. The side effects are no longer there (they stopped after about 6 months after starting Victoza) and I now weigh 276 pounds… yes I lost over 100 pounds. I am continuing to lose weight and wish you all the best.

I was taking this but the side effects were horrible. The heartburn, nausea, great scott. I will say however that it did bring my blood sugar down very fast and kept it at 100. Needle was very small. This drug was not for me because of the side effects however if your Dr. has prescribed it to you then dont hesitate to try it. Like I said it does work and it works well.

Used for 2 months, when got to full dose had continuous heartburn, diarrhea, continuous nausea & massive headache. It lowered sugars really well & added benefit of significant weight loss.  Too bad I was sick all the time. I am trying something else.

Insurance forced me from Byetta to Victoza due to the cost.  I am using 1.8 once a day and getting poor am readings in the 200-250 range with Victoza so I am researching alternatives.  With Byetta I was always 140-160.  I tried Bydereon, once a week exenatide, but the needle was enormous and worse it left a lump at the injection site.  But it also contained my am reading to 140-160.  I will give Victoza another course and hope for improvement.

Started using Victoza to control blood sugar which it had done.  I have been able to back off of my novel in N by over 1/2.  I have also lost 24 pounds in 3 months on Victoza.  I kind of turns off the hungar switch, abnd it is much easier to diet and say " I don't really want that ". We're pleased that I am using it.  If you are on Medicare, watch your cost.  I was on WellCare part D abnd Victoza was $770.00 a month.  Switched to Atena this year and it is $35.00 per month.  I just don't get these drug companies, but you can get it for a reasonable price on Medicare.
Acute pancreatic reaction with non-stop vomiting and diarrhea..taking over 24 hours to recover

I started on 0.6 a week and worked my way up to 1.8 a week. I haven't had any bad side effects with this medication. No nausea, no sickness. I did have a slight headache the very first week I started. It hasn't help me lose any weight but it has kept my blood sugar under control.

Was on 4 oral medications for my diabetes, and after several years of good control, my numbers started to increase. Started Victoza and even before moving up to 1.28 dose, my numbers immediately dropped about 30 pts,and I lost about 7 lbs in first week. Only side effects were some minor nausea, and a couple days of diarrhea,but both passed after a week or so. The sugar control remains good (averaging about 110) but unfortunately the weight loss stopped. The dosages for my oral medications have dropped, and some may be eliminated. My medicare advantage plan only provides partial coverage (tier II drug)but the drug is worth it. Of course, I hope I never develop the more serious long-term side effects, but the long-term side effects of uncontrolled diabetes are pretty bad also.
I want to thank God for my Dr. Iam pre diabeta, been on Victoza for 9 days loss 9lbs.  I could not lose any weight.The only side affect, I am never hungry.

Hello. I heard some great things about victoza and some really bad things so I decided to try it out and hope for the best. Sad to say that I simply couldn't stand all the side effects that I encountered while on it. I felt like I was in a daze all the time and the nausea was really bad. I completely lost my appetite and after a week I started to throw up multiple times a day. I decided to stop because it simply made me sick to my stomach. I did some research on the internet to try and find something over the counter without side effects. I found this supplement called cinnalife which so far has been amazing for me. My A1C has significantly dropped which i'm sure is a large part due to the energy that this supplement gives me. I have been very active since I started taking them. Anyways, just wanted to share that there are always alternatives to these injectables with these horrible side effects. I have heard that there are some new injectables out in the market, but I'm simply too scared to try them =(

Let me first say that I just started this medication and am still on the starter dose of 0.6, but already I can feel my cravings and desire to eat subsiding.  I have had some intermittent nausea but it's mild and tolerable. Only other side offect was a mild headache and my fasting blood sugar was 77 this morning.  77!  I am also on Invokana and Glipizide and without the Victoza my sugars were in the 180s-200s fasting.  Also, for those dreading the needle, it is tiny.  I felt only one of the three needle sticks so far and the one I did feel was much less painful than sticking my finger to check my blood sugar, which I do multiple times a day.  Don't let fear of an injection keep you from considering this medication as an option.  I will update once I have been on Victoza for a longer time.

I took Victoza for almost as year and went to my dr. because I was having breathing problems.  He couldn't find a reason.  Then I got extreme diarrhea a couple of months later. I stopped the Victoza for a week to see if that was the problem.  It was and I also noticed my breathing got better.  I went back on Victoza and both the diarrhea and breathing problems came back so I can no longer take it.  I would become out of breath just walking from the parking lot into a store.  I was also tired a lot as I was not getting enough oxygen.  Now my energy level has also gotten better.  I was really disappointed as my A1c was lowered while I was takeing Victoza.
not sure if I have to eat before or after I give my injection.

After two years of taking Victoza, my blood sugar came down from 7.0 to 5.7 A1C, and I've lost 30 pounds.  I'm thrilled!  Also, using Reli-On 4 MM/32Gauge pen needles from Walmart. Much more comfortable than the BD needles.  All I'm not too happy with is the cost of Victoza.
My levels are excellent and for the first time in years my weight is going down!!!  Taking this has been the best decision in a long time.

I would highly recommend this product to others.  I had an upset stomach when first prescribed but that only lasted a couple of weeks.  In 5 months I have lowered my A1C from 7.0 to 5.8.  I have lost 16 lbs.  I have more energy and feel great.  I take with 2x/day Metformin. I exercise daily and eat a reasonably healthy diet.

This medication was great it lowered my A1C 2 points on the starter dose of 0.6. I felt really good on this, did not effect my energy level. The only bad issue I had was that it increased my pulse rate too high so I had to stop using it. Wish I could have kept using it best medication I have been put on that actually worked for me without side multiple side effects.

WOW, tremendous reduction in daily sugar readings. Was at 300+ everyday. I took the wrong dose for 4 weeks taking 3 times per day even during the ramp up. Was told to go to once per day and the med will last longer without refills. My numbers are now 85 to 97 fasted and jump to 127 after meals. I have also lost some weight due to less appetite. It will be interesting to see if the proper dose 1.8 once a day will still keep my numbers in check.

i have been taken victoza for a lil over 2 months now and i have lost 22lbs my a1 is where it needs to be and my sugar levels are in a good rage the only down side to me using this is i have sever joint pain from head to toe about once a week or once every 2 weeks im not sure if anyone has this same problem or not but i really do not like it at all i have to stay in bed all day and it hurts so bad if someone touches me or i have to move other than that it works great.
Works very good for me when other med failed.

Within a week of taking it my numbers went from 190 to between 97 and 124 routinely.  My fasting numbers in the morning were slightly higher 140-154 but leveled out throughout the day.  I am taking a 2x daily dose of Metformin with Victoza. After a month I have seen weight loss of 10 pounds. If it continues I am on target to lose 60 pounds in 5 more months !!!  Slight diahrrea at the beginning of dosage.

I was fine taking .6 and 1.2 dosage, when I increased to 1.8 I had injection site hives (very large 3-4 inches) that appeared 24-48 hours after injection. I have reduced back down to 102 and the reaction has continued.

When i first started taking victoza it made me feel like I had a stomach virus because if the vomiting and diharrea. I stopped taking it for a week and restarted taking it. In the beginning my fasting numbers were 250+ after 3 months of taking it my numbers are 120 and less.
For those who cannot afford Victoza, go to Victoza website and get coupon to never pay more than $25.  That's what I did'

The Victoza did help decrease my blood sugar numbers nadmy A1C, but I had a massive amount of side effects that I didn't know was being increased by the Victoza because the Victoza was started around the same time that I was also having gallbladder issues, and had a gall stone. After my gallbladder removal I remained sick with the same symptoms I had prior to it of: heartburn, nausea, vomiting, epigastric pain, severe foul smelling belching, and gas. This continued for some time, and my doctor decided to remove me off my Victoza because my diabetes #'s, and A1C were getting to a level of satisfaction for her.     I remained off my Victoza for about a month, and my blood sugar numbers began to gradually creep up again, so my doctor decided to put me back on it.     I had finally became free of the side effects listed above, but still not relating them to the Victoza.  Then my wife, who is a RN said the she was getting ready to give me a Victoza injection, and wanted me to let her know if any of the symptoms that I'd had for so long returned.  Within 30 mins of receiving the Victoza injection I again started having foul smelling belching, gas, and began vomiting profusely.      Victoza is an awesome drug, and does what it's suppose to do.  I'd recommend it to anyone who is able to take it, but if you have anything weird start happening within your body once you start taking it, you can bet money that the Victoza Will be what's causing it.

Don't even start taking this! I took Victoza for ten months. I feel like I have lost ten months of my life. It started with diarrhia, vomiting. I just felt yuck all day. then the hives started. I've gone to the hospital four times in ten months. That doesn't even include hives that didn't send me to the ER.  So everyday feeling not great, the last trip to the ER was in a ambulance because the reaction caused me to pass out. I lost a little weight, but when you are always nausea and diarrhea andvomiting, of course you will loose weight. I feel like I was a guinia pig with this drug. Just stay away from it, it was life changing. After not taking it for three weeks now, I feel so much better. Not even a stomach ache!!!

Began with such hope, but turned to nausea day 1, tired & lack of energy. The next few days went to nausea, bloating, stomach cramps, etc. affected my ability to work for several days. Then hit the 6th day nausea, bloating, vomiting and diarrhea began. I'm done. I lost 9 lbs, but it is NOT worth it.
So far, I can't write much of a comment, at this point; I have only used it for 3 days.  Also, I am taking a different oral medication at the same time (3 days).

Am a 71-yr-old male., and on 1000mg Metformin, 5mg Farxiga, and 1.8mg Victoza daily.  Been taking Victoza for 10 months.  Almost immediately lost 10 lbs to a comfortable 200 lbs (6'4").  A1C dropped from 6.7 to about 6.1. Morning glucose readings run 105-120.  Seems to be working great, but concerned about long-term side effects.  Still, high sugar levels are known to do much damage long term, so plan to stay with what's now working.

Its a small dose daily, but has help me lower my A1C.  Plus, seems to 'slim' my waist and 'reduce' the Fat in my Belly, gone form a Beach Ball, to a 'two pack' when tightening my belly muscles!  Did not realize I had any Stomach Muscles left!!
Side effects experieced is many sour stomachs with gas bloating,so tired, I'm on 2 months lots of nausia, not able to continue on this drug, just not for me.

Has helped me get control of my sugar and eliminated the use of another drug with serious side effects. Don't know if it effects my sleep but since I have begun taking it I am having difficulty falling asleep (take injection after dinner.) Am going to switch to morning shots and see if any change. Have lost about 4 pounds in the month and sugar is down from mid 200's to under 200.
Works great but giving me violent hiccups :( both at 0.6 and 1.2 dose.

Have been taking this for 6 months with a gradual increase in dosage to 1.8 per day.  My A1C went from 9.6 to 8.1.  I expected it to be lower as I have also lost over 50 lbs.  The worst side effects I have are bloating, if I eat more than a small amount and a sour stomach of the worst kind.  Even went as far has having a bunch of Gastro tests but all were negative.
On this medication for more than 2 years... lost 20lbs. Controls my glucose levels and A1C down from 8.1 to 6.4. No side effects, but a little constipation.  Great drug!

After being nauseous for a week, the drug was fine.  The third week I started getting heartburn which continued into the 4th week.  I'm waiting to see the doctor to see if this is a typical side effect and how long it lasts.  I would hate to give it up as it has  lowered my after meal blood sugar by at least 30.  Has anyone else had this problem?

I was given Victoza by my diabetes specialist for my type 2 diabetes as he hoped it would help me lose weight. I am also taking insulin.  However, my nausea turned quickly to vomiting and dizziness.  I continued in the hope these symptoms would go away.  I was certainly losing weight but at great cost.  Finally, I was so weak I had to be rushed to the emergency room.  I was severely dehydrated and my blood pressure was so low the doctor there put me on intravenous fluids. AS soon as I stopped the Victoza I began to feel better and am now feeling pretty ok.  Dizziness, dehydration and extreme low blood pressure went away. Just as well, because right before all this, I had gone to the drug store to fill my prescription for Victoza (till then my doctor had given me samples) and I found out it was going to cost $600 to fill!  Needless to say, I can´t afford this.  I live on social security and a small pension.

Started taking this in July 2013. Nausea & diahrea was the biggest side affect. The nausea went away in a few weeks. I took the shot in the evening so wasn't nauseous all day, just in the morning. Needles are so small they hardly hurt at all. It decreased my appetite & I was able to lose 20 lbs. Still plagued with the diareha, but don't know if that is the victoza or the gallbladder surgery I had in July. My A1C went from 8.6 to 6.5. Was happy with this med. But now insurance won't cover it in 2014, so I have to try something new.

Sugar dropped like a rock. Run 70-90. Lost about 15 lbs. Side effects- constipation, "sour stomach" belching. Feel like food sits in stomach for hours.  If low sugar occurs, eating or drinking doesn't help.  Just have to suspend insulin pump and hope for the best.
easy to inject, helps with the pain in my legs and feet.

I've been using Victoza for over a 18 months.  I've had no side effects.  It helped to lowere my A1C from 9.4 to 6.6.  I've lost 50 pounds and I feel better than I have in over 30 years.  For me, this drug has been a miracle.  My Endo. is saying that he will soon start cutting the dosage of the other medication I take for diabetes (metformin and glyburide and actos).

Without using Victoza as a supplement to my insulin, my blood sugar would spike to the high 500's after eating a bowl of grain type breakfast cereal (Containing less than 8g of sugar) With the Victoza my readings are well within normal levels, high 90's an hour after eating the same thing. I only use it once in the morning and it has brought my A1C from the mid 8 range to the mid 6 range.

I started taking Victoza in February, 2013.  Since that time, my A1C has gone from in the 9s to 5.9!  I've lost approximately 40 pounds and BG stays in the 90-110 range.  I am SO upset because my insurance provider (BCBS/Express Scripts) will no longer cover this medication after 1/1/14.  How can a person's health take second fiddle to a "business decision?"  Disgusting.

This drug did help me control my blood glucose readings BUT I did develop acute kidney disease & hyperkalemia after taking the medication for about 2 months. My creatnine levels spiked to 1.77 and my potassium levels were very high. The creatnine and potassium levels came back to normal after not taking this medication for 2 weeks.
have been on it for 1 month now. After the first week most of the side effects have deminished and have now lost almost 20lb. My blood surgers are more under control.

It has lowered my A1C from 7.4 to 6.2 in 3 months.  It was a rough couple months getting use to this medicine.  It made me very sick to my stomach and I belched like a sailor and the heartburn was bad.  Zantac helped with that.  I had to increase my does VERY slowly.  It took me 3 months to be able to handle the full does.  I have lost 10lbs.  through the process. My appetite is definitely smaller than it was and hope to lose more weight.
weight loss supplement
I injected myself yesterday. 4 hours later have brusing circle size of fifty cent piece. First time that has ever happen in 2 months
My a1c dropped from 7.8 to 6.2 in six months along with using levemir. Curbed my appetite. Don't eat like I used to.  I do experience more low blood sugars. Continue to lose weight.
caused ear problem
Victoza has been great for me.I have lost weight and my sugar levels have gone done.My   only conplaint has been constipation,which I   use a laxative for.
i feel  better
I like the effectiveness of this medication.  In trying to get used to this medication I am alot more hungry.  I e had to adjust accordingl.
diabetes no problem
Have been on it for a week, not sure I am going to continue.  I am hoping the nausea stops soon.  But it is lowering my sugar levels

Love this med!  Down 40 lbs. so far and was able to come off Metformin.  BG has stabilized even more since I'm off the Metformin!  Be sure to use the tiny "nano" needles, I don't even feel them. A1C was 5.6!

This has been like a wonder drug for me. Besides no appitite. Makes it difficult to eat when you know you have to but there is no desire.  Lost weight and A1C is impressive.Tried Byetta first and thought I was slowly dieing from the side effects this one has not done that to me.

It was very easy and convenient to use this medication.  However, the nausea, inability to eat and diarrhea were so severe that I could not tolerate this medication longer than 3 days.  I could not give this medication enough time to prove it was helpful in lowering my blood sugar or not due to side effects.
it has helped me lose wt

This medication helped by blood glucose level come down from 185 in the morning before breakfast to 110 within a week. I also take metformin 500 mg 3 times a day. The down side is the nausea. Three weeks in the stomach ache and nausea were constant and after a day of barely functioning at work I stopped taking it.Plan to see my physician to see what else might help.

I have been on this medication starting my 3rd week--I have lost 7 pounds and feel full when eating very little. Have had some minor headaches and nausea, when this happens I eat a couple of crackers and it goes away. They just increased my dosage to 1.8 will see what happen next. Sugars have been okay. But I like it so far.
this medication has worked very well in keeping my blood sugars in the ideal range
i fill full all the time is this soppose to happen

I've been on Victoza for 2 months. My blood sugars are good and I've been able to eliminate glyburide and cut my insulin from 25 units twice a day to 10 twice a day. I've been able to follow a diet and eat less and have lost 24 lbs so far.
It lowered mu A1c considerably. I lost 10 lbs., then no more. The only thing I don't like is the high cost. After 3 mos. I'm in the donut hole already & have to pay over $600. for a 3 mo. supply.

The Victoza works really well keeping my blood sugar levels down but I can't eat more than a few bites of food at a time.  The lowest dose isn't strong enough to keep my blood sugar where my doctor and I would like it to be and still causes be to feel bloated and nauseated.  (And that's before I've eaten.)  If I take the mid-range dose then I really feel terrible and can't eat at all and I get nauseous to the point of vomiting.  I really don't like this medication and I have an appointment nextweek to see what else we can try.

I have been on this for 18 days and have a great experience.  Loss of appetite, cannot eat as much as I used to.  Lower Blood reading levels.  Very little stomach discomfort (not pain) I am an emotional eater and do not have the urges to eat as I used to.
The drug works great, but it cost me $1,000 for a 90 day supply until you meet your ins deductible.
have only been on Victoza for a week its been fine so far

Have had issues with constipation while using Victoza, but nothing else has worked this well to control my blood sugar levels.  Amazing medication!  Very easy to use.  I have not experienced any other side effects other than a mile nausea occassionally.

My doctor started me on Victoza when I started to experience high overnight blood sugar numbers.  After starting Victoza my numbers were great, but because of the cost my insurance company required me to change to Byetta.  My numbers when back up immediately.  So with an appeal the insurance company allowed the Victoza.  My blood sugar number are back to a normal range... 120 and lower.  I have experienced no side effects with Victoza and it is easy to use.
I was very sick with this med . Very sick stomach nervous tried for 14 day couldn't do it anymore.

Non insulin drug has significantly reduced my blood sugar levels (and my weight) after years of uncontrolled blood sugars using insulin and glucaphage. Only thing, keep hydrated and stomach motility intact with natural foods and supplements. Works for me.

I have had type 2 diabetes for 15 years.  Have had no side effects in the 5 months I've been using Victoza.  Unfortunately, has not been effective at all; glucose readings remain the same.  Will be discussting w/my doctor tomorrow.
I HATE needles, so this is alittle hard for me to do every morning ... but my glucose levels after eating takes less than 2 hrs to be in the normal range of 100 - 120. Very happy with that!
ON metformin and glipizide my BS was high at 170 or more in the mornings,now after 2 weeks on Victoza my morning BS ranges from 70 to 100. works great for me and no side affects.

I have been taking this since New Years Eve. My sugar was above 275 and the first dose dropped my down to 87. The morning sugar is between 87 and 100 now. The only side effect I have had is the constipation. I don't drink any sodas, not eating any sugars and stopped the pastas and starches, this was my choice to try and make myself healthier. I still take metformin twice a day. I have lost weight, I don't know how much but my clothes are getting very loose. I hope to get where I won't have to continue taking this or the meds. They say its possible

I have only been on Victoza for 2+ weeks. The first week was at 0.6 and after that 1.2. The first day, I experienced slight nausea and a little back pain but it quickly subsided after a day. When I made the Jump to 1.2, no nausea but a slight bit of back pain again. After a day at 1.2, all was fine. Very quickly, my BG wne from 205 down to 150, and now at 135 and still going down, I also take the generic Actos as well as a Metformin. The Actos is in the AM and at the smallest dose. Three 500mg Metformin (1 in the morning-2 at bedtime) complete the regiment. Victoza, for me has been simple and painless. It's been effective and time will tell if there are adverse effects. I can only recommend that you see a really good endocrinologist. Get ALL your blood levels, A1C checked, and follow a better diet. I'm really bad about this but, I'm trying hard to be better. Also, stay away from all sodas, and drink V8 juice in moderation. Use Tabasco to give it some zing. Love yourself and life too!

I have been on this drug for two weeks now, the first week at .6 and now 1.2 for the next 2 months then I see my dr. again. But I can speak for the last two weeks and call them a big whopping success!! Yes, there is belching and nausea, it has faded. I have diarrhea, it has not faded. The  so worth it part: blood sugars are down from 405 to 157....in TWO weeks! I do not know about weight loss amounts..haven't weighed yet. Certainly feel thinner and my pants feel looser. Prior to this drug, I wason Januvia, novolog, and metformin. Kept only the metformin (1000mg 2x day) and added this Victoza. I know this isn't the perfect drug with the side effects, but it is an answer for me.    Major tip: eat small...and I mean small...meals throughout the day. Drink slowly in between the meals. The only time I have vomited was on the second day when I ate a bowl of soup and then drank three cups of tea right away....I won't do that again!!  And don't even attempt a six inch subway sub in one sitting. I won't do that again either. I swear this drug is like a lap-band you inject! :))))

Doc switched me to Victoza from Byetta to bring down expense.  Nice not to have to take but once a day.  Taking 1000 Metformin twice a day as well.  Lost 10 pounds after starting Victoza, just as I did for Byetta (but lost 30 then).  Took Victoza for 13 months. Quit because my husband and friends said my mouth smelled like a sewer; I had thought it was just me tasting it, but they could smell it as well.  I was belching a lot, flatulence as well.  But that taste was what drove me back to Byetta.Weight loss stops pretty fast; I think it is a side effect of the nausea making you not eat, not the drug doing something swell.  Lots of itching in the last 6 months of taking it.  Didn't change my morning blood sugar levels any better than Byetta or just Metformin, which were 120 and doc wanted below 100.  Turns out morning high due to predawn low while sleeping, causing the sugar to swing high.  This is a known phenomena; if it's just your morning sugars high, consider that. Victoza good for 3-4 months, then just like other meds.  Expensive.  Insurance company gave me hell continually about finding an alternative. Beware the sewer mouth. (I guess things were staying in the stomach so long, they were beginning to rot.)  Have your friends/spouse check your breath.

Have been on 1.2 for 8 months.A1C went from 6.8 to last week of 4.4. Only taking Victoza. Since A1C was so low, Dr took me off all meds for diabetes. I did suffer constipation but that is from stomsch staying full.
Have frequent bouts of nausea early morning and sometimes several times during the day

I have reduced my metformin to once daily with vitoza in AM Metformin before bed.  Lost weight , sugar went from 180's to 120 or less.  My wife on the same program lost 52 pounds in 8 weeks !  Paula Dean takes it and so do WE !

I have been taking this drug for a year now.  The first two weeks were horrible but I am use to it now.  Blood glucose  has gone down a little (using 1.8mg dose) and lost some weight.  Still having issues with throat feeling swollen and heartburn twice a week.  I do not like injecting myself in the stomach.....my doctor states that is the place he wants me to administer the drug.
Used for one year, able to maintain weight, there is no loss, but stabilized. Injection is easier than Glucose meter test.

I have used this drug for almost a month, but since I have switched to a higher dose, it has been given me some serious stomach pains and cramps, I have seen a little weight loss and appetite not being good, so I hope it is working.
Third week of Victoza. Stomach pain is really bad. Head ache for the first week but is now gone. But the stomach pain and wanting to vomit is horrible. I am also having hiccups

I take this to control sugar levels after eating. The first use my sugar level dropped to the normal range. It has increased my general sense of well being and side effects are minimal. I tried this after failing miserably with byetta.   Bonus is the weight loss.
Victoza has helped reduce my sugar levels and curb my appetite thus helping me lose weight.
this medication has my blood sugar in an acceptable range after 3 weeks of use.
i have been having a lot of belching and nauseated feeling. is this normal for this medication.
been using for 18 months for pre diabetes.  Lost 15 pounds effortlessly.  has anyone else started to lose weight again?  Especially if I modify my sweets and exercise.  :(
I have taken byetta BEFORE AND IT MADE ME REALLY SICK NOW THIS DOESN'T BOTHER ME AT ALL AND IT IS EASY TO TAKE.
I'm in my 2nd month of taking this & I feel great now, was sick feeling for the first two weeks & I lost 10 lbs. It has brought my readings down a lot & I love it now.  I'm almost up to taking 1.8
My diabetes levels are consistently lower using this drug. The side effects are frequent flatuence & diarrhea, though this drug may just worsen my lactose intolerance.

I have been on victoza for almost 4 months with really no side effects, but now in the last two weeks having constipation and severe acid reflux. Is anyone else experincing this or have a solution because really dont want to stop taking it.
I have been taking Victoza for 1 year now and my A1c went from 8.7 to 6 and I have lost 35 pounds! Had trouble for the first few months with nausea, but that has subsided and I feel great!

this is my 2nd week and I had no nausea, small headaches all day the first week but woke up to terrible "egg burps" this morning, does this go away??? Its terrible I hate eggs to start with and this is the worst thing yet.

I have been on this drug for two years and I am concerned about the effect this will have on my throid gland and it is not curable if you get it.  My DR. is no longer in business and I take it with Lantas Insulin.

Have been on Victoza for a little over 30 days. statrted with 0.6mg and went to 1.2 after using up 1st pen. have just started 3rd pen (1.2mg) and only side-effects are some vertigo and mild constipation. not certain if either are related to increased dosage, but suspect the vertigo may be as my sugar has dropped from an average of 170+ to 123 for the past 30 days. I am impressed with the quick return to more normal sugar and have labs coming up in 2 weeks so will be interested in seeing what A1Cwill be. also take 1mg of Glimmepride after 1st meal. I hope the vertigo will pass but will discuss with Doctor after labs.
im on my seconed week of this and i have a lump on my tounge

i have been on victoza for 4 weeks. i have lost 10 lbs and my legs were really swollen and they went down on the 2nd day of use. am on 1.2 with no side affects and i am very picky and everything makes me sick. Now i am trying to eat healthy and at least walk
I take this for metabolic syndrome. I have had a good response. I feel better. I have lost 18 pounds in the first 5 months. No side effects. I guess I was lucky.

I have been taking Victoza for 9 months along with 1000 mg metforman 2 x's per day and glipizde 1 x per day.  This is the wonder drug for me.  My glucose levels are in check and I have lost 30lbs. to date, have lots of energy again, and the once per day dosage is perfect for my lifestyle.
It seems to lower my blood sugar even on the smallest dosage. My sugar has been high for some time.
It is so easy to use and it is definitely effective. I would recommend it over Byetta.

I am on Victoza for 2 months, my fasting levels in the morning are anywhere from 189 to 234 and I also have a backache on the right above the waist line.  I have developed a strange red rash on my left forearm it doesn't itch, I am not sure what this is.  I really haven't felt like myself since taking this medication, no energy, I'm  tried all the time and belching a lot.  Is anyone else having some of these symptoms?

Started 3 wks ago, had headaches & vertigo the first week, as well as nausea & stomach ache.  Numbers are coming down, and I have lost 8 lbs.  Really tired, feel I could sleep all day.  took with 500 mg Metformin at first, stomach upset was terrible so stopped the metformin.  Also taking Gliclazide in the morning.  Will hang in there, but this is not fun.  Needles don't hurt, lancets are much worse.  Really expensive.

I was put on insulin for glucose levels ranging between 250-400 but insulin only would raise my sugars 100 points on the average. I tried 3-5 different kinds and none worked. Finally my doctor prescribed Victoza and the first day they dropped from 250+ average to 175! i used .6 for a week and stayed at 200. I then went up to 1.2 dose and sugars are staying in 160 range after few days! My glucose numbers also used to jump all over the place but now are stabling out. I have had queasy stomach butafter about 1/2 hr or so it settles down and seems to calm as my system adjusts. I have only been on it a couple weeks.
This medication is a good drug! it works for me! I've been taking it for 3 years

I have been on Victoza for about 6 wks. I have not had any nausea. I take the shot at bedtime. It has brought my blood sugar down to 160-170 from 220.  I have lost about 6 lbs sense I started tha medicine. I am taking .6mg a day. The only side effects that I have had is tightness in the chest.  It was so bad that I went to the hospital thinking I had a heart attach. I'd like to know if this has been a problem with anyone else. I still have some tightness in the chest every day, but no way near what it used to be.

I started on Victoza 3-11-2011. I weighted 362 lbs and my A1c was 13. I now weigh 284 and my A1C is 7.2 pretty good for 13 months.I no longer crave food, have lots more energy, and can walk 4 miles without taking A break when I started I couldn't walk 1\2 mile without stopping.
sometimes makes me vomit
Has been great in my treatment of typeII diabetes. Blood sugars are regulated! Love it!
intialy it was working well after one year of use effect started diminishing came back to same as it was one year back

I am only on Victoza 1.2mg for 2 1/2 weeks.  My hg is down significantly however the fatigue is terrible.  I am finding it difficult getting up in the morning. In the past I was fine on 6 hrs sleep.  Now I need more tha 10 hrs.  Not happy about this.

Hi, I started taking this medication about a two weeks ago. It's been one of the WORST treatments I have ever been on. I was vomiting all day long and severe stomach cramps. I went off the medication last Saturday and on Tuesday I had to be taken to the emergency room. I was hospitalized for almost a week, the doctor diagnosed me with severe vertigo and am awaiting to be evaluated by an ear specialist this Monday. My doctors believe this to be a possible side effect from using Victoza. I know for sure I will never take this medication again nor will I endorse it's use. For me it's been a horrible experience.

I lost over 10 lbs have not lost anymore , been taking it for over 6 months now. I love it BUT I am so irritable... am I the only one with this side effect otherwise no cramps nothing also a little headache in the mornings.

Soreness at site of injection, bruising.  I feel far less hungry - in other words, the stomach pains have ended.  I have not lost weight though.  It's my understanding that this med only works for about 2 years and I'm close to that time now.
I am having stomach and breathing problems.

Love, Love, Love Victoza. Feel so much better. I've been on a year now. A1C dropped immedietly.lost 65 pounds so far,and changed my life. I feel lucky my doctor sent me in this direction. Tried metformin for 3 weeks, like to kill me. Threw up all the time.  No side effects from victoza. I just can't say enough positive things about how victoza has changed my life for the better.

I had extreme fatigue as my BS stayed below 60. I had severe upset stomach, severe head aches, severe indigestion, severe low BS. I also had some minor itching. I lost 11 lbs in 1 week 2 days, but that was bc I could not eat. My BS would not stablize, so I am now trying Symlin and hoping for good results. This medicine would be good if it didn't have so many unruly side effects.

I have lost 75 pounds since june 2011. when i started taking this i did not exercise and lost 40 pounds.starting using treadmill in nov. and now i walk 3 miles a day.i love this medicine. i was also taken of actos. i still take a med twice a day.
Morning fasting blood sugar level has dropped close to 15 points so far.
I am not sure if this is working...only had 3 injections...have severe nausea, severe headaches and severe heart burn for 3 days.

I have type 1 diabetes, and this medication is the best thing that ever happened to me (of course, I still need insulin).  I started to use this instead of Symlin, and and it works 500% better at not causing my sugar to spike after meals.  I have also been able to decrease the amount of insulin I take by about half, and I've only been on it for a little less than a month.  The problem - it's not appoved for the treatment of type 1 diabetes so my insurance won't pay for it!!!!  Once I use up thesample I got from my doc's office, I'm out of luck:(
I just started taking this a week ago and struggling with the nausea, just bought sea bands to help, has anyone else tried this as well?

when i first started using victoza, i noticed within the first day that my level came down, and remained under 94 - 130 while I continued the medication, It was  reading 188 - 294 before this time, then I stopped due to the cost of the medication  $88.00 for 2x amonth, 2 pens that was my copay. I couldnt continue it was to expensive with my other medications.  But my glucose level went back up again and I have started taking it again, the price is now $45.00 a month, half the price on my copay,and it is working with half the dose.  I'm happy with the results so far.  But thinking of having some type of weight loss surgery.  Lap Band? ? ? ?  Have to research it some more.

Only on the meds a week and my numbers are going down - bothe FBS and weight! Thankful that I've had no side effects and that it's so easy to administer.  I take this in the AM and 2000ER Metformin at night.

I started taking this for weight loss.I felt like I was very ill for the first 10 days ( started at .06-went to 1.8 by day 10 ). It helped me alot, lost the need to eat all the time. Lost the cravings for sugar most of the time. Yes, they're side effectts too this like most drugs out there. I figured I would give myself 30 days and all negative side effects are gone. This is definately worth it, just had to rough it out for the first 2 weeks. By the way, lost  20 lbs !( with diet and gym 5x a week ).

I took 3 injections of this medicine at the .6 dose. It decreased my appetite but I experienced horrible nausea and burning in my throat. I stopped it because I have to work. My doctor is going to be angry

I have been on this shot along with 2000mg of Metformin and 45mg of Actos... The Dr who prescribed this shot told me that it would lower my blood sugar levels and also help me loose weight... It's been a month and a half and I have gained 25 lbs.. Not real happy with this. I'm having problems moving around and also have no energy..My kidneys feel like they are shutting down. I feel 10 times worse now then I did 2 months ago....
nausea all the time. saw no difference in blood sugars

I have been on Victoza for about 2+ weeks.  I gradually went from .6-1.8.  I had a really tough week or so with the dizziness, headache, heaviness on my chest and TERRIBLE ITCHING!  I'm soooo delighted that others talked about the itching.  The last few days I have noticed I'm having TERRIBLE abdominal and back pain under my ribs.  I had my gallbladder out in Nov 2011, so I think it's pancreatitis.  I see the doctore this afternoon.  I do like what Victoza is doing to my numbers, both AM fastingand during the day, much, much lower.  I have almost no appetite and I have lost 10 lbs. in such a short period of time.  I also take 2000 mg Metformin at dinner.  Not sure what the DR. will say today.  Sometimes you have to wonder if the doctors want the numbers going down at the expense of the patient.

I was extremely allergic to this drug and had to stop taking it after only 2 doses.  I had major problems with itching, shortness of breath, heaviness in my chest, bloating - it was strange because I am not a sick person nor do I have extreme reactions to medications.  The fact that I did to this one - who knows - but I did and that has made me reluctant to take other meds that are injectible.  Try it on for yourself - if it works great! if not watch you symptoms!!
This medication has helped in controlling my blood sugar but it makes  it causes insomnia and makes me hyper. Anyone else with this problelm?

My blood sugar meter readings now seem to match my low-carb diet.  I find myself having less feelings of hunger through out the day.  I did have some intestinal problems the first week, in the way of bowel movements, but never so severe it kept me from going to school and daily life.
My numbers were high and now in the 112 - 125 range. Glad I am taking this.
Only Rx that could and has brought my high numbers down to controlling area.

This medication is very good.  It is easy to administer to yourself and even if you don't like needles it is better that pricking your finger (less pain).  I have been having indigestion since I have been taking this medicine.  I not sure if the medicine is cause the problem.

Developed type two after a drunk driver hit my police car and I gained 35 pounds and began to eat poorly.  Tried all sorts of medications and this one has been the easiest and best so far.  Concerned about the thyroid cancer, but will be vigilant.  Did not like needles, but I do it on the side of my stomach and can not even feel it, unlike the finger testing.  I have also recently lost my gall bladder and have developed a candida yeast infection which has also messed up my stomach.  I was on massive amounts of anti biotics and am not sure if victoza played a role in that or not.  Trying to get my stomach balanced.  Have lost 25 pounds, but that was as much contributed to almost dying from the gall bladder and not being able to eat for two months.  Blood sugars and A1c have been GREAT since starting this.  I also take metformin (1000mg's) twice a day.  Have had to go on and off metformin due to some of the testing and the surgeries I have had, which seems to increase numbers.  Together, victoza and metformin seem to work very, very well even without major improvements in my diet.  Dont give up on the victoza/metformin.  Try tweaking things a bit until you feel better.  Good luck!

Was on glucophage 500BD and Diamicron 30 daily. Difficulty in maintaining sugars. HbA1c started to climb. Started on Victoza and ease at control of sugars. Off the Diamicron and sugars maintained with just 500 of glucophage a day. HbA1c down to 5 after 6 weeks from 7.2.

I have a fear of needles and this is VERY easy to use and there is no pain. Poking your finger is more painful by far, this is EASY. I love the small needle and it's easy to use, does not require much to inject the medicine. For the first time since I've been diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes, my sugar levels have dropped to normal levels and I am losing weight finally.
PEN ISO HARD TO PUSH WHEN INJRCTING SND IEDAL TO SMALL

this medicine made me feel the sickest i have ever felt in my life ! the nausea warning should be changed to " makes you feel like your guts are being turned inside out " ! however, i am on day 7 and starting to feel a little better and my fasting sugars have already dropped into the normal range. still feel like i have a boulder in my stomach but am hoping that will eventually go away.

I have been on this med. for two weeks and I am loving it. My sugar has been under control for the first time sense becoming a diabetic in 2000. I have been on every kind of diabetic med. and nothing has helped.
Extreme digestive matters, including dirrahea, indigestion, and stomach cramping

I have lost over 50 lbs in the last 6 months, my a1c has went from 8.5 to 5.9 over this period. My sugar stays in control which it never has before. I have gastro problems with eggy burbs and then usually throw up and then everything is fine for a while.  The dosage I am taking is .6 + 4 clicks. I have tryed to go to 1.2 but the above gastro gets worse.  If I don't over eat, I don't think I would have a problem but occasionally I do.  I have reduced my other diabetic meds too.  This is great, had to buy some new cloths though.
Have been using for one week and already seeing average blood sugar drops by 60 mg/dl average.

I've been on Victoza for a year now and have been very satisfied with my results.  My blood sugars are controlled for the first time in about 10 years!!  I did have quite a bit of nausea at first and definitely had "eggy" burps that I've read others have experienced as well.  The nausea got better once I changed my injection to the morning rather than night.  And I've noticed that if I'm disciplined about taking it at the same time each day, then the nausea doesn't seem to come.  I lost 50 lbs within the first 6 months and have stayed fairly steady since then (hoping for more :) ).

My doctor prescibed this medication because I was at a very high risk of developing diabetes. I have been on this medication for 1 month and I have lost 10 pounds.  It certainly has suppressed my appetite but I am extremely constipated.
This has been the best I have ever used I have lost weight my levels have been between 100 and 115 daily my A1C has also dropped sick to my stomach for about a week  no problem since
since using this drug my blood sugar has been so mush better.  way down.

This med has been very effective in lowering my BG levels and A1C numbers. The nausea was initially a problem. I only experienced vomiting once, but that was when I had eaten more than usual.  This drug lowers blood sugar and initially supresses the appetite.

I have been taking this drug for almost 2 years and saw a quickk drop in my daily sugar tests backed up by lowering a1c from 8 down to a steady test at 4.5 to 5. also saw a 12 % weight loss. simple to take after getting past the first shot.

I've been using Victoza for about 5 weeks. Before that I was taking Byetta twice daily. With victoza I am no longer using insulin (lantus) and feeling WAY BETTER! My A1C test 3 months ago was at 8.6, and as of last week, I have an A1C of 6.5!!!  This medication has really helped to bring my blood glucose back under control and I am feeling so much better now.

I started Victoza 3 weeks ago. I have some nauesa but my morning fasting numbers went from 135 to 95. I'm feeling better every day and I've lost 11 pounds so far. It has helped to control my appetite.

I have been on Victoza for about 6 weeks. I am currently on 1.2 dose with 1000 mg Metformin 2x per day. I had the nausea for about the 1st wk but that has subsided. I did have some constipation and diarrhea, but I am not sure if that is from the Metformin. I take my injection at night so if there is any nausea I would be asleep.  I would recommend taking at night if you are experiencing nausea.  I have lost over 12 pounds so far and my last A1C was 6.3. I also have been experiancing a decreasedappitite.

Been on Victoza for 2 weeks. .6 dose seemed to be working. Doctor upped it to 1.2. After a couple days had horrible side effects. Felt like throwing up all day. Terrible diarrhea. Doctor moved me back to .6. Will see how it goes. Definitely an appetite suppressant.

Is anybody but me worried about the side effects, most specificially thyroid cancer and or pancreatitis or pancreatic cancer or gall stones? I resisted because of the risk factors but relented. I have only been on it less than 10 days so I still have nausea. I hope that goes away!!!!!!
diarrhea with urgency about 3 hours after administration

My A1c levels have been consistently under 7 in the 3 years or so, while taking this medication. Admittedly, I have difficulty eating properly in the sense that I usually eat but once a day. I also use Metformin 1000 x 2 a day and my daily blood sugar levels average around 130. It's difficult for me to say whether I have any side effects specifically stemming from Victoza as I have several medical conditions for which I am prescribed other meds. Overall, Victoza has by far been the better of theinjectables I've used over the past several years. Levimear = weight gain. Byetta = low blood sugar and stomach problems. On the down side, Victoza is an expensive medication as a BCBS tier 3 $40 per month copay

Has any one had trouble sleeping on this??? I was on Byetta for 5 years and started feeling really bad recently, so the Dr switched me to Victoza to see if it would help. I feel alot better but my numbers are not where I want them to be, but its only been 3 weeks. I hope this improves with time.
Can't really say how this Med is doing, it is EXPENSIVE! Even with insurance.

I started take in Victoza in Feb 2011. I've lost 10 lbs. I'm now at 130 lbs. I'm on the 1.2 dosage. My A1c taken in Aug 2011 was 5.3.    In May 2011 I noticed my hair was thinning. Hair loss is not one of the side effects. However, this drug does slow down the digestive system which can interfere vitamin and mineral abortion. I started taking a daily vitamin/mineral supplement.  I also started take additional zinc (with copper include). My hair is growing back. I have little short hairs growingback.    Hair loss also can happen when a person looses weith too quickly.

After 6 months on Victoza, my morning sugar are down about 17%.  My P.M. sugars are well under 105.  Not like other users, I have not lost any significant weight. Started out with a bit of nausea, but it is all gone now.  I would highly recommend Victoza.
Nausa upset stomach but good weight loss still using lost 86 lbs

I have been on Victoza for five weeks, lost 15 pounds, and have morning blood sugars that have dropped in half, from 190 down to 95.  Only using 0.6 per day, and the appetite suppresant alone would be worth it.  I guess I'm one of the fortunate ones who have no side affects, outside of a slight nausea the first day.  So far, so good.
Have had great success with victoza. After initial nausea and weight loss, things settled down. I am still losing weight though not as fast. Diabetes under control

Have been on Victoza for about 3 months. It took a few weeks to get to 1.8 due to nausea. My blood sugars have lowered drastically and am very happy with drug.  One of lucky ones whose insurance covers.  The only real side effect is "rotten egg" burps which are embarassing in public because of smell.  Any suggestions?

Was prescribed Victoza for pre-diabetes. Has the usual side effects of nausea, headaches, which subsided after a few weeks.  Was not sure about how this med. affected my BG levels because docter did not advise me to do so and I was not familiar with diabetic practices.  I lost about 10 lbs.  I developed new side effects, however, after a few months of use.  I had increased pulse rate, severe fatigue, greatly increased hot flashes, and a surge in my apetite.  So I took myself off of this med. andwill advise doctor at next appt.  I have since gained about 5 lbs back.  One note to consider; I am on a lot of other meds for fibromyalgia and depression which may have had a bad interaction with Victoza.

The first two weeks were difficult with the nausea and being tired all the time.  I’ve lost about 7 lbs in two weeks.  My appetite is gone and I eat small normal size meals.  My morning blood sugars went from 200 to 90 within days.  I fell better that I have in years.  I did use the discount prescription card at Walgreens and they charged mw $35.00 when the program is $25.00????

Has anyone out there  experienced hair loss since using victoza?  I have been on victoza for 1 1/2 years.  Very good results, but, after about 6 months noticed my hair beginning to thin quite a bit.  It has continued to thin at a slower rate than at first, but would like to hear if any one else has experienced this as a possible side effect.

Istarted on Victoza Nov. 2010. Since on it,  my A1C has gone from a previous 7.7 to my current 5.9.  I have lost 60lbs and feel well. I do watch my diet and am more able to exercise since I am not so big.  Initially I had nausea and headache on the  medicine.  However my endocrinologist advised me to go back on my dose and increase my dose more gradually and my nausea subsided.  I do have an occasional  headache.  I think it is an incredible medication if immense help to me!
It does make you nauseated at first, in fact it really made me sick, but after about a week and a half I was feeling okay. It is helping my blood sugar it lowered my A1C by .9 the first 2 mths.
iv been on this medfor about 3months and it works great for me.I am at the maxium dose now. Lot better than Byetta which was real inconvient

When first started seemed to lower levels. Dr took me completely off Metformin.  Then  my levels started to rise. Went back on it with the Metformin but numbers still continue to be high. Did nothing to control my apetite, in fact I'm hungry all the time.
I have been vomiting often. It's quite frustrating.

I have used Victoza for 1yr. I am 1.2 dose and remain. 1.8 caused dizziness. A1-c great! BS numbers good. Did have to up my dose of Zoloft and if I forget to take Victoza which I have when I get busy, more that two days I start heart palps. I have lost 20lbs. Nausea at first but not much now. Still on Metformin 1000mg 2x day. Would like to lower this.
