I have been on Victoza and have lost 20 pounds. I was precious on Byetta for 4 years and have lost a total of 50 pounds. Everything was fine until last week when I obtained an abcess at my injection site and spent a few days in the hospital with IV antibiotics. I will not stop Victoza, but am now very careful with cleansing the injection site with an alcohol prep.
I feel victoza is working very good fo me, Big loss of appetite. Sugar not real low yet, been of this medicine for two weeks.
JUST STARTED 2 WEEKS AGO. SO FAR MILD MILD NAUSEA, AND CERTAINLY A DECREASE IN APPETITE AND THE SUGAR NUMBERS HAVE GONE FROM OVER 400 TO 130'S ....

Diagnosed with DM 2 in mid 2010. Dr prescribed this medication and I did worry about an injection everyday.  My blood sugars dropped from 400+ at time of diagnosis to 90-110 fasting and after meals.   VERY expensive because the company still has the patent on the medication.  Skip a few months and my insurance changed- had to start using Byetta.  The Byetta caused all sorts of side effects and I stopped taking it until I could appeal my insurance co to cover the Victoza again.  Looking forward to lower blood sugars and decreased appetite again.   Very good medication in my opinion, just sad it is so cost prohibitive to people without insurance or poor coverage plans.
Lost 21-24lbs in 3 months, blood sugars are great, avg 98 no real side effects for me   Best thing to come along for me in a long time

I have been on this medication now for 6 months, with no serious side effects. I have lost 17 lbs and my BS #'s stays in the 90's and low 100's.  This medicine is very expensive. Without insurance I could not afford it,

Developed vision problem due to high blood sugar.  End. doctor put me on victoza plus Janumet of 50/1000 to lower my blood sugar [130/180 day/eve, AIC 8.6]. Terrible nausea, lost of appetite but not losing weight, headaches and profuse sweating - worse than hot flashes.  Went from 0.6 to 1.2 after 5 days and symptons better but not great - vision slowly improving. Appetite still not there and smell of food makes me ill. Seeing Retina dr. in 2 weeks as well as my End.doctor for their input and recommendations.
It makes me VERY sick to my stomach.

Started Victoza in February 2011.  Have lost about 15 pounds.  I also take 1000 mg Metformin at dinner, the Victoza in the morning.  A1C went from 6.9 to 6.1 and is now at 6.2. Still a little uneasy about giving myself an injection and conerned that my body will not respond to any of these medications after being on them a while.
I have been taking this drug for about two weeks now, I cannot get over the naseau!  I hardly eat anything and have very little appitite. I wish the nausea would stop then Id love it!

Made me sick to my stomach daily, constipation, and at times it made me very hyper and I was unable to sleep.  It is also extremely expensive costing over $300.00 a month for just one daily injection.

Within two weeks of starting I felt better and my blood/glucose levels were lower. I  then had to stop the Victoza because my gfr readings were too low, my blood levels started to rise, I have gout in my knee and feel poorly. If possible I will resume Victosa as soon as I can.

I started taking VICTOZA about 3 months ago. First weak I experienced nausea and constipation but and during the first month I lost 8 lb. The next month I lost another 6 lb and now so far I lost 20 lb. I hope this continues since the blood sugar is normal and I am feeling not hungry for longer periods of time.

I've been on Victoza for over a year.   My blood sugar was nearly perfect and I lost 40 lbs in 4 months.  Then.....    All of the appetite suppression went away, and of course my weight started going up and up.   I have now gained back the 40 pounds plus 10 more!   I'm very disappointed.   My doctor doesn't have an explanation.    I did notice that one time when I accidently double dosed myself (several hours apart) that the appetite control came back, at least for a few hours.    I just don't see a lot of difference between taking two 1000mg of Glumetza, and taking the Glumetza plus the Victoza.    This is all based on my personal experience.      I think in August I'm going to go back on Byetta for a while.

I initially started taking Victoza about two months ago.  I would inject it every morning at 6:00 A.M. ant take my hypertension meds (by mouth with food) at the same time.  As I titrated the dose up to 1.8mg.'s my blood pressure began going up.  By time I reached the 1.8 mg. dose my BP had reached a really dangerous level (174/108 so I stopped taking it and my BP dropped back to it's normal(118/76) or reasonably there about.  Needless to say, my physician wasn't happy that I had discontinued theVictoza with out consulting him.  He went as far as to say "the Victoza wouldn't do that"(time for a new Doc.) referring to the elevated BP.  Long story short..the doc. changed my BP meds and placed me back on the Victoza...Same problem with the BP again.  Not wanting to stop the Victoza because it was really controlling my blood sugar readings and food cravings, I did some more research decided to try taking the Victoza 3 hours after my BP meds....Bingo..BP has stayed within my normal range and the Victoza is working well.  My guess is that the Victoza works so well at slowing stomach emptying that the my BP meds were probably only trickling into my system if they were being absorbed at all.  Only other problem was some constipation...that seems to have passed (sorry for the bad pun).
I have been taking this drug for six days. Nausea, diahrrea, no actual vomiting but have been crying for two days! I also take Prozac. Anyone out there on both of these meds?

Been on Victoza for 1.5 months.  1 week at 0.6 dose, the rest at 1.2 until the last few days when I went up to 1.8.  It just isn't working!  My blood sugar is higher than on my previous regimen.  Sadly, the side effect of weight loss hasn't happened to me, either.  I talked to the doctor, wanting to go back to the fairly effective combo I was on before, but she just said to go up to 1.8.  That was 3 days ago and my fasting blood sugar is still over 200 every morning.
I only started this 3 days ago. The first night I was up with stomach pain, nausea, and head ache. Haven't been sick since but I can't seem to stop crying. Has anyone else had this strange symptom???
I am one who does not like needles.  It has lowered my blood level and I have lost some weight
lost weight and blood sugar in the normal range.
I have even lossed some weight with this medication its help keep my blood sugar down to normal ranges for a year now
Have been on this med for awhile, doing great until I switched ins. co. New ins. does not cover. Found at a canada phar. at a extremelly reasonable price. Drug co and ins co are screwing us.

I've been taking two diffeent types of insulin (fast acting and a 24 hr. type that levels me out for a 24 hour period) for at least 8-10 years.  I recently found that not only had I gained weight but my insulin use increased substantially (daily fast acting up to 70 units; evening insulin up at 62 units).  I began using Victoza about 1 month ago and the results have been startling.  There was a 2 1/2 day period that other than the Victoza shot, I took NO insulin whatsoever!  While using VictozaI soon learned that any corrective fast acting insulin must be reduced dramatically or there are severe "going low" consequences.  No problem now with adjustments I've made (I take no more than 7 units of fast acting insulin for a full  day and I reduced my evening type dose to 42 units.)  Now when I awake in the morning, my blood sugars are between 80-133 and are relatively normal throughout the day.  A huge change for me.  I have also lost 15 lbs. and have a suppressed appetite (something that goes along with the Victoza use).  The side effect for me is nausea.  This side effect began on day 1 and continued for almost 20 hours/day for a month.  Now my nausea has been significantly reduced but my appetite remains suppressed.  This is a miracle drug!  My doctor says this drug contains a certain hormone (nomally produced by the body) that directs the pancreas to produce more insulin (the stated purpose of Victoza). Apparently, I have not been making this hormone for some time.  Now, 1 Victoza shot of 1.2 units/day is all it takes and I'm close to normal. I hope this all continues.
on victoza 5 months a1c down from 11.5 to 7.9 side effects go away at 1.2 dose Constipation is still a problem but low b/s readings are worth it

Tried Byetta - dropped by BS too much.  Started Victoza, within first 2 weeks stopped 2 other medications for diabetes.  Have had very few side effects.  Additionally have lost 30 lbs in 6 months because I feel full longer and I am not always craving food because of variance in BS.  I am glad this is working for me.

I had been taking Byetta before starting Victoza so my side effects were minimal.  It has been working great for me, controlling my blood sugar and also my appetite.  My A1C's have been between 5.8 and 6.3.  I have had just a few occasions where my sugars dropped low.  So far this drug has worked great for me.
I have zero side effects but it's also not having any effect on my blood sugar.  I'm at 1.2.  I just don't think going to the max will make a difference.

I JUST STARTED TAKING THIS MEDICATION A FEW DAYS AGO .  i am taking the lowest dosage of 0.6, I have to wait a week before I can take the next dose of 1.2.  I sugar has been up and down and I am concerned about it.

Cannot take the nausea,headache,weakness, I lost a few # due to the fact I was too sick to eat!Feeling like this and trying to work as a nurse is not a good combination, will stop this med.0.6 did not have as severe side effects as 1.2 but had no positive results. Will take a different route
No side effects, good wt loss and glucose control.

I have been on Victoza for 3 weeks and am now up to the 1.8 dosage.  Just can't seem to get over the nauseaus, tired feeling all the time.  Definitely has decreased my appetite.  Just wondering how much longer these side effects will be around.

Just started taking this a few weeks ago.  I didn't have significan side effects until I started the 1.8 dose.  Back pain, abdominal pain, horrible diarrhea, reflux and "rotten egg" burps - feeling very sick for two days now.  It has definitely helped my numbers... actually 89 the other day! This is down from my norm of over 200!  The shots themselves are relatively painless, but the side effects at the higher dosage are pretty miserable.  I hope they will subside soon.

Been on this medication for about 4 months and it is fabulous. Blood sugars were normal within days at 1.2 dosage. Lost about 22 pounds though that has slowed down. My only issues are the cost which I currently have a 1 yr. discount card from Victoza for $25/mo. and the belching/constipation. Just uncomfortable but not horrible. I went off oral meds because of gastro issues (allergic to sulfa) and had been on Byetta (didn't work) and Symlin (unpredictable nausea) as well as lantus and novloog. Am now off novolog entirely and dosage on lantus is cut by about 1/3.

when i first started it,i lost weight.however the longer i was taking it i regained the weight.now i am maintaining the weight rather than gaining. i have been experiencing stomach and back pain which i thought was irritable bowel syndrome.now i have read the side effects i am not so sure about this.
Makes me sick on my stomach

I have been taking victoza for 2 months, along with metformin and Lantus. It took about a month to really "kick in" but when it did, I brought my BS down to the low 100's and I lost 20 lbs so far. I was able to lower my Lantus from 55 iu down to 30 iu. I have not experienced any adverse side effects!
I have had no side effects! It has lowered my blood sugars. I am eating less which good for me because I need to lose weight.

over the years have used Byetta (no good for me) Levemir and Novolog (caused severe bloating) various Oral meds incl. metformin which disagrees with me, and finally now on Victoza.  Been using Victoza for 4 months now also using amaryl 4mg per day and lost 34lbs, no more swelling or bloating. Started on .6 and went to 1.2 within 2 weeks and now on 1.8. Great appetite suppressor. currently trying Metformin again as well to help lower BG numbers, however only able to handle 125mg 2x per day without side affects.  Only problem now is constant indigestion and burping, very little acid. I think it is the Metformin and higher 1.8 dose combined, so will hang in there and see how  the next 2 months go, adding an anti indigestion med to the mix.  overall very happy with experience and on the way to losing another 15lbs this three months... AND lowering BG#... we'll see.

I've had hypoglycemia since my 30's..now in my 60's I vasillate between type 2 and hypo with sugars going high and/or dropping low.  This drug has helped me to balance out these highs and lows... I have been using it for 6 months.  lost 5 lbs at the beginning but no symptoms or problems with the drug... just a balanced sugar level..

I have lost 11 pounds in just 9 days on this drug.  That's a plus but the benefit of having no appetite makes me have to force myself to eat. The nausea, at least for me, is minimal if at all.  I started out at 0.6 for 1 week and have been on the 1.2 for 3 days now.  I think it is a great drug that minimizes stomach upset.  Was on Metformin and had constant stomach/bowel issues.   The warning about the pancreatitis for those with high tryglicerides kind of spooked me but I talked with my doctorand he said it was a minimal risk.  I read the clinical trials as well.  I would recommend this to anyone who is pre-diabetic or type 2.
I have been on so many different medications and this is the first one that has truly worked for me.  I am so happy to finally have my diabetes under control.
lower my blood sugar level by 100 points

Have been on Victoza since 9/25/10. At the 1.8 dosage for about 3 mos. Doing great. A1C was 6.2. Dr very pleased. Have lost 34 lbs since starting. Still helps w/appetite control, but not like at first. Even so, am definitely making better decisions on my own.

Was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes in 2004, and while Metformin worked at first, it gradually became less effective.  Dr. added Glucotrol, and upped the Metformin dose, and I did my best with diet and exercise, but my numbers just went up and up.  Finally went to see an endocrinologist who put me on Victoza.  Have had no noticeable side effects, and my fasting blood glucose went from 276 to 92 in a month.  A1c is down 1.5 points in that same time period.  My BG numbers are now always well withinthe normal range and I'm losing weight.  Don't love the injections, but it's not hard or painful, and the result is totally worth it!

I've been on BP meds, chol. meds for years, always been heavy. Had bariatric surgery 11 years ago and gained all 110 lbs back +. All joints ached. Miserable. Diagnosed w/ type II diabetes 2 years ago but did nothing about it until 3 months ago (other than Metformin). Started Victoza and it is like a lifeline for me! Minor nausea for first week but that's all. All readings have come way down, no more pain, no more swelling in legs/feet. But best news is 45 lb. weight loss. Increased from lowest to highest setting in 1 week. Not hungry, no more "grazing" which is my downfall normally, happy and hopeful for first time in LONG time. Only trouble is I can't afford the drug as my insurance won't cover it. Dr. has stopped giving me samples. I'm out of Victoza and now devastated. Talk about "dangling the carrot!" Make slightly too much for medical aid. Give me something that finally works then take it away due to outrageous costs. Victoza drug rep tried to help but my insurance wouldn't budge on it. Help!

I am a type 2 diabetic and I was on Metformin. I was having some complications with it so I stopped taking it. Well, I found a new doctor and she placed me on this medicine. It has been wonderfull! I dont eat as much, I feel full faster, and my BS level is staying down. I am not a fan of shots, but this is so easy that I can do it myself. I am starting to have some trouble with my feet hurting though. Does anyone else have this problem?

I have been taking Victoza for 6 months.  At first I had headaches, was nausas, heart burn,constipation...it took about 2 months of backing down and slowly increasing again on the dosage and taking it in the evening.... to level out. I also had flu like symptoms and was so tired all the time. I lost 13 lbs. initially in 2 weeks and put 3lbs. back on. My blood sugar levels are better than they have been in years. I am so happy with Victoza, it was worth the rough time I went thru at first. Now Ihave started weight Watchers to take more lbs. off. My enery level is up and I am working out or walking every day. LIFE IS GOOD! Thank you Victoza!!
I have just started taking the 1.2mg injection. Three hour later, before lunch my BS reading was 265. Does anyone know how long it takes for Victoza to start lowering BS levels?

I have been on Victoza for 2 weeks and I love it. My BS is actually normal now. I am still on oral meds and insulin. I have had some ill effects, like constipation, gas, bloating, nausea and headache but they seem to have disappeared now. I am now on the 1.8mg dose. I have lost a few pounds. My appetite has decreased which helps with weight and sugar control. I am keeping an eye out for serious complication(which can happen with ANY drug). I am very satisfied with Victoza
I like the med. but have a problem with nausea and vomitting.

I take 1.2 micrograms of Victoza along with 500mg metformin bid. This drug is pretty much amazing. I've been on it for about two weeks and my BG levels are way down. Was averaging about 250 fasting and am now down to low 100s fasting. I've also lost about 6lbs already. The needle is so small that you barely feel it. I prefer this drug to Byetta. I am so grateful for this medication.
it took my blood sugar from 190 to 75
Really brought my readings into normal range.  Had a severe breathing reaction after increase to 10mg.  I thought I was having a heart attack.  Went to the emerg. room.  told to stop taking victosa.
This shot has worked for me along with Advandia (I know the reports on this and I am not having any problems been on Advandia for years) ~ It's easy to take with no pain or side effects!!
drug interactions WITH pain medicines caused bad rashes
Have been on Victoza for 2 1/2 months with no side effects. I have lost so far 35lbs. but now at a standstill. So far my numbers are good. Am very pleased with the drug I take 1.8 each day

I have been on this medication for 6 months without experiencing any serious side effects. Initially, I had some nausea, but once I regulated the dose, it's been fine. I take it along with one tablespoon of flaxseed oil which has significantly dropped my levels and my AC1. If you want to take a natural alternative along with med, get your doc's permission first. I just wish the med was less costly, but so far worth it.

Started on Victoza a little over a week ago.  First day, I took my Vicodin for my joint pain and was sick as a dog.  Never been so sick in all my life.  Throwing up on average every 2 minutes for 2 1/2 hours straight.  Then, was fine till a week later when I took my Vicodin again.  Also sick.  I blamed it on the Victoza, but I think it's the combo.  My numbers are incredible.  Went from morning fasting of around 250 to about 140 on the .06 dose.  Am still taking metformin and glymiperide.  Am going to tritrate up to the 1.2 gently over the next week, but may have to cut the glimperide down.  Weight loss: 5 lbs. but could be due to vomiting and diarrhea.  Love this drug though.

Have been on Victoza for two months. Started on 0.6 and moved up to 1.2 two weeks later. Initial nausea has subsided. My sugar levels are way down, I am losing weight and have stopped my nightly insulin injections. Still take 2000 mg of metformin daily. After all the other drugs I have been on, this is the only one that has worked and I am quite happy with it.

I've been taking Victoza for just over a week.  No luck with oral medications.  Instant positive results with Victoza.  Initially, I had nausea, but that improved on a daily basis.  I'm not constantly hungry, so I can see weight loss in my future.  I will be increasing the dose to 1.2 mg within the next week, and remain optimistic that I can deal with any side effects that might accompany the increased dose.  Victoza has been an eye opener for me.  2 or 3 days of use showed me that being more and more restrictive in my diet was not going to help my oral meds lower my blood sugar.  I am just so happy with the results I've experienced so far with Victoza.  I feel like the hands of time have been turned back for my health!!!!
Lost weight the first 2 months, am now at a plateau it seems. No side effects.

In one month of taking Victoza, I have had four episodes of severe vomiting, diahhrea, severe stomach pains and indigestion.  I now have a serious  infection of the pancreas and will need treatment.  I think this drug is the worst!  It should not be  on the market!!!  These are serious side effects!!!
very rugged side effects of the stomach and intestinal tract
Dropped my glucose to half and my insulin is cut way back. I have some stomach upset but not too bad. Almost gave up hope. great stuff!!!
I've been on victoza for about a month_sugars way down with no bad side effects-UNTIL NOW-I am having an allergic reaction at injection site.  Any suggestions? Topical creams? Tips?
i did not get hungery
When I first took it I was very sick at my stomach and felt horrible.  As I increased the dosage the nausea got better.  I am so glad that I waited it out and kept taking it.

I have been on Victoza for a week and am very pleased with the results so far.  I am up to the 1.2 dosage and have lost a few pounds plus it has cut my appetite tremendously.  My sugars were in the mid 300's before starting the drug and in the last 24 hours they are in the upper 100's.  I have had a little bit of nausea but taking the drug at night seems to help.  The worst side effect I have had is burping...alot.  No acid reflux (I'm on Nexium for that) but quite a bit of burping.  Wondering if anyone else has had this problem?
this treatment has work well for me
LOVE THIS DRUG...IVE LOST 25LBS IN 4 MONTHS AND BS WAY DOWN!!!

I've only been on the drug for six days on the lowest dosage of .6.  I've lost 5 lbs. although I do experience hunger before meals. No major side effects except mild reflux.  Worked amazingly first 3 days, with blood sugars decreasing by about 100 points.  However, since the fourth day, numbers have been steadily rising.  Hoping the 1.2 does will stop the rise.  Has this happened to anyone else where the first few days were great but then the blood sugars began to rise?

I tried Byetta and experienced intense nausea and couldn't tolerate it. My MD switched me to Victoza and I have lost 20 lbs in 4 months. I still experience mild nausea and acid reflux but my A1C is better and my sugars are better controlled.
I just started using this drug. My doctor is positively optomistic about the coming results for me. Therefore the scores I gave above should come up in the next few months of use.

PLEAS IF YOU ARE READING THIS, STOP TAKING THIS DRUG, MY MOTHER WAS TAKING IT ,AND SHE ALMOST DIED BECAUSE OF IT. SHE IS IN HOSPITAL AND IS IN SEVERE PAIN, SUFFERING FROM PANCREATITUS. THIS DRUG SHOULD BE BANNED..................

I started taking Victoza on Nov 23rd. It's been six weeks and I lost 10lbs. I am so happy with the weight lost. I started out on lowest dose, I am on max dose now. I did have nausea mostly at night and some acid reflux. It seems to be getting alot better. My glucose readings are way down. The lowest it's been in 13 years.I can't wait to go back to dr at the end of month to see what my A1C is now. Last one was 7.3.... I take Janumet 50/1000mg 2xday. Amaryl 4mg-- 1and half tab daily.Victoza 1.8mgin morning. It definitely decreased my appetite, I no longer crave sweets like I used to, which is amazing in itself.....This is a wonder drug for me, I just hope I dont end up with the thyroid cancer. My pharmacist said it is safe, that the benefits outweigh the risk and that everything has potential for serious side effects. I dont know if losing the weight has anything to do with this but I noticed my blood pressure has been really low so I decreased my benicar to see if that's what I needed... I hopefully will loose some more weight at least 20lbs and I would be so happy...... I will post my blood results when I get them next.

First week on new med, taking with glucophage 1000mg bid, love this med! Was on Byetta but Victoza is better.  Blood sugars are excellent, appetite suppressed. Hoping for great results nest week when I up my dose.

I have been on Victoza for about 6 months with fantastic results.  I did experience nausea with initial dosing, however, Dr. prescribed Phenergan to take along with the shot until the nausea subsided.  The Dr. recommended taking the shot just before bedtime along with the anti-nausea meds.  Also, do not give the initial dosages in your stomach area, this will increase the nausea effects.  My A1c went from 7 to 5.1.  I have lost about 45 lbs. and will probably no longer have to take Metformin.  Iwas very hesitant about taking Victoza, but glad I stuck it out with the nausea and hope to continue to lose weight.
Have been on Victoza for 4 months. HgA1C was 9 and dropped to 6. No side effects. No wt loss either but getting BS close to normal is great.

Have been on Victoza for about 8 weeks now.  Started on .6 for 1 week and bumped dose up to 1.2 one week then up to 1.8 1 week.  Have had nausea from the start and was so bad at highest dose I dropped back to 1.2 1 week with no relief.  Spoke with Dr and she told me to drop to .6 which I have been on for 5 weeks.  Still having nausea despite watching dietary intake, drinking fluids, etc.  Fasting BS have been between 85-110 and after meals highest was 115.  However I can't stand the nausea and have experienced dizzyiness, weakness and constant leg and foot aches and pains (not sure what this is all about as I have done nothing to hurt my legs/feet).  Also been having itching scalp, legs , arms and body but thought it was just dry skin.  Didn't know it was a side effect until today.  I've tried giving injections with meals, without meals and at bedtime.  I wake up nauseated and experience nausea throughout the day even on lowest dose.  I don't think this drug is for me. I see my Dr monday the 20th and going to get her to stop the drug.  I am sick of being sick.
well i really havent taken this drug very long only 1 week but it is esy to use and my sugar seems to be doing better

Started Victoza six + months ago. Using  Actos pills, Lantus at 45 units daily and Humalog 10 – 15 units 3X daily. A1C was 6.5 and gaining one pound per month.  Initial goal was to lose weight. First attempt 0.6 for one week then 1.2. Stopped because of the vomiting and hiccups.  Second attempt 0.6 for one month then 1.2. At 1.2 suffered from heartburn, ED and hiccups. Third attempt 0.6 until sugar levels begin to rise (2 Months) then went to 1.2 for two weeks. At full dose for just over a weeknow. No longer taking Lantus or Humalog with morning readings between 100 and 106. Spikes are below 180 two hours after meals and 100 – 106 before meals.  Side effects are hiccups after meals and random hiccups between meals, constipation and ED. ED medications ineffective so far.  Giving it another month to see if the ED goes away. The key was staying at a lower dose until blood sugars rose to the point of increasing insulin. Eating several small meals daily and drinking lots of water with mild exercise is a plus.
great a1c is very much controled.  55 pounds lost using this drug
A big improvement over Byetta in ease of use.  Started at 0.6 for first week and then directly to 1.2 dosage without any problems. Weight loss has been a plus.
easy,slightly nausea, appetite decreased and loss weight which I wanted.

I'm 56 yr old female.  Changed from Janumet to Januvia about 3 months ago.  Absolutely no side effects except went from constant metformin diarrhea to a little constipation, but that left when I bumped up the fiber.  No appetite unless I have physical hunger, which is good, and I'm down around 5 lbs.  Not as good BG control as I would like, but I spent about 5 of those weeks with a tooth infection and one on cortisone, which wreaked havoc with the BG.  I'm scared of the thyroid cancer possibility--to the one who's developed the cancer, what were the symptoms?  I feel for you....

Easier than Byetta. One injection a day and not having to time it around a meal makes it much more appropriate for my lifestyle. So far I've had very little nausea. My appetite is significantly decreased, but not in an unpleasant way.

I've been on Victoza for about a month now as the sole med to treat my Type 2 diabetes. Started off at 0.6 for 1 week... then increased by two CLICKs each day for 5 days until I reached the goal of 1.2mg. I found that the slow titration upward decreased the side effects. I must say I've had some nausea the first week... but haven't vomited until today. Vomited several times this morning... not sure why now?? Injections in my stomach and thigh often times causes a quarter size bruise. I don't like that at all. I have found a hip injection to work the best... no pain or bruising. I hope that site is ok. It seems to be working pretty well. BSs are down a good bit but my fasting bs is higher than I would like... about 115 each morning. I hope my A1C gets back below 7 and I don't have to increase my dose up to 1.8. Constipation is my biggest side effect. I have never had that issue before. I'm taking 3 Docusate Sod 100mg per day. Its better but still an issue. So far, I like the Victoza over Metformin as the Metformin made me violently sick with nausea/vomiting/diarrhea.  So overall I'm pleased... will know more later
To soon to tell only one month .

Have been on Victoza since Sept 25, started 6 days at .6, then upped to 1.2.  A bit of nausea at first, long gone.  Lots of constipation, taking fiber.  It has drastically reduced my readings back to normal.  Between 5 and 6.5 in the morning and absolutely no highs anymore.  I am on an insulin pump and have had to reduce my total amount of insulin from approx 85u a day to 50u or so.  I have lost 14lbs and my appetite is greatly reduced.    My endocrinologist said we will wait another month and then increase to 1.8, it should help even more for the weigh lost.  This drug is unbelievable, I only wish I had found it before. I cannot take Metformin as it makes me seriously sick.
haven't tried it

Have had three episodes of vomiting during the past month.  I thought I had food poisoning the first time but soon realized what was causing it.  I am no longer taking Victoza.  Stomach feels a lot better.  It did lower my sugar readings but I could not tolerate the side effects.

Have been on Victoza for about 2 weeks. Endless nausea, some vomiting and diarreah all the first week. Probably lost weight because I feel like Im going to be sick all the time. Blood sugars just as high as always, I feel like my Zoloft is no longer effective and am basically miserable on this. Will give it another week or two but if no improvements, forget it!

After 7 weeks, I have lost 10 pounds and my morning BSL is down from around 200 to the 130s. Not as low as I would like but something is better than nothing. I also take Metformin 1000 twice a day and Glipizide 2x daily as well. I have found that if I have a piece of toast or something else small on my stomach when I first take the injection, there is no nausea and vomiting. I have definately lowered my intake of food which is the major goal, and my numbers lower as well. I have not had any of the other side effects mentioned here, so I count myself lucky. Hope this helps!!!

I have been on this now for about 2 weeks, started at the lower dosage for the first 4 days with no nausea or vomiting.  Increased it after 4 days and on the 6th day I had a violent episode of vomiting and severe nausea however since then everything is good.  I have lost about 5 pds so I'm loving the appetite suppresant, levels are lower and I hoping they get better.  NO other side effects and I'm loving it!!!!!

I have been using for 6 months or more, recently up dosage to 1.8mm.  I have had sinus stuffiness, doesn't go away.  Nausea was short lived no problems, does help some with appetite, but not tremendously.  So much easier to remember one shot a day, I take in the morning or early afternoon.  I do have constipation issues since starting, and severe dry skin since upping my dosage of this medication.  My morning blood sugars are definitely better, nothing else had helped morning sugar readings.  Overall, this medication has been a good thing for me.

this drug has work great,about a week into taking I started getting a bad egg taste in my mouth,I stop taking the drug for one day and now i have been taking for the last two weeks and i don't have no more bad egg taste in my mouth.

Started Victoza 9/25 & have lost 14 lbs. Feeling fabulous! Feelings of light to moderate nausea have gone away, but appetite still supressed most of the time. Inject at night before going to bed. Dr is really please, as am I! Blood sugars within normal range first time in a long, long time!
My a1c has dropped in 3 months from 10.1 to 7.4. I take it in the morning and wait awhile before I take my other meds. It really works for me and I'm happy.

I have been taking Victoza for 10 days now. I lost 6 lbs, and have reduced my insulin intake by 20 units a day.  Little bit of almost nausea, no appetite, have to force myself to eat, except in the morning.  So far, I am in love with this drug, hope it continues to help me reduce my insulin and lose weight.

5th day on this and have had great results with my blood pressure.  Sugars are fine. Has taken all of the water off of my legs, which use to be so bad.  I can touch my shin bones now.  However I don't like the nausea but am hoping that it will subside.  I am taking the beginning dose of .6. Having slight headache but is manageable. Loss of appetite is great, but no one likes to eat to much when they are nauseated. First time with injections and is incredibly easy and painless with no bruising.Am hoping that the weight starts to shed. I am so glad that my copay is only $20.

Have been on Victoza over 3 mos. now.  I have nausea, vomiting, constipation and diarhea.  I thought that by changing the time I take my Victoza, 1.2, to the afternoon and my other dia., blood pressure, synthroid, etc. meds in the morning that the nausea might stop.  It hasn't.  I cannot stand the morning nausea feeling anymore. occasionally this is accompanied by vomiting/dry heaves of thick clear foamy liquid.  Victoza has decreased my appetite. I do not know how much if any weight loss yet.It has lowered by morning sugars to the 90's.  I would like to continue to take it for its appetite depressant and lower blood sugars but I cannot stand the nausea ruining days out of my life.  I have changed the timing of the medication, which seemed to help for a while, but I am still getting the nausea.  I do crave sweets more though.  I would only hope that there is a solution to my problem because I do want to continue this medication for its sugar lowering and weight loss effects but will not be able to do so with this nausea.  I have also recently had an allergic reaction requiring the immediate use of benedryl.  Don't know for sure if reaction was to the VICTOZA.  I am going to contact my dr. to stop this med. unless there is some other way to get around the nausea.
it is helping to lower sugar however sinse i have been taking victoza i have had allergies i have never seem to have had before? also skin....hives?
cant take the rotten egg smell and the beltching, I burp a lot and can't control it.
this has cured other illnesses i have

i've been on victoza for about 3 months and the first week was tough but after that no problems.  I have lost 18 pounds so far and no more hot flashes so for me it's helping with two problems diabetes and menapause
just started having unusual symptums

Been on this medication approximately 2 months. Blood sugar level down, weight loss of 5 pounds. Had minor headaches and limited nausea but never vomited. Feel really great. Concerned about the side effects that may cause throat cancer especially since I have enlarged thyroid. Would like to know more about this.

Been on Victoza 1 wk today. Lost 5.5 lbs so far, which is great! Only a slight feeling of nausea, but appetite is greatly reduced. Sometimes it's hard to find something to eat that's appealing. Blood sugars coming down nicely. 97 the other day. Don't know when I've seen 97!

It works!  I have been taking Vitoza for about 3 months and I have lost 22 lbs.  My glucose levels have stopped wildly fluctuating.  For the first week or so I did suffer from nausa but it did subside.

Been using Victoza for several months now. Very good results. Unfortunatley I have been recently diagnosed with medullary thyroid cancer. My doctor said there may be a link to Victoza usage. Not good.

This has been a good experience for me.  I've used Victoza 2 months and lost over 15lbs, immediately.  I started at .6 then moved up to 1.2 on the Victoza Pen.  Walmart Pharmacy has a very good prescription program to help with the cost of the needles and Pen.  My readings are between 85 and 90 before and after eating. Was nauseated but never threw up.

I have only been on this medicine for 3 days, but everything seems good so far.  I was leary about giving myself a shot, but Victoza is very easy to use and you can hardly feel the needle.  For those concerned about the cost, my Doctor said that there are certain pharmacies that have a pilot program with Victoza where your co-pay is covered for a year. I have noticed that I feel full much fast than before and am not hungry as much as before.  I have had acid reflux and a minor headache but nothing unmanageable.

I am a morbidly obese patient, that has PCOS, insulin resistance, and I am not a diabetic.  However, the insulin resistance part of the PCOS is making it nearly impossible to loose weight, no matter how little I eat.    I am on Victoza for 3 full weeks now, along with a prescription of Metformin, and I have lost about 11 pounds the first 3 weeks.  I have not had ANY nausea or gas issues that people complain about, and I am at max dose 1.8 once a day.  My appetite is drastically less, my cravingsare completely reduced, and it takes less food to feel full with.    So far, I could not be happier with this new medication.

I been taking Victoza since the end of July 2010.  This is a miracle drug for me.  Typically my blood sugars have average 85 to 100 since taking it, and I've lost about 10 lbs so far.  The appetite has definitely change; I have to remember to eat and no longer crave sweets/carbs.  In the early weeks, the vomiting was hard to deal with, but that has eased some what.  I take it (1.2mg Victoza) along side 1000mg of Glucaphage daily, but have to ensure at least 4 hours between the Victoza and a Glucaphage dose or the vomiting returns. All in all, I'm very happy with this medication.  Yeah for 'V'...

I began using Victoza 4 months ago..I have experienced so side effects and my HA1C has gone down significantly (from 7.0 to 6.1). What I like best is the fact that you only use one shot a day so it is much easier to use.

Overall goal is weight loss and reduce or eliminate insulin thru weight loss, exercise and diet.  Started this drug for third time with Actos. First time with Humalog (on a sliding scale before meals) and Lantus at bedtime, (dose cut in half as needed until zero is needed) at 1.2 does experienced violent hiccups and vomiting along with constipation. Lost 10 pounds and sugars were never over 120. Root cause was Meals to large and not drinking enough water. Second attempt experienced ED at 1.8. Third attempt, first week, 0.6; sugars no higher than 125, have not taken any Lantus or Humalog. Lost 4 pounds.  mild heart burn and occasional hiccups.  Will move up click by click until ED occurs then back off until ED goes away. Third time Pros; weigh loss, not hungry and lower sugars. Cons; not thirsty, can’t judge sugar low levels by feel, not thirsty at all, very small and more frequent meals or violent hiccups/nausea will result, generally feel different, mild heart burn, occasional hiccups when I consume near the food limit. Happy with drug if I can lose weigh without the major side effects.

I have been on Victoza for 4 weeks now and my numbers haven't been above 116.  Sore at the injection site(leg), but overal tollerable.  Weight loss total so far is 8 lbs.  I don't feel as tired and I have to force myself to eat.  I haven't finished a complete meal, always leaving food on my plate. I wish I started this medicine a long time ago!!

After 3 months - 34 lb weight loss, blood sugars have dropped about 30 points, A1C went from 6.1 to 5.9. Only side effect so far is manageable constipation. Hope this all keeps up (except the constipation). So far am very happy with Victoza - dose 1.2
I'm very pleased with the results.  I take Victoza and Metformin (2 times a day).  My numbers are better than the ever were with Byetta. I've been taking it for 3 weeks with no side effects so far.
been on about 3 weeks, losing weight OK, indegistion more often, sugar levels seem higher without glucophage but going to give it a few more weeks, better than beyetta.

I am a 35 year old female and have been taking Victoza since August 22. I have lost 10 lbs so far. I am very tired but I feel better now than I did before the medication. I have no other side effects except bruising at the injection sites which is no big deal. Will continue to monitor progress.
Three weeks into starting Victoza and I'm still sick.  I haven't gotten to the full dosage yet.  I have to make myself eat.  I don't know how long I'll continue.  Lost 8 lbs.so far.
digestive problams

I started Victoza around March 2010. I have lost around 10 pds, my blood sugars are always great now. I am still taking glucophage also.  This drug has been a miracle for me. I would recommend it. I have had no bad side effects that I read from others. Doc says A1C is great!

So far so good. Have been on Victoza since March 2010. No significant weight loss. Some bruising at the injection site. I have experienced a slight nausea that I would attribute to Victoza. I inject in the abdomen, it's not fun. Drug needs to be oral.

Victoza simply put my bowels in an uproar and I was tired all the time, after 6 weeks.  I am off of it now and feel better and bowels are in check.  But I like the no craving sweets and loss of weight, slowly.

Replaced insulin with  Victoza, and in three weeks have ramped up from 0.6 to 1.8 mg/day.  Blood sugar is well controlled, usually between 90 and 110 in the morning, and during the day staying within 20 points of the morning reading--much better than with the once-a-day insulin.  Also in those three weeks I've lost 8 pounds.  Minor nausea (though no vomiting) has kept my appetite down.  Have been experimenting with much smaller meals, which has usually helped.  I am very tired, though--is this aside effect of the drug or the disease?  Very satisfied with the drug.
Extreme nausea and tiredness at the highest dose of 1.6.  Dropped back to 1.2 and symptoms much less.  Now an injection site reaction is happening.
I been on it for 1 week., blood sugars are down.,blood sugars run around 200, this week 150 and today 114., But I can't stand the headaches

Took Victoza over 4 months. Told my Dr. about the vomiting; she wanted me to stay on it. So I started over with using the lower, middle and higher doses on a weekly basis.  Still I could not tolerate the violent vomiting and rotten eggs burping tastem and 'losing' 2 days of my life every time I got sick. I lost only 10 pounds. My numbers did not come down, especially the fasting. My Dr. does not know I quit taking it; she will not be happy with me but that's a chance I have to take. Went back toMetformin and Glimepiride. #s are better if I watch the carbs; if I don't, they go through the roof. It would appear I'm on my way to insulin.

I am fortunate not to have experienced any of the negative side-effects that have been listed.I have been using it since March/April and my AC1 is finally below 7.I have lost about 30 lbs.and mytaken with generic version of amaryl my fasting readings are between 90-110 and an hour after meals, no more than 130. I am very satisfied with all of it except the outrageous cost.

I am a 53 year old female and I have been on this drug for a little over a month now and it seems to do wonders in lowering the blood sugars as well as keeping me from wanting food.  I find that the acid reflux is very annoying but I really need the weight loss.  I am lossing weight although I have not checked the scales.  My clothes are not as snug and people are noticing so I know it is working in that area.  I am still concerned about the stomach issues and may need to adjust the dose.

I have been taking since May 22. I lost 2 lb on first week,and have stayed the same weight since,My blood sugars was good,until   Aug I had a lot of  heart burn and stop take  Victoza, and blood sugars is hight and Dr chang my med Janumet 1000mg, hope is work for me, other thigs Victoza is too expensive. My ins not cover :(

I have been taking since May 22. I lost 2 lb on first week,and have stayed the same weight since,My blood sugars was good,until   Aug I had a lot of  heart burn and stop take  Victoza, and blood sugars is hight and Dr chang my med Janumet 1000mg, hope is work for me, other thigs Victoza is too expensive. My ins not cover :(
45 yr. old male I have been on this medication for 1 month now.Side effects are   allready gone,MY Sugar level's are down as well as My A1c test.Weight loss around 2-4 Lbs.

A1c dropped from 7.2 to 5.8 in three months. Started in May and have lost 37 pounds and still losing. Watching diet and walk 30 minitues 5 to 6 times a week. Think this combination is best for me. FEEL GREAT!  Mild headache is nothing compared to how I feel overall. Love this drug!

Found Victoza easy to use and effective. Have had none of the documented side effects. Blood chemistries improved significantly over a two month period. Only issue is prohibitive cost. Initially tried Byetta which caused nausea which increased over time.
Getting much better sugars than with Byetta
After 6 mos. weight loss of 33 pounds is great.  Morning glucose has not dropped at all, even after adding Actos.  Probably not the right med for me.
Within a few days, blood sugars dropped 30-50 points pretty consistently.  Have had bad gas with the rotten egg burps and vomitted violently on day 4.

Started 3 weeks ago at lowest dose.  Now at highest.  No major problems and good blood sugar levels (105 fasting, up to 150 at mealtimes). Appetite curbed and losing weight slowly (1-2 lbs. per week).

I developed a huge rash on my legs. I also broke out in Hives all over my body at one point when first taking this drug. I had a UTI and a yeast infection that developed on my leg and croch area that could not really be explained. I had a horrible experience with this drug. I recommend not using this unless you have no alternative.

We are still experiementing with all my meds, but my sugars have dropped big time.  my morning number is still around 100-110, but after that, it RARELY goes over 150.  My biggest issue is that since I started 2 weeks ago, I have had 4 lows, and always feel sick.  My normal after meal number is usually around 110 (2 hours after meal).  if I check again in 1 more hour, it is usually in the low 80's.  Hoping a tweak of my lantus helps out.
First: constipation. second: diarreha, nausea, vomiting. However: blood sugars are great.
Easier to use than Byetta since it doesn't need to be taken twice a day and near mealtime, but does not seem curb appetite as well. Blood sugar is about the same.

I have been taking this since May. I lost 12lbs and have stayed the same weight since. My blood sugars have been good. I had some heart burn last week but it is better this week. I had lost my appetite but I have noticed it is starting to come back and I am concerned. I hope this  drug doesn't only work for a short time.

started drug 2 weeks ago at .6 with slight nausea and headache.  bumped up to 1.2 and have more nausea, constant mild headache and overall generally feeling tired.  Not much change in blood sugar reading yet.

Within 2 days my numbers were down to 140 or below at all times. With insulin my morning numbers were higher than doctor wanted. I have lost 4 lbs, have slight constipation and some acid. I also have less appetite. However, ALL syptoms are more tolerable than the daytime lows I was experiencing with insulin! To me after a 3 weeks and at the .6 dosage it is a miracle drug! I hope the good news continues!!!!
I do believe that the drug is helping me to shed someweight. That is great,however,I have been having pain in my abdomen like I'm very nervous. I don't know what else it could be.

At first it worked. My readings went down, but nauseous and sick feeling.  No appetite, so I lost weight. Now,fourth month on the drug and my appetite is back, my numbers are back up,no more nausea, and weight is returning.  I think it loses its effect on the body.  I am on the maximum dose.  Symlin had the same history with me and I could not tolerate byetta at the maximum dose.  Unfortunately, I am still constipated.  The cost is excessive.  I doubt I will stay on it after the next Dr. visit.
Painless injections,great drop in blood sugar levels.  Cost may be a problem.

I have been on this about a week. Already lost 5.5 pounds, morning sugars dropped about 50 points (were about 220 each morning).. Still at .6 dose getting ready to increase to 1.2. So far the only problem was nausea, second and third day were worse - much better now. Headache on the third day, but went away. This looks promising!

I had some nausea and rotten egg burps, but it has dropped my morning blood sugar readings from 250 or higher. Now the readings are within range of 90 to 105. I am happy and my doctor is happy. Have lost 27 lbs since May 24, 2010.

Started Victoza 6/16/10.  Bgl remained high 300-400.  Dr added Lantus insulin on 6/23/10.  Numbers started dropping to 150-101 by 6/30/10.  On 7/6/10 became dizzy and nasus.  Stopped Victoza 7/7 continued Lantus, dr felt is was inner ear virus, went back to Victoza and Lantus and because very dizzy and ill again.  Stopped Victoza 7/11/10.  Will continue to take Metformin 1000gm am and pm and Lantus if bgl rise.  Current fasting bgl after fasting were 118 if they rise will take Lantus no more Victoza for now.  Not worth the illness that takes at lease 48 hrs to recover.  Will f/u with dr next week.

on recommendation from MD, started on this med therapy 1x daily, warned about side effects most common (nausea, headaches), but they have lessened with time. I have lost weight (reasonable, not excessive 2-5lbs per wk).  Copay highest for insurance, as it is a new drug without generic alternatives.

i started it in june 2010 it has lowered my bgl fast but i do have some side effects ...im hoping these will ease soon . i can tell a big difference in appetite and im not hungry as often so i would recomend trying it if offered to you.
The medication is working for me but I have been having joint pain. Is this a side effect of the madication?
So far its helped. Not feeling the craving I use to have.And I believe I have lost some weight . The only thing bad is the cost.Is there any help.
started on april 9th have lost 25lbs, have some nausea and constipation. I eat a fiber bar or take benefiber and it has helped the constipation. A1C droped from 9.9 to 8.3.

I have had rotten egg burps, headache and ucky feeling.  It is working for my appitite thought.  My a1c levels are pretty high. I got to go to dr to have it checked next month.  Hope it makes a difference.

love this drug!!! try januvia and byetta then insulin, my fasting sugars were at the lowest 266 and highest in the 400s, started this drug 4 weeks ago and they are now 120's and even dinnertime readins of 110!! Im thrilled. Had headaches and nausea for first couple of weeks but persevered and they have gone and I ahve lost 15lbs!!

took for 2 months, had headaches, nausea and diahrea/gas.  I never even got up to the highest dose either.Then developed bad pain in rt side of back area under ribs.  I stopped taking due to this as per warnings.my numbers were all over the place and crashed several times which I did not do on Januvia.  oh well.
Byetta had me doubled over in pain.  I am very comfortable on Victoza.  Hope it works.  It does decrease my appetite.  I do crave sugar a lot more for whatever reason.

Started June 2, switched from Byetta 5 mg. Victoza has been wonderful, brought down my blood sugars to near normal, suppressed appetite, lost 10 pounds so far but no other side effects. Much easier to do 1 shot in morning not related to meals. Very hapy with it.
my blood sugar isnt as low as i would like it to be. i have lost no weight. have used it since feb 2010.
just started
I just started using the medication.Seems to be working for me. Lets see what happens.
unknown as of yet
This drug combined with 1000 mg of glumetza was the answer for me. I average between 82 and 111 every day.
loss of appetite weight loss aome slight nausea occasional pain in lower legs better than januvia or byetta

Immediate constipation, nausea, heartburn that has not gone away after 3 months.   My numbers are great, but I feel sick all the time.     Dr appt at end of the month and I hope to switch doses or medicine.

I started out great.  Sugar numberes came down, not hungry, insulin reduced.  After two months, my appetite is back, and my numbers are climbing.  I am getting back to where I was with three shots of insulin a day, but victoza is way more expensive.  I wonder if you can develop an immunity from this drug after a while?????

Started this med less than a wk ago.. Bgl were bouncing all around in the 100s..139 in a.m. and up to 188 in p.m. Also have gastroparesis. Dr. rec'd to try this along with metformin. I like the steadier readings. Don't have nausea or diarrhea side effects from this but have it from the gastroparesis. HOWEVER, I have already developed acid reflux in the 5 days I have been injecting. Don't like this effect and hoping it will go away once I get used to this new drug. Otherwise, I am extremely pleased with results.
only been on it a week, better than Byetta. did get sick 2nd day but ok after that. it sure helps with not being hungry.
Stoped hunger,blood sugar went down,after  7 days had sevral real bad nose bleeds for two to three hours at a time.Had to stop the drug.
Causing nausea in the afternoon, to the point I to stop work. Now also suffering fron acid reflux

victoza has made a big difference in my am numbers from the 2oo,s to 140 and lower in the afternoon having a little nausea, but can tolerate it. have been taking for 6 weeks have been taking glipizide in pm. so far so good

i havent been on this med long ,but this is working better than januva as far as bgl they went from 220 to 120 in three days but headaches and nausa is bothersome hope it gets better with time,also maybe i can lose some weight because im never hungry.

Third month on Victoza. Instant reduction in blood sugar readings at all times of day. Early am to 130 from 190. Afternoons from nearly 300 to below 140. Some nausea for 1st month or so. 8 - 10 pound weight loss. Full after eating about 1/2 amount prior to starting. Seem to be developing acid reflux in this 3rd month. Not sure if that will dissipate, but it is becoming bothersome.
It help me to loose weight i dont get hungry

On medication 11 wks. Started at .06 dose and to increase to 1.2 dosage 2nd wk. By mid 3rd wk, I was having acid reflux and nausea so returned to lower dosage.  Lost 4 lbs. Saw MD end of 4 wks; instructed to stay on low dosage for 2wks and increase it to l.2 again.  Acid reflex returned minus nausea.  Appears I cant tolerate higher dosage.  I was taken off Januvia and placed on Victoza due to spikes in sugar level 4 hrs after meals eventhough 2hrs cks were within range.  May have to stay at lowdosage or return to Januvia.  Appt at end of month.
Started using 10 days ago, morning blood sugar dropped from 179 to 134, evening from 150 to 105...Some nausa in the late afternoon,
I have been using Victoza for a little while now. The only side effects that I have had are morning sickness and not being hungry at all.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’ve lost 8 pounds in one week with absolutely no side effects.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am 12.5mg now and have been on the shot for almost a year and have lost 65 lbs. I was weighing 304 and now I’m weighing 239 and I’m 6’0, so I’m happy, I’ve struggled with obesity since my teens and I’m 47 now. I still want to lose 40 more lbs.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This shot is the devil. I have had diarrhea & nauseous every time I take a shot . They need a lower dosage.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Started on Zepbound March 17th.  Have been on for 5 weeks, have only lost 3 lbs.  Not sure if due to med or just increasing exercise and watching what I eat.  Extremely tired all the time.  Usually have 1-2 days of no stool, then by day 3 have a lot of loose stool.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started zepbound 3 weeks ago.  It does curve my appetite, sometimes too much.  I have gastrointestinal side effects.  I had a cookie yesterday and was so nauseous with severe stomach pain.  I didn't realize what was happening until I read the reviews about sugar.  I must have missed that info in the package insert.  I also have headaches, fatigue and aching.  I will probably finish my last injection and then quit.  I know it takes time before you see any real results but the side effects are abit much. This isn't really helping me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: It has caused me to have gastroparesis after only 6 weeks of usage and this is a life long chronic illness I started getting very sick into week 6 of using the zepbound had to be hospitalized I would not suggest this matter of fact they need to take it off the shelves period. I wouldn't wish this illness on anyone

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am 67 years old and have not had one single side effect from Zepbound. After first injection I have felt better than I have in 4 or 5 years. Plus, I am losing 2-3 pounds a week. Super pleased with Zepbound.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been premenopausal for over 2 years now. I put on approximately 35lbs and have severe hot flashes. I started taking Zepbound my weight was at 184. I’m on my 3rd week and I’m down 177. I have also noticed that my hot flashes have slowed down. I’m NOT saying this meditation took them away but losing some weight has less skin to skin rubbing. IDK But I will say my appetite is reduced, and I do feel fuller sooner than before taking this medication. I do the injections in my stomach with little to no pain. It has been a great experience so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Zepbound since March of 2024. As of today I have lost 72 pounds. I have had some side effects, mostly constipation issues with this medication but for the most part that is manageable.  With the exception of a few months because of the shortage of the drug but I have increased monthly to a higher dose and have been on the highest dose, 15 mg, for a few months now.  I am now at 167 pounds so I do not know how long my doctor or insurance will allow me to take this prescription, hopefully longer to maintain my weight since it really works! I also have followed Weight Watchers on this entire journey to eat healthy and live a healthier lifestyle for my future. I highly recommend this for weight related issues.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Zepbound 2.5 mg, and increased every 4 weeks. I was not hungry, and when I did eat, I was full very quickly. When I got to 10mg, I started having projectile vomiting the early morning hours after my shot days.  After being on 10mg for 7 weeks and dealing with this same problem, I have gone back down to 7.5mg and still had Vomiting the morning after my shot. I have only been back down to 7.5mg for one dose and plan to see if the vomiting continues after my 2nd dose.  If I am still having the vomiting, I will definitely see if my doctor can prescribe me something else.  I really want to stay on Zepbound because it has helped me lose 34 stubborn pounds and I am getting really close to my goal weight. I have been on this drug since August 27, 2024.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on this for almost 2 months - have lost 12lbs on the 2.5mg- little side effects, no nausea-  hopefully staring 5 mg soon as I feel the 2.5 mg isn't working for me as well.  Hang it there!  It will be worth it!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Been on zep for 8 months and steadily lost 36.5 lbs.  Drink lots of water and avoid heavy sauces and fried food so am pretty good with few side effects.  Life changing at my age and has even helped my arthritis some.  Will be on it indefinitely as I want to lose another 50 lbs to get to " overweight ".  Love getting full fast!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: A lot of belching. Some stomach pain at 1st.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Good weight loss. Side effects I am experiencing are thinning hair loss, extreme fatigue the day after injection, shortness of breath. I do not drink enough water, so I occasionally get headaches. I cannot eat any kind of carbohydrate, fat or white sugars as it causes extreme nausea. Although I am experiencing side effects, my Doc is monitoring me and says I am doing well.  I no longer have back pain and my knees no longer buckle. Well, one knee does, but that is not because of obesity. I use the injection pen. It is easy and is not painful. Barely even a prick. There is no way I’d be able to use a syringe.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: In the first month  I lose 20 pounds. I was on 2.5. For the second month I’m on .5 on Tuesday I took my 3rd shot of .5 and I have a little rash around the injection site. I’m still losing weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: In spite of the below side effects, it has been worth it to lose 40lbs in 4 months without exercise (I am mobility disabled).  I have far more to go but I see motivating photo results on Reddit Zepbound pages. The Pen injections don’t hurt! But the side effects have not been easy.  1. At starting dose 2.5 mg, came diarrhea for about a month. If I ate anything oily or with corn fructose, my stomach revolted.  It modified my food behavior!  2. If I overeat, I feel nauseous and sometimes get headaches.  3.  After I went to 5mg at month 3, I was very constipated - like for 3-7 days.  I found a non-medical solution: cup of strong coffee with 3-4 spoons real sugar & fat & sugar free creamer, then 6-8 oz of prune juice.  Wait 2-3  hours, and if no results, drink a 2nd cup of prune juice.  Wait up to another 3-4 hours. Patience is a virtue!  I’ve seen miracle weight losses on Reddit but if you don’t change your behavior with food, you will be one of the 95% who gain it back after stopping.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The day of my first shot I have had panic attacks at night, woke up nauseous, loose bowel movements, and feeling sick.  I have no appetite and if I eat I feel sick. I will not be continuing this medication.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I started this medication in Jan 2024. It's now November 2024.  I have lost 100 LB's  It has been a game changer for me.  I don't have sleep apnea anymore, My blood pressure has gotten better. I', feeling so much better no more being short of breathe. But.......I have suffered the side effects, burping, nausea, Injection site itching. But I noticed if you give yourself the injection in your thigh the side effects are not so bad.  and I found also, if you do the injection in the fatty part of your thighs meaning the inside if your thigh, you don't suffer the side effects.  I had to pay out of pocket of $550 a month because my insurance would not pay for it. Which is a shame. But I do know people who their insurance did cover the cost.

It seems Zepbound is better than Ozempic, people who I know who has used Ozempic had to come off it and go to the ER due to the side effects. 

But if you use Zepbound and had the experience I had. you will be extremely Happy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I was diagnosed with PCOS in my teens and I have developed high blood pressure, diabetes and high cholesterol. I have been on Zepbound since November 2023. I have since lost 100+ lbs and off ALL my meds. I feel better than I have in over 20 years! This has been a life saver for me.

Started 2.5 zepbound a week ago , I don’t feel any different food wise , I’m hungrier than ever but not overeating, didn’t lose weight yet, body ache and burping but it is gone now . Exercising weight training and walking 5 days a week . I’m very disappointed after paying that much money .

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
When blood work came back during my annual physical earlier this year (2024), my steadily increasing A1C levels had finally crossed over into pre-diabetic. My cholesterol was increasing as well. My blood pressure averaged 145/93, and I was on two medications for that.

My doctor asked if I had thought about the new weight loss drugs Zepbound and Wegovy. He said that both drugs had just received FDA approval for weight loss, that both drugs were remarked/dosed versions of existing drugs to treatdiabetes, and that likely insurance would fight to cover them. He suggested Zepbound as he felt it was the better medication, and sure enough, insurance denied it. I got the cash discount from the manufacturer and had two months in savings I could spare, so I paid for the first two months out of pocket. I have never had any side effects to speak of. This was a life-changing medication. I can't state that in any other way. 

After the first month, I had lost almost 20 pounds. My cravings were no longer an issue (and they still aren't). After the second month, I lost another 20 pounds. I could return to the gym and exercise - my body no longer hurt just moving around. My doctor took me off one of my blood pressure meds as my typical blood pressure was now at 108/63. Even my plague psoriasis cleared up (this is NOT a known condition Zepbound treats, but after ten years with psoriasis, it's gone). My insurance finally covered Wegovy, which I have been on since, with a total weight loss now of 56 pounds. My A1C level is back to normal, my blood pressure continues to stabilize in the 116/69 zone, I'm off my psoriasis medication and one of my blood pressure meds. My cholesterol is back to normal. I am eating significantly better than I have in decades. I am consistently working out. Again, this medication is a life changer.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Works very well for me to control appetite. Few side effects. A real life changer for me.

I've been taking rybelsus for 2 months now. I never experienced nausea or vomiting, but I do experience dry mouth, a horrible taste thru out the day and night and swallowing the pills is a challenge because of the taste. The benefits outweigh the cons though. I started at 200lbs and am now 180lbs. I haven't had my A1c checked since starting but I'm sure it's way down too! All in all, it's worth trying it at least!

I had tried several different meds for type 2 before starting on Rybelsus. My A1c was out of control at 13.5 and i needed it below 9.5 just to renew my merchant mariners license. In just under a months time it dropped my A1c down to a 8.1  I was also taking farxiga, Humalog and Lantus Those alone were not doing it for me, it wasnt until i started Rybelsus that my numbers dropped. .I have yet to experience any side effects, the only con is the taste of it.
I haven't had any side effects . It isn't working for weight loss like the doctor said.

I was prescribed Rybelsus after my insurance denied the claim for Wegovy.  I started at 246 and I'm down to 202-203.  I had horrible nausea in the beginning and slight constipation, and every time I was upped the dosage, I felt nausea all over again and had a headache for the first few days.  When I would get full, food immediately repulsed me.  I stopped craving junk food.  I'm at month 7 and its pretty much stopped working.  I'm not losing any weight and I'm hungry all the time.  I'm craving junk food BAD.  Waiting for my insurance to approve Wegovy again.  Hopefully they will cover it.  If your insurance denies the injection, I would recommend going on Rybelsus.  Worked great for about 6 months for me.

I first started taking felicity and that worked. But last heartbeat unavailable, so my doctor put me on rybelsus. I had really badmouthing and also Dry mouth and sticky saliva. I also had a very bad taste all day in my mouth. I also suffered really bad constipation. Rybelsus did not work for me at all. My bloods sugars were up to 17.5 most of the time. When on trulicity I lost 4stone   I didn't loose anything at all on rybelsus. It's the worst medication I've ever been on and it also tastes awful especially if you get it stuck in your throat

I asked for Semaglutide because of diabetes, heart issues (stent) and for weight loss. I suppose the holy trinity of relevant ailments.  I started on 3mg and after a few months I’m now on 14mg tablets. Although it does cause side effects, namely constipation, going for a wee more at night and some nausea, the advantages are worth it. I’ve already lost 18 lbs with a target of 50. It really does blunt appetite throughout the day and I find my portions are half the size when I eat my evening meal.I’m hoping other cardio benefits (in addition to weight loss) will further increase my life expectancy and allow me to led a fuller and more active life. I also like the fact that it reduces my alcohol in-take which is probably linked to the hunger suppressor effect it has. Two glasses of red wine and I’m done. All good.

I took it for 3 weeks and it was horrible, almost life threatening.  I went from functioning to almost bed ridden. And the trips to the bathroom all day and night I refuse to take anymore, I was really declining fast.  No appetite, dehydration , no energy pain all over my body.  This pill should not be on the market, not even for weight loss

Did not notice any results until 9th week of Rybellsus.  However I am experiening a throat issue, as if i I have something stuck in my throat, wondering if it common, will it subside, or is it life threatening?
Taste is horrible.  I've lost absolutely no weight, in fact I ate more and gained weight back. Stopped taking this drug and went back to Mounjaro. DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Doc prescribed this med (Rybelsus) because A1c was 9+. Took 3mg for 3 days and had terrible heart palpitations. I stopped this med immediately and symptoms went away. - I started a new diet of mostly veggies, small amounts of fruits, nuts, whole grain bread and baked meats. I no longer eat any fast food or processed-foods high in sugar and salt if I can help it. My sugar now averages 140 and below. I have lost 15 lbs in less than a month with no meds. You too can do this!

Gender: On medication for less than 1 month
Textual Review: I HAVE BEEN ON 3MG FOR 3 WEEKS ALL IS WELL NO SICKNESS N NO POOPS I WAS ON IT LAST YEAR I HAVE LOST 10 POUND IN 3 WEEKS.

I started taking Rybelsus 7mg 6 months ago as well as I had started my own plan for intermittent fasting and avoiding carbs in my diet 2 months prior to Rybelsus.  Just from the fasting (no food from 9p-9a), not eating potatoes and minimizing my bread intake I lost 20 lbs.  In the six months since taking Rybelsus I have lost another 10 lbs.  Rybelsus does seem to help me with feeling hungry less often.  However, it has also caused me several bouts - about once a month - with cramping or constipation/diarrhea.  My tips...taking the pill is easier than an injection but not by much considering how bitter it is (and if it gets stuck in your mouth or throat for any reason you'll regret it).  I also found that I had to avoid any greasy/oily/spicy foods as those seemed to bring on the cramping/upset stomach issues much faster.  Now having my A1C much lower (due to the diet change/weight loss) I'll be stopping Rybelsus soon.  It's just not worth the impact (gastroparesis) that it is having on my digestive system, in my opinion.  It wasn't a terrible medicine most of the time, but if you do experience the side effects they can be considerable.

I have been taking the 3 mg for almost a year.  My A1C levels dropped.  I have lost about 32 pounds.  I have had some light headedness and nausea.  I was also taking Metformin and my doctor advised me to stop the Metformin since my concern was the light headedness.  Since stopping that, I very occasionally have some light headedness but not like I was with both Rybelsus and Metformin. Some constipation and diarrhea.  Not overly bothersome for me.  I have not noticed a metallic taste or anythinglike that.  If I feel nauseous I drink a little water or eat a little something and that helps.  I asked my doctor to keep me on the 3 mg because I tolerated it well and it did what it was supposed to do.  My appetite has decreased and I don't have the sugary cravings as often, rarely in fact.  I crave fruits more than anything on this.  I am nervous about long term effects reading all of the reviews posted.  Another reason I have asked to stay on the 3 mg.  I will see my doctor again next month to review more lab work.  This medication has been successful for me but there are a few side effects I deal with as mentioned above. Overall the medication has done what my doctor wanted it to do.
If ever there was a miracle drug for diabetic,  this is it. Sugars are now in total control. Total satisfaction

I was diagnosed with type two diabetes about 8 years ago. I have been on many different medications including glucophage, and injections like Victoza and last one was Trulicity. I had an allergic reaction to the Trulicity so my doctor switched me to Rybelsus. Full disclosure I am a retired RN and always research my meds and keep up with labs. 8 years ago my A1C was 11.2 and my random blood sugar was 295. I took Rybelsus exactly as recommended, starting with 30 days of 3 mg, and worked my way upto 14 mg. I am down 32 pounds but that has been over many months. I eat less, slower, low fat and very few sweets. Letting your body digest your food and not over eat is key. And I play a lot of pickle ball. I have had no side effects, and my A1C last check was 6.  I am very satisfied with the medication and will continue until my doctor says otherwise. I do wonder if I can begin to decrease the dose as my weight continues to go down.

It is to my use I believe Gila monster poison is not ment for human consumption ! Bad drug for human body but lowers blood sugar  causes vomiting nausea continous loss of appetite stools smell severely bad urine too! Pancreatitis was an inch from death! 
Bad drug I’d rather been bit by a diamond back rattler then take this Gila monster poison!

I started with the 3mg and got sick after a week of taking it for the next 3 days I threw up once after consuming it at 8am I threw up at 10am. After 3 days that stopped and I tolerated it fine. Then my doctor moved me to 7mg. After 1 week all was well but then I woke up threw up and then suffered with the worst gas and stomach cramps ever had. I am stubborn but any normal human would have went to ER. I was severely constipated for 2 weeks. Couldn't lay down because of the sharp back pains whichwas gas but at the time I thought it was ddeath.i ate nothing for 10days because the pain was Terrible.  I stopped taking it and it went away. I switched to vegan and lost 72lds naturally, A1C dropped from 6.9 to 5.6 naturally and I'll never put that drug in my body again. Especially now that I discovered how to reverse type 2 diabetes with a whole food plant based diet with very little fat. I consume nearly 800 carbs a day and less than 30 grams of fat and nearly reversed type 2 and lost a ton of weight. Look up mastering diabetes and follow what they say it's too easy. Eventually the medication will cause irrevocable damage

I have been taking this drug for over a year and in that time, went from 217 lbs to 172 lbs and my A1C has gone from 7.2 to 5.3.  The largest side effect has been intense constipation which I have to take other medication to mitigate.  If your A1C is higher and you have trouble getting it under control, then I definitely recommend this.

I have been taking Rybelsus for about 13 months now. I have lost a total of 110 pounds. It truly helps with controlling your blood sugar. Prior to taking it, my A1C was 10.8 and blood sugar stayed anywhere from 250 to 300. Now, my blood sugar stays in the 80s and my A1C is down to 4.9. Yes, you will be nauseous sometimes but this medicine has literally saved my life. My doctor wants to keep me on it for another year and hopes that my diabetes will then be controlled just by diet.
rapid drop in blood sugar and difficulty getting up to normal levels. I stopped taking my insulin but have had persistent hypoglycemia for the past 3 days of Rybelsus.

Who at Rybelsus decided to put caps on their bottles that simply WILL NOT OPEN?? . . . Furthermore, who was the genius that decided to put the directions on the top of the bottle blue on blue??? Are KIDDING me???
Been on Rybelsus 7mg for 1 month. My A1c has not changed. I check blood sugar when I rise every morning. Stays in 150’s. How long should I give it to see if thst changes?

I wish I had never started it.
