I only took it for 2.5 months and in that time I had constant nausea that got worse with increased dosing, that turned into sporadic vomiting and I decided to stop it when I was laying in bed in pain from the nausea and vomiting thinking I'd be better off dead and thinking how to achieve it. That was my no more moment. Yes I lost weight, mostly because I couldn't eat without feeling sick, yes my a1c came down, but the bad effects are not worth it. Now 2 weeks afterstopping it I am in the emergency room thinking am having heart attack and am told it's a gallbladder stone. Lucky they don't recommend surgery since it's only 1 and my gallbladder isn't inflamed or infected. 12 hours at er, excruciating pain in my chest and back with non stop vomiting. Not how I'd planned my day. At home I research and see the rybelsus can take 3 months to leave body after last pill. And that it can cause gallbladder stone which is something I'd never dealt with before. I don't think this is a good drug overall.

I began taking this medication 3mg/day seven days ago. I didn't know what to expect, other than my doctor telling me it was going to curb my appetite. Holy cow, he was right! I've been about 45 pounds overweight for over a year and it's been really difficult for me to lose. In seven days, I've already lost six pounds! 
There are some side effects which aren't that great, but I'm losing weight so fast, I don't even care. I'm mildly nauseous often and it's not a fun feeling, but the queasiness ismanageable. Also, I am only able to eat a fraction of a full plate before feeling very full. I can't eat another bite after only enjoying 1/4 of what I normally consume. My bowel movements have dramatically slowed down to every other day or so, but I'm eating so little now, my stomach has actually become flat. The constipation doesn't bother me very much. 
Overall, this experience, so far, has been amazing for me, even with the mild side effects. I've been trying to lose weight for years! 
Thank you, Rybelsus!

Took 3mg for six days. Day seven had severe pain in upper part of stomach. Then everything else hit. Thirty six hours of extreme vomiting and severe diarrhea. Very very close calls to the bathroom. After that passed, a small meal of toast and broth. That night again severe diarrhea. Immediately stopped medicine. Imodium, bland diet and drinking Gatorade to replenish electrolytes. Day three of night leaving the house, don’t know how people could do this for months. Totally not worth it.
Side effects miserable

Don’t eat too much at a time or you can feel like you had a Thanksgiving meal.  Much smaller meals and no stomach problems.  Hunger is at least half. Snacking does not even sound good. Pills working about as good as the shots.

I got a script for Rybelsus for weight loss because my BMI is over 30 and I have high cholesterol. I moved from a 3mg to a 7mg in four days and then to the top 14mg.  I lost 23lbs after 2 months and never had any problems except extreme constipation (you just intake more fiber to counteract this). The key is little-to-NO sugar, fat and VERY LOW carbs.  You can consumer carbs but if you keep daily consumption under 15 (just like with Keto or Paleo), your weight will drop significantly, quickly!I am on a second round after seeing if I could hold my own weight without it for several months and I only gained 5 pounds.  For me this really works since I have chronic insomnia and keep generating cortisol so it's difficult for me to lose weight any other way.

I was on Trulicity the highest dose and when it became in short supply, my endocronologist put me on Rybelsus.  I guess I am lucky--I have had no side effects other than constipation. I had to start taking MiraLax daily which solved this issue.  I have been on it for 5 months and have lost 24 pounds. It isn't a miracle weight loss drug.  It just curbs hunger pains and makes you feel full faster, so you eat much less.  I have also found it helps with cravings--sweets and fried foods are not as tempting. it's odd, I just don't want them much any more. I do feel better over all and walk daily now.  I do think the weight loss has plateaued for now after 5 months with eating the same small meals.  It will be interesting to see if you can continue to lose weight long-term on this med.  A1-C has been brought down to 5.9.  I have had a good experience with it.

Started on 3 ml then 7 ml then 14 ml that’s when my problems started .
It came on gradually over some days 
Shortness of breath , palpitations pain radiating up to my jaw so bad I was admitted to Hospital with suspected Heart attack or Angina or Blood clots on the lungs .
Everything came back normal , This was over a 3 month period  and several trips to ER . Steed taking it and within days all symptoms eased . It’s a little known Allergic reaction that even the Hospital didn’t know about

After being on Rybelsus since March. I ended up in ER in Afib with a 35 second episode of V tac. In the very end of the side effect of Rybelsus says possible Tachycardia. Please be very careful with this drug.
Been take 3mg for just under 2 weeks no side effects which is great! Don’t no if doing what it should!? Hopefully!… will be starting 7mg once I’ve finished my first 30 days on 3mg

I have taken the 7 mg dose for three months and have experienced no side effects at all. It has really lowered my blood glucose, for which I am very satisfied with. Unfortunately, I actually have gained weight since beginning it. It hasn't decreased my appetite at all. Wish I were like most people and had lost weight. Don't know why I had to be different. Very depressing.
Dr prescribed this medication and I almost killed me because of the amount it was an overdose and all I never heard from them again, I’d stay away from this medication it’s dangerous.

I've been taking 3mg of Rybelsus for about 6 weeks. My blood sugar is averaging 112 and I've lost about 12 pounds. I do have tummy aches now and then but nothing like I had in the beginning. It slows your digestion and makes you feel very full after a few bites. I've found that the ginger chews work like magic for nausea and fullness. I will not be increasing my dose to 7mg because its not necessary. Glipizide and Metformin made my glucose levels higher and I had severe stomach pain and weight gain. While eating salads! Semaglutide is saving my life.
After taking this for 4 months my stomach was hard and painful, after 1 month of not taking this I feel so much better and feel like moving again.

Gender: On medication for 6 months to less than 1 year
Textual Review:
Took Rybelsus for 7 months doctor prescribed for weight loss after I gained a lot after gallbladder removal.  At first it was fine sort of helped with hunger and made cheese taste awful.  But after three months I noticed I was nauseous all the time to the point of debilitation.  I didn't suspect the medication because it was 3-4 months after I started taking it.  But after an endoscopy the doctor noted I still had food in my stomach after not eating for 18hrs.

Rybesus makes you digest food muchmuch slower than normal and was causing serious issues for me.  Two weeks after I stopped taking it I also noticed a huge mood increase.  So yes I lost 25lbs but not worth the side effects for me.

I started 3mg and went to 7 mg about a month later. Lost 47 pounds and had no side effects. Went in for CT scan for other issue and incidentally found my right parathyroid was enlarged. Found out that taking this med can cause thyroid to enlarge. Fortunately mine was benign. I stopped taking immediately and will have another CT in six months to see if thyroid gland has decreased.

Used for weight loss This is an evil drug - even at 3mg it is debilitating and I felt sick morning until night having taken it with awful headaches. However it works- list lots of weight but is it because you feel so ill?

I have been on 3mg Rybelsus for a little over a month. Overall it has been managing my blood sugar along with Jardiance. My side effects are burping, bad taste, and some nausea. But not enough for me stop. I no longer have hunger pains and the need to eat all day and night. I don't really have an appetite. I have to make myself eat or snack. I have lost 5lbs so far. I go back in August for my 6 month checkup and A1C, but my numbers look good on my glucose monitor.

It's supposed to take the 7 mg dose to work. I am on day 20 of my 3mg dose. I have lost 11 lbs, my blood sugar has dropped 80 points, I have no side effects at all now. The first few days, I had some slight vision blurriness, which I attribute to my rapid drop in blood sugar. I've been on metformin for years, and stayed: fat, high sugars, miserable with gastric issues, not being able to leave the house much for fear of accidents. Also, I was starving all the time, because I do not eat very much,and my stomach would empty so fast, I stayed hungry from about one hour after a meal until the next. Now, I eat three meals a day and two snacks. Still small meals because that's how I eat, but no starvation pains. The doctor is going to put me on 7mg. I'm curious as to how that will go, but right now, I feel fantastic!

With age my A1C and weight were creeping up. Worth noting: I have no gal bladder. I've lost 24 pounds in 4 months, A1C from 8.9 to 6.9. Not being a slave to hunger is the biggest benefit though. On 3 mg I had zero side effects and didn't see what all the fuss was about. On 7 mg I noticed I could go hours without eating. I also did not need to eat before bed so I wouldn't wake up hungry in the middle of the night (and was sorry if I did). I had zero tolerance for anything fried, or Sulphur burpsand gas would happen (a few pieces of fried shrimp y'all, not going to happen on this drug). On 14mg - waking up in the middle of the night with stomach cramps, ending up in the bathroom projectile vomiting, started. Figured out this was 100% tied to what I ate, if not how much. You absolutely have to change your diet when taking this. Things like Caesar salad, rich pastas, subs, fried food, etc. your body will reject even if only occasional. Fruits and vegetables, garden salad, simple stir fry, grilled or baked meats are fine. Every meal is a choice you can end up regretting.

I’ve been on Rybelsus for seven weeks so far. Just phasing into the 14mg dose. My A1C has gone down, I’ve lost 26 pounds so far, my liver values have improved. I haven’t had any nausea issues. I take fiber gummies every day anyway so haven’t had any issues with constipation. I don’t have any cravings anymore, I have lost any appetite for fatty, greasy or sugary foods. I eat 4/5 bites for each meal and I’m done. Rybelsus is working really well for me so far! I hope to lose enough weight to lose my diabetes and fatty liver too.
I’ve had a general feeling of the blahs (non-medical term), so, I’m going back to either straight merformin or JANUMET.

Started on 3mg for 2 months, no issues. Moved on to 7mg for 1 month and now on 14mg. Other than the bad taste that would also linger all day, no other side effects until 4 months into the 14mg. Started getting severe, uncomfortableness in my upper diaphragm, just under my ribs. Feels extremely bloated, difficult to take a deep breath and bend over, increased burping, lack of appetite .. lasted a few weeks. Stopped taking for 5 days, of which 3 days in the symptoms diminished. Day 4 and 5 felt almost normal again. Tracked blood sugar through-out the 5 days, which went from 110 to 150. On day 6, took a pill and 8 hours later, symptoms came back, but blood sugar started back down, and is 143. Note: have not lost a single ounce of weight, the entire time.

My doctor prescribed this medication to me to help with my weight loss. The first month I started at 3mg and then went to 7mg. I was nauseas a couple times, for a couple minutes each time. I kept a granola bar with me to snack on when it hit. I am down 16lbs in 2 months. I highly recommend this drug to anyone looking to break the chains from food addiction. After insurance, I pay $10 for 30 days. It has truly changed my life. I have tried it all and finally feel free.

Caused many problems after going from 3mg to 7mg. Called Dr. and he told me to stop taking it. Scheduled me for several test that I await results. Most likely Gall Bladder damage.  I expect to see many lawsuits in the near future. I wish I had never started taking Rybelsus and advise people to be very cautious about taking it. My A1C actually increased during the time they experimented on me.

I tried this medication but it taste very bad. I wonder why the did made the tablets with a film coating. You remain with that bad taste the rest of the day. 
No wonder you loss wait, you don’t want to eat with that awful taste in your mouth.
Also it make you dehydrated, even my skin started getting dry.
I do not recommend this medication
Started 3mg nausea is very real until your body adapts. Same happens every time you're on a new dose. I've been on it 3 months & I'm down 34 pounds

I too rybelsus for 2 days and had a slight upset stomach when I took it on day 3 I got so sick in my stomach the pain was almost unbearable, I was vomiting and had diarrhea really bad. I couldn’t even make it to the bathroom I didn’t take any today and my symptoms are the same  I took 3mg for weight loss. I need to stop because I can’t go I like this  the pain, in my stomach is unbearable my husband wants me to go to the ER but I’m trying to hold off until tomorrow because my doctor will be in.I have never ever in my life had any communication with any medication before. But this is awful, if you are taking and doing ok God Bless You  I pray no one ever has to go through this I have read that the higher the dose the worse systems I really think a higher dose would actually kill me. Honestly that is how painful and scary this is

i started rybelus about a year ago i was feeling very sick , due to diabetes but this pill helped me feel so much better , at the beginning it was a little hard bc it made me very nauseous once weeks went by i started feeling better not only that my weight was 200pounds now I'm at 163lbs feel a lot better and keep losing weight .
I totally lost my appetite. I had severe constipation. I had nausea from undigested food sitting in my stomach for days. It was horrible.

Side effects like acid reflux, throw up tendency and also constipation never went away. It’s been 3 months now. 
Definitely brings down glucose level and lose some weight too, but not worth the continuous I’ll feeling in the stomach.
I am going to stop it

Rybelsus doesnt work worth a DAMN. You see those stupid commercials where actors tell that "my A1C used to be here (high) and now its here (low)." Well, I use a CGM. Before Rubelsus my "time on target" was 91% and since Rybelsus, my time on target is 33%. In my case, Rybelsus seems to be working the exact opposite way of the way it is supposed to; stimulation my liver to release more glucose and inhibiting my pancreas from releasing more insulin. Why did I start taking it if my time on target was 91%? Because i was taking metformin and glimeperide together and when I would sleep my blood glucose would drop dangerously low. One time it hit 30. Several times in the 40's. Quite a few times in the 50's and 60's. So I was put on Rybelsus to keep my blood glucose down in the normal range without getting to low. Well, yes, it never gets to low any more. But that is because i am in the high caution or danger area almost all the time. Rybelsus is worthless. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Rybelsus has not made me feel sick or have bathroom ya know !  Problems at all .I have noticed my weight is slowly going down so far its been about a month on it.happy with this Med so far. I have PCOS It has truly made symptoms slow down

This medicine caused extreme nausea and loss of appetite, but once I got used to it, it has been smooth sailing.  I've discovered that if I hold the pill in my mouth for too long, an extremely bitter taste sits on my tongue (yecch).  I advise everyone to place this pill near the back of your tongue as far as possible and quickly drink your sip of water.  I dropped from an 8.2 A1C to a 6.4 A1C in three months and loss six pounds in addition to my 1000 mg Metformin.

I have had great results with about 2 years of Rybelsus!  I had a weight loss of about 20 lbs (180 down to 160).   The only thing I wish I knew when first taking it was that it had the potential to cause huge lowering of blood sugar.  I was at work when I first took it, and had a fairly sudden extreme drop in blood sugar...luckily I had plenty of glucose tablets available.  However, while I'm still taking Rybelsus, it seems to have lost its potency for me.  I'm starting to have the extreme highsand lows I experienced prior to the use of Rybelesus.  Has anyone else experienced this after longt erm use?
On day 4 of starting 3mg.   Heavy metallic taste in my mouth and feel like someone punched me in right kidney.   Gonna wait till day 7 and if symptoms don't improve,  going to STOP

I started this medication about 1 year ago. After increasing to 7mg I noticed skin sensitivity (almost like shingles pain) almost anywhere on my body that would last for days and then move to another spot. Like others I also had the GI side effects, but wanted to keep on it because it was helping my weight. After stopping the rybelsus (because of the skin soreness) the symptoms went away. But my weight climbed back up pretty quickly. Have restarted the rybelsus and the skin pain has restarted. Ithink I will have to stop it.

Took this medication for weight loss. Felt high blood pressure behind eyes. Got low blood sugar often, felt faint. Makes u nauseous most of the day, but if you don’t eat you feel like you’ll faint. Heartburn. 
Got nervous about side effects, so stopping medication after 3-4 weeks.

I have been taking Rybelsus for a year and a half at the 7 mg.  My life is miserable.  I have terrible bloating, stomach pain and gas.  I lost about 40 pounds and that is because you can not eat.  It started to give me heart palpitations and now it is not controlling my sugar even with very little carb intake.   I am going to discuss with doctor to find an alternative to this medication because it is making me miserable the longer I take it.
Went from 3mg to 14mg in about 3 months. Numbers are down and down 17 #. No side effects so far
Drop sugar from 300 to 164 in 1 hr

I started taking Rybelsus last year and again this year. no effect on weight loss, no effect on my blood suger. I had stomach pain, heartbeat, constipation and lower back pain. after every 6 month I had problem with vomiting. I think Rybelsus give me Acute gallbladder disease. every time I stop taking it, after a few days all the side effect was gone.I will never take it again. the biggest effect of Rybelsus was on my wallet.

i am insulin sensitive. Means, anything that will spike my BS, will eventually, drop me into the 40s-50s. I did not tolerate Trulicity at all. After 3 wks of horrible s/e, I broke out in hives, head to toe. Next was, Rybelsus. This is my second month with it. I am tolerating it only w/Zofran to back me up. I get N/V often, I am not tolerating any food with any amount of carbs, let alone sugar. I wear a CGM so i'm pretty confident of my numbers. Rybelsus on the whole, has been great at keeping myspikes lower. I get them, but they don't make me as sick. My A1C is great, but that really isn't the issue I have insulin sensitivity, which i'm told, if i cannot control this, will eventually be Type 2 diabetes. It's prevalent in my family.
I have been taking 7mg for close to a year and lost 20lbs blood sugar down and A1c no side effects
I have been taking 7mg for close to a year and lost 20lbs blood sugar down and A1c no side effects
Absolutely did not improve A1C.  Average daily GLUCOSE INCREASED over +150.

This medication tore up my insides after only the 2nd dose.  Had diarrhea, vomiting, and nausea so bad I couldn't move.  Discontinued it right away.  Of course you will lose weight because you can't keep food down
used 3mg for one month with symtoms of bladderfulness and nausia, started using 7 mg for the last 15 days side effects are same,but sugar levels have come down.
The smaller strength pills had no real effect on appetite.  The largest dose caused extreme nausea and diarrhea.  Could not eat to take nailing because I felt so sick.  The should be other strengths

I was prescribed this for weight loss. Day 1 & 2 I was fine then on day 3 I started throwing up constantly all day for the next 12 days straight everything I ate came back up. The nausea is horrible I am almost at 3 weeks of being on the medication I just slowed down with throwing up I don't throw up every day but in the last 6 days I have thrown up four times I'm hoping it stops at some point. I have lost 10lbs. This has been a wild experience goodluck to others taking it!

I have been taking 3 mg rybelsus for 3 weeks and have tolerated it very well.  Will start 7 mg in a week.  Had slight light-headedness the first few days after starting med, but that went away quickly.

I will be honest and say that the only thing I dislike is having to drink it with water in the morning before breakfast.  Drinking water in the am makes me nauseas.  Besides that, I started with 7mg and in 30 days lost 10 lbs and my sugars in fasting or even after 2 hrs of eating are between 80-90.  Now I  up to 14 mg.  In some cases you may feel some stomach discomfort but it will go away after drinking for about 2-4 weeks.  You need to let your body adjust to the changes.  My appetite has greatly decreased and I love how my cravings for carbs have also diminished.

had normal side effects, mostly stomach upset and nauseous on and off for the 1st 10 days. thought i was getting better with symptoms, but 2 days later came back worse. stop taking pill after 15 days. can not tolerate side effects

I have not tolerated any diabetic meds other than insulin up to using Rybellsus. Other meds have caused me stomach and GI tract upset and some with urniary tract issues.  Rybellsus initial sample was 3mg a day for three weeks and a move up to 7mg which I am on now and I have tolerated the med very well. Blood sugar has shown better control and I expect to be moved up to 14mg.

I was put on rybelsus about two months ago the first month was with the 3 mg pill and I was put on the 7 mg pill about a week or so I couldn’t sleep had bad dreams I could have eaten the refrigerator if I could have and the real bad thing was my heart was always running away I went from a 100 pause up to a 130  pause in a while so I just went back to my doctor and told her to take me off of it

I took this medication for 30 days. I had stomach pain every day that I took it .Nausea all day long .I could not eat enough because of these side effects, so I experienced low blood sugars . It isn't convenient to have to take it on an empty stomach.

I had a severe allergic reaction to this medication. I took it once weekly. It didn't start until the 4th dose. It was the 6th dose when we realized it was the medication Ozempic causing the reaction. I had large weeping lesions all over my face and a few on my back and arms. They resembled ringworm  in size and were perfect circles. I had to go on steroids to treat it for 2 weeks...which is not good for a diabetic. The doctors took pics to document it. Since it was so new and no patients had areaction like mine.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 6 weeks ago. The first week I lost most interest in all foods. Week two experienced some nausea. End of week 3-6 I am throwing up daily, bad diarrhea, and no desire to eat. The weight is falling off because I can't keep anything down. The constipation adds to the nausea. The weight is coming off and my sleep has improved. But is it worth it?? Will the bad symptoms go away eventually??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Hello,

I lost 25lbs on .25 wegovy dose between February 25th and May7th(about 10 weeks). I went from 178lbs to 153lbs. I am a male, 5'6". I was already exercising for 45-50 minutes a day for 6 days a week, but I could not loose the weight. Wegovy helped me control my appetite mentally resulting in fewer calory intake and boom, the weight started to came off. I also have fatty liver disease and have recently seen some studies showing promising results with this drug. I sometimes have mild bloating and stomach cramps, but not extreme.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have experienced moderate side effects. Nausea, indigestion, sweats and slower bowel movements. Weight loss started to ramp up after week 2 on the 1mg dose. I have lost 7kgs in 4.5 months. Have just started the 1.7mg dose and excited to see the results. This has definitely helped me after trying everything before even considering medication. I am active and on my feet every day but could not get my cravings, hunger and calories intake down after having my 3rd child.  My opinion is that it is worth the moderate side effects that come and go. I feel happy within myself again and am so much more motivated. I have also been advised that overtime they will subside. Fingers crossed!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: have been taking for 4 months, only lost 10 pounds. have had bad side effects , headache, bloating ,gas, burping always. constipation, pain in my arms. has anyone had throat pain?? have had throat pain the whole time. will not keep taking.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started taking it in May of 2024 and as of February of 2025 I lost 128 lbs.. Wegovy is a great tool along with a healthy diet. I highly recommend this to anyone trying to lose weight, don't get discouraged, you won't start to notice a major difference until you're about 3 months in.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Pissed off .my 4th injection pen wouldn't work

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I lost over70 lbs, I started with the 25mg, then it was increased to 50mg, then 100mg, and lastly to 170mg. This was over about 6 months. The weight has stayed off. I also got walked a lot for exercise. I lost the cravings that I had.

I was prescribed wegovy to help with weight loss due to chronic injuries of my legs. I have not been able to shift my weight due to not being able to move without pain. Prior to taking it I had just tried the svelte diet plan and had actually lost 2kg in the 11 days detox. I decided to keep following the food suggestions within this diet plan whilst taking wegovy.

I kept losing weight by small amounts whilst taking 0.25 and 0.5 amounts. I had a small amount of nausea and tiredness but that wasonly in the first two days of taking the injection. I've just completed my 4th injection of 1.0 and at this dosage the weight has been falling off. I have been waking up in the night with indigestion but have found sleeping on my left side eases this.  

I am no longer waking up and walking in pain, im no longer limping and feeling so much lighter. My belly has gone and i can see down there again. I've lost 12kg so far and am so thankful for wegovy in helping me shift this weight off.

The only complaint i have is the shock of finding out as the dosages go up the price goes up by a ridiculous amount! I'm in Australia and the doses from 0.25 to 1.0 were $260 per month. I filled my first script for 1.7 it has gone up to $380!!

I will be speaking with my doctor to let her know she needs to inform her patients that the costs increase with the dosages.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Still getting the hang of this medication. The first week wasn’t so bad , my cravings for food decreased and I felt full faster. Nausea was on and off , would creep up on random hrs of the day. I have loss 10lbs in 2 weeks but it is because I cut down on sugar and been limiting my carb intake. Today I over ate and feel like crap. The burps are no joke . The heaviness and fullness feels. But uncomfortable. Headache and dizziness is a bit challenging to deal with at the moment . Despite the side effects I hope they subside because I feel some of my inflammation has gone down which has helped me into being able to stay active thru my day. I just hope the dizziness does go away because it’s a bit hard to even walk straight without thinking I’m gonna fall. Almost fells like I’m drunk ? I don’t know of anyone has this feeling to the med. will see how it goes. So far it’s been working but the side effects will determine if it’s gonna work for me in the long run

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have zero appetite, which would be great if not, for the fact that I can’t get out of bed. After vomiting, everything in my stomach and being unable to hardly handle water because of the extreme nausea, I have decided that I will not continue on this medication. i’m not sure if I’ve ever felt this horrible in my life.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I just used the 2nd (week 2) (lowest dose) shot 2 days ago and it will be the LAST!!!
While I lost 4lbs the 1st week I wish I had read some of these reviews before taking the 2nd shot because I have been in SEVERE PAIN since injecting the 1st one!!
I have suffered from chronic back pain for years so at first I did not think much of it accept that the severity of my pain was way too high with no discernable cause AND my blood felt like and still feels like it is literally on fire causing my entire body to be in extreme pain if I don't take more of my prescribed pain meds than normally needed for my normal amount of back pain!!  I did some research on this drug when the pharmacist warned me about this drug when I picked it up and I decided not to take it.  I stored it in my frig in case I changed my mind which I obviously did (upcoming wedding attendance) I wish I had stayed with my gut feeling about this drug!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have spent 20 weeks on Wegovy at a cost of $1325 total (that's 5 X 4 week doses at $265 per syringe). I have lost 0 kilos. Yes, that is correct. No weight at all! The doctors keep promising me that I will see results but, I'm planning to give up. It's too expensive and exhausting. I'm an active, busy person and I am just flabbergasted that this has not worked at all. Massively disappointed ??.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: It worked at dosages of 1mg and 1.7mgs. It’s not working at dosages of 2.4 mgs. I am always hungry between meals. My weight loss has stopped.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy for nine months and have lost a total of 90 pounds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The first dose, felt ok then day 3 horrific nausea, terrible constipation, just to look at good made me feel sick. Stuck it out for the next 5 weeks but no more, the sickness is just awful, constipation awful, needed enemas for relief. Stomach pains awful. That's for me I'm not continuing, I don't feel it's worth the misery

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: My first week on this wasn’t too bad but, OMG this second week I can’t wait for it to be over and will never be touching it again. The dizziness, nausea, headaches and shaking hasn’t stopped. I have lost 3.5kg in 12 days though. Can’t wait to feel human agin.
I was very sick on this medication. It is one week after my 0.25 dose and the side effects are horrible. I will not be taking any more of this medication.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: It's a DISGRACE that I can't find your medication in ANY pharmacy.  It started with problems finding the .25mg, then again with the .50mg.  Now the 1.0mg is IMPOSSIBLE to obtain and I have wasted the last 2 months of my life because of your supply issues.  SPEND MORE MONEY ON PRODUCTION AND LESS ON ADVERTISING!!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Lost 13 lbs in 3 weeks.  It tells me when I've had enough by making me feel repulsed but only when I've reached  my limit, which is a lot less than I thought it would be.  It also has taught me not to eat at bedtime or I will get stomach pains and have sulphur burps.  This all sounds horrible but it's the kick in the butt that I needed to teach me that I don't need so much food.  Had ice cream the other day, my all time favourite food, had about 4 bites and i was fine with that and gave the restaway.  Not because I was trying to have will power but because I genuinely just didn't want it.  The key is to make sure you eat something small if you forget to eat or you will feel sick, don't eat before bed and stop fretting about calories, just make healthy decisions, supplement with protein shakes if you really can't eat.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This drug hasn’t helped me loose hardly any weight. I’m 4 months in and only 10 pounds down. I still don’t get full

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Week 13 / Just started on 2.4 Wegovy having started with the lowest dose. Current weight loss at 38lbs / 17kilos.  Persistent side effects - heart burn, and belching - Bad stomach pains if I eat to much in one sitting, tired / lethargic.   Certainly takes away food cravings for me.  Apart from that I feel fantastic, hip pain when walking has gone!  Good luck to those trying

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Love Wegovy! Minus the terrible migraines (which are easily solved by a BC), low sex drive, mood swings, and expensive price…. I still love it! I weighed 225 when I first started (5 months ago) and I currently weigh 135 which was my pre FIVE kiddos weight!!!!! I am able to fit into some pants I still had from my high school days (18 years ago) It’s amazing! I bought weights and exercise tools from 5 Below and downloaded a couple light workout apps. I also work at Sonic and deliver 200 or more orders a day so that may have what helped me a little too. I started eating yogurt, nuts, and straight protein and drinking a ton of water a day! On average I would lose 7-12 pounds in a month which does lead to saggy skin (not much) but hey it does work. However, weening off I feel awful…. Yes, it’s expensive but it IS worth it! You’ll get a tonnnnnnn of compliments when you start dropping weight too! ??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: My doctor started me off on the highest dose possible. I have been extremely sick for 5 days now. Cant eat or drink. Extremely dehydrated. Severe diarrhea. Every symptom they list I have. Haven’t been able to leave my house in 5 days. Would never suggest this medicine to anyone

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’ve been on the medicine for 4 months I’m at 1.7 mg. I have experienced some side effects. I lost 17 lbs. but at an unhealthy cost. My stomach has turned into painful cramping, nausea, diarrhea. . but I’m not enjoying life. Up all night in the bathroom. Loosing sleep no energy. I decided to stop. I want my life back. I’m at 200lbs. I was prescribed this for liver disease (fatty liver) . I’m happy for the people who are taking this and having positive results. But I’m just miserable.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: 0.25 did nothing. 0.5 omg! It’s like my body has become intolerant to ALL junk food! Even just 1 bite of junk food and my stomach is in knots. I now crave fruit and water! I’ve actually become repulsed by junk food and I’m only on day 2 of 0.5. And in Australia it costs me around $200 for a month. I say definitely go for it. I’ve lost 4 kilos in 4 weeks so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
This medication works.  I've gone from 184lbs to 155lbs in 19 weeks.  I'm pre-diabetic.  Dieting and exercise never worked for me.  I was miserable in my own skin.  I couldn't lose weight - even after months on a 1000-calorie /day diet. 

My side effects are minimal (occasional nausea) now.  I did have a lot of nausea to start with - but 'morning sickness' home remedies worked. 

The benefits are amazing!  I used to be so out of breath when I'd do anything strenuous - not any more.  I'm comfortable in my own skin again.  My BP is down!  I'm completely satisfied with small portions and have zero cravings. 

If this doesn't work for you - or if you have bad side effects - perhaps Wegovy isn't the right treatment for you.  

Perhaps the side effects are due to another medication you take?
After losing 20 lbs, I was lightheaded and dizzy.  It wasn't the Wegovy - it was because I no longer needed BP medication.      I stopped the BP med and immediately the dizziness was gone. 

I hope my review helps you!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I received a second box of Wegovy 0.25mg. Three out of the four syringes did not work. Wegovy helpline would not give me voucher for replacement syringes because their policy is the prescribing physician must increase your dosage every four weeks. Since that not happen with my doctor (I have kidney disease & fibromyalgia) so he wanted me on 0.25mg for 8 weeks. As this is against company's prescribing policy, I am out of luck. Will have to pay for med myself as I know the insurance company wouldnot cover an issue with the product. Or be without medicine for 3 weeks. Wegovy is spending millions of dollars on advertising & making billions in profits from Wegovy, but won't give me a voucher for their defective product over difference of opinion on prescribed dose.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: 59 yr old female. Starting weight 194. 16 weeks in, lost 32 lbs. Averaging about 2 lbs a week. Love this product. Had to switch to Seniglude after 8 weeks. Much cheaper. My insurance would not cover it. Could not afford $600 a month. Should be cheaper so that everyone is able to acces this medicine. Has been a real life changer. So glad I tried this!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Im on day 4 of week 1 so far Ive been feeling fine, today I started itching and Im getting a rash. Today is also the first day I wasnt hungry. No other side effects.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy now for 4 months. I list 5 pounds.  In the beginning it made me not hungry. In month six it’s doing nothing and dose increased.  I’m thinking about giving it one more month.  Gave me dry mouth, do sleep and always feel weird like something is wrong with me.  Pass on Wegovy. Not worth it so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Just started on Monday night of Sept 16.  I have not felt anything. Still eating the same.  Do you need to wait and if so, for how long until it start to kick in??

Condition: cardiovascular event risk reduction in obesity
Textual Review:
Week 1.

About the 5th and 6th day of taking it, I cannot express the extreme body pain I had in the mornings when I wanted to get out of bed.  I had to call for one of my kids to help me and I am not even 50 yet.  It hurt to move and it was impossible to even get into some form of motion.

2 Weeks and a day past the injection of the first shot and I have like this boil where the injection site was.  It is still there and it is purplish read.  Thank goodness I never took shot #2.

This is definitely not for everyone. Be very aware that this will either help you or feel like it is killing you.  Those are the extremes I am reading in reviews.  I win the bad lottery on this one.  

Good Luck if you take it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person

If you want to die take this!!!! 
I took this for less than a month…still suffering 6 mths later…I have been to the ER 26 times with this pain that is killing me…there is no structural damage or reason why or what the pain is coming from 
This is a slow death!!!!!
This is terrible. Around 3 AM you will wake up with an obnoxious commercial screaming at you. WEGOVY!!!?? Stop. Please with the ??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am one week in and down 3 lbs. I have only been eating chicken, veg and fruit and some crackers. As for negative side effects, once bit of a headache and OTC worked. Some heart burn but antacids worked. One thing I noticed on my last day the appetite suppressant effects seem to have dwindled and I have to make sure I stick with my diet. Over all, after 1 week use, I am quite pleased.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I'm 46 years old and I was 89kg and I'm 166cm in height. Had appendix out and lost 3kg over that week. 
Started wegovy 13/08/2024. 
Easy to use. I recommend the thigh. Had a bit of a rush, slight headache afterwards. 
Almost immediately I had no appetite. I only have to eat a little and I'm full. I have to force myself to eat something. Drinking loads of water in the mean time. 
Taking magnesium as side effects said constipation may happen and magnesium always helps me to go. 
It is Thursday andI have already lost 2.3kg. I'm now 83.7kg. 
I'm so happy and excited and can't wait to get back to 69kg where I've always been prior to having my son who is 2. 
Oh and once I heal, I'll be back in the gym again which I have not been in for awhile. So that will speed up the process. So far so good.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I experienced nearly all physical side effects listed as common but also had neck pain and sinus issues.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Starting taking this med back in February of 2024. Had to stop because insurance stopped paying for it. Now 6 months later I am having tingling in my hands and feet. All blood test are really good and nothing has shown up that has changed. Didn't have any tingling until I took Wegovy.  It's a shame because I lost 35 pounds in just that short time and stayed on the low dose. Tingling is awful.  I wouldn't recommend taking this med.

Condition: cardiovascular event risk reduction in obesity
Textual Review: 5 months on Weygovy, and down 35 lbs. started at .25 and worked my up to 1.7.  Have lost a lot of muscle and fat.  Having a hard time keeping my daily protein intake up. Have changed my lifestyle habits, better nutrition, drinking a lot of water.  Have a dry mouth, and get cold, my clues to rehydrate.  Have had nausea, the worst, constipation, manageable, and lack of interest in food, have to remember to eat at least 3 times a day, small, small servings. I am hyper aware of how slow my digestivesystem is working.  Most side effects lesson with a couple of days of shots.  On the plus side, I genuinely feel better, more agile, and down 2 sizes.  My taste buds changed and I don’t like bland food any more, whereas before I wouldn’t touch anything spicy.  I do have fatigue and this can also be from the extreme heat we are experiencing.  My dr is pleased, my blood tests(kidney) are fine.  My blood pressure is lower.  My regular blood pressure is 110/70, and now it’s 90/55-60.  That was scary, turned out to be normal.  Fluids are doubly important now to keep my blood pressure up.  At the end of the day, the results for me outweigh the side effects.  I don’t know that I’ll go up to 2.4, maintenance for me might just be the 1.7.  Whatever hormone Weygovy is simulating has proven to me that I don’t have it in my DNA.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: My dosage may have been too high. I have been very sick with fatigue,  nausea and a horribe headache for 3 days after my first injection.  I wonder never take this medication again. It's been a horrible experience.  I've not left my apartment in 3 days. I've missed working and I've paid $1550 for this awful experience.  I have 3 unused pens and the company will not reimburse me. STAY AWAY FROM THIS DRUG. IT'S SIDE EFFECTS ARE UNBEARABLE!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started Wegovy exactly 4 weeks ago today. I have had 4 injections 0.25 mg. I am down 16 lbs. on Wegovy when nothing else worked at all. I was diagnosed with Gestational Diabetes 19 years ago. It never went away I had my last child when I was 39 so you know that weight was really hard to loss. Thank Goodness for this medication. I have never been an overeater and have severe back problems and can not exercise which is why I was approved for this through my insurance. It does work on Insulin resistance stomach! I can't wait to see how much more I can loss and be a much healthier person.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
My provider started me at a very low dose, .20, w/ slow gradual increases. I was supposed to go to .68 13 days ago, but decided to bump up to only .60 to save money. I am getting 5+ weeks from a 3 mg vial (somehow, they put more in the vial.)  I started at 201, and quickly went to 189; then slowly to 185, and now at 182.5. After I complete 10 weeks of .60, I will bump up to the final .68.  My income will go up in 2.5 months. I paid $299 + $94 'membership fee' for 1 mg vial in month 1; then $299for a TWO mg vial + $94 fee. Now I am paying $299 + $94 fee for a WHOPPING 3 mg vial.

Even before I started compounded Wegovy, I had constant constipation. Stool softeners would only work a little bit. I switched to EXTRA strength Ex-Lax. It works, but I am addicted to it, ha ha!

I just barely qualify for the medicine. I am exactly 5' 5 1/2"  Provider rounded it down to 5'5", and at 189 => 31% body fat. I actually used a previous provider who got me down from 201 to 189. He didn't weigh my or anything. His medicine ramp up scale was even more slow.

I was able to lose my  semi-temporary weight gain a lot more easily. I got covid 8 months ago, and ate a lot and rested on the sofa. So, the first 12 pound drop went fairly easy and fairly quickly.

Now, I've broken thru a stubborn plateau, and hope my weight loss continues.  Today 182.5; goal 155. If I have to, I can increase from .68 to 1.0 but it is expensive.  1.0 would only last me 3 weeks + a stupid $94 membership fee every mont

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on wegovy for one year now. Lost 75 lbs so far. No longer eat whites. (Bread,rice,potatoes) am on the highest dose still because the other doses are hard to get. Only get nausea and stomach pain when I eat more than I should.

I have been on Wegovy and now towards the end of month 4 on 1.7mg and am having to stop as the joint pain is unbearable. I have found a few reviews that also mention joint pain so it definitely seems to be the drug.

For the first few months I got nausea and not a huge amount of weight loss (max 1lb a month). Found on 1mg I started to get joint pain and nausea increased (and I was sick a few times), it did massively reduce my enjoyment of food and some days I struggled to eat more than 600 calories (I am also doing Zoe in conjunction to make sure my diet is still good and average calories were between 1200 and 1500 per day), by week 3 of 1.7 my elbows and shoulders are so painful that I have decided not to take the final dose and not to increase. So for me, it was a lot of money with very little weight loss (I do have pcos and now in menopause FYI so wasn't expecting miracles but hoping for more than I lost). Just for info I only had 2 stone to lose so was not massively overweight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Not worth the side effects, acid reflux 
Heart palpitations, stomach pain and vomiting, and this is only after first dose.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: First week gained 6 pounds. No change in diet was on low carb before shot. Left elbow became so inflamed could not use arm for three days.  Never had any problems with elbow before and did not do anything different in daily routine that would cause a problem. Was told the shot should not cause that. We all have different body make up with this in mind how do they know it did not cause it? In finalization I will not be taking the shot anymore. stick to the Keto diet that I was losing weight before the shot.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I began taking Wegovy February  2023 through June 2023 and lost 45lbs.  I had severe constipation while taking Wegovy.  Then July 2023 this medicine could not be found in my area at all.  From November 2023 until March 2024 I gained 35 lbs back.    March 2024 i was able to find the prescription available again.    It is now June 2024, 12 doses since March 2024 and i have lost "ZERO" weight.  did they change the formula?  Wegovy worked last year but when it was back on the market again, NOTHING!Anyone else having this problem?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am on day 1 of week 2. So far, my only minor side effect is maybe a little gas and a headache this morning, which may not be related. I have followed a high protein diet and lost 7 pounds. I feel great so far. Time will tell....

I did mail one back and I have called but they are so hard to get a hold of. Shoppers Drug Mart will not touch them. It is your responsibility. I am paying $473.38 each time I get a pen. Any ideas?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person

A headache or stomach ache is a small price to pay.  Take my second shot tomorrow.  It is true I’m not hungry at all.  You do have to force yourself to eat which is less then half what I use to eat

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took Wegovy from May 2023 to November 2023.  I lost 30 pounds but experienced many GI symptoms, i.e., nausea, vomiting, diarrhea alternating with constipation and ending with developing pancreatitis. As a registered nurse I can’t recommend anyone taking this drug without considering the serious side effects you may have to endure.  After I quit taking the drug it took  3 months for the symptoms to resolve.

Keeling track of muscle mass and bone mass to ensure it's mainly fat coming off...lots of cycling!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Taking Wegovy for 4 months.  28 lbs. down.  I have had no side effects.  I check in with a doctor every 30 days for a check up online.  I follow exactly what she says: eat more protein drink water and eat.  When I am not hungry in the morning I go for a no sugar yogurt or an Atkins Plus protein shake.  I eat my heaviest meal at lunch now and very light dinner.  I drink lots of water.  If find Wegovy curbs my hunger and stops me from mindless eating.  I focus less on food.  I am finding it easierto stay on track and work on making better habits.  I also use the Wegovy website and have a free coach that chats with me every 2 weeks on my habits.  I think I am losing weight this time because I decided to get help from my doctor and the drug is helping me to pay attention to what I am putting in my mouth.  I will continue to take it till I reach my goals and maybe a little beyond that to wean myself off.  I have about 60 more lbs. to lose and feel I will reach my goal for the first time in 30 years (time I have been holding on to the extra weight).

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am o you 5ft tall so just a stone overweight makes me look 4 stone over. I started on Saxenda back in June 2023 I found it was working great then I couldn’t get it so went about 2 months without anything. Then I started the weygovey I found it much better as only one injection a week. I started at almost 11st now 6 months on I’m 8st7 iv had no side effects apart from a little nausea’s in my first week. But other than that iv been fine. I feel healthier with more energy it’s helped me with muchless aches n pains from a bad back . I’m eating healthily and keeping active everyday. It’s a combination of everything to get the best results . I highly recommend it

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am in month 4 and have gone from 300lb to 272lb. Very easy, minimal side affects, easiest dieting I have ever done. substantial lose of appetite. Let me know when I over do my eating with a good dose of indigestion.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: At first this medication was great! After just a few short months of taking it, was hard to get. When contacting Novo Nordisc they were not willing to help what so ever, by how much money they are making I think it would be okay to give me two free pens since yours malfunctioned?!! I can not wait until Zepbound and Mounjaro are approved for weight loss, these are both Tirzepitide and Ifound that they were a lot more affective I lost more weight and they are actually available. Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I have been receiving semiglutide injections weekly from a provider that works with a local compounding pharmacy. These injections definitely have pros and cons. I have to take anti-nausea medication at least once a day to be able to tolerate any of the doses, and take it more frequently the couple days following my injection. I would not be able to get the injections without that. I never feel great or normal, but it is usually tolerable. I have definitely had a decreased appetite (which is theobvious goal) but can also be difficult, since most of the time nothing is appealing to eat and you can start to feel more sick from not eating enough. I have personally had a difficult time drinking water as it has become more unappealing as well. So I have to really push it. My acid reflux is a little worse and my stomach often feels tender. I go back and forth between constipation and diarrhea. I had a couple days of frequent sulfur burps. 
I haven't lost a lot of weight as far as the scale is concerned but have definitely gone down inches and my clothes fit more loosely. I am learning that a lot of other people have been having that same experience. That part of it can be confusing and discouraging at times, but you have to remind yourself you are actually losing weight. I think that side effect is actually somewhat common, but I don't think there are really any answers yet as to why, and that it isn't really a well known aspect outside of those of us experiencing that. Part of it may be due to constipation/fewer bowel movements, slower digestion and bloating.
While it has come with a lot of challenges for sure, I still feel it is tolerable enough for me to continue for now.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Only got to 0.5mg dose and whilst I did lose 4 kg in 7 weeks the side effects were horrendous. Nausea, heartburn and constipation I could almost deal with but had serious exacerbation of severity, intensity and frequency of migraines and had to discontinue. Also increase in stress and anxiety which was observed by my partner. As a health care practitioner I do have some concerns re the online availability of this medication.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I first started on a medication called Saxenda in August of 2022, that worked /ok/ but in December of 2022 I switched to Wegovy, was way more effective in my opinion. In August of 2022 I started at 435 lbs and now im at 289 lbs with minimal side effects. I will mention it cut my ability to eat food to literally a 1/4 of what I used to be able to eat.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: horrible stomach, gastric issues, seeing doctors to help me, this is horrible and should be outlawed

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I just finished my second tier dose of wegovy. So .5mg. So in those two months I’ve lost 20 pounds total! 8 this first month, and 12 the second. I’m going up to the next dose (1mg) this week so I’m excited to see the scale continue to go down. I do stick to the diet they recommended for the most part and I exercise 4-6 times a week doing cardio for at least 30 minutes. The only side effect that I have predominately experience is nausea. But because of this I’ve quit smoking cigarettes and drinking alcohol which is a huge plus. I can’t even think about either without wanting to gag lol. I did have a really painful and intense menstrual cycle last month which can be a result of rapid weight loss. But I’m willing to deal with it! So far I’ve had an amazing experience and looking forward to what happened next!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I am 53 years young and post-menopausal due to surgery (7 years ago) with high blood pressure and cholesterol. My weight has exponentially increased over time. I started Wegovy in March 2023 at 200lbs. Followed the recommended titration, slowly.  I started .25 and then stayed on .5 for two months. I lost 16 pounds in 3 months and was feeling amazing!! Yes, some acid reflux and then slight nausea on dose day but not worse than after a night out of drinking and eating greasy foods!  

Then, the "supply issue happened".  It was extremely difficult to locate the 1mg dose and my PCP refused to prescribe the 1.7mg. Most pharmacies I contacted didnt even want to discuss supply and I became frustrated. I tried intermittently to locate 1mg to no avail. I then gained back 8 pounds (but not the 16!). 

I FINALLY found the 1mg dose 2 weeks ago. My pcp recommended I return to .25mg due to possible GI issues but I went for it and took the 1mg as I had minimal to no side effects from the other two doses. Unfortunately, I ate a pretty big meal that evening and then took the 1mg injection. I was sooooo sick all night long, pressure on my stomach and nausea all night. And you cant 'undo' the injection once it's administered. I decided to stop fighting the nausea and vomited the next morning, which made me feel so much better. I was very nauseas for a few days and am happy to say that I am back on track with weight loss with no side effects after my injections (3 so far). Ive lost 6lbs in the past three weeks. 

Due to the lack of appetite, I am making sure my body is getting enough vitamins and minerals by taking supplements and forcing myself to eat things like oatmeal, vegetables etc.  I have a company in my town that will do my labs for a reasonable price which for me is important for holistic wellness (insurance is finicky). I am feeling great and enjoying the idea that my blood pressure and cholesterol issues may reduce as I continue my weight loss journey.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started taking it in May of 2023 - six months ago.  I am still nauseated, with heartburn and very bad constipation. I have only lost 20 pounds so far. I exercise and eat very little, and slowly. No fatty or spicy foods. I've followed all the recommendations for nausea, etc. to no avail. Now it is making me feel faint and dizzy, so I have to stop. I was hoping that with Hashimoto's I would have more success than this. I am fortunate - Express Scripts insurance pays all but $45 of this.  At least it didn't make my hair fall out!! :)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I am 40 years old, and am in surgical menopause. After years of struggling to lose weight, I started wegovy. I have been on it since the start of April 2023 and have successfully lost roughly 1 lb. per week. I combined this with 3 days/week of exercise and calorie control (the medicine does the portion control for you!). The first few weeks I had side effects, but now I only notice not being hungry the day I take the shot. If  I eat something fried (chicken wings, mozz sticks) or greasy, my bodyreminds me that I shouldn't be eating it and i feel sick (or wake up mltiple times in the night for the restroom)...but honestly, that is not a bad reminder to stay away from those fat/calorie dense foods.

I have lost 30 lbs and am staying on the 2.4mg dose for maintenance. It truly helps!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
So I just started 1.7mg. Down 20lbs from my start weight. I definitely can't eat like I used to or portion size!
Although I do have nausea and heartburn it's not a deal breaker. The oddest and most surprising side effect is I've lost all taste for alcohol. I love my wine and some would say I drank to often.. but I love that I don't miss it! If everyone experiences this it may have yet another off label use!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: been on Wyegovy since March 2023 - have lost 43 pounds to date.  Started at the .25 dosage/weekly and got to the 2.4 dosage... couldn't handle that dosage, severe cramping, severe constipation and nausea..  Back down to the 1.7 dosage every other week.  Nausea and constipation are the worst side effects for 2-3 days after injection, but it's tolerable.  The shots do change your taste buds and minimize cravings.  Overall, happy with the other week injections of 1.7 dosage.  Hoping to lose an additional 15 pounds to get to goal weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just completed my first month on wegovy .25mg dosage. The last two injections were when I really started to notice symptoms like nausea and heartburn. These symptoms are mild and don’t bother me. Without exercise and mild dieting I lost 12 pounds the first month. I’ve just started the .5 dosage today and am now adding gym 5 times a week and committing to a stricter diet so I’m hoping by end of month two I’m down 30 pounds total. With the pace I’ve been going it’s definitely possible! I do expect the side effects to get worse with this next dosage but my doctor prescribed me anti heartburn and anti nausea medication to help. Clothes are already fitting different and my mood is improved greatly. I’m happy with my experience so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The pen is difficult to inject.  My first two injections the medicine leaked out.  I know have to inject into my thigh and apply a lot of pressure to the pen.  I do count to 20 after the plunger stops.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person

I was excited to try Wegovy to losing weight.
The first one was .25mg. I took it for one month, then I started taking. 1mg. At the second week of wegovy .1mg I was suicidal.
To bad I had to stop talking it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The needle doesn't enter the skin, medicine is wasted.  Have to basically stab yourself with the injector for it to fully deploy and not lock the head immediately.  Once head is locked you cannot push down more to get penetration.  I have lost 2 weeks of medicine and instead of just providing a screw up cap that allows easy injections I have will go back into side effects of not having meds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Back in 5/2022, I met with my PCP, discouraged at how much weight I had gained with no motivation to help myself.  I was at my highest weight 207 lbs and my daughter had just got engaged.  I needed to do something for myself, so when my doctor recommended Ozempic, I decided to try it.  I lost small amounts of weight each week, so was feeling good, but decided I needed some structure, so that I didn't go back to my old habits.  I joined Noom and that kept me paying attention to what I was eatingand where my weight was at.  I felt nauseous and immediately full after a few bites of food, but never got sick.  I couldn't eat greasy food and if I did, I would feel very sick after eating it.  After a few months of Ozempic, I switched to Wegovy because of the shortage but still continued to feel good.  I'm so happy to say that I've lost 60 lbs and am just short of my goal of 140lbs by 5 lbs.  This medication is a miracle for those who have tried unsuccessfully to lose weight on their own.  It's a great jump start for those who have a lot of weight to lose and when you see your body working the way it should, it's very motivating!  Well worth trying!!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started wegovy 6 weeks ago and taking 6th dose of 0.5 mg. this evening. Started on 0.25mg for 4weeks. Had a few side effects with the first 2 injections of 0.25mg. Felt light headed ,some nausea and fatigue at times but was tolerable and managable with pepto bismol. Easy to inject and painless. I inject into my thigh because I read that you have less side effects. It works for me. It definitely decreased my appetite. My starting weight was 210 and now it is 196 in 6 weeks. I', glad I didn't let the negative reviews stop me from trying wegovy. I am looking forward to completing the 0.5 mg in 3 weeks with no side effects and more weight loss and hopefully move up to the next dose of 1mg. Will update at a later date.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started on ozempic while wegovy was out of stock and switched over after getting up to 1mg. I had no issues or side effects till 1.7mg. Last week I’ve thrown up 7 times and will wake up right as I’m going to vomit, once you do tho the nausea is gone. I as someone who would eat all the time it’s been harder, I can only eat a 1/5 of my old portions. So far the results are worth it, in just under 4 months I’ve lost 50 pounds. Started at 390 down to 340, So I’ll take whatever nausea comes with it:)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
SW204 /CW 172 Goal 160
I have lost over 30lbs in the last 4 months.  I have had some stomach problems (gas, bloating a little diarrhea) But overall I haven't been to bad.  The worst was changing strengths . Each time can with new stomach issues. Now that I am at 2.4 my side effects have all but disappeared. Well worth it to me

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve been on Wegovy since April of 2023 and have experienced shortage of supply. I was on the 0.25mg dose for 2 months, where I didn’t experience any weight loss, followed by the 0.5mg dose for a month. There were a few weeks after that where I could not get the prescription filled. I then was able to get the 1.0mg dose which I took 9 days ago. I was sick, vomiting, for 2 days. The side effects subsided after that. I took my second dose of 1.0mg 2 days ago and I was violently ill on the second day, couldn’t even keep down water, and even after purging everything in my stomach, I was vomiting a ton of bile. It was horrific. I’m afraid to take it again out of fear that I will be dealing with 2 days of vomiting every time I take the injection. I’ve lost 20 pounds but I’m trying to figure if it’s worth it or not.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: My prescriber and pharmacy errored and my first injection was yesterday for 1 mg. Should have been .25.  I’ve never been this sick.  Vomiting through Zofran. Headed to ER prob today for help.  Dehydrated. Can’t even keep two sips of anything down.  Know this:  THERE IS NO REVERSAL FOR THIS.  THIS FIVE DAY OD SHOT FOR ME - will continue until it’s out of my system. Nothing manufacturer can offer to reverse.  Per poison control.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Since I've started Wegovy, I've lost so much weight. I started at 230 lbs. I currently weigh 175. The only downside is the nausea. If you overeat, you'll be super nauseous. Also, any time you start a new dose, it may also come with a bit of nauseousness. I've had no desire to drink alcohol which I love. I used to drink quite a bit. Not an alcoholic but I would drink during the weekend. There's absolutely no desire for it so that's good. Once you get past the first day or two of nausea, you're back to normal.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy since Jan. 2023. I am up to 1.7 dose. I elected not to go up to 2.4 because 1.7 was an effective dose for me. I have no major side effects. At the very beginning, on .25 and .50 doses, I would have a headache and major fatigue the day after taking the shot. I didn't really notice appetite suppression until 1.0 dose. It would only last about 4 days then my appetite would pick back up. 1.7 is my sweet spot. I eat about half of what I use to eat pre-Wegovy. I workout with weights and cardio 5 days a week for an hour. I have lose 32lbs in about 7-8mths. There was times when the medicine was on backorder. I take Metamucil twice a day for fiber also to keep bowels regular. I love that I can eat a normal portion of food now and not spend all day thinking about my next meal!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started taking Wegovy 2 weeks ago and just took my 3rd injection yesterday (start of week 3).  I began on the max 2.4mg dosage after trying to obtain lower doses for nearly a year to no avail.  I dropped from 260 lbs to 237 lbs in 2 weeks.  The first 3 days at this dosage was absolute hell, which I expected.  I vomited 4 or 5 different times over the first few days and felt drained and fatigued.  I could not stomach any food whatsoever during the first 3 days and just sipped on a bit of waterfrom time to time. However, after the 3rd day, I was 100% and back to normal in all ways, except my appetite.  I hardly ever feel hungry and when I eat, I can typically only eat a small portion before feeling full.  For example, 2 weeks in, I can only eat like a 3rd of a cheeseburger or a  half of a salad.  Another good by product is that I hardly drink anything alcoholic any more (beer and wine).  Just no craving for it.  When I started week 2 and took my second injection, I was expecting to have to go through hell again.  That did not happen.  Felt great and still do starting my 3rd week.  Lots of energy, no sleep issues, and losing lots of weight.  Just took my 3rd injection yesterday and feel great.  In summary, the first 3 days absolutely sucked for me, but so glad I stuck it out.  Spending a lot less on food and drinking a lot less alcoholic drinks.  Very noticeable weight loss in my face so far.  I am also told that I don't snore anymore (lol).  Hoping this pattern continues over the next couple of months.  Very happy with Wegovy!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I lost 12lbs my first 3 injections, and everything was manageable until I went on vacation. I was at a concert when I tried a vodka lemonaide and ate half a hot dog after not eating all day and just drinking water. 10 minutes later I had horrible abdominal pain. I chalked it up to constipation, but it got so much worse. The pain was different than anything I have ever felt. Even drinking water was killing me. It felt like I swallowed razor blades and my intestines were ripping and my upper backwas shredding into pieces. The pain lasted for 3 days with constant diahrea. I skipped this injection because the pain was worse than my gallbladder surgery. Last night the pain moved to the left upper abdominal area, it felt like I was being stabbed for hours on end. Literally my entire left upper stomach was visably twitching. The pain subsided today, im still constipated, extremly bloated, and tired as hell. Only 3 weeks in and I feel horrible. Please be careful.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Day 2, no hunger & no side effects

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Wegovy works too good of you ask me. I literally cannot eat and food looks so unappealing to me now. I lost 40 lbs in two months and I'm not even at the full dose yet. My only issue is the nausea and complete loss of appetite I now have to force myself to get even a little down. I think I may take a break for a while, I miss being able to eat

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Had no weight loss at all and when I got to the 2.4 dosage an alarming amount of hair fell out.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Worst experience ever after taking the 1st shot of .24ml. I’ve had severe vomiting for 48 hours continuously. It was so bad bile was all that I had left to vomit, made my teeth brittle and I was so cold and breaking out in sweats. I had to get an IV after the 3rd day. What a horrible experience and I’m terrified of the thought of taking the next dose of this over priced medication that took so long to get approved for!
I can barely eat anything and keep it in for 5 mins without throwing up! Taking OTC Dramamine to help with the severe nausea. It’s not worth going through such a terrible experience to lose weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I began my Wegovy journey May 2nd and am about to conclude my 4th month.  I am down 41 pounds.  The side effects have been minimal for me, I have been very lucky.  Other than a little nausea and some fatigue from time to time, I have felt great!  It has definitely curbed my appetite and doesn't allow me to eat very much at one sitting.  I have learned to listen to my body when it tells me to stop eating.  I have over eaten a few times and most definitely paid the price!  I haven't really changedmuch as far as the foods I eat, just the amount.  Being someone that has struggled with my weight since my teens, this has been the easiet, less stressful weight loss journey I have been on.  I am halfway to my goal!!  Yay!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Feb 2023, lowest dose, for the month it worked, curbed any food craving and started to lose weight. Come March, nothing, and what weight I lost, I gained back. Aug 2023, I found out I have low Testosterone levels, and found out, Weygovi and Low Testosterone dont mix, and low T will cause the Weygovi to be ineffective. I kept twlling my endocrinologist that somethings been blocking the Weygovi, and of course, the answer is, well it doesnt work for all…..I think we all know our bodies…so, waiting to fix the low t levels…

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started off the lowest dose but when I started the 1 mg I got super sick hours later vomiting nonstop really bad nausea bad headache dizzy  fatigue sever stomach pain  I feel horrible like I’m dying haven’t ate in 3 days since  taking it it’s not worth it ! Pls stay away for these

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am so pleased with this medication!  I have had no side effects so far. Although I'm still ramping up the dose (1mg now), I've lost 8 lbs.  I don't obsess about food anymore and I don't crave fried food!  The only downside I've found is that I forget to drink enough water now, which I never used to do.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: BMI over 30. On week 10, 2nd week on 1.0 mg dose. Little to no appetite for a couple weeks. Decreased food intake. Zero weight loss. Until this week. After last injection, have been violently ill for days. Can't keep anything down, Threw up food from 2 days prior at beginning of this dose. Throwing up completely undigested food many hours after eating, Stomach won't hold any solids. Lost 10 pounds this weekend. Would rather be chubby.

My experience is different than most. I was not overweight, But had put on 20 pounds since peri-menopause that I could not lose and I felt horrible. I started at 158 and two weeks in I am at 147. Months also started at the 1.7 dose because that was all that was available to get without delay. My first shot was horrible on the first day.  Then my doctor called in nausea medicine and I was good to go. The second day I was good to go. I have just not felt hungry. I definitely have to watch what I eat and I eat supper slow. I was weak my first weak but I hadn’t been taking my vitamins. I started taking them and everything got better. I took my third shot today and haven’t felt sick all day. I was surprised. Last week wasn’t too bad either. I didn’t have headaches or any of the other horrific side effects that some of the others have left in their reviews.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
If you use any medication you will have side effects that you don't want. Thats what drugs do. They give side effects to combat an ailment. Even multivitamins can cause vomiting, dehydration, gi issues and lightheadedness. If you don't use as prescribed then it is not the med to blame. If you expect to take a shot and wake up tomorrow 100lbs less you will be disappointed. 

I have had side effects but got through it. It wasn't pleasant but I got through it. I am happy to stay close to a bathroomonce a week if it means my body can be in less pain because of my weight. Getting older sucks way more when excess weight mixes with normal wear and tear. 
I do think that too many people are not realistic about what this does. It doesn't fix everything by itself and nothing is going to give you that social media glow that isn't real to begin with. Even when you do lose a lot in the end, you now have another round of new problems. You look like a deflated balloon and are dealing with the complexity of being a fat person in a stranger's skinny body. 

Moral of this story. If this works the way you think it should you didn't need it to begin with. If you quit because you don't like the side effects, you didn't need this to begin with. Some of us are desperate, including myself, and will do anything to feel less pain. No one should stay on a med they don't like but don't blame it all on the drug.
