Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I have been taking Wegovy since the end of April 2023. Due to supply issues, I took 2-months worth of the .25 dose and then now 2-months worth of the .5 dose. I have one more dose of the .5ml pen left, but have put off taking it due to experiencing extreme side effects last week (the 2nd time this has happened). It feels like a really bad case of the flu, mixed with nausea, vertigo, a horrible headache, fatigue, and having a very hot, flushed face that I cannot cool down no matter what I do. I can’t stand for more than a few seconds at a time either. It’s seriously awful. I have been prescribed nausea medication and will still sometimes throw up out of nowhere. Mostly like acid reflux. I noticed that this has happened a day or two after taking my 6th or 7th shot of the SAME dose. It is almost unbearable. Also, it is really scary that these side effects can appear seemingly out of nowhere when other weeks I feel mostly fine (maybe not ever 100% but manageable). I think these side effects may also be corresponding with my period, but that’s just a theory. So, adding that into the mix is the cherry on top of what is a horrible experience. 

Some weeks I feel less hungry than others, but it has never been consistent or gotten progressively “better” with each week. I already try to drink a ton of water, but have upped my water intake even more since starting the medication in hopes of helping avoid any potential side effects. I have also tried to incorporate more protein and veggies into my diet and stay away from really greasy foods or lots of sugar. Again, some days or weeks are better than others, but overall, I have made some decent improvements to my diet and still haven’t been able to lose much weight or keep off the little bit I have lost. When I’m not experiencing extreme fatigue or any other side effects, I am usually able to exercise 2-3 times a week. But if the fatigue creeps up on me? Forget about it. It will feel like I’ve been drugged.

Overall, I’m disappointed that the medication hasn’t worked the way I’ve heard it has for others. My doctor reminded me that not everyone experiences rapid weight loss in the first few months, but I guess I just assumed (or hoped) that’s what would happen. She feels that my progress is good enough/gradual and that if I can get my hands on the medication during these crazy shortages then I should try to push through. However, risking feeling like death 2-3 days every 6 weeks has me questioning if it’s worth it. I want to be the healthiest version of myself, but have never found it easy to lose weight without crash dieting. As I get older and my metabolism slows, it only becomes increasingly more difficult. I want to be heart healthy, have energy, and feel my best. So far, Wegovy has occasionally made me feel less hungry, but the anxiety and stress that comes with experiencing side effects and dealing with supply chain issues/coverage is a lot.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Im just starting week 3, no noticeable weight loss. I noticed another person had problems with their throat feeling swollen and sore. That is what Im going through. Does this go away?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I'd give it 10 stars if I could. Started on 1/15 at 277 pounds down to 201 6 months later. It slows the digestive system, so I took on an empty stomach though instructions says it doesn't matter. Minor side effects. Headaches and the runs the first 2 days and the runs when I upped to the 1.7 dosage for about 10 days. Only other side effect was fatigue. Though when I'm fatigued that's when the weight comes off. Doctor kept me on the .25 doseage for the first 3 months, .50 for the next 2 months, 1.0 for a month and just started the 1.7 doseage 2 weeks ago. 
   Was able to eat the foods I like, though I avoided pasta, bread and sugar foods, diet mainly meat and baked potato. Wegovy curbed my carb addiction considerably, snacking reduced by about 80 percent and meals by about 40 percent. 
   Had a few periods when the weight loss stalled for 7 to 10 days. I lost weight before but never this easy. The cravings for food went away within an hour of 1st injection.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Extremely disappointed! I was excited to finally get my Dr. to prescribe it/my insurance to approved it ( $1,600.00/ 28 day supply) Got the 1st month and did very well on it. Got a Lil nauseous and dizzy but bearable. I lost 12 lbs.so happy.My second month had to wait 3 weeks, wasn't available, on backorder! Gained 3lbs waiting. Waiting 4 weeks now for my 3rd month. Gained 3 more lbs waiting! Backorder AGAIN! Rediculous! For that price, they should be producing for the demand or don't advertise!It's messing me all up! SO MAD!!!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This is a very dangerous medication and you should be warned, I have been vomiting nonstop for two days!! I can’t even stomach my essential pills for my heart or pain!! I can even eat apple sauce without projectile vomiting every last grain of it!!! Even Gatorade I can’t stomach! It’s going on day two and it’s getting better but yeah you will loose weight in a pinch if you POISON YOURSELF!!! I have felt hungover for days now with no relief!! Never again I will just count calories from now on!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm on week 6 and on 2nd step up in strength. The first 4 weeks were rough. I was hungry all the time, but could only eat a couple of bites and my stomach felt full! But then I was hungry again in about 30 minutes. I just suffered through it and lost 12 lbs. This 2nd round is better. Hunger has finally subsided and I've lost 3lbs per week - 18 lbs total. I have found that Pepcid has helped with nausea and occasionally I've laid down because of dizziness, but all-in-all I've been happy with results. Sam's Club Pharmacy has been helpful in ordering my next set of injections a little early so they are available when I need them.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am 42 years old and have a 27 BMI. I started with Wegovy at .25. Unfortunately, it didn't do anything - not even curve my appetite. Due to lack of supply, I lasted 2 weeks without any medication. I jumped up to 1.7 because .50 and .10 were out of stock until further notice in my area. I am on my last week of last applicator and I feel horrible. I am nauseas everyday, like pregnant morning sickness. I have extreme skin sensitivity, specially on my back and I feel like my bones are freezing allday no matter how many sweaters/blankets I put on. I can't be with to AC, I still like I'm freezing. Also, I noticed that my tonsils hurt and feel inflamed almost like when getting strep but it hasn't worsen just remains bothersome and feel somewhat swollen. My appetite has definitely decreased and I force myself to eat so I can have a little energy. I'm exhausted and cold all day long with extreme skin sensitivity. I have lost @6 lbs but I think I have lost more Fat % vs actual scale weight. My clothes is fitting loose. I just wish these side effects weren't as horrific. Is anyone else experiencing Skin Sensitivity/chills?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been taking the drug for 4 months and lost 40 pounds.  Overall, I am very happy with the results but have had some significant side effects.  Once starting the 1.7 mg I have noticed increased nausea and abdominal pain.  As well, recently had two separate times of vomiting and diarrhea, the last being the worst thinking I may have to visit the ER.  I was able to recover but since have had abdominal pain.  I'm concerned after reading the effects for others that I should stop taking the drug.  However, I've had such good results I would rather push through and hope they go away.  Several users commented side effects go away after 6+ months of usage.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I've been taking Wegovy for 10 weeks and have lost 20 lbs.  The side effects haven't been too bad.  At times I am very sick to my stomach, but doesn't last but about an hour.  Happens about 1 or 2 times a week.  Appetite is definitely curbed and little want for sweets.

Been on Wegovy for 8weeks now. Have lost 18 pounds. Very little side effects on .5. Nothing you can’t push through. Some days you may have fatigue, and then it goes away. Other days you may have a bout of diarrhea, and then it get better. You without a doubt get fuller quicker. Hands down the best thing I have been given. I’m at menopausal age and as hard as I tried the weight wouldn’t budge until starting this. I feel great! All my numbers have dropped greatly, cholesterol, A1C. I do try to walk three times a week for exercise but nothing too crazy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Only made it to the second dose until I had to stop. Had to go into the ER after my second shot because I was having such bad vertigo that was making me vomit all day. I’m now 3 days since my last shot and I am still overwhelmingly dizzy and feel so out of control. Only thing that helps is laying in a dark room trying not to move my head at all. One slight move and the whole room is spinning all over again. Nausea and vomiting has subsided at this point now.  
Before this medication I was on Mounjaro and that one had gone MUCH better but insurance no longer covers it for people using it for weight loss.
This has been such an horrible experience and I would not recommend this medication to anyone!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: In hindsight, all was pretty tolerable until the second week of 1.0mg. After 14 days of feeling increasingly worse (extreme and sudden depression and crippling anxiety, weakness to the point I can barely walk across the house, fatigue, massive brain fog, confusion,  dizzy, cold and chills with no fever, rash on arms, swelling in neck, headache, eye pain, blurry vision,  jacked up blood pressure) I went to the ER. All sorts of abnormal labs for kidney function, electrolytes, metaboloc acidosis and messed up red blood counts. Prior to that dose, I was doing great, exercising daily, sticking to my lifestyle changes and happy with the results. Now I'm weak and unable to exercise, work, concentrate, feeling unmotivated, tired, moody, and anxious. It feels like I'm literally dying and there's nothing that helps. It's everything I can do to force myself to eat and drink a little bit.  This med doesn't help that much to justify feeling like absolute hell, mentally and physically for weeks after stopping it. I see that many people experience the same gigantic kick in the face at the 1.0 to 1.7 mg dose . I wish there was an antidote, I would pay anything to end this torture. I'll do this my dang self once I can muster the strength to move, think clearly, and get out of this quick, hard hitting depression.  Sorry brain, sorry kidneys, bye-bye sanity.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy for just over 2 months. I have lost 15 pounds, so I will say it is very effective. I am currently at the 1mg weekly dose, and it is rough. Since the start of this medication, I have had a general "queasy" feeling almost all the time. My appetite is definitely decreased. I have also had some dizziness and fatigue and it has interfered some with my workouts. I was eating low carb and exercising regularly before starting Wegovy, but was at a weight plateau. I started this because of my A1C (prediabetic) and triglyceride levels, and I believe weight loss will help both these numbers. I know to avoid weight regain, I will probably have to be on this indefinitely. At this point, however, I don't think I will go above the current 1mg dose, at least for a few months, because the side effects on this dose are pretty bad. Queasy all the time with intermittent nausea, constipation, fatigue, some dizziness during my workouts. I am hoping with time these will get better as the weight loss continues. I don't want to take Zofran, miralax, and colace forever.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I have been on Wegovy for a year and a half, minus 4 months when my insurance was denying the claim due to a misunderstanding. I’m giving a review because mostly people with bad reactions leave reviews here and my experience has been overwhelmingly positive. It was working so well for me that I did each dose for a few months before increasing to the next level. I’m just now starting the 2.4mg dose and although I’m nervous, it’s worth it because the results are so good. 

I had a bmi of 31 when Istarted and now it’s is 24. I’ve lost about 28% of my body weight and now look and feel great. All my arthritis is gone! I did have some pretty significant nausea and constipation for a few months, but I only vomited once. Some headaches too and just not feeling great. But the longer you’re on it, it seems to get better and I mostly don’t have any side effects anymore. We will see with this new highest dose. 

When I had to stop for 4 months, I gained back about 14 lbs, so that’s why I started it up again. I intend to stay on it so that I can keep the weight off. Totally worth it, for me, and just hoping I don’t get any serious side effects from long term use. I recommend people try it if they qualify. You never know how your body will tolerate a new medicine and you might get lucky!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Wow! I'm so glad that I started on Wegovy! I'm on the 1.7 and have lost 31 LBS. I didn't get sick or anything.  I do have dry mouth. Please don't let the reviews scare you! It feels amazing to finally loose the weight! In the first .25 dose I did have bathroom problems but that went away.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Starting treatment weight was 302 currently at week 10 of treatment, dose 1.0, weight is 268, intermittent fasting, cardio, and weight training daily. That is 34# in ten weeks and 11% of my total body weight...! Minimal side effects. Excessive dairy and alcohol are not a good idea. This product eliminates cravings... could not have changed bad habits without wegovys help.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
The Folks out there that write Negative Reviews against Wegovy. You guys NEED to understand that everyone is built different. If you experienced negative side effects, well , Wegovy is not for you then. But don't trash Wegovy with your negative side effects. I am on my 10th week using Wegovy and Yes there were side effects but after time they do go away. Fatique, tiredness, constipation etc. Give the meds the chance to work first. And YES, you will definitely LOSE WEIGHT.
Regards.

I am not obese but have not been at a good weight for 9 years. Have tried all the diets, lost weight but have not been able to keep it off. A friend suggested Wegovy, since she lost weight on it. I asked my doctor and she prescribed it. 

In the first month I lost 10 lbs. When my prescription went to .5, I started losing weight a lot more slowly and having my first side effect, increased resting heart rate. I don't have any other side effects. With the increase in dosage however, I never feel full. 

To date, I'm on Wegovy for 7 weeks and have lost 13 lbs. I don't feel any different and am a bit disheartened that the weight loss is not as quick. I work out with a personal trainer twice weekly and go for daily walks. So far, I'm not really impressed.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy since the end of March 2023. In 10 weeks I've lost 22lbs, which is over 2lbs a week. This is a TOOL to help you lose weight. I workout 5 days a week, including strength training. I eat around 1200 calories, but that isn't hard, since the medication does curb cravings. I'm one of those people who has always eaten well and exercised, but after years of dieting and excessive restriction (even Anorexia), my body didn't want to work effectively anymore. For the first time maybeever, I'm able to eat things I wouldn't normally eat, and not gain weight- but in fact, lose. I don't restrict things, but as an overall healthy eater and Vegetarian, this works wonderfully for my lifestyle. People really need to do their research, though. You are meant to slowly titrate up the doses so that you can eliminate or reduce the side effects. There are ways to deal with the side effects when you have them- drink more water, eat plenty of protein, etc. The therapeutic dose doesn't even start til 1.0mg-1.7mg and many do not lose anything until then, so you have to be patient. I'm one of the lucky ones whose had great success from the beginning, but I do lead a healthy lifestyle. I feel like my body is finally working the way it's meant to. Exercise, choose foods to fuel your body, eat lots of protein so you don't lose muscle mass, and be patient. Don't compare your journey to anyone else's.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve been on this medication for 2 months now and have lost 26lbs. Nauseous and vomiting during the first 2 weeks. My doctor does well with keeping up with my progress and since day one has mentioned increasing my fluid intake. By reading other reviews dehydration seems to be a big issue for people. Hopefully this continues to work for me and I reach my goal with only 24lbs left to lose.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Do not take this. I took the .25 dose at 8:30 and by midnight I have continuously been vomiting. Diarrhea and extreme stomach pain. This is horrible!

I do not recommend Weygovy. I only did the initial shot and was sick soon after and for weeks after (even though I only did the one shot; I discarded the other 3). Im talking relentless nausea, vomiting, fatigue, weakness, zero appetite Which isn’t healthy! I did lose 6lbs in 6 days bc I physically could not eat or drink without being immediately in the bathroom. I ended up in the ER on day 5 and 6 due to dehydration ??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I took my first dose of Wegovy and had some manageable symptoms. Diarrhea, fatigue, cold sensitivity. It did decrease my appetite, but my energy level is so low I can’t exercise. Second dose was worse. I have felt like I have had an ongoing stomach bug for two weeks. I can’t eat anything that’s not clear liquid. I didn’t, and won’t take the third dose. I just hope this goes away!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: First lower dose didn’t do anything for me and no symptoms. First week on highest dosage 50, was tough, vomiting, constipation, fever for 24 hours. 2nd week has been fine, a little nausea. I have not weighed myself but my clothes are looser…

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This sent me to the hospital with dehydration and severe abdominal pain. I have a pretty high pain tolerance, but this abdominal pain was by far the worst I have ever dealt with. I took 4 weeks of 0.25 followed by 1 dose of 0.5 (the correct dose schedule according to manufacturer) and 6 days later I was in the hospital. I have not taken another does since. But- my GI tract is still not right. It took at least one week to deal with the aftermath of the hospital visit, and now, 3.5 weeks out frommy last dose, I still get queasy/nauseous 1-2 times weekly, so much so that I have to take Zofran, which barely touches it. And BTW- the nauseousness lasts for at least 12 hours, it's not a quick, passing thing. This "medication" is dangerous even when used correctly. I did read all these reviews before starting so was hesitant but went ahead anyway, and thought after a month that I skirted around any side effects, but I was totally wrong. Never again and don't do it. It's not worth it.

Condition: weight loss management, obese adolescent (BMI 95th percentile or greater for age and sex)
Textual Review:
This has been the worst day of my life. This morning at 7am I did my first shot of .25, but 3pm I had called 911. 

I have been vomiting non stop since about 2 hours after the injection. My heart rate when EMS arrived was 155, I was having chest pain and palpitations. I was dizzy and delirious. 

My local EMS said they see this a few times a week from wegovy, the ER dr said he sees it daily.  I had focused on hydrating the 4 days before the injection and was even fasting I took it. Please reconsider taking this

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started on the medication 4 weeks ago and I have lost 13lbs. I have had no side effects and cravings for sweets are gone. Can't wait to see how much I lost next month.

Let me first say that digestivelly, I have never been more miserable in my life than I was on this "medication." Wegovy  gave me abdominal cramps so bad I had to go an ER. I was very dehydrated and in so much pain. Luckily my CT was normal, but my WBC was elevated. Maybe this is some other side effect that will start being reported more often now that half the population seems to be taking it. I started at the 0.25 and did that weekly for 4 weeks. During that time, I was ok but constantly felt somewhat bloated and would burp way more than what would be considered normal. Then came 0.5, one dose. 6 days later I was in the ER. It's now 1 week later, and my GI tract is still not normal. I am glad some people had success with this but for me, my life was way better before this medication. I'll take 15# overweight and feeling great to this any day. My next visit is to a GI doctor. I just hope there is no permanent damage.Thanks for the misery, Wegovy. Never again. Big pharma can take their bogus, fabricated  BMI and stick it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This drug has helped me to reach a healthier weight. I have not had any side effects. I could not have done this without this drug.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I was terrified to start this because of the reviews I read. So far I have had minimal side effects. I’m more sensitive to the cold, sometime have indigestion and definitely have constipation that I need to take colace for but besides that I have no other side effects.  I have loss 14lbs in 4 weeks. I am combining this with weight watchers so I am pretty careful about what I’m eating. Wegovy seems to make it possible for me to avoid the cravings I generally have.  Part of it has been fear of getting sick from all the reviews but I think it’s also that it makes me feel pretty full longer.  I do still experience hunger but I am definitely able to eat way less and still feel satisfied. my insurance covers it and it’s working so I’m happy to continue on the same dosage for another course (4 weeks). My doctor sees no reason to increase as it’s working and not making me sick.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: So I just started 1.7 today. I think the is a great TOOL for weight loss. I am down 50 lbs. I call it a tool because its still a lot of work. I have been on this 12 weeks. I started at 320 and am down to 270 with not many side effect. I have twice overate 2 times while taking this medicine first time bad heartburn through the night last time was last night even though I knew better. I had acid reflux and 1/2 way into the night I through up. You would have thought I learned my  lesson. So I havehad a few headaches and diarrhea bur nothing to hard. Losing 50 lbs I feel so much better and with the 1.7 I have noticed I don't feel hungry at all today. I am so glad I started this and my wife is on it she felt nauseous her first day on .50 dose but at a little and was fine. I am a believer

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I did one month of each MG and have lost a total of 24 pounds.  I initially lost 9 pounds the first month while on the .25.  During the second month while on .50 I lost nothing(I also didn’t exactly give any effort).  After starting the 1.0 I started losing weight again, towards the end of the month my weight loss started to slow down again.  I am now on my first month of the 1.7 and am losing weight again. For the first time I have a side effect of fatigue.  But what do you expect when you don’t eat?  This will be my last month as I have hit my goal.  

Overall I am happy and would recommend.  Only negatives is the price and the fatigue once I started the 1.7.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: At first I was nervous about the needle, but the first time I used it I didn’t feel a thing. Very easy to use. The appetite suppression began right away, no nausea, no constipation, no diarrhea. I just took my second dose, and so far I am down 8 pounds. This is just after my first week. Could be a fluke, could be a difference between scales, I am going to weigh myself again at the doctors office using their scale where I initially weighed in, for a more accurate comparison. Overall I’m very pleased. No insomnia. No cravings. I’m definitely eating less and feeling better. My clothes are also telling the tale, fitting much better with no bloating.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I lost 10lbs initially on Wegovy then I stalled no more   I am overweight by a lot and prediabetic.  I do feel like it kept my cravings down but weight loss just stopped .My coworkers had good experience  they didn’t have a lot to loose compared to myself  but dropped 40lbs plus  so I was very discouraged.  I didn’t experience side effects  except for headaches  I sure wish I had experienced the same results as others but as in all situations not all medicines work the same on different bodies.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I took the .25 was ok except for nausea. Moved up to the .5 was still ok. Then moved up to the 1.0. Two days after the shot I was so sick. Watery #2,  terrible nausea, burping up sulphur eggs, stomach pains. I thought I had the stomach flu. Went away after two days. Took my shot again the same thing happened only worse. I ended up in the ER because the stomach pain was so bad it was worse than I ever could imagine. Had two bags of IV CT scan to make sure everything was ok and said that my stomach was distended and my hiatal hernia was inflamed. Also during the first two months of the shot I was stagnant with weight lose. I did lose 20 lbs but going back to eating the right way without all the pain and discomfort I went through plus loosing pay at work. Will not recommend this drug at all. Big pharma wanting to make money.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: So far I have been very happy with this medication. I just took my fourth dose of .25 today and I am down 13 pounds. At the beginning, I had a lot of bloating and some constipation. I started taking a probiotic daily and that has seemed to help a lot. I have also increased my water intake. It definitely has decreased my appetite significantly. I am struggling to get my protein intake up. I concentrate on protein and vegetables at my meals. I snack on cheese, yogurt, fruit, protein bars or shakes, some nuts. Move up to .50 next week and I’m hoping it goes just as smoothly.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Update, I have now have sulfur burps alongside nausea, heartburn, diarrhea, abdominal pain, distention, bloating, flatulence, etc. If I would I have this would be the end of the road for 7 lbs, I wouldn’t have ever started. DONT DO IT. Everything easy comes with a price!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Started Wegovy initially no side effects other than constipation.Lost 8 bs in 10 thought this was going to be great. The higher the dose, the more nauseous I got. No appetite. Lost and gained the same two pounds now for 2 months. Even with a very low calorie diet. I was so hopeful, but this is for the birds. The only reason I will continue is so that I don’t gain. I’m so disappointed.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I am in my 2nd month of the startup dose due to the nausea, severe constipation and headaches the Dr thought going up to next dose wasn’t a good idea…he wanted me to discontinue saying that the medication doesn’t work for everyone BUT I asked to try 1 more time 
as of this morning I have done 6 doses and have lost 7.9 pounds. 
It does help with the feeling that I need to eat but I am seriously considering if the side effects are worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I am 65, weighed 203, and am 5’8. I was really hoping this would be the answer to my weight loss journey.  I began Wegovy with .25 five weeks ago. I have lost five pounds. This drug has had a strange outcome for me. The scale stayed the same for eight days straight. It wasn’t until I expelled a week’s worth of #2 that I finally lost another 1.5 pounds. At the beginning, I didn’t go to the bathroom for nine days. I was miserable. I tried senacot  and Miralax together before I finally went. 
Thishas been a horrible and disappointing experience.  It has made me depressed and lethargic, not to mention the stomach pain every day. Last week I went to the .50 dose. Worst week of my life. I have eight grandchildren and can’t even enjoy them because I’m so sad and sick. I have struggled with weight loss since I was 50. Thank goodness I am tall or I would look like a cow. I have three injections left and I’m not sure I can put myself through this for three more weeks. 
I pay $906 for a month’s worth, and I feel like it has been such a waste of money. I may go back to the .025 if I continue Wegovy. At what price does one pay to get healthy? Ugh!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Listed as a possible side effect but my dr says she has never heard of it..... I'm extremely weak feeling.  My legs feel like they could give away from under me.  I feel shaky. Its the feeling you get when you do need to eat not eating does not help.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Been on Wegovy for 2 1/2 months now and down 23 lbs. Beginning Nausea was horrible! Just took my first dose of 1 mg a day ago and Im so sick! Can’t eat not hungry and the relentless Nausea…! Horrible pains on right and left sides of my stomach. Exhausted! I don’t know if I’ll be sticking with this or not.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started on the normal dosing schedule, 2 months in and on my last one week of 0.5 when I started getting left upper quadrant abdominal pain. As a nurse and knowing the rare, but possible side effects, afraid of pancreatitis I went to the ER. Cleared on the pancreatitis but the pain will not reside. Now it’s projectile vomiting, I can’t keep anything down. I’ve had debilitating fatigue. I’ve only lost 7 lbs in 2 months. Gastric emptying delay .. that’s how this thing works? There’s better waysto lose weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Day after my first shot and I feel horrible!  Headache will not budge been taking Tylenol extra strength.  Constant nausea I guess that’s the way of losing weight?    Keep burping and taste like eggs I don’t even eat eggs.. Sorry I’m not looking for an eating disorder .. when does this crap leave your system??  I really don’t want to continue to feel this way it’s horrible!  This drug should be pulled off shelves waste of money.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Today will make week 1 on Wegovy. First week I had 2 nights of insomnia but no other side effects. I completely loss my appetite and had to make myself eat healthy meals. Total weight loss for week one was 6 pounds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 6 weeks ago. Initially, I felt horrible fatigue, for which my doctor instructed me to take vitamin B6, so the fatigue is gone. I had to stay on the initial dose the second month due to stomach pain and diarrhea. I am taking Metamucil and drink a 3 liters of water a day. I do feel full fast and there are minor taste issues with food. The general feeling of being unwell does not allow me to eat much. I also am not exercising much but I try to just push through that and I walk.  Ihave only lost 6 lbs in 6 weeks but maybe slower weight loss is better. I will post again when they up my dose. Wish me luck!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Lost 12 lbs so far over 3 weeks & haven’t even started to increase dosage yet.  Still need to pick up more exercise. Shifting to a low carb diet boosted weight loss

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This medication has ruined the entire month of March for me. I have been sick every 3-4 days with explosive diarrhea and vomiting. I cannot wait for it to get out of my system. The reason people are loosing so much weight on this is because you literally cannot eat.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’m on week 5 doing the slow increase up to the 2.4 mg. First month was .25 mg and this month is .50, next month 1 mg, etc. Definitely learned after my first dose to do several things. Be super aware of what I eat on my dosing days and the next two days. Nothing fatty, unhealthy etc. that results in diarrhea. I always take Pepcid in the mornings now and on my dosing day and the next couple of days take another anti acid before I eat. I drink lots of water. Also one time I pushed the pen into myskin and it didn’t click to dispense the medication so I lifted up the pen and ended up wasting a lot of the medication ??. Lastly I always take out the pen out of the fridge on dosing days in the mornings then dose at night but not right before bed time. It sounds like a lot but I’m super happy and excited to be on this med. definitely notice the appetite decrease and I’m excited to see how things go once I get up to the 2.5 mg dose. All side effects have been manageable just need to readjust some things.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I used .25 Wegovy March 2022 and it was amazing. Took away appetite, unfortunately this is when the shortage started and I couldn’t refill for an entire year. Started up again .25 dose Feb 2023 and feel nothing. Did not take away appetite at all. Increased dosage to .50 and have been on that for a little over two weeks and still no noticeable change in appetite. Wondering if the rush to get the medication back on the shelves changed the med, as in 2022 the .25 worked amazingly. 
Hoping the nextdosage works!

Condition: weight loss management, obese adolescent (BMI 95th percentile or greater for age and sex)
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 8 weeks ago and am completely happy with the results! not much as far as side effects go. One night I ate to much later and was sick through the night. This would happen before Wegovy but I was sicker. This has helped me not over eat late at night. I did Have Diarrhea one night and a little constipated nothing bad. My appetite is def less than before but you still have to work at it. I have loss 32 lbs in & weeks with a week at an all-inclusive resort where I did drink and ate what I wanted. I just took my last dose on .50 I will see how the other ones do. My wife just started Wegovy

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started a week ago today with my first shot. I made very smart choices with my food and drank a lot of water. The third day I had a severe headache. Otherwise a little nauseous. I am down 8Lbs. So far so good!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Started with the .25 dose, now one the 1 dose.  Working with my Nurse Practitioner to monitor side effects and tolerance to medication.  So far so good.  My Nurse Practitioner also has me adhering to proper nutrition and exercise in addition to taking the medication. 
Working with dietitian to change eating habits and that has been a good experience.  I like the approach because the first 3 months we focused on adding a new goal in terms of nutrition focus so as not to have to worry about everything at once.  My water, protein, carbs and fat each day are now where they should be for me.  Its not so overwhelming now trying to meet my daily goals.  The medication is just helping me not focus on food or being hungry while doing this.  
I have experienced some nausea after the injection but seems to go away after a day or so. We will see how this goes as the dosage increases.  Some foods i dont seem to tolerate as well but they are foods I should not have regulary as a part of my new behaviors anyway so I am ok with that.  Also now understand that those items are choices as well but should not be a regular choice so again the medication is helping with behavior changes. 
On the .25 and .5 dose i did lose weight but nothing remarkable, but this is probably more related to me working on smaller manageable Nutritional goals. 
I am have more significant loss each week with the 1g dose so I imagine this will continue as the dose increases.
After reading some of the reviews I would say your best experience with the medication is partnering with a provider who knows about the treatment of obesity so that you can get all the tools needed to have a good experience.  The medication alone is not enough.

3th shut at 0,25 mg and I got terrible pains in my stomach, so terrible bad that I had to annonce myself sick at the job. Was just laying on the bed. Screaming in pain and agony.
No way able to eat anything that that would just make the pain even worse.
Stopped the 'treatment', not by any means worth the effort.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I completed two does of Wegovy. The joint pain, every joint  hurt. Elbows, knees Arms, bottom of my feet..not listed as side effect however have read others posts with similar experiences. My dr doesn’t recommend I continue with the medication. Also a black box warning on thyroid cancer. Eating healthy watching my calories and carbs while difficult at least I will live to enjoy my weight loss??
Decided the risks with this drug don’t make it the cure all for weight loss !!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Effectiveness: I've been on Wegovy since 1/19/23, in the first month I was down 15 pounds, second month another 15. I just took my 6th injection today 3/23/23, and am currently at 35 pounds. My BP has already dropped from 130s/90s, to 90s/70s, and have been removed from my first BP Med. 

Ease of Use: Once you get the needle out of your head, it is an easy injection. Both injections on 1.0 have been 'light', as it doesnt feel like the needle is going as deep as the last 8 doses. Todays dose wasleaky, even with the needle in and pressing hard. I'll try again next week to see, it'll still do it's job even if some leaked out.

Satisfaction: Overall I'm satisfied, I haven't had much of a change in taste, but have noticed I am definitely more sensitive to smells triggering retching. Nausea for .25 and .5 were very mild, with 1.0 being on the slightly higher side of moderate. The night of the first 1.0, was horrible; But that was my own doing, having eaten heavier foods through the day before the injection, today seems to be back to a more mild sensation, eating like I had been the previous dose days. My partner has been absolutely supportive through this, adjusting his diet to closer to mine. I've mostly stuck to a sausage egg and cheese JD Delight sandwich for breakfast, raw veggies with a yogurt based dressing, or chicken patties with salsa for lunch, and pretty much whatever has been made for dinner. I have greatly reduced overall carb intake, getting closer to a keto diet but not strict. Something you MUST do is tell yourself to eat. My first 2 days after my first injection were very hanger ragey. Lesson learned. Beef seems to be a trigger food for nausea now. One side effect I've experienced more often than anything has been dizziness on standing. The first time I experienced it, it was quick as I was actually getting up from crouching; I actually had to lay down for a minute to come back to myself. Since then, I've either sat back down or just stood and braced myself against something. The removal from the first BP med seems to have really lightened up that side effect though. Outside of that, I am gassy from both ends, but I can't tell if that's the Wegovy or the CPAP at this time; Probably both... but the drug is doing what it's designed to do. I am trying to tell myself to endulge more, as I am somewhat concerned with how fast the weight is coming off... thinking maybe my blood sugar has been getting lower than it should be (have never been diagnosed diabetic), but feel like that could have also been contributing to the dizziness. It has mostly curbed my sweet tooth, I do endulge in a little bit as dessert towards the end of the night, usually a serving of peanut butter cups, trying to include more fruit as well; But overall just learning to be more mindful of what I'm actually putting in, since I'm eating about 1/3 of what I would have before, so that what is going in is actually nutritious. I haven't started getting back into the gym yet, but am planning on it and becoming more active as the weather is getting nicer. I work from home, and have become accustomed to... remaining warm, since I'm now also cold much more easily.

TL:DR, you have to figure out what works for you, what triggers symptoms more severely and how to mitigate them. Having a support system WITH you, not just online, via people who are willing to make these changes alongside you also makes a HUGE difference.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am 59 - 5’7” weigh in at 189 and menopausal and Hypothyroidism, As the years pass I keep gaining weight, I have tried other diets, and this is my last resort. I am on my 3rd week of Treatment started at .5 for the 1st 2 weeks and 10 on the 3rd  week I have only lost 5lbs, I have been a bit gassy and lethargic, Minor Nausea when I don’t eat, my constipation now is severe but working on it.   I still do get hungry, but the cravings and anxiety eating have gone down and feel satisfied with smallmeals. I would like to lose 30 lbs. Will keep you posted.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy for 1 1/2 years and I have lost 50lbs I am very satisfied. I have tried many other diets and had no success. I am a type 1 diabetic on an insulin pump and very much in control I am feeling so much better I can bend get up off the floor tie my laces it’s amazing. At this point I’m not losing weight I’m just maintaining but couldn’t be happier.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have finished my first round of .25 Wegovy and nothing really changed for me. I've read so many reviews by people who have success immediately, so I am currently wondering why I am not having the same experience. My appetite has slightly decreased, but I actually haven't lost weight. I'm exercising and working hard at maintaining a healthy diet. My doctor has increased my dosage to .5, and I will start that this weekend. Has anyone had a disappointing experience at .25, or am I alone?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just started the first week with my lowest injection. I had some nausea. I am a bit constipated. I feel great, I have no cravings and eat till I am full then done. I am drinking more water. Over all I feel GREAT!! Hope the weight comes off fast. 4 days with this...loving it

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been taking Wegovy for about 9 months. I am currently on the 2.4 dose. In the first few months I lost roughly 25 lbs. and thankfully had little to no side effects-- I was excited. At the end of Dec I had a 2nd surgery to repair a hernia and due to the extreme pain I wasn't very mobile. I have continued to take the shot, but I have plateaued. Thankfully I haven't gained the weight back, but I am not losing either.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’ve only been on wegoy for 1 month and I wake up so hungery. I thought it was supposed to stop to hunger. I am now about to start my 2nd month on 0.5 so we will see how it goes .

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Most effective weight loss treatment I've ever used. I've been losing at a rate that is slow but very steady.  I am convinced that like many things, the reviews here are naturally an adverse selection in that people with a bad experience are far more likely to write reviews. My only side effects have been tiredness the day after shots, and occassional mild nausea.  The nausea was really just during the first few weeks, I assume as my body was getting used to this. I am 3 months in. 1 month .25 and 2 months .5. This medicine helps me eat less. I'm never starving between meals and when I do eat I simply don't want as much. I have noticed that as the week goes on I get hungrier and I have days where I eat over 2000 calories sometimes when I near my next dose. I am very happy with this med. I've even still been able to enjoy a drink or two on special occasions with no issue.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I have been on Wegovy for 5 weeks. The shots are so painless, I sometimes check to make sure I was the autoject pen actually worked (I inject in my abdoment. I have lost 15 pounds rather effortlessly. The main benefit I have noticed is I am no longer fixated on food. I don't think about eating constantly or have the desire to snack throughout the day nor do I eat voraciously. I started off at 231 pounds (I am a 56 year old male, 5' 10" tall). That weight put me in the obese category with a BMI of 30. After five weeks, I am at 215 pounds. 

I have reduced my caloric intake by at least 1/2. I am fuller faster and can stop eating with food still on the plate. It has also increased my ability to reject evening snacks. I still think about them occasionally but I am able to resist the urge rather easily. 

As far as side effects, there have been a few minor ones. I started off with a dose of .25 mg and on month two it was increased to .50 mg. The side effects I have experienced were mild to moderate and only happened when I ate too much food i.e. binging. When I ate more than a human being should, I had stomach aches, mild nausea, cramps, and acid reflux. Again, this correlates directly to overeating. The psychological effect of cause and effect (eat too much and suffer moderate physical discomfort) is also beneficial to changing my relationship with food.  I learned rather quickly that binging has a negative consequence. 

I think many of the negative stories about Wegovy can be traced to people either being initially given too large a dose or people thinking this is a miracle drug that will allow you to eat the way that made you obese and still lose weight. It is not a panacea that will allow you to continue to overeat. It is a significant resource to curb cravings and slow down digestion making you feel fuller with less food and also holding you accountable for your bad eating habits should you try to continue them. 

I have found that increasing your water intake and adding fiber supplements to your diet can minimize the side effects of constipation and diarrhea. 

My goal weight is 185. If I can maintain my current weight loss trajectory, I should hit that in three to four months. I had almost given up on losing weight until I was able to get this drug. I am extremely happy with the results and feel the minor side effects I have experienced are completely acceptable and manageable. If used as part of a reduced-calorie diet and with added physical activity, I believe Wegovy can help many people reach healthier weights in relatively short periods of time with minimal side effects.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: My first dose I had some upset stomach bad gas burping and a little diarrhea. Took my 2nd dose last week and on Saturday night it hit me like a ton of bricks!! Severe diarrhea vomiting gas burping stomach pain. I am down 12lbs but can NOT deal with this type of side effects on a weekly base. so I'm done for now.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Horrible vomiting and explosive Diarrhea for last 2 weeks. Anti vomiting perscription meds do not work. STAY AWAY

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am overweight with a BMI of over 30. I have been taking this medication for two months and have lost 20lbs. I have been trying everything to lose weight for years and this is the only thing that is working for me. The first day I take my injection I do feel cranky and super tired but it subsides after about a day and a half. I still have about 20-30 lbs to lose and I am super hopeful that I can finally reach a healthy weight with this medicine.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have loss about 20 pounds- since August- The medico makes me feel full and satisfied- like after a good meal. The weight began to come off and I couldn’t believe it- Nothing else has worked for me. I do get occasional stomach cramping but it is only after the day I take my injection when the medicine is the strongest.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I stopped Wegovy after the third shot because I have a horrible taste in my mouth.  All food tastes disgusting.  I hope this goes away because I AM hungry, but I am repulsed by food.  Water is even hard to drink... It's like I have a mouthful of pennies all the time.  When I eat, the food is what I imagine dog food covered in lard would tastes like.  Once I start chewing, my food feels foamy, pasty, and is just gross.  This is the most bizarre thing to try to explain
I started with Ozempic and did 8 doses at .25 with no issues,  but since I am unable to get Ozempic, I switched to Wegovy.  I know they have the same active ingredient, but the Wegovy didn't work for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
First injection- no issue. 
Second- 36 hours later vomiting, diarrhea and terrible spasms in stomach for 3 days. 
Third- 4 days later, stomach spasms, vomiting. 
I am doing my best to get past this. I will decide whether or not to continue after injection #4.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The first few weeks on the lowest doses were great. I didn’t think of food 24/7. I made healthier choices and kept us my exercise routine. I plateaued on weight loss so we increased the dosage. I have been sick almost 2.5 weeks now. I have a hiatal hernia and GERD. I take Omeprazole daily anyway, but nothing helps it anymore. Not Zofran, Gas X, or Protonix. The sulfur burps are constant and disgusting. I’m pretty sure I have a stomach ulcer now. I had one years ago and this feels the same. I throw up everything eat. It doesn’t matter what I eat or how much or how little. I’ve lost 6 lbs and several inches off my body. It’s nice, but not worth the sickness. I’m not sleeping much before of it. It’s effecting my work. I ended up in urgent care last week. This week was the last shot I’ll ever take. I’d rather be fat.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: 59 yo female with a neurological illness preventing me from exercising as I would like. Last few yrs. Ballooned up to 198 lbs, 5'2" . Started 0.25 the first month. This was all very well.appetite decreased and able to eat sensibly without cravings. Sleep was better and lost 12 lbs in the first month. Month 2, Feb. 2023. Started 0.5 mg. Noticed more feelings of nausea and fatigue,especially the day after the injection. Experiencing more constipation. Just started 1 mg yesterday. Awoke during thenight with intense nausea. Zofran only partly helped. Worked all day with nausea only ate cottage cheese. Feels very tired and very constipated. Taking cola e and metamucil alternately at times but can't handle the metamucil. Feels too full like I'm gonna vomit. Total weight loss now 23 lbs in 2 mos. I think I may need to back up to the lower dose. I think I was doing better on that.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I've been obese most of my life. On my last physical my A1c was borderline to diabetes so the dr agreed to put me on Wegovy. First and second week I was fine w diminished appetite. At the end of the second week I started burping these horrible eggy burps. That night was the beginning of the worst. For three days I had projectile diahrrea and vomiting. Terrified of these symptoms I stopped the injections. Went to work for three days and here I am at 2am writing this review. Sick as a dog again. Will have to call in again. For those who are happy w Wegovy, Im happy for you. This is not for me. In the two weeks since I started injecting, and getting sick. I've lost 13#! I want to lose weight but not like this.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This is my 3rd week of taking the beginner dose. I’ve only lost 5lbs. I’m not hungry and craving sugar all the time and I am able to stop eating when full. Here’s the caveat:  the copious amount of gas it causes in my system. Stinky sulphur burps and even stinkier gas from the other end. It starts about 1-2 days after the injection and it is continual, painful bloating and gas for the next 48hrs. Extreme fatigue during this time, too. I won’t be taking my last dose.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy for just 10 days and have already lost 15 lbs. I have 80-85 lbs to go but I am absolutely astounded that the weight is dropping so quickly at the start. I do expect a plateau at some point, but I am very pleased so far. I just have very little appetite, and I have no desire to drink alcohol. I get a bit nauseous briefly at times, but I just chew a piece of gum and drink a glass of water and it subsides. This is an amazing drug. I am so happy so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: 34 year old female. 5'2" and 168lbs. After first injection, I knew I'd messed up already. I got dizzy, sweaty and nauseous instantly. The next day I was pretty nauseous and so I didn't eat very much. The third day is where it all fell apart. I had a hypoglycemic attack at work from not eating enough due to the severe nausea. I was able to get a few bites of chocolate and crackers down and went home. I'd already messaged my doc about the nausea and he called in some Zofran. My husband picked themup and brought them home to me. I took one and laid down. About an hour later, I sat straight up and flew to the bathroom. I projectile vomited harder than I ever have in my life. I could hardly catch my breath it was coming out so fast. Then the diarrhea hit and I was doing both at the same time. And if that wasn't enough, I had another hypoglycemic attack during all of that. I was pouring sweat. It was running off of me like I was standing in the rain, rapid heart rate, dizzy and my blood sugar was so low I was barely responsive when my husband came to check on me. He called 911 and I stayed 3 days in the hospital receiving fluids, glucose and nausea meds. I'm home now but I'm still nauseous, bloated and my kidneys are hurting now. I'd be very careful taking this poison and double check that it isn't contraindicated with any meds you already take.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: BMI >30, menopausal, AA woman with mild spinal stenosis and pinched nerve in left leg. I started Wegovy and just took my 4th week's dose of 0.25mg. I have not had any side effects and found it to be a very effective appetite suppressant. I have, like many others, tried dieting and dieting programs, my last one was Metabolic Weight Loss center. This is a keto-esque program that bids you to increase protein, lower carbs, lots of water, exercise, yada yada yada. But, of course those things don't work very well for me and I feel like a failure, or it does work for a while and then I gain weight again as I live my life. I am a stress/boredom eater, and also eat larger portions that I should. Wegovy was prescribed due to my starting weight of 215 lbs @ 5'7'', and elevated cholesterol levels, which I am on medication for. I did increase my exercise, from nil to trying to go to aquatic exercises, 2-3x/week for 45 mins. So far, I am down to 204 lbs without much effort. I realize that a significant weight loss will be very helpful with my back issues going forward and hopefully will relieve painful flare ups with arthritis, degenerative disc disease, for which i get cortisone injections a few times a year, and allow me to not have to use a CPAP machine.  But, I am a bit concerned that I may begin having side effects with the elevated dosages and may ask if I can stay on lower doses for a longer pd of time, especially since it is working. I read that sometimes people have gallbladder problems if they lose too much weight too soon, so I definitely want to avoid any of that.  Also, to be honest, I am concerned what will happen when I finish with this rx and what tools will I be able to use to keep all or much of the weight off. I will also disclose that I did research all of the common medications for weight loss that are now being used. My Endocrinologist said that Wegovy was one of the better weight loss drugs, and that it not only helps with weight loss but in some cases may save many lives as well from diabetes and heart disease.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Just started yesterday on .25, I didn't mind the injection. But I didn't sleep last night, this morning headache and nausea through out the day and don't feel like eating. I have been sipping Gatorade and water. I hope this feeling doesn't last through the weeks and months a head . I feel like I made an expensive mistake, from reading all the comments.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Absolute HORROR!!! I read many reviews before deciding to give this a shot in desperation to lose weight! I was hoping that the bad reviews were winers but low and behold they were correct!! I consider myself tough with a pretty tough stomach but I got to dose one of the .5 and third night I am still sick as a dog I feel pukey all day and every time I barely eat something healthy in a small portion I feel like I’m food poisoned for hours!! I took a prescription ondansetron 4 mg for nausea and itdidn’t touch it, severe headache extra strength Tylenol didn’t touch it, diarrhea… you get the picture… I have lost like 1 pound and feel like I was doing better than this on my own! Matter of fact I feel that it’s keeping me from losing any weight which is weird since I’ve barely eaten and normally would lose weight … I’m questioning the people who are able to stomach this stuff, are you really human or possibly part alien lol. I would NOT recommend this drug, I just hope I haven’t damaged my body in any way and can’t wait until this drug is washed out if my system, waste of time and money.. the rest is going in the garbage!! Don’t do it, that’s my advice, or you’ll be sorry!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I am about to start my 6th injection (second dose of 0.5mg), so starting my 6th week on this medication. The first month has been all about adjustment and transitioning to a new way of thinking. Wegovy is a tool to help curb appetite and cravings, which it does for me. In the past, while decreasing food intake for weight loss, I was always so hungry  - and now I am not, and this has been amazing. My cravings for salty snacks and sugar have decreased significantly. I eat a smaller amount of the bad stuff and am satisfied. 

My barriers at this point are psychological - I still want to eat too much at the wrong times, I still want to drink wine, neither of which should you do on this medication. Your GI tract slows, and food and drink stay in your GI tract longer. If you overeat, you will feel awful. If you drink too much alcohol, you will feel awful. In an effort not to feel awful, I have been adjusting portion size and when I eat. I am trying to be aware of these issues - this has been why I have only lost about 3-4 pounds in 5-weeks. Still a victory considering how difficult it is for me to lose weight. (50yo F, 5’10”, starting 232#, current 228#.)

The only side effect I had during the first month was fatigue. It was significant! However, my PCP suggested increasing my protein (wow, was I not getting enough), and I also became more mindful of hydration. An increase in protein, and hydration, and a decrease in meal portion and wine turned it around. I feel great now! But it wasn’t easy. The struggle is real, still. Lots of work left! Fingers crossed for the next 6-weeks!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’ve been using this medication for two months now. Have always maintained a very healthy diet. Don’t snack at all. Eat a low carb diet.  Drink plenty of water and do cardio a few days a week. I can’t lose a pound. I’m so disappointed:(

Condition: weight loss management, obese adolescent (BMI 95th percentile or greater for age and sex)
Textual Review: Took Wegovy for four weeks.  Never felt so ill.  Stopped two weeks ago. SEVERE depression. Blood sugar crashing - feel so foggy- no energy- WHEN DOES THIS POISON LEAVE MY SYSREM?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Just beginning to use wegovy. I've finished the four week starting doses of .25 . No weight loss yet. 
I want to share that the injector pen is gross to use! The pen requires you to press the needle into your skin, then the auto inject starts. I hate feeling the needle puncture my skin! It hurts!!! I use another type of auto injector pen for different medicine which requires that I push the pen against my skin, then I press a button which quickly plunges the needle into my skin and injects the medicine. That is such a better experience.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am a caregiver and the patient has lost 40lbs on this medication. I am writing to share in the very poor 1 star section an observation about the comments posted here. First, there are quite a few in which the dose does not begin at .25 but much higher, including in one case 1.7mg because the lowest dose was unavailable. The instructions tell the user to work up the levels starting with .25mg so it is understandable you can become quite sick starting with much higer doses. Second, people claimno weight loss at all despite being on the med for months. However they don't share whether they are exercising and eating a low calorie diet. One person said he lost nothing including his appetite so just ate as normal. Maybe his dose had to be higher? Finally, one person claimed to have extreme vomiting, headaches, etc. and that he was eating 500 calories per day.  500 calories is not a low calorie diet that is starvation. Perhaps that is why he had terrible side effects.  In summary, if you are going to complain and be dissatisfied (or even super happy) do explain the basics about your diet, your exercise, on what dosage you have had the problem.  Thanks for sharing.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I took my 6th shot this week.  I have not had much weight loss, three pounds total but my body losses weight very slowly.  I have noticed that you must make a couple of accommodations to this medication.  1.  Drink water.  Seriously, drink a lot of water.  It truly mitigates the side effects if you don't drink water then you will notice a lot of side effects.  2.  Watch spicy foods. The heart burn is very real if you eat spicy foods or if you skip meals.  You have to do some trials to see whichfoods your body will tolerate.  I have read about others having issues with fried foods, I don't eat fried foods but I can see it could be problematic.  3. Don't overeat.  Listen to that "full" signal your body is sending you.  Over eating leads to some bad side effects.  Just realize you are only able to take in so much food at once. 4.  Plan what you eat and prioritize nutrient dense foods.  You can only eat so much so you need to plan your meals.  

Adapting to this medication is not difficult if you listen to your body.  I am still learning how to live on this medication but I am confident in the long run it will work.  I also meet with my Doctor once a month to ensure that everything is ok.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Worse side affects from any med I've ever taken!  Started on the .25mg injection and woke up the next day thinking I had covid or influenza because I had HORRIBLE body aches and fatigue. Went to the Dr and was negative for both so then it dawned on me it might be the Wegovy. Could barely  function for the next 3 days I felt so bad and was extremely fatigued. Decided maybe that was just a bad reaction to the first injection so went ahead with the 2nd. 24 hrs later the fatigue is worse, keep falling asleep while working from home and in the evenings. Nauseous and nothing tastes good except for bland food. On overwhelming feeling of severe depression kicked in after the 2nd injection and I've decided I'm done!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started with this medication when it was recommended by my Dr due to being overweight, unhealthy, feeling poorly about myself and nothing else truly continuing to help/work including excessive exercise.  I have noticed as I have gotten older it is in my head with the thought I am hungry plus I am a stress eater so I needed help more so with the “food intake” piece.  I started this journey in September starting at 247 pounds.  I do t want to pretend it has been so wonderful because my body hasdefinitely seen the wrath in good and bad ways.  I started out the first month at .25mg and am now in January 2023 worked up to 2.5mg.  The first month I didn’t see much in weight loss but definitely noticed a HUGE difference in my appetite.  After the first month I did see the weight start to fall off.  I want to add I was not exercising at all.  My food intake was less and then came some of the not so pleasant things.  Diarrhea, stomach pain, breaking out in a full body sweat but thankfully no throwing up.  However, all of that I described was just as bad.  This would happen when I would make a poor food choice that maybe had a little grease or spice in it.  I did pay for these decisions and for a while I thought this was going to be the new norm and I along with my husband asked myself more than once is it worth it.  I can still say almost February 2023 it is.  I haven’t had one of those spells at 3am for a long time now but I also don’t eat like I once did.  I am now down over 40lbs and still have a ways to go with this journey.  I will say and want to stress everyone is different including how your body will react to this.  Just like any weight loss you want to take this slow and start with the lower dose to get your body used to this as well as that is what your Dr should be giving.  I know we are a world who wants to see results right now but with this you will just give it time and don’t force higher doses or you could be quitting before you truly begin due to side affects.  Some takeaways for me.  When you are prescribed this make sure to ask for some anti nausea medication as well.  I have zofran and I am positive that is the only reason I didn’t have vomiting with my side affects.  If you have sulfer burps which I started experiencing the end of December get on some anti acid medication.  I take omeprezol and it is a life saver.  Also try and remember why you are doing this.  I look at my parents (who I have now introduced to this as well) and want to be on better health and be there for my husband, kids and now grandchild.  You have to consider what is best for you.  Don’t feel guilty for wanting to help yourself, just be smart about it.  We all go at different paces and I do believe after the research and my own experience this works.  Good Luck

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Been on Wegovy for 3 weeks now.  The first week I actually felt full for the first time in 40 years where I didn't want to keep eating like I usually do.  I literally cried.  Feeling full is such a wonderful feeling.  I do need to train myself to stop eating when I'm full, that it's ok to not eat everything on my plate since I'm a compulsive overeater and that it's taboo to leave food on your plate. Once I eat my first meal of the day and I'll stop when I'm full, I'm then full for the rest of the day and don't even want to eat dinner.  I believe that eating very small meals during the day will be a benefit for me in making sure I don't starve myself. I really don't want to eat because of feeling full and that's scary for me.  I am getting help professionally in re-teaching my mind.  My sleep schedule is off, I'm wide awake at night and I do get sick to my stomach with a headache more so in the evening then during the day.  I've also noticed that my taste buds have changed and I'm not tasting the food that same way before I started Wegovy.  I've also noticed that my sense of smell is off as well.  I am so stoked to losing 100 plus pounds and pray that I'll be able to stop taking Wegovy without going back to my old ways once the weight is off. Long way to go so I'm not dwelling on it.  Good luck to everyone who is taking Wegovy for weight loss.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
F, 52, BMI 35, 5'2", starting weight 195 lbs.

I've tried and failed at diets and exercise programs for most of my adult life. I can lose weight with extreme calorie restriction and exercise, but the miserable extremes I have to go to are unsustainable in the long-term. Now menopause is looming, and the weight has been creeping up, even with diet and exercise. 

I started 0.25 mg Wegovy in late Dec, and will be taking my 4th shot tomorrow. I have experienced mild appetite suppression, enough tohelp me shed almost 3 lbs so far (yeah, it's still hard). I have definitely reduced my food intake, and do find it easier to eat smaller portions and make healthier choices, as my cravings are somewhat reduced. I found that my 3rd shot didn't produce the same appetite suppression as the first two, so I'm hoping that graduating to 0.5 mg will give stronger effects. I travel a lot for work, so it can be difficult to make healthy choices on the road, but Wegovy does seem to help.

I have experienced very mild side effects: slight nausea (mostly just when I wake up an night to pee) and constipation (I suffer with this anyway, and take Metamucil, stool softeners, and magnesium). The last few days I've become exhausted in the afternoons and MUST take a quick nap, but I've also been under a tremendous amount of work/family stress, so that could explain it. 

Overall I'm happy with Wegovy, and feel optimistic for the future. My (new as of 1/1/23) insurance provider (BCBS) denied my pre-auth due to lack of 3 months of diet and lifestyle modification, but my doctor is appealing, as I've been doing that for 30 years! Fingers crossed.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took one injection of .25 of Wegovy.  It started working almost immediately.  I’m on several medications for heart related issues from Covid but all was stable.  Was nervous about taking this medication but did my research and discussions with doctors.  After a few days of the injection I developed a severe allergic reaction of hives/ rash.  I’ve still lost about 6 pounds in the past week but unfortunately can’t continue.  I’m one of the very few people who this has happened to, however, it was a possible side effect.  I worried about the other side effects, however, I didn’t experience any of those.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I was prescribed Mounjaro first. I followed Mounjaro’s plan for 3 months until the $25 trials ended. During the mounjaro trial I lost 45 pounds in 90 days. I need to add I went on a protein shake diet. There were a few carbs thrown in there, but I really tried to go to as few carbs as possible. 

Now that Wegovy is available again and my insurance covers it, I’m on Wegovy. I started on a low dose compared to where I was on Mounjaro. The 1st week didn’t produce much weight loss or appetite control. My Doc doubled my dose and I definitely can feel a difference. My appetite is gone again. 

One word of warning about Mounjaro. In my case the constipation was off the chart. I had to be very careful what I ate and if was much at all (a slice of pizza at a party did 
me in) I had to use stool softeners, a laxative and eventually drink mineral oil to break up the road block. Seriously bad situation. Be careful.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have never had a feeling of satiety naturally. Wegovy keeps me feeling full and allows me to make good choices with serving size. I have only taken it twice. The first week I lost 6 pounds because I just felt satisfied with very small servings and lasted so I could make it meal to meal. With that being said, I did make healthy-ish choices: soup, salad, salmon, grilled chicken...It is painless and easy to use. I was nervous to administer my own shot but they made it very easy. I am tolerating it very well. I feel lucky that I have only slight nausea and fatigue but it subsided after 1 day.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started Wegovy in April 2022 at 269 lbs. and I am now 212 lbs. Sometimes I feel nausea but it doesn’t last long. I can go all day without eating so it does curve the appetite, but I have to make myself eat something so I can drink my ??. Everyone is different when it comes to the side effects that others have mentioned, but I recommend this medication for weight loss.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This medicine may be horribly sick.  I vomited for three days, severe headache and fatigue for seven days.  I couldn't even keep water down.  I was too afraid to keep taking it since I had such a terrible experience on week one.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am glad I didn’t allow these reviews to prevent me from starting!  Reducing one’s weight is never going to be easy and this does require trial and error at first.  Very few issues after 6 weeks. I now inject on Friday evenings in case I am mildly tired Day One or Day Two.  Never both days.  Ask your doc for an anti-nausea medication before you start as you may need it the first several weeks.  Works great!    One that doesn’t make you drowsy.  Also have Tums and/or Pepcid. You will quickly learn sitting up straight allows you to quickly release acid buildup. Immediate relief.  Will also need to increase fiber and perhaps consider stool softener.  Stay on top of this and don’t hesitate to ask your doc about your symptoms versus being miserable.  As with any weight loss, a steady, but small decline is great.  Don’t worry if you plateau on occasion.  But we can’t continue eating the same things and not exercising!  I’m not a clinical person but I do suspect some people have more issues because they have more health issues overall.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve lost 43lbs in 9 months with little to no side effects. I love this medication. But I’m worried about gaining the weight back once my insurance company will no longer cover it. Right now I’m approved for another 3 months, stay tuned.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started this journey 6 weeks ago and have dropped 12 lbs so far.  I find that if I overeat or eat fried foods I get nausea and diarrhea .  This is the first medication(I've tried lots) that has actually worked for me.  I am definately sticking with it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The center started me on the 0.25 dose for 3 weeks, then bumped up to 0.4 last week.  This week, I expected to see a big drop, as last week I went up 0.2 lbs.  I am extremely disappointed.  My food intake has decreased.  I did not have the nausea, vomiting and diarrhea that some have reported.  I was not eating much when I started the medication, and that may be why.   I did have extreme fatigue which I countered by drinking Zipfizz (electrolytes and vitamins - specifically B).
