I was ready to quit and they bumped me up this week, so we'll see if I start losing.  I started at 268 and now am at 263.2.  Less than 5 lbs in 4 weeks.  For the cost and the risk, so far it is not worth it.  In 2019 I lost almost 40 lbs doing Keto and Carb Manager.  My weight started creeping back, and I thought I'd try this "no diet" wonder drug.  I was hoping that using this medication would allow me to put fruit and whole grains back into my diet and help me limit those carbs.  Unfortunately, it just may be for my body, Keto is the only plan that works.  I just got sick of counting everything.  The center said that you don't really start losing weight until the dosage is increased and that they want to make sure your body tolerates it well.  I paid for 10 weeks, but am thinking that it just isn't going to be effective for me.  I would have been happy with 2 lbs per week, which, I don't think is too much to ask given the cost.  If I have to count carbs and calories, what is the point?  Keto keeps away the insulin spikes so you're not hungry.  This was supposed to be effortless... but if you've already changed your diet and don't eat much, it just might not work.  Maybe it's my age and being post menopausal.  I was hoping to lose weight to save my joints more than vanity.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy on 2/1/22 weighing 244 lbs at only 5'5". As of today, I am 149lbs. For the first 3 months I did experience some pretty severe nausea and vomiting. I found if I would wake up 30 minutes before I actually needed to get up, took a 4mg sublingual Zofran, then laid back down for 30 minutes, the nausea was bearable. I always take my shot before bed and I would do this regimen the day following my shot and up to 3 days after. I was hospitalized once, around month 4, for dehydration. Itis very important to stay hydrated. But I am happy to report, after month 4, I now have zero side effects and feel AMAZING. I have struggled with obesity my entire life. I have tried every diet, I have hired the trainers, worked out 2 hours a day 7 days week, meal prepped, counted macros, etc. You name it, I have done it. For this first time in my life, I have had success! I have never been this small in my life.

Flawless drug. Stopped overfueling in the first 24 hours. Dropped 20 lbs effortlessly. Will stay on this forever as I have 17 of the 22 identified "genes" (we all have them; I just have the bad versions) for obesity and diabetes type II. I stopped both in their tracks. I was not obese but not at an ideal weight, so this ABSOLUTELY can be used by anyone wanting to slim down for personal reasons (and NO ONE should try to tell you that you have a bad reason). As a research scientist, I have a VERYopen mind. As a pharmacologist, I understand that not all drugs work for all people especially since behavior is involved and THAT makes you fat (nothing else). This stopped my genetically determined lack of satiety and allowed me to drop weight almost instantly.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I felt a little run down and out of sorts the day after my first shot and then felt fine the rest of the week and then fine for 2 days following my second shot. And then the nightmare began. I developed the absolute worst heartburn I have ever had and then had severe reflux. I constantly felt like I had swallowed a softball. Nothing tasted good. It definitely curbed my appetite though which is the intent of the meds. I tried to stick with the process hoping that my body would eventually adjust.I took nausea meds, Advil for the constant headaches, ate TUMS like candy, and took Prilosec twice a dat. I followed up with two more injections. But the side effects are just too much for me to take. I am nauseated almost constantly, burp all the time, am constipated, have a constant headache and have severe fatigue. I already have bouts of diverticulitis which I think are now aggravated by the constipation. I don't want to lose but about 20 pounds so I think I will have to go another route. This awful feeling all day is just too much. I know my family is sick to death of me being so sick all the time.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This is my second month 6 weeks. Lost 14lbs the first month and 6lbs the last two weeks. This is the easiest weightloss ever. I have tried everything. I eat about half of what I ate before. I walk for exercise but not as much as normal since the weather has gotten cold. No side effects. I did throw up once because I ate a really rich soup. I snack on fruit and sometimes have a little candy. It seems like the weight is just falling off. I love it. 18lbs in 6 weeks. I feel great. I do get constpation but try to drink water and eat high fiber.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Experienced bouts of diarrhea in the beginning but it stooped after a few weeks.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
For weight loss (probably more vain, than obese): I waited until week four to write a comment. 
Week 1: I had no side effects, lost 5 lbs. 
Week 2: I had every side effect listed for three days, if you want to know how bad I felt just think of either the worst hangover you have ever experienced, or the worst morning sickness! Luckily I work my own hours so I could stay in bed. But if you have a 9 - 5 job, you will be calling is sick! You cannot function. No weight loss. 
Week 3: Again for threedays, I had all of the side effects as week two, but could sorta function. Lost 3 lbs. 
Week 4: Injection last night, and have started to feel sick again. 
Is it worth it? Well I have two more weeks left of a VERY expensive medication. I will power thru it, see if the side effects subside, and what the overall weight loss is and then decide.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Did this medicine work, yes. Took away my appetite for sure. Was it easy to use, yes. Was I satisfied, no. I threw up and had diarrhea for 14 hours. Started an hour after I used the injection. I was not myself for over a week because of this. Now I did start at the 1.7mg dose because that was all that was available. Still debating on trying the lowest dose if it ever becomes available. By far the sickest I have ever been in my life.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started taking wegovy 9/22/2022 I  am assuming I was given the correct dose which is 0.25. I am very disappointed, it did not suppressed my appetite. I honestly think the makers need to reimburse me. For a very expensive drug like this and no results it's not right. I can honestly say I waste my money

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
Been on it for exactly one week, it was an interesting week.  I may find that I come back and add another review later that is rated higher, 

 Brief background on me, I have been a gym rat since 2008, very healthy, I eat lean chicken, veggies, and complex carbs, no added sugars, no processed foods and only drink water, green tea, and milk... 

 but I was post-menopausal in my late 30s and which caused massive weight gain (60 pounds), though my diet and exercise never changed.  

Got on HRT andlost 20lbs but could not get under 200lbs. My weight fluctuated between 200-230 for 3 years..  I even intermittently fasted. 

 I asked my doctor about Wegovy and I was given a prescription.  My labs are good, no high glucose so insurance wouldn't cover it.  I filled my script at a compound pharmacy.  They mix it with B12 and I get it for $150 per month. 

 I  need to go from 211 pounds to 150.  The pharmacist told me to take 15-20 units. 

 The next day I took 18 units and felt great!  Not hungry, very focused, no side effects- I always drink a gallon of water a day...  

In comes the nightmare of my first night... 

 I normally take 1/2 of CBD gummy at night to help me get a full 8 hours of sleep... so as usual, I ate it and went to bed at 10 pm.  

At 10:30pm I got super hot, dizzy and massive sweats...so much that my hair was soaked.  I ended up passing out in the bathroom, falling face down... I had to be rushed to the hospital as I kept losing consciousness, I had all the severe side effects, minus nausea.

  After about 7 hours I was released.  

Turns out, that the CDB interacted with it, and plus I was only supposed to take 12 units. The combo of CBD AND taking too much (not preloaded injectors) caused severe reactions. 

 I have been fine since.  

No more CBD!  

 My current problem now is am not sleeping at night.   So I am unclear if the CBD gummy caused the reaction or if it did so because I took too many units of Wegovy.. either way, I am waking up at 3 am.. ugh.  I don't know what to do to stay asleep as I am scared of taking ANYTHING to help me sleep as I never want to experience what I did the first night.   

Taking the sleep issue out of the equation.  I lost 8 pounds in my first week and I feel fine. This is the first time in 3 years the scale or my measurements MOVED DOWNWARDS! 

Those who want to take this: Make sure you tell your doctor EVERYTHING!  

You have to change your diet to avoid nausea, gas, and those types of side effects.   Eating carbs, sugary things or over-eating will cause stomach issues.   

Cool it on the caffeine and get plenty of water.  keep track of your food and how you are feeling and stay in contact with your healthcare provider.  

If I can go back to 8 hours of sleep, then I can raise my rating.  I am looking forward to this journey of finally moving out of the category of Obese!  I will be contacting my doctor to see what we can do about my sleep. Other than that, I am satisfied.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have lost almost 30% of my body weight - 58 lbs so far in 8 months - taking Wegovy in conjunction with a focus on diet, exercise, sleep and stress management from Calibrate.  Wegovy was an absolute game-changer for me in terms of hunger and being able to portion control.  I have always felt hungry, could not skip meals and this absolutely gave me the power to portion control and take it or leave it in terms of food.  A couple of bites and I am good now!  It's absolutely remarkable.  The side affects are minimal too, some burping and tiredness but nothing consequential.  I'm a 52 yo menopausal woman - 5'7" and now around 137#.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I've only been on the drug for one week.  But I've lost 6.8 pounds.  I want to be clear though.  I was worried about side effects so I've done exactly what my doctor said.  I did not overeat.  I did feel fuller when taking it.  I also generally exercise 5 days per week.  The reason I began the program with Wegovy was because with my regular diet and exercise, I was not seeing results - none.  So, I took drastic measures and got on the program.  So far, so good.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Oh my God I never experienced any thing like it in my life..i only started yesterday 1/10/22..i ate very healthy my first day..felt nausea from the min i took injection..went to bed last night and the vomiting started and the burps were unreal..sick all night..and still dry reaching to day afwul..im afraid to eat..i am done wit it even though it cost me €157..ld be terrified to take another one nxt wk..it has been afwul experience..

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started wegovy in March 2022. I'm down 40 lbs. I'm still on wegovy 2.4 mgs but my hunger is back. I've called the wegovy phone number that's on our prescription but I've not gotten any answers or help. My Dr says keep taking it. I'm frustrated without any answers of why this is happening.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Took one dose. I think my doc started me too high at 2 mg.  Threw up violently all day. Nausea body cramps no appetite. I am day 3 post injection now.  Can’t wait for it to wear off.  I am done.  Rather be fat

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: My SW was 199.6 CW is 142.2. Wegovy was fantastic. The only side effect I did experience was a little bit of nausea in the morning. I had used with Wegovy for seven months and have currently been off of it now for four month and continued to still lose weight. My insurance covered it and I had to pay $100 per month, but if you go onto the Wegovy website and sign up for their training you get a prescription card that makes that will go be only $25.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started off with a BMI of almost 40. I'm barely 5 ft tall and aging. I've fought my weight for so many years that it was depressing and exhausting. I lost over 70 lbs in 2020 and gained most of it back between summer of 2021 into Spring of 2022. I did not know anything about wegovy until Spring of 2022. I've lost an average of 10 lbs a month and I'm currently down 58 lbs going into my 6 months of using wegovy. I hate giving myself a shot but this works. Side effects for me are minimal. Someoneelse posted it's like a gastric bypass without surgery. I would say compared to what I watched my mom go through because she opted for the surgery this is close on the effectiveness but the side effects are not as bad as undergoing surgery. I would recommend to anyone that has been in the battle for a long time and it seems like nothing works. It works if you stay with it and push through the not so great days. The good days outweigh the bad.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started Wegovy on 10/2/21 weighing 313lbs. As of 8/29/22 I have lost 100lbs with no exercise! Very little side effects.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started this medication March of 2022, as I write this it is August of 2022. I started at 247lbs standing at 5’9” I did show as Obese on my BMI. I am now 177lbs which means I have lost 70 lbs in 5 months. This medication is a miracle worker but I have spent about $100 on vitamins, laxatives, and other medications to help with the side effects. If you are serious about weight loss the side effects are just something you have to deal with. I have nausea, constipation, vomiting, low iron, and a multitude of just other little things. I highly recommend buying ginger ale, multi vitamins, vitamin D, and a probiotic to help reduce symptoms. I LOVE WEGOVY!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Started this med with beginning dose and read all potential side effects.  Use some Zofran 1st two weeks for nausea.  I have learned what I can and cannot eat on this medicine.   More of a mediterranean or paleo diet.  Has been wonderful for me.  Lost 40 lbs since March.  Listen to your body tell you it is full.  If you over eat, you will be miserable for a while.  One word of advise... You cannot eat late and go to bed.  You will have indigestion, nausea, etc as mentioned in the other comments.READ ABOUT THE MEDICINE, then decide it it is for you.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: My doctor started me at the 1.7mg level at the first of July.  I've lost 11 pounds even though I skipped a week( the fifth week) when I went on a summer trip that involved a long flight. (I didn't want to be sick over the Pacific and stuck on a plane.) My insurance surprisingly covered it, probably bc I have tried all sorts of things over years to lose weight.  I started off needing to lose 20 pounds but hopefully 30.  I was quite sick with vomiting the very first dose of the first week, for oneday.  Hwr, since then I take a Zofran an hour before the injection and do this right before bed.  I have experienced all the negative side effects at some point or another, but feel they are all manageable. I'm a bit frightened to go up to the 2.4mg dose, but I'm just planning ahead for a couple of rough days.The worst for me is the fatigue. I used to work out more, but now I'm without energy. I'm just making the choice to do it anyway, and I do feel better when I do. I do not plan to take this medication for the rest of my life, but I'm not sure how getting off of it looks. I am very curious about the science of this medicine and how to stay at a healthy BMI without it.  I was prescribed Plentity before this, and I stockpiled it with the plan to take it after I finish Wegovy. My doctor isn't sure this will work.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I was surprised to read how many people experienced bad side effects. I did not, fortunately. Some loss of appetite, but I figured that was kinda the point, at least at first. I had a little nasua the 
first week on .5, but it went awayin a couple of weeks and never came back.  When I do eat, I enjoy my food. I am just able to eat less, and less frequently, without being uncomfortable or stressed. I have been on it for about 10 months now, topping off at 2 mg. I have lost over 30 pounds, which since I am short was almost 25% of my body weight and has made a tremendous difference. It would be best if I lose about 7 to 10 pounds more to be at my healthiest weight but have been a little stuck for the last couple of months. My doctor is increasing dose to 2.25 which is still a little lower than the prescribed dose of 2.4 used  in the study. I am optimistic that will do the trick. I LOVE this medication. Highly recommend!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: 6 months, lost 25 pounds( out of 237), minor stomach issues. On 2.4mg. Highly recommend.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This has been a complete game changer for me. I can finally feel full with smaller portions, I don’t get shaky and irritated when I’m hungry, and I have lost 10% of my body weight in first 5 months. I did have nausea and tiredness at first but after first few months I haven’t noticed it again I’m still on 1.7 mg and will continue until needing to go up. I love this medication and I am so thankful for the ability to take it as not all insurances cover it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I think what causes weight loss is the nausea. I'm literally afraid to eat while taking this. The heartburn is like nothing I've ever experienced and now I'm on the 2.4 dose and have decided I am DONE. I will not punish myself anymore with this drug. On this dose I feel nauseous, dizzy, and exhausted as well as the horrid heartburn. I'd rather be fat

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: So far so good for me. I'm just starting my 14th week (2nd 1.7 dose) and have lost 26 lbs so far. My side effects thus far have been super mild compared to what I've read here; some mild nausea and constipation, but that's really it, and I guess I'm tired a bit, but I can't separate that from the rest of my normal life, stress, whatever. I haven't slept well in eons, so it is more likely related to adulting in general, and not med-related. I get nervous at every jump in strength, but so far, that hasn't been an issue either. I guess we'll find out when I jump to the maintenance dose. My biggest frustration has been with price (my insurance doesn't cover it) and accessibility, and my biggest fear is maintenance when I finally (if I ever) reach my goal weight. This obviously isn't sustainable forever (who can afford that?!) but I will appreciate the jumpstart it's given me, I guess regardless of where I net out down the road. Good luck all!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I have been on Wegovy for 2 months and have dropped 40 pounds. This is good, but it comes at a cost. The drug has totally changed my relationship with food. I always loved food. Every meal was an event I looked forward to, and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. But due to childhood trauma (being starved as an infant), I always ate way too much. Sometimes 3 or 4 times what might be considered a normal portion. 

Since taking wegovy, I can't enjoy food at all anymore. Eating even a small amountmakes me feel ill. Swallowing itself causes pain. I've never vomited and the feeling passes eventually. But I no longer look forward to meals and sometimes I'll just skip eating altogether because I don't want to go through the hassle and pain.

I feel like the protagonist in Clockwork Orange. I've been conditioned by a drug to hate one of the things I've always loved most. It's the mental strain of this situation that has caused me the most stress. Far more than the nausea and pain of eating itself. 

But I need to accept it, or face weight related conditions like diabetes, heart attack and stroke. Living longer to see my grandchildren grow up outweighs my passion for food. So, I'll keep taking my shot. Unless they invent a pill that allows you to eat as much as you want and never gain weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I definitely lost weight then plateaued at about 7%. My insurance company decided to no approve it so I stopped taking it. I feel amazing though now that I am no longer on it! I didn't realize how negatively impactful it was to my happiness. Not depression just sluggish and indifferent. I am glad I am no longer on it. I just need to figure out how to keep losing weight...

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am on week two of .18mg and I am severely sick. Nausea and dry heaving. I tried to cancel my next vile but the company already charged me and the file is in the mail. I can’t return the vile which means I am out a substantial amount of money because my insurance doesn’t cover the drug. I am so mad at myself for moving forward with the shot. It also makes me severely tired and depressed!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I got extremely I’ll an hour after taking this. Vomiting violently for 48 hours, horrible heartburn , absolutely no energy. Couldn’t eat for two weeks. I’me going on my third week out of work because of how sick this has made me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’m on my 13th week, and the first week of taking the 2.4 ml strength. Started at 280 lbs. and have lost 35 lbs. so far. By far, the worst side effect has been the vomiting, even with Zofran. Like many here, finding the correct dosage was a challenge, even resulting in delayed refills. I found the vomiting was worse after a delayed dose. I hope to be able to live with the nausea, fatigue and extreme vomiting long enough to lose at least another 80 lbs. I have found that the day of taking Wegovyand the next 3 days are the worst, but of course by then the next dose is around the corner. I have very little appetite, no taste for anything sweet, but crave anything salty. Salted pretzel sticks are my best friend.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Per my insurance I had to try four different weight loss regimen to no avail before they approved Wegovy.  I am on 2.4.  I have lost a total of 40 lbs over 3 years with different meds.  Wegovy worked very well, though I've had side effects. In the beginning I got nauseated, headaches, and I've had severe hair loss.  Hair is growing back. My physician told me to take antacid for the nausea and that worked very well. I started in November 21 and by now the effect is slipping away. I have more hunger and cravings again. I am at a weight plateau for weeks now. Not sure what to do about the effectiveness and I can't find anything about that online. Anybody have the same experience or a tip what to do?  I really don't want to gain any weight back!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I had a positive weight loss experience with this medication but still was often sick and vomiting the next day after taking it.  I only took the medicine for a month and a half because it was just a sample pen.  .25 for first month then .5 for the other two weeks.  My body tolerated the .25 but not the .5 I would be nauseated the day after taking it and vomiting, then it would subside.  I did loose 12 pounds but with the medication I incorporated using the ‘my fitness pal’ app to track what I ate.  Personally anytime I have been successful at losing weight, keeping track of what I ate was a key factor.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Took the medication for four months did lose some weight but the side effects were terrible. One side effect is the Slowing down on the stomach to empty.  In my case the drug caused a permanent damage  with my stomach no longer being able to empty on its own. I had to stop taking the meds, see a gastro physician abx was diagnosed with gastroparesis.  The only way for my stomach to now empty properly is with the assistance of a neurotransmitter that has to be implanted into my stomach. I now livewith a lifelong condition thanks to this drug.  No weight loss is worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have only been on this med for 1-2 months but i was previously taking saxenda at full dose and it wasn’t doing anything for me so i switched to wegovy and my dr started me at the 1.7 dose and then after 2 weeks to the 2.4 due to pharmacy shortages. Most of my side effects are during the first few days of the injection. I have lost 10 lbs within the first month but then nothing so far since. I have considered stopping multiple times due to the side effects. I have random bouts of nausea but worse in the morning when first waking up and i take a few drinks of pickle juice and it goes away usually. Worse than the nausea for me is the intense fatigue. I nap daily and have no energy to exercise for the first few days after my injections. On the lower doses i was getting outside and exercising but it causes so bad fatigue and weakness it’s hard now. All in all for me, i don’t think losing 10 lbs has been worth giving up my entire summer being sick form this med and unable to enjoy stuff. Perhaps if i had a 30 or 40 lb loss that would be different. I plan to give it 2 more weeks and if i haven’t lost at least 8 lbs I’ll stop it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I take Semaglutide 1mg/0.5mL for diabetes/metabolic syndrome. I tried 2mg to also help with weight lose and I know why it makes you lose weight. about 2 days after I took 2mg I was sick at my stomach so much that I was projectile vomiting. I couldn't eat anything for 4-5 days without getting horrible belching, nauseous, stomach cramps, dizzy, diarrhea, or all of the above. Needless to say I will be searching other options for weight loss.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am 48 and started at 185lbs. I was on .25 for a month with no side effects or benefits. The pharmacy couldn’t get the next two dosages for months, so my doctor ok’d me to jump to 1.7mg. I got very sick for two days, only side effects after that have been constipation. I just started my second month on 1.7mg and I’m only down 3lbs. I doubt that has anything to do with the meds. My appetite hasn’t changed at all. I’m hoping the next dosage up will be where I start seeing weight loss. I’ve triedevery other weight loss drug available, including phentermine, ozempic, rybelsus, topiramate etc….I’ve worked with dietitians, physical therapists, and weight loss specialists with not one pound lost. I was hoping Wegovy would be what my body wanted. So far, I’m disappointed. I still have hope tho!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started in Feb increasing the dosage until I got to 2.4 so 4 months later I've been at a standstill on losing weight started at 214 and down to 191 which is where I've been the last 2 months, some of my urging to snack in the late evening are coming back. The lower dosage seemed to work better than the higher dosage. I had one day I threw up on the 2.4 dosage but that was the only time.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Drug has been life changing. I started back at Thanksgiving 2021 at a weight of 357 lbs, I'm 6'3. I'm currently at 250. I no longer take any blood pressure medications, or water pill for swelling. I'm no longer pre diabetic. The side effects are mild. My side effects are basically zero. Some mild stomach upset from time to time(if I eat the wrong things, high fatty foods ECT). I can't stress how much this drug has changed my entire life.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I’m at the end of the 1mg dosage and start 1.7mg next week.  So far I am down 26 pounds and have managed to loose weight weekly.  My appetite has definitely decreased tremendously, it really surprised me how quickly it worked.  Some of the side effects I have had are nausea, constipation, diarrhea and abdominal cramping.  The cramping is definitely uncomfortable but fortunately only happens to me about once a week.  I’ve also noticed if I eat certain foods 
(greasy foods mostly)  it can make thecramping worse. Overall  I eat pretty healthy and have no cravings for sweets or chocolate! I will eat it on occasion but do not get the same satisfaction from eating it as I did pre-wegovy.  It’s very important to drink a lot of fluids, on days I feel blah I will drink Gatorade or Powerade zero and that has really helped. I have also taken Zofran a handful
of times in the last 10 weeks. I’m very happy with the results and  each week it gets easier to tolerate.   I have no regrets and have recommended it to others and am very hopeful I will get to the max dose of 2.4.  as far as supply I have been lucky and  able to find it. Most of the shortages are with the .25-1mg. dose, I did have to call four pharmacies to find the 1mg. 
Overall, I am pleased with the results and will continue to use it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Taking wegovy has definitely decreased my weight, but only because tge medication caused complete loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, extreme fatigue, dizziness, headache, abdominal cramping.  I was barely able to eat or drink much water.  When I did eat, I would always get nauseous and would eventually vomit.  I lost 20lbs in 7 was but purely due to starvation.   I have never felt worse.  I dont recommend this medication.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I game changer for me. 25# down but the bigger take away is the shift in my relationship with food and eating. I am thrilled.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I’m a 56 year old female, 5’11” and started out at 227 pounds. I have struggled with my weight since high school. Like many, I’ve had temporary weight loss successes, regaining everything and then some, each time. My realistic goal is to be 195lbs. My ideal goal is 180lbs. I have currently lost 23 lbs and have been on the program for approximately 6 weeks.
 I began the standard titration schedule in April 2022. Luckily, my insurance covers the medication!! Due to a pharmacy glitch, I only had one of the .25 doses before jumping to .5. The result was 3 miserable days of the gut wrenching vomiting described elsewhere in these reviews. I contacted Novo Nordisk to ask questions and report my experience and was told I would be receiving a call, which I never got.
My titration schedule since the week 2 glitch, has been smooth. I’ve chosen to have my Rx filled by a large mail-out pharmacy, reasoning that they will get inventory priority over my small town local pharmacy. So far I have not experienced the medication shortages suffered by others. 
I am currently one week in on the 1.7 dose. I have no intention of stopping the medication, but it is definitely not a walk in the park.
Intermittent nausea, deep fatigue, headaches, constipation, general feelings of yuckiness, plus  my initial bout with vomiting, have made this a difficult journey. Zofran is my friend. My goal is to stay on the medication for at least two months at the 2.4 dose, giving my body plenty of time to adjust.  My credo is that I would rather be sick for a little while than fat for the rest of my life. 
I have had no hair loss (an adverse effect  reported in these reviews but not in the Wegovy literature), nor have I had any other serious or life threatening side effects.
Like most, I have an extremely reduced appetite as well as a distinct change in the type of foods I find appealing. Like another reviewer, I can’t tolerate heavy greasy foods. Fresh and frozen fruit are my favorites. I have increased thirst and find myself guzzling ice water (I also happen to live in New Mexico which has literally been on fire for the past 6 weeks, contributing, I’m sure, to my feelings of being parched).
Overall, I’m extremely grateful to finally have a chance at real and lasting weight loss. My knees hurt less, my self image has improved, my clothes are more comfortable and less tent-like. Moving around is easier in general. I’m no longer embarrassed by how much food I consume. I’m still too ashamed to be seen in a bathing suit, but soon even that will be a possibility (I want to start swimming again). I have hope again.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
WAgovy has been working for me well. I so hope I can get it field. I ha e had the tardiness an every o ce in  while my stomach will hurt when I eat. I get full faster. My hunger is curbed well. It's amazing.  I wish all the people that have tried it had a better response. For me it's amazing.  Thankyou . I sure hope it can be filled. I'm on the highest dose. One week in on it. I will start my 2nd week next wensday 
 So far I have lost 50lbs I'm thrilled an I'm working on 70 more. That would putme at 130
135. I sure would be tickled to get down to that. 150 would  be fine to. I'm a very satisfied women.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I was excited to try this medication as my Dr. thought my results would be beneficial.  I had no health problems except being overweight.  Three days after my first injection, i developed severe chest pain.  I was taking my ambulance where i developed pericardial effusion and was hospitalized for 2 weeks.  I also developed A-FIB.  Being a had a complete physical one month prior and everything checked out alright.  I can help but believe this medicine was the culprit.  Needless to say, I DID NOTTAKE AGAIN.  Be careful as I did not tolerate this medication.  I do know others that have done well.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I have been on the drug since October and have lost 40 pounds. Cycled through 0.25, .05 and 1.0 doses with no major issues. Started 1.7 dose just as I got COVID. Horrible side effects (almost ended up in the ER from dehydration) and could not tolerate the 1.7 dose so my PCP recommended I go back down to 0.5 and cycle through again until my body could handle the higher dose.

Just finished my time on 0.5 dose and now cannot get any 1.0 dose pens from my pharmacy. The drug manufacturer has no supply of 1.0. Apparently there is now a national shortage. They are saying they should have some in "the second half of 2022". Not sure what that means - June? December? Glad the manufacturer is being so transparent. My pharmacy told me to start calling around to see if anyone has any Wegovy and they will transfer my prescription. Who has time for that? 

Basically this drug manufacturer has left their customers high and dry. There was ZERO communication that there was a supply problem. I would not have cycled through doses a second time if I had known I was going to have to go off it again. I won't be waiting around for them to decide to actually supply the drug to consumers. I certainly will not be cycling through doses a second time.

For anyone who has not started Wegovy - don't bother. Since they cannot guarantee supply, I would not start down this road. You can't just stop, start and jump doses unless you want potentially severe side effects. 

Clearly this drug manufacturer does not care about the people using this medication since, "Novo execs are pleased with Wegovy’s launch so far." Not sure how they are pleased with a launch that leaves patients high and dry and having to discontinue use of the drug after MONTHS of stepping up doses. This drug costs me $1300+ per month so this is not something I take lightly, not to mention the health impacts. I feel I have wasted over $10,000 in drug costs. Glad Novo is "pleased" with that.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Almost at the 3 month mark and am > 40lbs down. Started at .25 and am now on 1mg with no plans to increase as this is already incredibly wildly effective and I don't need it to be more effective. I am now in the 'normal' weight range per BMI chart for the first time since I was in my teens. I could not be more thrilled. Now my doctor and I are trying to figure out how to titrate back down the dosage and hopefully not re-gain the weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Just getting ready to start month 3 and it’s not even available. From what I have read won’t be available anytime soon. I paid 2 months of this for nothing. Not impressed…

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I just finished my 1 mg and had to stop because I’ve had constant vomiting, to the point that I’m throwing up poop, so one of the cause effects happened to me that you have to stop taking the drug. Currently on the way to the hospital to find out what’s wrong
But the first dose I was fine, second dose I had nausea and just started taking zofran but this last dose has been a nightmare BUT I’ve lost 25 pounds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Four months in and I've lost 16 pounds. Titrated up to 1.7 dose with minimal side affects. Only thing I've noticed is occasionally dizziness and headaches. Along with sticking to a low calorie diet along with walking at least 30-45 minutes 5 days a week this seems to he working well so far. Started mid Jan 2022. Get full very fast which is something I've never been use to, lol. Really helps curb appetite. Hopeful for no additional side affects. Goal to lose another 30lbs.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just took my 9th shot 1g. Doing it for 2 months I have lost 22lbs. I workout at the Gym 3 times a week and eat 2000 calories per day. I am so happy with the results and very little to no side effects.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy in mid-September 2021, from 0.25mg, and took the last shot on March 28th @2.4mg. I'm off the Wegovy since then and keep my weight as is, I exercise and pay attention to what I eat (I did that during the time that I took Wegovy as well). altogether I lost 50lb and I feel much better with my body, I had no side effects luckily, and felt great the whole time. I'm looking to get back on the program but unfortunately, my insurance does not cover Wegovy. Hopefully, there will be another promotion via my doctor that I will have an option to get on this program again :-).

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
3rd shot..no weight loss at all. Nauseated..yuke..get explosive diarrhea. Plus my damn hair is falling out...I don't like that at all. Not sure I'll continue.. because if this is the way you have to loose weight by puking and diarrhea...nope 
..makes no sense.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
0.25: on this dosage for 4 weeks. Nausea the first few days after taking a dose, but not bad. Noticeably less hungry and less cravings. Slight fatigue. 

0.5: noticeably more fatigue and nausea. Still losing weight (down from 177 to 165 at this point). HORRIBLE diarrhea 3 days after 2nd dose- could be period related but omg I’ve never experienced that kind of pain before, which lasted about 12 hrs. 

1: I just took my second dose of 1mg. Not hungry at all. Fatigue not as bad this week. Nausea isalmost crippling, but I’m trying to stick it out. Down to 161lbs. 

Overall, for me, this med has been very effective as far as weight loss, but very difficult to enjoy normal life with the side effects. I will probably quit when I finish this pack. 

Also, it’s $860 per month with the discount from manufacturer, which is ridiculous.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took the injections for a little over two months with no side effects and great weight loss.  My problem started just into my third month.  My hair start falling out in big clumps.  I am 7 months into stopping it and I had had to cut my hair short as I had so many lengths it looked awful.  I have been a stressful time.  I called the company to let them know of my hair loss and someone was supposed to call me back but never did.  I still do not see hair loss on the Wegovy site as a possible side effect.  I wish it would get put on as one just so people can make a decision as to if this is something they can live with.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Similar to many reviewers: 1) it has worked, 10% body weight in three months, because I never feel hungry- and when I do eat, the portions are minuscule.  I can’t abide anything greasy, spicy, or unhealthy, so that helps, too.  2) The side effects range from tough to terrible.  Fatigue, hair loss, constipation AND diarrhea, but the worst for me is the horrible nausea. I vomited every time I increased a dose and often for no apparent reason.  This is full-on, empty-your-entire-stomach-until-your-throat-is-scraped-raw-vomiting.  Yesterday I moved to 1.7 and have had constant vomiting and diarrhea.  I will be not taking another dose of 1.7 because despite the clear effects on my weight, I can’t let this drug ruin my life in this way!  I will see if I can go back to 1.0, since the nausea was intermittent and handled by Zofran at that level.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Easy to use. I took for 4 months and had no side effects until the 1.7 mg dose, but also sadly not much weight loss. My appetite was lessened, but I continually lost and gained within a 5 pound range. For me, that is not worth the bloating, belching and (during my period) extreme dizziness and diarrhea I experienced at the 1.7 dose. I've stopped the medication. Insurance was not going to cover the drug after my 6 month coupon period ended anyway.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: After taking my first shot of the 1.0 mg, within 6 hours I was vomiting every hour.  2nd day that was reduced to every two hours. The nausea was horrible and the stomach pain really bad.  Third day my husband dragged me to urgent care where I had severe dehydration.  After 4 hours of tests and 3 bags of fluid and anti-nausea drugs I was released to go home.  It's been a week since all that happened, and my stomach still is not 100%.  I'm going back to losing weight the old fashion way by smallerportions and daily walks.  I have issues with my thyroid and losing weight is very difficult, but I don't want to ever feel that awful again.  I'm glad others have had success, it's just not for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I work for Bariatric and Medical weight loss for my local hospital. I have NEVER had weight issues. I started putting on weight in my mid 40's. I'm very active...I play softball a few times a week, crossfit (LOVE), 5k's and did bootcamp while doing crossfit. I'm NOT a big eater & I don't like fast food much. I eat decent but was told not enough. At lunch I always walked over a mile but I continued to "BLOW UP"...literally! I found out I had Hashimoto disease which explained the bloating. Once Istarted my medicine for that my weight started to come off. Our drug rep came in one day with Wegovy. I asked my doctor in my office about it & was told I could try it. Me and some of the nurses started taking it. The side effects weren't to bad at first. The 3rd & 4th month was HORRIBLE! I was having IBS attacks...vomiting & #2 at the same time, tired, burping more. If I ate something...which wasn't much...if I sat down to watch tv I started feeling like I was bloating up, like I had to burp. Once I stood up I would burp & I could immediately feel the bloating going down. Then I would have attacks if I drank my protein shakes. Then I had attacks if I drank milk. I tried Almond milk & I had attacks....so I stopped drinking any form of milk. I was told by the drug rep that Wegovy doesn't do well with people that doesn't have a gallbladder...which I don't. I have lost over 20pds but I'm sure my thyroid medicine helped with that as well. I noticed since taking Wegovy I have lost some of my muscle mass which for EVERYONE is not good. You want your fat mass to go down & your muscle mass to go up. As I'm reading some of these reviews, I'm reading that some are losing a lot fast. That isn't good & it is probably muscle mass, not a lot of fat mass. 
Another side effect for me and another coworker was gag reflex. I was brushing my teeth & then tongue and I literally vomited!! NASTY!! I took my last shot this week & I'm done. I'm glad it has helped some people BUT remember to consume 85 plus grams of protein & more if you are exercising more. Drink a lot of water and do weight training!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Started on .25 in November and every month moved up and am now on 2.4. Greatly reduced appetite has enabled me to sustain weight loss program. Post-menopausal and 60 - have lost 36 pounds in the winter with less than normal exercise.  Very effective in supporting weight loss - few people understand that some people experience hunger more than others and this medication significantly reduces appetite.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This is the best weight loss drug I have ever tried! Started in Jan. 2022 and so far down 38 pounds as of today. I have another 50lbs to go but am now more confident than ever that I can reach that goal. I have been overweight my entire adult life but menopause really put me over the edge. Nothing else I have tried has worked like this. Currently on the 1mg but am moving up this week. Unlike others, I have had very few side effects. A little sick to my stomach and a little dizzy but that is it.Nothing I can't handle. My energy level has actually increased which is not something I have heard. This has been a true miracle for me!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This medication has definitely curbed my appetite. Since I was a kid I have always been a hungry person and never able to go more than a few hours without eating. I typically compensated for years by extreme exercise.  After combining Covid isolation plus menopause I was obese and not feeling good. Wegovy combined with a low carb diet and exercise has made the pounds continue to fall off. I can now eat literally half or less of what I would eat normally with no stress. My brain really just tellsme now that’s enough. Thankful for science and this great advancement for weight loss!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started taking wegovy February 9 th 2022 weighing 176 pounds . I am down to 144 pounds now and it’s April 2022… I’m very happy with the medication I’ve had no side effects and feel great ….

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’m 53, post menopausal with Hashimoto’s thyroiditis  and have had a very difficult time getting scales to budge. I started Ozempic at 0.25mg in January weighing 156lbs 5’4”. My endocrinologist slowly increased my dose staying at the 0.5mg dose for 8 weeks to adjust to the GI side effects. I recently increased to Wegovy 1mg and had a tough adjustment,( abdominal pain, fatigue, just feeling run down, GERD with feeling like everything I ate just sat in my stomach for 48hrs. ) however, it slowly improves over the first few days, now it’s April and I’ve lost 23 lbs, down to 133 and feeling like it’s been worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: The pen is simple to administer.  I just started my 2nd round (5th week) still at .25, and already lost 11 lbs. Although I’ve lost weight, I’m not going to sugar coat the side effects.  For me it’s the  sudden nausea with bloating, constipation and fatigue.  By now, I’m learning to manage by using OTC nausea medication and stool softener. Sometimes I want to stop using it because of the symptoms, but seeing the lbs come off keeps me going.  The medication really does curb your appetite dramatically.  I don’t feel hungry at all.  Every patient will react differently but you won’t know until you try it.  I can’t see myself increasing the dosage right now.  I don’t think I can handle a higher dose.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I got VERY VERY sick at 1.0 dose. I had to go to the ER because I couldn't hold any food or liquid down. Also I had constant diarrhea. 
I am going to let everything get out of my system and then start over, but will STOP at .5 dose. 
I have a sensitive stomach so I am not surprised I experienced every side effect. I did not have any issues with .25 or .5. 
The medicine did curve my appettite. I am diagnosed with hypothyroid so I wasn't feeling the full sensation before this drug. I will be verycareful with this drug the second time around.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am so pleased with my progress. Started Wegovy mid- October 2021, I’ve lost 49lbs as of today. It’s truly been a miracle for me, my appetite is very small and I get fuller, faster, which is the whole concept of this hormone. My doctor and I have decided to stay at 1.7 since I’m doing so well, that way we have a backup. This past month I will say I feel like I need to titrate up, as I don’t seem to be getting full and I’m starting to think about food more. I would like to know if anyone else has noticed a decline in effectiveness. I’m still happy, plan on taking it forever if needed, with my success, it’s clear my body was depleted of this hormone. The majority of my weight came off in the first couple of months, now I’m steady, losing a pound or two occasionally, I’d be happy here, although my goal is to be 11lbs lighter. Stick with it, I had nausea up to 1.7, now it’s non-existent. Keep a bag of saltines with you, have a couple when you experience it. Highly recommend this drug.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been taking Wegovy for approx 6 months.  Have lost weight and I am going to stick with it.  But after I went up to the 2.4 I started experiencing sensitive skin on my arms, legs and back.  It felt like sunburn but there was no rash, no redness.  It was very weird!  At times it was severe, especially on my back.  I actually went to my doctor thinking I had shingles.  But it has for the most part gone away.  I am still having just a small amount of sensitivity in the skin on my back.  My sister started Wegovy after me and started having the same sensitivity in her skin.  That's when we realized it must be from the Wegovy.  I have noticed my hair is dry feeling.  But over all once I got past the "sunburn" feeling, I am pleased with it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 9 months ago and have lost 25 pounds (210 down to 185) and I would like to drop another 20.  I am on the full maintenance dose and the weight loss seems to be leveling off.  I have not tried to lose weigh--it has just happened due to decreased appetite.  Finally something that works!  I have always had a big appetite and after menopause it really became a problem.  It seems incredible to me now that I'm not needing to eat as much.  I avoid junk foods but still have a strong sweet tooth and indulge in sweets fairly regularly.  In have had constipation, some low level nausea, some fatigue, and tingling skin at times, but not to the point of stopping Wegovy.  These side effects are mostly felt on day 2 and 3 following the injection.  By week's end they are typically gone.  Side effects also occurred when moving up to the next dose level.  But after a week at the new level the side effects dimished each time.  I lingered at .5 for two months rather than going to the next level and did the same spending two months on 1.7 because I didn't want to deal with the side effects.  Once I took the plunge and made it to 2.4, I was glad I went for it.  The first few days at 2.4 were rough but I'm okay now.  I'm about to begin my second month on the maintenance dose and am hopeful that the weight loss will continue.  I think it will because I am just not craving all the calories.  My doctor provided me a Rx for nausea, which I have only used a few times.  Also, I have continued on 10 mg of Omeprazole for acid reflux that I had taken for 5 years prior, and I did not need to increase it once I started Wegovy. I also take thyroid medication without incident.   The weight loss has really helped my arthritus knee pain,  and I feel that has been worth the trade-offs .  My doctor is pleased that the weight is coming off slowly because, she says, it is more likely to stay off that way.  I am concerned that if/when I stop taking Wegovy my appetite will return along with the weight.   But for now I am very pleased with the progress and I have no plan to stop anytime soon.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy since December 2021. I have lost 20 lbs. One month I stayed on too low of dose .25 mg and it did not work. You have to go up each month. I do get body aches (like Fibromyalgia) all over until the 5th or 6th day (before I take a new shot). No nausea. I am at 1.0mg. I am debating if I should go up to the 1.7 mg. I do not like the body aching all the time. My appetite has changed for the better. I eat very small meals now. I now walk 2.5 miles a day for 4 to 5 days a week.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: No problems initially with the lower doses. Not much weight loss. HOWEVER, starting the 1.7 dose yesterday... woke up this morning throwing up bile. Had heavy chest and back pain. Thought I was having a heart attack! Called paramedics. Everything checked out but I still have heavy chest and HORRIBLE reflux. I'm DONE!! The 10 lbs I have yet to lose is NOT WORTH what I'm feeling now.

I’m 54 with post menopausal weight gain. I started Wegovy in October 2021. Stop in January. Lost 25 pounds. 150 to 125. During the process, had several bouts of nausea as well as severe stomach cramping. I am on thyroid medication for hypothyroidism. Wegovy caused me to become hyperthyroid.  I was losing my hair, I was always cold and could not sleep at night. I’m not sure that losing 25 pounds was worth using Wegovy. I never made it past .50 The nausea stomach cramps and constipation were morethan I wanted to deal with. It is April 2022 and I have lost a lot of hair and my hair became very brittle and is breaking off. I do not recommend this for anyone taking thyroid medication. It is definitely going to interfere with that.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This really has helped my appetite I have always had an appetite 24/7 that was ravenous but wegovy has calmed it down I have experienced tiredness nausea and headaches but nothing that couldn’t be managed I  am really hoping it works

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started on 2/11/2022 at 343 pounds. I am titrating up monthly and just took my last .5 before starting 1.0 next week. As of today (4/4/2022) I weigh 315. So almost 30 pounds in 2 months. Diet is mid-keto. Keeping carbs below 35g/day and protein above 80g/day. Have not incorporated exercise into my routine yet. I try to drink around 100+ ounces of water a day. So far no side effects on either the .25 or .50 doses other than fatigue and being constantly cold. But at 55 years of age and going through menopause, I welcome the cold. I am nervous about the higher doses, but I cannot let it bother me. I put off taking my first Wegovy injection due to fear of side effects - and that was a mistake since I haven't really had any so far. Slow and steady is best. My Doc says that anything lost on the lower doses is a bonus as most people see their best weight loss on 1.7 and 2.4 doses. Good Luck to everyone on their journey.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Today would have been my 4th shot. I'm down.16lbs but cannot eat, nauseous ha ING to take Zofran, constipated taking miralax, bloated, belching and even a trip to the ER. I am happy with the weight loss but the side effects are just touch to handle.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy for nearly 5 months and I'm now at max dose.  I started at 178 lbs and currently at 157 lbs. So I'm averaging about a lb a week. Some weeks I don't lose any weight but then the next week may lose 2-3 lbs.  I have not had any serious side effects.  Occasional nausea 1st few months but  would only lasted a few hrs. Occasional stomach cramping. I have found that when I experience these side effects it is due to forgetting to eat, eating something I shouldn't (ie: fatty or highsugar foods), or eating to much at one time.  Be sure to drink plenty of water.  I have had mild constipation issues since having my gallbladder removed just over a yr ago, so I have to occasionally take a stool softener but Wegovy hasn't seem to make it any worse. I have cervical stenosis and was having severe low back spasms. I also have some arthritis in hands and feet so I needed to get some weight off my small frame of 5'4".  So far I'm happy with Wegovy.  I recommend not restricting your calorie intake to extremely and not trying to losing more than 1-2 lbs per week on avg (unless doctor advises otherwise). Remember to eat something every few hrs and drink plenty of water. Don't let yourself get too hungry and then eat too much, that will lead to discomfort.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am 53 and have struggled considerably with my weight loss journey during menopause.  I tried everything...exercise, intermittent fasting, keto, clean eating, more protein less carbs, HCG, WW, etc etc etc and the weight would not budge.  I am working with a nutritionist in my Dr's office and started a month ago at a very low dose of .25.  I am eating half of what I usually eat and have no cravings for sweets, wine or bad food.  I am down 11 lbs in 1 month and I feel hopeful for the first time in a long time!  I am less bloated and down a size.  I have nausea at times but nothing unbearable.  It basically slows your digestion down so I take something each day to help with bowel movements.  I take pepcid each day to prevent any reflux.  My injection also has B12 in it and I think it helps.  I also take a B12 shot on its own about 3 days after my Samgulitide shot.  I should also say I started bio identical hormone therapy around the same time and I think it has helped me a lot at least with the hot flashes!  I feel like my metabolism is kicking it up a notch finally!  If you can work with a reputable medical professional who has experience administering this medication, I recommend it!  I meet with mine each week and she monitors me very closely.  Dosage is key and it sounds like a lot of people start to high for some reason and that creates complications.  By the way, I started at 212.  Good luck!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I took wegovy for 3 months and got to the 1.0 dose. Had nausea, constipation  and acid reflux daily, but 3 days after my first 1.0 dose started having extreme pain on my right side. Ended up needing labs and ultrasound. I now need my gallbladder removed and my inflammation in my body is over 10 times higher than it should be. I will never take wegovy again! All this and only  3
Pounds weight loss in 3 months.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started the Wegovy injections 2.5 months ago because I struggle to lose weight since being diagnosed with hypothyroidism.  I started on a dose lower than .25mg, and I am now taking .5mg and have only lost 10 lbs.  first 3 days after injection, I am tired all day long...it can be tough if you have to work and manage a family too.  I also get bad acid reflux for those first 3 days after taking the injection.  It does help with my appetite but I struggle to have the energy to exercise.  AlthoughI will force myself to do exercise, it is not enjoyable (as it once was).  I have not had any stomach issues with the dose I have taken thus far.  And... after reading some of these other posts on here, I am nervous to up my dose for fear of severe nausea!  I really need to lose at least 30 more pounds for a knee surgery.  I have been at a plateau now for the past month, so I either need to up my dose or try another route.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: The first month I lost 7 pounds and the second I only lost 3.  I am carefully following a low calorie diet and exercising.  Not sure I am going to continue with this medication. I easily could have lost those 3 pounds the second month without this medication.  The side effects are no joke.  I am exhausted so much of the time (many days I need to nap) and have frequent GI upset, although no significant nauseau and no vomitting like others have reported. Frankly, I am really disappointed.  My doctor told me to expect to lose 8 pounds per month and that the side effects are transient and that is definitely not what is happening.  On the plus side, it is very easy to administer.  I can't imagine someone having trouble with it and I was initially nervous about self-injections.  But of course, why do injections at all when then treatment benefit seems so minimal.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Five months ago I started at 364 lbs.  I lost 20 pounds in the first two months, none the 3rd month, 2 lbs the 4th month, and 6 lbs the 5th month for a total of 28 lbs.  I have lumbar spinal stenosis, so exercise is difficult for me, but I do water walking 2-3 times per week and just started strength training twice a week.  The injections are super easy; soooo much better than a daily pill.  I wish the injector pens could be sanitized and reused instead of thrown away.  I have a hatial hernia and severe GERD.  Wegovy makes this much much worse, especially when I’m trying to sleep.  With the coupon, I pay about $1200/month as this drug is NOT covered by Anthem.  I’m a bit disappointed that I have not lost more, especially since I can eat very little without starting to feel some minor nausea. I am prediabetic, and my A1C has gone from 5.8 to 5.6.  I do think the weight loss has helped my back pain a bit, but I still need a walker to walk more than 1/4 of a mile, but I can stand up longer without as much pain as I had when I started the Wegovy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have just started Wegovy. I am my second week .25. Can anyone tell me how long it takes to see a difference?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy since just before Thanksgiving of 2021. Started out 183 pounds.  I have been on it 6 months and have lost 40 pounds! I  55 and have tried every diet out there with no results.The nausea is horrible for about 36 hours after my injection,  but eases up considerably.  I have been a little tired after each injection, but I thought I was just being lazy. Didn't realize that was a side effect. My main side effect is hair loss. I got COVID the 1st week of January and heard horrorstories of hair loss after COVID. I have noticed hair in the drain after I wash my hair and when I run my fingers through my hair. I did not realize hair loss could also be a side effect with Wegovy.  Not sure if the hair loss is from Wegovy or COVID. Seeing lots of baby hairs coming in, thank God.Overall, I really am impressed with my weight loss results with Wegovy.  Once I realized the nausea is not constant and goes away after a few days, I knew I could tolerate it. Hubby says I " eat like a bird". Feel full after a few bites. Learned quickly not to drink a lot of fluids and then eat. You will vomit. I learned to adjust my fluid intake around my meals. I recommended Wegovy to my sister and she is starting it soon. Interested to see how her journey on Wegovy will go. Very impressed with Wegovy and definitely recommend it for weight loss.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Have taken the medicine for the max amount the Wegovy co-pay benefit would cover my costs. So at month 6 I’ve lost 36 lbs but the side effects got worse in the last two months with terrible gut pain 2-3 days after injection. When I stopped taking the medicine the pain was gone, but weight began to creep back even after maintaining the exact same amount of calories and exercise. Not sure how the medicine affected that drastic loss of weight but I did my part and at least I have better eating habits. My doctor offered to switch me to Saxenda but I’m a little uneasy about the abdominal cramping.  It’s no joke.  Hurts a lot.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: For me, Wegovy has been a great experience so far. I just finished my 8th week and today started on 1.0mg. I have been steadily loosing 2 pounds a week and I feel great. I can already see a difference in my body and I have more energy. The injection is truly painless and easy. Occasionally I will feel slightly nauseous but that is always because I didn’t listen to the cues my body is sending that I need to stop eating. It is hard to re-learn how you eat and listen to what your body is telling you, but if you do, you should feel fine. This medicine is a tool not a cure-all. The patient needs to also do their part and use it along with your own efforts to help on their weight loss journey

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy since January 1st and have not lost one pound. I am up ton1.0mg but I also had gastric bypass surgery in 2006 so maybe it is not absorbing in my system like others. I am not sure, but I am not taking my shot this week and I will see if I start to lose again. I am in boxing classes and not eating because the shot makes me not hungry.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This medication worked wonders for me so far. I was grateful not to have any side effects until month 3. I am almost to the 6 month mark. With HITT exercising and eating less I’ve lost 40 lbs. The nausea and vomiting suck but luckily it only last one day and I can plan my schedule around it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started 5 months ago, just started the 2.4 dose.  Have lost 28lbs so far. Results were slow to come, but really started to drop weight at 1mg dose.  Nausea has definitely been the biggest issue.  My GP wrote me a script for zofran, it really helps.  Also I have absolutely NO appetite whatsoever.  I am struggling to force myself to eat, and even when I do, I am absolutely done in 2-3 bites.  I have also noticed a serious decrease in energy and overall mood- not sure if this is from not eating orthe drug itself.  But the side effects are well worth the results, for me at least.  As far as supply, there are occasional issues with getting it filled.  But I recently read the manufacturer is shut down temporarily due to safety regulations- and from what they are saying, the lower doses will be the only ones affected, and could be off the shelves for up to 6 months.  For reference, I am a 40yr old female, started in October at 201lbs, as of now (March) I’m at 172 lbs.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I was doing OK with this medication for three months- Oct, Nov Dec 2021. Had no appetite some nausea not awful. Lost 15 pounds.
Then at the 1.7 dose the bigger problems began. 
Super nausea omg I felt so ill I stayed in bed. Couldnt even talk I felt so sick. Also started to give me more muscle spasms ( I have fibromyalgia from Lyme Disease). They were nonstop and horrific. More anxiety,  could not poop at all. When I forced it and took every laxative it was so painful I wanted someone to shoot me dead.
Also..sweating. ugh.
Just awful. So I backed it down to the .5. Made it 4 weeks and after I had more anxiety again and more depression and freaked out ith a major panic attack I'm quitting forever. I don't know if it built up in my body and then caused the problems mixed with my other health conditions or what but this drug is not sustainable. I also vomited terribly on the 1.7 at 3am.
It has the most side effects with any medication I've ever tried. They were delayed, but then I got super slammed. I had to increase my anxiety med because of this.  I hope I feel better in a month. I'm disabled and don't work. I'd never be able to work while taking this drug. I'm glad some can continue.
I've felt like death since January 2022. All done with Wegovy. Lost 20 pounds but I really don't think it was worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 4.5 months ago and have lost 10 pounds.  I am currently on the 1.7mg dose and upping to the 2.4mg dose next week. I personally get extremely nauseous and fatigued for the first 2-3 days post injection.  The medication absolutely decreases my appetite, I get full very quickly and stay full for a long time.  I often feel quite nauseous about 20-30 mins after eating for about an hour and then it goes away.  I  read a lot of reviews that show I much greater amount of weight loss ina shorter amount of time than I have achieved and I have felt frustrated at time by that, however, the clinical trial data shows an 15% weight loss over 68 weeks, which is 17 months.  Therefore, I think my “slower” weight loss is ok and I do find the medication effective.  I am also on an SSRI for depression maintenance, which increases my appetite significantly and perhaps slows down some of the weight loss.  Before every injection, I debate if I want to stop the medication or continue it because I feel so sick the first few days, but it’s is working and I’d like to get more weight off before I stop.  In a nut shell: don’t get too frustrated if the weight is not flying off.  Watch your diet, exercise and keep going as long as you can tolerate the med.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I've only taken 2 doses at the .25mg and have already lost 20lbs. I do have to force myself to eat and drink cause im just not hungry, but at 41 I have lupus and a few other issues and I'm happy so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started at the 1mg dose almost 6 weeks ago. I must say it really decreases my appetite. I have to force myself to eat sometimes, and when I do I get full quickly and almost averted to food when i've barely started eating. Mild side effects. When I first started nausea and stomach pain, now nothing. That being said 6 weeks in. Have not lost a single pound. I will speak to my md about maxing my dose in another few weeks. I'm just worried too much Wegovy will prevent me from eating at all.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: In about 2 1/2 months I lost 21 pounds. Very happy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I was fine on the .25 and .5 doses, maybe a couple pound weight loss. Which is to be expected since those are loading doses. I took my first 1.0 injection 8 days ago and I’ve not slept one night due to horrible stomach discomfort, nausea and pain. It’s awful! This just isn’t for me. I’m done. Wishing you all the best of luck! I know it works wonders for a lot of people.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This is a wonder drug. However!!!! The nausea and vomiting it causes will make you think you are dying!  Let’s just say it’s a mixture of the worse drinking night of your life, plus the worse morning  sickness anyone could ever have combined with the worse stomach virus you could ever get. This all lasting about 4 of the 7 days of a week.  With that being said, who in the heck would want to eat feeling that sick. Hence = weight loss.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: First 3 days after taking Wegovy deal with EXTREME nausea. Remainder of week, general feeling of blah.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Havent had any side effects yet @ .50 dosage but lost a total of 10 lbs so far while being on it and stuck at a plateau for months. Started weight 283 and was at a plateau @ 220, started taking Wegovy and weigh 210 now. I wouldnt be taking this if insurance didnt cover it so it only cost $35 per box.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started the medication in October 2021.  I have tolerated it well and have lost 80 pounds.  Easy to administer and is a good adjunct to a good diet and exercise.  It remover the constant hunger feeling and cravings.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have had constipation but other than that I have had no problems with this medication. I have lost 30 pounds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have not started this medication yet. I am writing to advise all of those who concerns about the cost. Check with your local compounding pharmacy. My pharmacy is compounding Wegovy prescriptions at $199 for a 2 month supply. The coupon does not apply and my insurance doesn’t cover it but I am able to file it to my Flex spending account. $200 a month out of pocket is Much better than the $900 I was quoted.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took my 3rd dose today.  I am prediabetic and had really lousy labs.  At 54 I was looking to finally drop the weight and get healthy.  I am already down 9 pounds. Very minor side effects.  Slight nausea but nothing a sip on ginger ale wouldn't cure.  I was extremely tired the first week.  I thought I was actually coming down with something.  The second week was alot better.  My clothes are loose today.  My underwear is starting to get baggy so I know I have lost inches.  I normally have very course and thick curly hair.  It has become soft and very manageable for some reason.  Loving my hair!  Highest weight 258

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I am a failed braiatric sleeve patient. That tool was effective at first 
and i lost 50lbs, but after 6 years  i was back up over 300lbs. So, my PCP told me about Wegovy and although skeptical, I Started Wegovy mid November 2021. Gradually titrated up and reached the 2.4 maintenance dose this past weekend. Up until now, constipation, belching and gradual decrease in appetite. Lost 15lbs. After starting this 2.4 dose, the nausea is miserable! But I'm determined to see this through. I am relearning a healthy relationship with food through side effects and what amounts to eat. I am thankful this medication is available and I can tolerate it. I'm sure this method isn't for everyone, but I'm happy with the direction  I am headed. Can't wait to get to "1"derland. (Under 200lbs)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have now been taking this medication for 4 full months.  I have lost 25 lbs and couldn't be happier.  I have had little to no side effects.  The most for me is being really tired the day after the shot.  It's sad that all of us benefiting from this medicine can not afford it after the $25 coupon.  I will definitely put my last 2 months to good use.  :)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Started at 237lbs. @.5mg and slowly titrated up to 1.7mg with only sporadic, and occasional nausea of mild to moderate intensity. Just did my first week of 2.4mg and experienced 2 days of strong nausea, but easily resolved and I think my body has finally adjusted to the full dose. If you can endure the nausea and stick with it, you’ll be fine. Eventually the body WILL adjust but it takes time…I now weigh 200lbs. I had to buy all new pants, I’m down like 4 sizes, lol.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Absolutely the best thing I have ever tried.  I have my weight on and off my whole life.  I have lost 35 lbs.
