I did have some of the minor side effects but nothing compared to the way it curbed my appetite and my sweet tooth and feeling full quicker.  My only complaint is I was able to buy the RX only with the use of a coupon and I got up to the 2.4 mg dosage for 1 time and the coupon had maxed out.  I can’t afford to continue with the medicine now

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started a month ago with .25 no sides effects except the first day i had a really bad stomachache. This is my first using .5mg i have been feeling a little nauseous specially when eating. So far i have lost 7 lbs, i eat less and feeling full for longer period of time.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve been using Wegovy .5 since last August, with zero side effects, and have consistently lost 1 lb. a week.  The doctor will not raise my dose unless I go 3 weeks with no weight loss.  She said there is no reason to titrate up, as long as it’s working, and that more side effects happen in higher doses.  I want to lose 84 pounds, and I’m down 27 pounds so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: 5 weeks in I’ve lost ~10lbs with another 25lbs to go. I moved up to .5mg after the third dose of .25 and I’ll probably do the same as I titrate up to 1.0 because I’ve not had any nausea-related side effects thus far. It’s a really great drug for me. Ive tried diet and exercise several times over the years and that program worked but it was SO hard to keep it up for several months at a time and the hunger pains never went away. That’s the best thing about this drug - no hunger pains. At all. Zero. The only two things that I’ve noticed is my sleep habits became a little worse. I had trouble sleeping more than a maximum of 6 hrs / night but I started taking melatonin and that’s helped tremendously and I’m back to normal sleep. The other is a little constipation. Prior to the drug I was routine once/day, now it’s once every 3-4 days. But I eat so little now that it’s not really an issue. Aside from that I’ve had a very good experience on this drug. Nothing tastes different or worse - I just eat 1/8 to 1/10 of what I used to consume. When I eat too much, which was hard to gauge the first few weeks, I felt like I had the biggest meal of my life, which was uncomfortable, but it went away after an hour or two. You need to learn how much food is enough, which is much less than you think it is. One trick I’ve used is to try to eat very slowly.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
WEGOVY has been a miracle for me. So far, I’ve lost 40 pounds due to complete loss of appetite. I only eat lean meats, fruits, vegetables, complex carbs, low fat dairy, very little sugar, and nuts. I exercise 4-5x/wk. Zero constipation due to exercise and eating a cup of bran-type cereal each day.

I do feel tired a lot, mainly from not eating much, so keeping a food diary helps me up my food intake when it’s too low. 

I’m currently on 2.4, but I think it’s too high, so I’m going to ask my Dr.to lower it back to 1.7 next month.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I lost 18 pounds in 4 months using Wegovy.
I started to have intolerable side effects at the 1.7 dose and after 6 weeks had to. Drop it to .5 again.
I have fibromyalgia from Lyme disease and it gave me unbelievable fibro flares. Maybe something to do with the sugars in the muscles. I screamed in pain. Also couldn't eat much at all, was so constipated I would take anything and everything to try and go and only could after 7 hours of lying in the bathroom in the worst pain imaginable.
Woke up at 3am twice and vomited also.
I also see a difference in the texture of my hair. Very dry. Makes sense if my whole system is dry.
So I'm using the .5 maybe 2x month but I think I'm going off it. I just got my hair back and I don't want to lose it again.
I don't know how many can tolerate the side effects at the higher doses. I was so nauseous I felt like death.
I'll try my best to keep the weight off.
Maybe a low bimonthly dose will help me do that. I am 53 years old. The website wouldn't let me record my real age.
Good luck

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Inserting the pen into stomach is very hard and most times has left bruising.  After my initial weight loss, I have been at a standstill for over two months.  This medicine is extremely expensive to not work continuously.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I am a 44yo female, have gone from 177 to 150 in just under 4 months. I exercise a lot, but haven't changed what I eat much. The pros... I can feel starving, then be full after eating very little. I'm losing weight pretty consistently. I can still eat things like sushi, ice cream etc, but instead of eating a bunch, a few bites and I feel satisfied. Food I used to love I no longer have any craving for. I have also noticed that even drinking (in a margarita fan) has lost a lot of its allure. I amlooking great and about to break the 150 mark for the first time in a decade.

Cons... I feel generally unwell. Like I am coming down with something. It wasn't terrible at first, but as the dose increases, it gets pretty bad. I am on a generic semaglutide so thank God, the prescriber has been able to titrate me insanely slow (often by .25 every week or two) but we had to lower it back again as I seriously was miserable. Since getting to around 1.7, I am having a lot of problems with constipation, way more nausea (like waking at 4am and running to the bathroom to vomit), heartburn, and lots of burping which randomly started this week and really sucks. I exercise about 6 days a week and went from level 8-10 on the elliptical to feeling like I'm going to pass out of I go higher than about level 2. A flight of stairs kicks my butt. I get dizzy super easy. Most of this slowly started around 1mg, but the 1.7 has been brutal. I told the prescriber I don't think I can go higher than this and she seems amenable. So I imagine the weight loss will slow down but it would be nice to find a balance of still maintaining/losing a bit while also feeling well.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Wegovy definitely works. Ive been on it since 12-8-21. Its been almost 3 months & I'm down 30lbs. I dont crave foods anymore since I'm on my 3rd box (dosage goes up every month). Sometimes I feel like I'm starving but when I start 2 eat I can only take a few bites. My issue is constipation. Exercise, drinking nothing but water, coffee, taking  laxatives, prune juice, fiber supplements, probiotics, & enema didn't work & now I'm having 2 see a gastrologist. Its a rough drug but worth it if your obese & need 2 lose the weight fast. My 18 yr old son is on it. He was 240lbs. Hes lost 20lbs in 2 months. His only issue is an upset stomach but he likes it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm on my last 1.7 dose and I've gone from 190 to 163.2 lbs so far. My side effects have been pretty mild. I think I had nausea/stomach pain the first few weeks after I started. Now for the most part I only have nausea in the few days after I've titrated up. I did have one week where I started puking and had really bad nausea. It turned out I'd forgotten to take my dose the week before. I'm writing the date I'm supposed to take each on the shots right when I get a new box now. My appetite has been reduced significantly. Some days I can eat normal amounts of food, but others I just don't get hungry or get full very quickly. I am very aware of when I'm full now, like I'll eat half of my food and then feel like I don't want another bite. If for some reason I do eat past that point I can get nauseous and my stomach might start hurting, but that's rare for me. Also the shots themselves aren't that bad. I do Emgality shots once a month and those hurt a lot more than the Wegovy. My weight loss has been really steady. I don't think I'm done losing weight and the weight loss has been pretty unrelated to my exercise/types of food I eat. I've been stressed and have not been making good decisions in those areas. I'll probably stay on this for the rest of my life if I can. As far as the cost, I get it for $25 with the coupon for now. I was told it would be $100 a month without the coupon. I luckily just got a better job, so I'm just going to pay the $100 a month once the coupon runs out. Hopefully insurances will start covering it more and make it more accessible.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy since October 2021. I'm currently on 2.4.  I have lost of total of 35 pounds. I have alot of constipation, I have to take something for the constipation. I do have some vomiting when I eat hot, spicy or greasy food. I'm very please with Wegovy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Reporting on 7 months of Wegovy after 6 months of prior lifestyle therapy. I started with a BMI of 32 at 217 pounds. With calorie counting aiming for 1500 calories a day, I was able to get to 200 pounds with constant cravings and food obsession. Since starting Wegovy I have lost an additional 35 pounds but with absolutely no food cravings or obsession. It was embarrassingly easy to lose weight on Wegovy. No nausea. I have classic symptoms of weight loss: 1) some fatigue initially when I was losing weight quickly, which has now resolved; 2) cold intolerance has been my most discomforting side effect; 3) bowel movements only once every 5-7 days but without any symptoms of constipation. Nearing a plateau in my weight with only 2 pounds weight loss in the last month and BMI 24. I could not be more pleased and feel blessed that I have excellent insurance with virtually no co-pay. I am 63 years old and have not had a BMI of 24 since I was in my early teens.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
What an experience. I am totally shocked by how this medication worked for me since starting 19 days ago. I did not know what to expect when I started this and of coarse was anxious about side effects. But I will be using my third injection in 2 days and am all in. Let me make a list of what I experienced on this med. 
From Day 2 
I did not Crave food. I did not think about my next meal
I did not feel the hunger one feels when they are obese. You know what I mean
I have gone every morning but two without breakfast. Yes I know its the most important meal. But its also a chance for your body to start burning fat. I dont care what nutritionist say it worked for me in the past. And if I can only have coffee until 1130a I am doing this.
So lets see how this goes

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I've lost over 50lbs in the 5-6 months I've been taking it, I'll be off it soon due to it no longer being $25 a month for me (insurance won't cover it sadly). It's definitely worked but has come with a lot of stomach issues. They improved when I started taking digestive enzymes with meals, but it didn't completely go away. I've been able to tolerate it though since I was only getting the massive discount for 6 months.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I m so thankful for this medication. I have lost 65 lbs since August 1, 2021 with minimal side effects. My favorite part of taking Wegovy is that it has changed the way I think about food. For me, the challenge and struggle in losing weight is that I constantly thought about what I was or wasn't eating. Wegovy has changed that. I rarely have cravings. If I do, a small bite of something satisfies the craving. Thankfully, my insurance has approved it through Aug 2022. Hopefully, I will be able toget it for my cost of $25/month after then. I hope that insurance agencies will see the value in approving weight loss medication for prevention of comorbidities of obesity.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have never been so sick in all my life. Sure it works, anyone would lose weight if they’re constantly sick. It’s like a forced eating disorder because if you eat more than a few bites you’ll vomit and then eventually you lose your appetite completely. Constantly nausea for 4 months  will do that to you. It did solve a problem for me in getting a large amount of weight off, 40 lbs in 4 months to be exact. Due to a health issue (diagnosis of RA) I suddenly gained a lot of weight and couldn’t getit back off. I’m not sure that this would work for someone who’s been overweight for an extended period of time for the sheer fact that you don’t learn any healthy habits so I’m not sure how you would maintain it once discontinuing Wegovy. I’m not even sure i won’t gain it back for the same reason. Not eating is not healthy, vomiting every week is not healthy and is it really safe to mess with your blood sugar and pancreas? I’m grateful for getting this head start and hope that I can now move to (my own) phase two and work with a nutritionist because I just can’t do it anymore. Bottom line it may have some benefits for some people but there are a lot of side effects so proceed with caution. Words just could not express how incredibly sick I have been since starting this! I started at the lowest dose and got to the maximum 2.4 at 4 months.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’m learning how much I can’t eat to lose and maintain weight but I had to go to reduced dosage of 1.0 from 1.7 because I was nauseous and constipated most of the time. Going back to 1.7 because the hunger is coming back although I still can’t eat much.  Will go back to 1.0 if nauseousness returns the same as before.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Im on my last dose of 1.7mg. Everything before 1.7mg was perfect and now is hell. I’m never constipated and being in 1.7mg kill my appetite completely because the food would get stuck in my stomach and in my throat. I can’t feel bowel movements cause every time I feel I’m going to have one, is stuck. Peeing have become difficult. There’s nothing in the side effects that talk about problems with peeing but I’m having them. I have try using miralax but it won’t work. I’m currently taking magnesiumcitrate and is not working. I will probably develop a infection and have to get a colostomy. I lost 20lbs in 4 months but at what cost?! Beware, if it gives you this symptoms talk to your doctor. I’m doing that on Monday.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Week 4, No effect. Actually have gained weight. Think the starting dose is to get your body used to the drug so there's no side effects at higher doses.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The first two months were pretty good. I was experiencing decreased appetite, heartburn, some nausea and weight loss. Month three as the dosage increased, I started experiencing a lot of nausea. Had to be extremely careful not to eat more than a few bites or vomiting occurred., Fourth month I was extremely ill with every bite I put in my mouth. I am now on 1.7 and contemplating stopping the medication. It’s time to increase to 2.4 but I told my doctor there’s no way and she gave me another prescription for 1.7. She also provided an anti-nausea medication that helps just a little.  Very torn because I want to keep losing but I also want to stop feeling sick every single day. My husband thinks this is ridiculous and I should stop because he is tired of me being sick.  In my third month I also started experiencing headaches and they continue. This last month I am experiencing severe muscle cramps in my back where nothing seems to relieve it. Thank goodness it’s only happened a few days here and there.  I’m down 25 pounds with a goal of another 15. I just don’t know if I can continue. Very torn!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Started November 28th 2021  .25 mg 4 weeks then .5mg 4 weeks now on first week 1mg .Lost 22 Pounds so far. have lil Nausea once in a while but eat a cracker or have some club soda im fine, no other syptoms so far. for me this has been a Blessing. I eat smaller amounts and all cravings are gone . I am staying on 1 mg for 3 more months cause its working well since the lower doses were also working . Im 63 stuggled all my life .this is awesome for me. just work with it ,its a wonderful tool. you have to put in some effort to choose healthy foods .,cant wait for the next 3 months Just do it !!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I was 75 lbs overweight and do a lot of stress eating. I am currently on .5mg dose for 3 weeks and have lost 14 lbs. Side effects include dull headaches which go away with Tylenol. Some constipation, but not real bad. My worst is the fatigue, it will effect your blood sugar. I have little or no appetite, but force myself to eat three meals a day based on diet plan.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on this medication since October, and I have lost 28 pounds.  This medication has had little side effects for me and has taught me portion control.  I have been on phentermine before and this by far is the best overall weight loss drug.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Sick. AfterI went to the 1.7mg sick sick sick. I lost 16 pounds and 4 of those was the 6 weeks I managed to stay on the 1.7. Decreased to the1.0 then. Also haveLyme and fibromyalgia and this made my pain worse because I could not go to the bathroom anymore.
It was scary. 
So I will come down on the wegovy.
I was ok until the 1.7.
Side effects are TIRED!
NAUSEA REALLY BAD. BURPING CONSTIPATION. I CRIED I felt so ill. I'll go down to the low dose and lose 1 or 2 pounds a month. Fine. No more highdose.
Taking a 3 week break right night.
Maybe I'll go to the bathroom. Also people...if you lose weight too fast your hair will cone out. Careful. I list 16 pounds in 4 months and I'm worried because I just regrew my hair from my illness. Be careful. Tirate SLOWLY 
I'm 53 yers old

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Immediately after the injection I have a day or two of a hazy headache and other mild side effects. I notice the most side effects when I up my dosage (at 1.7 currently) but by the end of the 4 shots I notice less and less. 

I get very tired initially and the mild headache along with acid reflex can be annoying but the results have been worth it. I feel less interested in eating, even if my favorite food is around I’m just not getting the same satisfaction from it that I did in the past. 

I haven’t been great about exercising but I’ve still been losing 2-3 (sometimes more) lbs a week. I’m definitely an advocate for this shot if other procedures and plans haven’t worked for you.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I lost 20 pounds the first 2 months. I thought this is easy. When my dose was increased to 1 it was down hill from there.. I developed gall stones and severe pancreatis.  After a stay in the hospital  several antibiotics  and gall bladder removed I'm feeling better. Needless to say no more wegovy for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: No weight loss. And the pen is a joke. I’m injecting it into my leg but I have to see the yellow line has stopped moving at some point after it clicks the second time? It’s the only Rx Injection I’ve taken that’s like this. It’s like they want consumers to screw up so they’re on the medication longer.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I'm only on day 4 but haven't notice any difference in appetite....only metallic taste in mouth. Is this normal? And how long before you started feeling effects?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I loved it. I lost 50lbs in 6mos and I had no side effects. I wish they would come out with another coupon.  Very expensive.  But my overall it was great an I feel great!!! THANK YOU FOR COMING UP WITH THIS WEIGHT LOSS PROGRAM.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This is the worst weight loss medication I have ever taken in my life.  I started with .25.  Week one, no side effect except for a little acid reflux.  2 days into week 2, the acid reflux was so horrible, I spent 2 nights not being able to sleep because I was coughing all night from the acid.  It wasn’t until the following day that things turned really bad.  I had a headache like I’ve never experienced.  I was nauseous and vomiting. I was weak and heard ringing in my ears.  I went to Urgent Care.  My BP was 171/100 and I am always normal.  It wasn’t until today that I feel somewhat better.  I will never take this medication again nor do I recommend anyone taking this.  This could have been life threatening.  Definitely not worth it!!!  The FDA should pull this medication immediately!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Sure you will lose weight if you can't eat and projectile vomit constantly. The constant, helpless feeling of nausea that will not subside, plus the vomiting is not worth it for me personally.  I also am experiencing times of twichiness-my hands will shake and I get slightly dizzy.  I had terrible insomnia one night where I only slept for 2 hours, was up for 3, then finally got another 2 before going to work but with terrible nightmares.  Praying this stuff gets out of my system soon.  I feel horrible.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve lost 50 lbs in 6 months

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I was on the injection for two months and lost 18 pounds which was awesome.  Unfortunately I started noticing more hair than normal in my hands after showering. My hair on my hair was falling out. I have always had pretty thick hair. I now have very thin hair on top with bald spots. Of course I stopped the medication right away. Now the depression of not having the halo to take the weight off I also Hate my hair. I think it looks awful. I had to cut it just to make it presentable. Wegovy for weight loss was great but there can be hair loss. I called the company to let them know. The lady said she was going to have someone call me about my results and no one ever did. Just know hair loss is a possible side effect.  Wish I’d hadn’t been for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I just began month 3 (1 mg). Up until this point I was nauseous, gassy and had diarrhea immediately after I ate, but I didn't mind all that because I could tell it was working. And the fact that I had already lost 20lbs in 2 mos was awesome. I had no cravings, the smell of food made me ill, no appetite -it was great. But now that I've started 1 mg, none of those side effects are happening, I'm back to craving food and I'm back to being able to eat food without getting rid of it right away (diarrhea). So now I'm worried that the 1 mg dose isn't working. It was the .5 mgs where I lost the most weight but was the sickest. Do I need to go back down to .5? Should I just keep going? Not sure what to do but this drug is amazing and I would highly recommend. Not everybody will experience the same side effects, so don't let that keep you from trying it. My nausea wasn't that bad and Wegovy has never caused me to vomit. Oh and I'm a female, 45 y/o and 5'3".

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Am I the only one having a problem with medication leaking out of the injection site?  I’ve had it happen after 3 out of 4 injections now, and it’s very disheartening.  According to the pharmacist, this is extremely common with these  pens— up to 45% of the time.  Wouldn’t the medication work better if you were getting the FULL DOSE each time?  I’ve lost 10#, so I must be getting a little of it.  I’m an RN with 45 years of experience, and this is a less than perfect  injection system.  And watching the medicine roll down your leg or abdomen is like watching $400 run down the drain.  Frustrating.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy in October. So far I have lost 25 lbs, which has been wonderful. My biggest issues are the nausea and constipation. I have increased my water intake which has helped a bit, but the nausea is unreal. I am on the 1.0 dose and I can't imagine getting to the higher dose. It is definitely a mental adjustment to not being able to eat as much, or as mindlessly. I am hoping Zofran will help with the nausea.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I really feel as though the Wegovy has changed my thoughts of food. I don’t crave certain things, I don’t want certain things. I stop eating because I am full faster. I am making better choices when it comes to eating. The weight loss is slow but I feel as though I am losing in areas I haven’t lost in a long time. Minimal side effects which don’t last long. I am looking forward to the end of my journey on Wegovy where I keep the weight off this time.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I weigh 225 lbs and gave been in wegovy for 4 weeks and haven't lost but 2lbs. I get bad headaches and have had diarrhea several times using it. I don't feel its working for me

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I've been using  this  medication  for 3 months and I have lost 25lbs. The first  time I used it..it curved my appetite and I was very impressed. My only upset is the having  to use the bathroom all the time and nausea  feeling right  after the medication  is administered. This is the first product I have used after years of trying  to lose weight that have given me these kind of results. I don't crave sweets  anymore. I would recommend  this  product

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: The first two weeks were rough. Upset stomach, lots of acid, fatigue, nausea.  Now I have stabilised and have just had my fourth injection.  Down 11 pounds in less than 4 weeks. I still to 1200 calories a day and use Noom and My Plate to make sure I am getting a balanced diet.  I have fewer cravings for sugar and alcohol and my appetite is definitely Italy decreased.   Now I have my energy back and my stomach is better. I work out with a trainer three times a week and feel strong!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started on the lowest dose in August and just started the highest dose today. I have lost 26lbs so far without working out and just doing portion control. My biggest complaint is nausea. It is awful if you accidentally overeat. If I eat even an average amount, I will vomit. I hardly eat anymore, which is a good thing. I used to overindulge. The side effects are a trade-off for the results. I am trying to lose 100lbs total so I will keep you updated.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am on my 9th week and I have felt terrible the last 3 weeks. I get nauseous and very dizzy. Anything I eat I have diarrhea right after (even bread). I need to lose about 25 more lbs but I don’t know if the side effects are worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm on my 4th month of treatment (one more week left) and have made it to the 1.7mg dose. Early on i started noticing constipation but that was an easy fix. Just making sure I eat more fiber and using a stool softener. There would be a few times I felt nauseous but i wasn't eating like i should have. Just trying to learn what my body needed. That went away with some adjustments to snacking and eating. This new dose however has been the hardest for me. The nausea is lingering. There have been a few times that I actually throw up. The nausea usually lasts the first two days of the weekly shot. If I take a nausea pill though it really helps. I notice that I feel full all day long some days. I try to eat something small just knowing that I still need to eat. I don't have any cravings. I've lost around 30 pounds. It started slowly at first but has really increased over the last 4 weeks. I've noticed that many of my clothes are fitting better. With more exercise I think my results will be even better. If you can find ways to manage any negative side affects I think its worth it to stick it out.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started this journey July 9th as a last resort to get healthy enough to come off of blood pressure medicine.  My brother is my best friend and is in need of a kidney transplant. His time if running short.  I am his only full blooded sibling. I went to Tampa to find out how to test to see if I was a match. I was turned away due to being under the age of 50 and on blood pressure meds which make me high risk for kidney problems in the future.  I was told I need to be off blood pressure meds at least 90 days before they will even test me to see if I am in fact a match.  I was devastated. When I returned home I spoke to my cardiologist and he told me to limit salt and lets try to lose some weight and he will monitor my blood pressure and see what we can do to come off the meds.  I went the very next day to a weight loss doctor and discussed options.  We determined that due to the nature of medical needs surrounding my need for regaining my health we would go with the wegovy.  As of December 20th I am down 34lb and about 8 inches off my waist.  I have been monitoring my blood pressure and taking half the medicine strength now from what I was on.  My blood pressure sometimes runs a little low/normal so we are thinking within another month or so I will be able to go without it and see how I do.  If everything goes well I hope to be able to enroll in testing to see if I am a match to donate a kidney for my brother.  If I am a match then we owe it to wegovy for saving two lives not just one.  That is a blessing for sure.  Fingers crossed and prayers raised.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This does work like a miracle for weight loss.  I have lost 20% of my body weight in 5 months.  I am at my goal and it feels wonderful. However, I have had several awful GI episodes in this last month.  At first I just had mild nausea and great appetite suppression, but the last month I have bad nausea/pain episodes about once a week.  Its bad enough that I am stopping the wegovy, even though I am terrified of gaining weight back.  Still, I feel this medication is worth a try by anyone who is overweight or obese.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started Wegovy on 10/18/21 & I'm down 25 pounds.I really didnt have any major side affects on the lower dosage. I'm currently on 1.0 mg, I get full very quick & if i over eat or eat something that dont agree with my body I have to vomit. I'm learning what I can & can not eat. My body lets me know when I'm full.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: First week of Wegovy. A little blah and had to take extra Pepcid for unset stomach. First day was amusing. Stomach gurgled nonstop all day. That night a little nauseous. Totally shut down my desire to eat. Certain food taste different. Sweet thing tend to taste overly sweet. Feeling full much sooner and can’t get through a full meal.  This is certainly the strangest drug I've ever taken. I’m hoping for the best. The doctor said she has had no one drop out. I think most of us will do anything toloose weight and as we have powered through all the side effects of being overweight, we will power through the Wegovy side effects. Good luck everybody.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’ve taken only my first dose at .25mg. I’m not sure that I will be able to continue taking this medication. While my cravings have been diminished significantly, I simply cannot eat without extreme nausea even with an anti-nausea medication. Within an hour of the shot, my arm and neck on the side I had the shot felt like they were sunburnt. Within 4 hours, I was vomiting more violently than I did while pregnant. I’ve never been this I’ll feeling since the time I had food poisoning and ended uphospitalized. The nausea is pervasive and will not go away even after vomiting and zofran. I’ve lost 7 pounds in 48 hours. Feel like I’m drying up. Smells trigger the nausea, even on day 3. It’s also given me some severe headaches that begin in the evenings and continue for many hours until I managed to fall asleep. I have nasty sulphuric burps and the gas and bloating are pretty bad too. Just started with diarrhea this morning. Not sure what it did to my system, but I’m not sure that I want to see what a higher dose does to my body. I doubt that I will continue this medication beyond the second dose unless my side effects improve dramatically.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Stopped working

I am a type 2 diabetic, my dr perscribed this to me for a few reasons, one main reason is because I struggle with loosing a few more pounds to get to where I would like my weight to be. I had taken wegovy for 2 months and recently decided to stop using it. When i first began shots it started to subside my appetite briefly, however the headache it gives it quite annoying. I continued using this in hopes that I would start to see some kind of change. Unfortunelty no change in my weight what so ever. All it really did for me was give me a weekly two day long headache. I stopped using and went back to using my ozempic. Was hoping for better weight loss results with this medication that I didnt get.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I've been on this medication for 11 weeks now, and lost 24 pounds, no side effects. I think my taste buds changed as there are things I can not eat/drink anymore like coffee or ice cream. 
I eat healthy and exercise 4 times a week for 2 hours each time, added walk for 30 minutes in the evening 2-4 times a week. I don't snack, I avoid carbs. I eat only when I'm hungry which is happening 2-3 times a day and even then, I eat very little as I feel full quickly. I listen to my body and stop eating when I'm full. I drinks lots of water. reading all comments here I think I'm lucky as I have no side effects. I highly recommend this drug after consulting with your doctor.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on wegovy no for 5 months, and I have lost almost 50 pounds. My doctor started me out on the lowest dosage, and now I'm on the highest dosage. The only bad thing is that I stay nauseous all the time, and the next 2 days after taking the injection, I would throw up, even if I haven't ate anything, I would throw up the wegovy medicine I think, because it would be yellowish stuff coming up, and it has a weird taste. But on the 3rd day, and after, I just be nauseous, and I can't really eat anything, and if I eat to much, I would throw it up. I asked my doctor if he could prescribe me something for the nausea, and he did. So yes the side effects are terrible, but I am very pleased with my results, and no exercise is needed.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: So I just took this last week and my cravings have stopped and feel full.  No nausea or diarrhea.  Feeling hopeful.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started this journey with Wegovy late August this year.  It's now just about 3.5 months later and I've lost 20LBs.  Some times I get headaches and a wave of nausea but really just around when I take the shot.  It passes quickly and the health benefits of having lost 20lbs so far exceeds the mild side effects.  At 5"3" and in my 40s as nothing else has worked...  The one impact is really not eating as much and believe me when I say I'm an eater so it's just been a bit of a mental adjustment notbeing able to eat as much at meal time.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Been on Wegovy for 5 months. Lost 10 pounds.  Nausea and diarrhea prevail. Disappointing.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I've been on WeGovy for two months. I've lost maybe 3 pounds. The side effects for me include constipation, heart burn and nausea.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This medication is the only one to work so far. I’ve lost 41lbs and I just started my first week on 2.4mg. It started slow on .25mg dowses, not always losing those weeks, but got better with the .5mg dose and the 1.0mg dose is where I really noticed the benefits. No cravings (as someone who craves a lot before). Most days I don’t have side effects. Occasionally, the day after the shot I would have some nausea and I’d just take an anti-nausea pill and feel better shortly after. I also some constipation, so I just have to be mindful of taking something for that when it happens.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Wegovy is the only medication that worked wonders for my weight loss journey.  I been taking Wegovy for 5 months and without exercise I have lost 32 lbs.  It has helped curb my sweet tooth and my desire to make unhealthy food choices.  When I eat sweets or sugary drinks I do get nauseated.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: On my 5th week of 1.0 and have had great results, down 18lbs and fitting in shirts I haven’t been able to wear for years.   Makes me feel a little blah first day after taking but I feel like I have so much more willpower and sometimes will make a meal that I just decide to skip altogether.  Very happy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: This stuff has made me feel so bad(sick! Terrible abdominal pain, nauseous, gassy) , not a way to loose weight.... Please try something different.... Not worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’m in my 5th month and I’m down 40 pounds. I’ve gone from a size 12 to a size 6. The medicine is doing it’s job. It’s extremely easy to use. I’ve been ahead of the curve and haven’t had any issues getting it. The downside are the side effects.  Nausea has been my number one problem. Overall I’m extremely pleased.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
This is my 6th week, currently on the .5mg dose after graduating successfully from the .25mg for 4 weeks. I've already lost a combined 15lbs in the 6wk period. I did experience severe nausea, vomiting and diarrhea for one whole day during the 6th week, which was honestly painful to experience, but that is the most common side effect as the body is getting used to it and telling your brain to stop eating profusely, otherwise you will throw up!

The injection is painless as I take it on my thighs.I highly recommend it after consultation with your doctor.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
The nausea is debilitating. I was ok till I hit 3rd week at .50 but now I can barely get out of bed I’m so nauseas. Trying to work through it with doctor suggested remedies. They work somewhat but this is really hard.
On the positive end…I have lost 25 lbs in 2 months.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Ive been in this for 5 weeks lost 2 pounds????

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: It's definitely making me lose weight, but only because I can't stop vomiting and having diarrhea. I've dropped 22lbs, but I'm miserable and can barely function between trips to the bathroom.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I took my first injection on 11-22-21 5pm, other than mild heartburn my week was uneventful for side effects but with Thanksgiving my eating habits were not the best, I did however manage to lose 3.5lbs. I took my second yesterday at 5pm at about 10 pm I started having anxiety and weird painless muscle spasms all over and a wave of nausea but eventually i fell asleep and woke up fine. My bowel habits have been pretty normal but i take Magnesium 500mg at night. I eat but still feel hungry after despite eating a whole meal and being protein conscious. Its too soon to tell if its working I think bc I ate Thanksgiving dinner for days but back on track so we shall see. I have read that most ppl are having trouble with side effects but so far pretty minimal.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: HAIR LOSS.  I started the highest level of Wegovy 10 days ago - 2.4 mg.  I almost immediately developed a skin sensitivity on my back.  Not itchy, no rash but just felt like I had a sunburn.  Honestly, I thought it was the starch in the shirt I had on.  It has remained for the past 10 days.  A few days after that started, I noticed that I had no hair on my legs - none at all.  None on my arms or underarms.  Honestly, I cannot pinpoint the day I noticed this development, but it was definitely noticeable after I hit the highest dosage.  I was freaked out - super concerned I would lose the hair on my head which at the moment, does not look any thinner.  I just got back from a dermatologist this morning and brought all the prescriptions I take.  When I pulled out the Wegovy box, he exclaimed, "that is so interesting.  I got two calls from PCPs last week that said their patients on Wegovy had small bald spots on their scalp."  He didn't know what dosage they were on.  He said he is going to contact the manufacturer to report these reported side effects.  He looked at my legs under a special magnifying glass.   He said that the hair follicles were not scarred - the hair was visible but not above the surface.  This would seem to indicate it will grow back.  He looked at my scalp and said it was healthy so, not thinning at the moment.  JUST A WARNING TO ALL.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This is absolutely the best medication I have ever taken for weight loss. I have virtually no side effects other than loss of appetite. Typically I can't finish a plate of food.  I eat some and then a switch sorta flips and I'm done.  I've never had that sensation before and I have tried pretty much everting including gastric bypass. I have been on it since August and I've lost 26 pounds. Typically my weight stalls at about 15 lbs.   I am eating a healthy diet, walking and drinking a lot of water.  I feel wonderful.  I am currently on 1.7 mg.  I find the injections easy.  My fear is what will happen when I quit taking it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started on 2.4; 4 days ago and experienced vomiting nausea and abdominal pain. Today I have zero appetite incredible pain will most likely see a doctor today. I lost 10 lbs from water weight and not eating. Most of all I’m just disgusted and ashamed that I paid this much this stuff, the discounts are a joke

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am on my 3rd dose and have lost 11lbs—thrilled!! I noticed all the typical side effects right away but all were mild and manageable.  Best thing this med has done for me is severely curbed my constant thought of food—for me almost a constant obsession…for me, controlling my eating is much easier when the place in my brain that causes me to obsess over it is regulated. Hunger severely diminished and fel full very quickly after eating small amounts and notice nausea if I overeat or eat too muchsugar..if this med continues to work for me it will be a godsend. Have not exercised much since starting but planning to up my game this coming week.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I just took my 1st dosage of the ,25. I feel nauseated & sick to my stomach & feel blah. I will keep everyone updated.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on wegovy for 3 months going on my fourth month. I have lost 6 pounds. Very discouraging. This week I'm starting on 1.70. I'm so sick. I'm nauseated, vomiting. Don't feel good. Just blah. I had some how ended up with extra .25 so after a week I added that to my 1 mg. I cut my intake of food to more than 1/2. I don't understand. The weight should be melting off. Am I not eating enough?? I don't crave sweets anymore which is a bonus! I don't snack or munch on junk food. Wish I had answers.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve been on wegovy for 4 weeks and have lost 16lbs so far. I have little to no symptoms with only slight nausea. My appetite has cut in half and I’m less inclined to over eat. I physically can’t! I’m ecstatic of the results and hope to see the weight keep shedding.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Took my first shot last night . Let’s just say that I got serious nausea and felt like vomiting. I thought it was cause of our dinner and food poisoning. Turns out after all that and being able to sleep I woke up and have been have some of the same symptoms. Sucky part is I can not keep anything down . I tired drinking green tea and not even 20 minutes later I had to throw it up . Had some madeleines vomit aswell. I looked up and realized the side effects are what I’m having but it hit me so hard this morning that I had to call into work because I didn’t want them thinking I had covid symptoms and send me home . 

Fingers crossed I get over this little rough patch because I wanna be able to try this new adventure because I’ve had trouble losing weight for years .

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am on my 4th month at 1.7 of wegovy. I have had minimal side effects including nausea and constipation. Some diarrhea as well on and off. However, I have stuck to it and lost 43 pounds which has improved my health and self esteem. I would and have recommended it to many friends and coworkers. It got started when the coupon offer was available however it has since gone away. I am concerned when I stop in a few weeks. It has really helped to keep my appetite reduced. I have learned to eat less but I don’t want to gain the weight back.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: started my first .25 dose this week- yesterday ...so far a little nausea but other then that no other side effects. Wondering how quick the weight will come off.... as far as eating I really don't have the need just feel blah. Any comments on your experience would be great :)

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: On my 4th week of .25.  Lost nothing, might even have gained a pound.  The weight is like glue on me.  I am on a calorie restrictive diet so I am not overeating.  I am on thyroid meds, the initial reason why I gained 30lbs. so not sure that is the reason why it's not workingl  Anyone else having the same result?

What I find hilarious about Wogovy and similar meds that are touted as a great way to lose weight is the fact that they make you feel like crap, and THAT'S the way they make you lose weight. Lol. Nobody will tell you this beforehand, however. I have had only one dose, so the jury is out in whether this actually works for me, but I have been dizzy and woozy since starting it. I'd better get over that, or I'm done.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Giving myself the shot is stressful; it is not painful you just have to push the pen so hard it creates anxiety. I started at .25 for a month and am on .5 for one and a half months and was nauseous for a month. I found taking the shot at night has helped with that. I have lost 12 pounds and It curbs my appetite like nothing else has, I no longer crave sweets or snacks; I am not waking up in the middle of the night to get a snack which been amazing! I do have headaches even lightheaded but that is caused from not eating.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started Wegovy on Aug 17th, so I'm 3 months in and have lost 25lbs.  I'm currently on 1.7 doses for this month. I've not changed anything in my lifestyle.  I will say that Wegovy helps me crave only nutritious foods and drinks.  It's totally changed my taste buds.  What that means is some foods/drinks i used to enjoy, i no longer crave and in fact, I now dislike them.  No more coffee for me at all.  No more sweets, chocolates, etc.  I seriously had an addiction to chocolate kisses and now justthe sight of them makes me slightly nauseous. I don't really exercise either, so like I said my weight loss is all Wegovy.  I have a minor side effect of nausea but it's mostly when i wake up in the morning.  How can anyone complain with these kind of results? I love Wegovy!  Happy weight loss everyone!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started last Friday, I am ok Saturday but Sunday night star my diarrhea, bloating and burping for 2 day, after that happen I am feeling so tired and so fatigue; when eating something immediately go to the toilet, all night like that . Stop now but I lost my appetite and I tired. I have high blood pressure,Rheumatoid Arthritis and fibromyalgia and I take a lot 7 different pills every day for my diseases . I decided not take anymore wegovy , because I do not liked lost weight like that. Thanks.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This medication has worked wonders for me. I am irritable and notice heartburn and headaches if I don't eat (since this curbs hunger and cravings). I am on my second round of .5 mg after three weeks at .25 mg. I accidentally took a 1 mg dose instead of the .5 dose. Anyone else do this? Any reactions?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Overall Wegovy has been one of the best weight loss tools I have ever used. However, those that are using this or considering using this need to understand just that, it is only a tool. Wegovy has allowed me to feel fuller almost every single day, without eating 1/2 of what I put on my plate. I am on my 2nd dose of .5 (about 6 weeks) and have lost 18 lbs. I do a lot of cardio, but I also love the gym. I feel nauseous if I eat too much or too much of something with too much sugar or fat. I feel this is teaching me how to eat better. Good luck to everyone using this product and to those that might choose this route for their own health.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I'm on my 4th dose of the .25 & only lost 8 pds. Its seems to be working, I found out that drinking beer is a NO GO for me. I havnt had any major problems with. I'm not as hungry as I thought I would be.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I am only two weeks in but seeing definite results. I have lost 10 lbs in 2 weeks with a combination of Wegovy, exercise, and a 1200 cal/day diet. I've noticed that Wegovy has curbed my appetite BIG TIME which is helpful since I've cut my intake in half. 
Some negative side effects I've been experiencing are:
1. constipation
2. headache
3. slight hair loss (this may be more from the reduced cal diet vs Wegovy)
I feel good though and I can't wait to give an update in a month or two!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I just started the 1.0 MG dose. I haven't had any trouble at all, except 1 night of horrible heartburn... that's it. I have a very large numb area on my left thigh from when I was pregnant, so I have no issues with taking the injection lol. So far, after 9 injections I've lost 30 lbs. I haven't gotten a whole lot of energy back yet... I'll be glad when it does.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am on week 5 on 0.5 injections and don’t notice that I am any less hungry. Lost 2 pounds. I eat just as much as I did before stating the medication so it is not working well for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: No carvings at all. Im able to stick to eating under 1200 calories per day. Doesn't hurt. Mouth nausea dissipates after about a month 3rd Month in...171-150. I love it

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy for almost 3 weeks now and have lost 8lbs. I had a baby in January 2021 and have had the hardest time losing the weight. The only side effect that I have had is a little constipation, other than that- this has been a life saver!! I will continue to update everyone as I take the medication. My goal is to lose 30lbs to get down to my pre-pregnancy weight! I am currently at 183lbs.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
Wegovy has been great for me July20th was my start day and my weight was 206. I'm able to get my medication for 25$ each month. I did experience some nausea and  feeling quizzy no vomiting. Yes it has been difficulty to get the dose of medication from pharmacies when you need it but my pharmacist has been great about looking around and getting it to me in time for increase. However when i increased to 1mg my body could not handle it , I became nervous on the inside and not eating hardly any food. The taste of most foods I love and have been eating  for years no longer taste the same therefore I don't have a taste for anything so my provider switch me back down to the 0.5 and I'm am doing great. As of today 11/2/21  my weight is 183. 

                                                                         Happy with Wegovy!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on ozempic for weight loss since May. I have lost 40 lbs. after getting through side effects over the first month.  I am currently at 1mg/week but want to increase my dose to 1.5.  As everyone knows, this drug is very expensive.  I have a couple of cartridges containing .5 or just 1mg. My question for anyone with any knowledge or experience: can I inject .5 of one pen and 1mg from another to bring my dose to where it needs to be?  I will not discard any of this medication! Any information would be appreciated. Thank you!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Just completed my 12th week injection and I’m down 32 lbs so far! I spent one month at .25 and two at .5. Moving up to 1mg next week. Did experience bad nausea for a while, so my Dr prescribed Zofran and I take one pill before the injection and I don’t have any issues now. Definitely cuts my hunger/cravings way down. I focus on eating clean/lean proteins, fruit/veg, dairy (Greek yogurt) and very few grains. I’m diligent about checking labels and learned early on not to cheat. This medication will let you know fast if it doesn’t like something you ate and you won’t forget.  Been working with a Dietitian and she really helped me with making smart food choices. Exercising one day a week with a trainer and hoping to increase that soon. Weighing myself daily which has really helped.  I can tell how my body responds to any new foods this way. I first tried getting the medication at CVS and Walgreens and they weren’t able to get it. My local CVS still can’t (asked them recently). I use an independent local pharmacy now and they have no issues getting it. Go figure. Briefly used the coupon code, which was great, but my insurance has authorized paying for it, so that’s even easier.  If you are committed to eating properly/exercising I would definitely recommend Wegovy.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This semiglutide has worked wonders for me.   My sugar cravings are non existent.   I'm drawn to vegetables and lean Mears.   I've lost 15 pounds in a little over 3 weeks.   "Game changer" for sure!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have taken this medication (.25) for one month.  I have had no adverse side effects.  I still enjoy food, but just feel full much more quickly and for a longer period of time than usual.  I needed to lose about 30 pounds and have lost 8 pounds in the past month. The only complaint I have is that it took over a month for any pharmacy in my area to get it in stock, and now I can’t get a refill.  I paid $374 out of pocket for one month.  My insurance didn’t cover any of it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: On my 10th week have lost 30lbs. It really helped with appetite control.  I feel like I am making better nutrition choice. I eat small snacks with high protein.  I do get nauseous the day after my injection and have trouble drinking water just switched to non sugar flavored.. I set a timer to make sure I am getting enough fluids to prevent the headaches.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Took for weight loss. Lost 23 pounds in 2 months but then not only did I not lose, I started to be hungry all the time. Nausea started. Discontinued. Disappointed.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I’m up to 1.7 mg dosage and the experience was great until I reached 1.5. Diarrhea and bloating completely took over. I’ll stay on it to see if perhaps that was just that’s dosage. 
The cost without the coupon is in the thousands but if you have the coupon your total cost is $25. My PPO insurance does not cover it and I think $25 is a great price. To be clear it’s $25 total and not $25 off.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have started very slowly — ozempix in the .25 dose for 8 weeks and then the Wegovy at .50 dose for 8 weeks. I have experienced acid reflux and diarrhea but not terrible. And I have lost 20 pounds in 3 months. I have no desire for food, but when I do eat, I feel drawn to carbs! If it wasn’t for the fact I was feeding a house full of men three meals a day, I probably wouldn’t eat a thing all day. As it is, I sit down with them and pick. It’s worked like a charm and I don’t feel at all deprived.Since I have hit a weight loss plateau my doc is upping my dose this month to the 1.0 .

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Today was my first day.  Discovered have hashimoto's thyroiditis and that is why I have gained 40 pounds in the past year. I took shot at 12pm and it is 5pm and I dont feel well at all, dizzy, lightheaded, chest tingling and dry mouth, I do not do well with most meds but praying they subside because the weight loss is definitely needed for health reasons.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Doc Gave me 2.4 mg first dose and violently throwing up for 3 days straight.  lost 16 lbs in that week and in bed for 7 days. Second dose 2nd week bloated, gas high B/P ! 3rd week more the same as second week.  Constipation! gastric slow down! Overall disappointed ! I stopped taking it.  Not for me.   FDA should never had approved such a dangerous drug! Join the gym !

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: so far I have lost 14 pounds in 10 days. The only side effects I have had are a mild headache, but do feel fatigued. But thrilled with the results and know that pace can't continue but need to keep trying

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started wegovy yesterday 10/17/21, Hoping for positive results. I did not yesterday night that I had alot of gas.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The third month really increases the effectiveness however, the fatigue and Nausea is almost unbearable.  I asked my doc to go back to month two for a bit

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Can anyone help me? I don’t think I’m fully getting the pen to work- I’ve tried twice and the medication just pours out on the ground after I think I am done!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have not had many side effects thankfully. I lost five pounds right away,  but 10 weeks in I have not lost any weight or seen any changes in my appetite.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’ve struggled with some vomiting and diarrhea, but noticed that not eating within 5 hours of bedtime, and truly not eating even a bite more when I start to feel full, is the way to avoid vomiting. (I read about bariatric surgery recovery and adapted accordingly.) I struggled with a bit of nausea initially, but now I take Dramamine ahead of the injection and it’s helped a lot. I started on the .5 mg dose and am up to 1 mg, and have lost 25 lbs since Sept 1.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Occasional nausea, but passes quickly. I have lost 3.5 lbs this first week. No real problems at all, injection is easy, in the side of my thigh. Wegovy defiantly helps curb cravings and appetite. Going to keep going as it seems to work well.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review:
I got violently ill from taking Wegovy. I had all the side effects nausea, diarrhea, vomiting, constipation, stomach  pain, headache, tiredness , upset stomach, dizziness, feeling bloated, belching, gas, and heartburn.
I was in the ER 2 times in 24 hours for severe dehydration, non stop throwing up and migraine.
Thankfully the vomiting has stopped but now I have diarrhea.
The cost of the medicine and copay for 2 ER visits have cost me almost $500. 
All this was after my first dose of the medicine. Now I have to dispose of 3 months of this stuff.
Very expensive lesson learned.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Had sever vomiting and headaches the first week but then slowly recovered. I have lost 20 lbs in 7 weeks. Has everyone upped their dosage as described in the materials or remained on the same dosage?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am happy for everyone that is having great results with this but i, unfortunately, did not. I stopped after week 5 because I had gained 18 pounds and was having terrible migraines. Instead of feeling fuller I kept feeling like no matter how much I ate I was still hungry. In an odd and possibly unrelated twist, I have non diabetic hypoglycemia and while taking this my blood sugar was constantly low, I’m talking in the 40s and 50s after eating a healthy meal. The only way to deal with that is toeat so this was a disaster for me all the way around.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I was started on the o.5mg dose and the nausea started about 2 hours later. I threw up about 6 times throughout the night and had severe nausea with tapering vomiting the following 3 days. I started to feel a little better the day prior to taking my second dose. Again, severe nausea for about 2 days, difficulty concentrating and very dehydrated. I’ve lost 15 pounds in 10 days. I spoke with my doctor who recommended that I go down to the 0.25mg dose for a month but can’t get the medication at thepharmacy due to supply issues. I’m now 2 days past when I should have taken it and back to throwing up again. I won’t be taking this again.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review:
I think I have tons of side effects. Nausea and vomiting for up to 4 days. Feeling better day before next dose.  Also, food sits on stomach for days leaving me with horrible gas and bloating. Alternate between Diarrhea and Constipation. 
I too have had trouble getting the meds in a timely manner.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took the highest dose and have been vomiting for over a week. So I’m losing weight but I’m so, so, so sick. Its been completely debilitating. It’s just not worth it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I'm so sick , can't stop throwing  up, it's been 1 week since my 1st dose, just got my 2 dose, was on ozempic  before for about 2 months,  down 40 pounds,

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Just started treatment. Had a fair amount of Nausea the first 4 days after injection; then it started to ease off. Lost about 4 pounds this first week, but made other dietary changes too (quit drinking alcohol, juice, sodas). Think the medicine made it easier to avoid those things (seemed to have more willpower to resist).  Next injection is approaching and I'm worried I will be nauseated again. Plan to go ahead with it though (hopefully that side effect is temporary).

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The pharmacies are having difficulty getting the drug from there supplier's so I might go 1 or 2 weeks between refills.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I’ve been taking it 2 1/2 months really no side effects and I’ve lost about 18 pounds I’m just really upset that they’re having supply problems especially once you start something you don’t want to stop and try to go back again.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Terrible vomiting, blood pressure through the roof 190/110 for more than 24 hrs so far.  Had to go to ER.  Dehydrated too.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: So far down 44lbs in 6 months. Thats nearly 8 per.  Could not be happier - hunger practically gone. Eating so much less, and what’s better, not constantly thinking about my next meal!  The hard thing is making sure you can get it. So popular, manufacture is having a hard time filling stock!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am on week#7 and down 15 pounds.  I walked an average of 13,000 to 15,000 steps Monday through Friday and on the weekend I average 20,000 steps.  I’m on the third .50 dosage.  I drink around 180 oz to 210 oz of water a day.  I use to drink half-half sweet tea all day and water at night.  It has cut back my appetite and no cravings for anything sweet.  I give the shot in my left arm since I have a phobia of sticking a needle in my stomach or leg.  The arm is so easy and it doesn’t hurt.  I would recommend this for sure.  The more you work out or walk, the better the results!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started on the 0.25 injection in July. No side effects, no weight gain or loss. Then had to wait 3 weeks to get the refill for the next dose of 0.5. I just took the first dose of it 4 days ago and I haven't been able to keep anything down at all. I eat a little bit and 20 minutes later it all comes up. I can't keep going like this. It is severe projectile vomiting. On the bright side, I did lose 3 pounds, but i don't want to lose it like this. My throat burns from vomiting so much, I've had amigraine, and I'm afraid to eat anything and i don't know how long it'll take for this medication to leave my body.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Insurance won’t cover and out of pocket is $3500- the coupon that is offered is a discount for $25! Big deal! I’ll have my NP switch back to an affordable pill option. Don’t waste your money nor your time.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am on week four and I take 2mg. Since I have gallbladder problems I expected to have some issues and I did but drinking apple cider in my water and taking magnesium helped a lot. All of those symptoms went away at week four. I love wegovy. It really takes away my sugar cravings and my appetite. In fact, food was all I use to think of. Now, I have completely lost interest in it. I have diabetes and thyroid disease, so it's really hard for me to lose weight, but for the first time, I am hopeful.Now that food has lost its charm, I am looking for something else to occupy my time. ;D

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm on my 3 injection and I've lost 6 pounds. My only issue is I have sever constipation. But overall, taking the injection is not bad at all. I hope I begin to see more weight loss.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Completed week 9 shot 1mg. I have been so sick, from the start. Vomiting, horrible constipation, burps, throat burn, acid reflux bad, just sick sick sick. I have lost a little weight but this is not worth being sick and not being able to do a thing.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I began 5 weeks ago. 10lbs down, no side effects. My craving for sweets were gone. Major problem, you can not get a refill. No pharmacy has it. Back ordered til September 30. So my Dr. has prescribed me something else til it gets in.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Ease of use?  How can it be easy to use when availability is inconsistent.  It has been a struggle to get prescription filled every month with it taking 4 weeks before first prescription filled after moving prescription to several pharmacies.  Now after dose 8 I’m faced with 7 weeks before dose 1.0 is available on October 31. Does stopping the progression of doses raise flags of concern for the anybody but me?  Lost about 7 lbs.  Good appetite suppressant.  Sweets are too sweet.  Definite side effect of messing with my mind and moods. I’m wondering if stopping wegovy cold turkey is going to cause more of these unwanted side effects.
The only issue I have with this drug is getting it filled.  The pharmacies are having difficulty getting the drug from there supplier's.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just took week 4. The side effect I have experienced the most is gas. I started drinking chamomile tea to help with it. Just like many of you, my sweet cravings have stopped. I have little to no appetite.  I noticed that if I do get a headache it's because I haven't eaten and once I eat the headache goes away. I do drink lots of water. I'm due for the higher dose next week and I'm hoping that the side effects remain tolerable. The needle itself is small, for those of you wondering it's like anepi-pen, slight sting but that's it.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just did my 6th injection yesterday. I have lost 7lbs and 30 inches all over. This has definitely cut back my appetite and sometimes I have to remind myself to eat. I am also eating much less at meals so I made up snack boxes this week to make sure I eat a healthy snack that is low calorie. The only problem I have found is eggs taste and smell funny to me. I have asked my family if they noticed eggs tasting funny and they said no so I know it's me with this medication. I also noticed that thesmell I get with eggs is now stuck in my nose. It's like a sulfur smell. Overall this medication is working and very easy to use. I do the injection in my thighs just switch each week.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Weeks 1-4 on 0.25.  Hunger diminished, exercising regularly, riding my bike daily.  Week 5 I started .5 and that's where this story unfortunately will end.   I cannot explain how sick I am.    I've had a hiatal hernia which is dormant for 20 or more years, I take nexium daily.   It's I describable how sick I've been.   Vomiting, diarrhea, sulphur burps, queasy stomach, feels like a brick is on my sternum.    Cannot lie down, burning bile backs up.   Today would have been my sixth shot, second st.5.  Instead of taking it, I'm googling how long it will take for this stuff to leave my system.    My diet is very low calorie, 500 or under, with that and exercise, I lost 11 lbs over five weeks.  After the horrific reaction, three lbs more came off but that's because of artificial weight loss although I would have lost a bet if I'd have bet no human being can expell that much material in one day.  I've never been this sick.  E VER.   So I'm going to stop now because I think the lesson is beware if you have a hiatal hernia.   It definitely was effective but I know it had very bad consequences for me. Nothing helped.   I found myself searching my cabinets for leftover Zantac, that's how much I just wanted to disappear.    Cannot lie down, aches everywhere.   Bye bye for me

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I began taking Wegovy 5 weeks ago. I started on the .25 dose and now am on the 1.0 dose. I have lost 10 pounds and my only side effect was some constipation   I’m taking Linzess twice a week to alleviate that. I am so happy with Wegovy. I have tried everything on the market snd this has been the only thing that works for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Within 2 days of taking this medicine, I began vomiting, this continued for 2 days,unable to keep anything down,dehydrated, by the time that I went to hospital, kidneys were at 26% function, and I was in ketoacidosis,spent 3 days in icu

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 0.25mg on 8/26/21 weighing in at 198.6lbs. I have been eating low calorie since then which has been easy to do because my appetite has decreased dramatically! I am super surprised because today I am down 5.4lbs! The only side effect so far is very mild nausea which comes and goes but is very manageable. I would definitely recommend this medication for weight loss! I also want to add that I have struggled with PCOS for years which has made weight loss very difficult.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Week 2 of wegovy I got appendicitis and had to have surgery to have my appendix out. I'm not sure what to do, the wegovy was working for sure! I'm MUCH less hungry! But I'm also scared that I may get pancreatitis next as it's also a common complication of wygovy?? I'm calling my Dr Monday to discuss this. Sitting in the hospital now revering from surgery??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started at .5mg no real nausea, I would have a few bouts of the runs the first week. However I had gastric bypass a few years back so my stomach is always off. Yet this didn’t make it any worse. Has taken urges away to snack and really simply eat. I don’t feel terribly full yet could be because I have a small stomach to begin with and I eat small meals to begin with. First week only threw up once. Second week no issues and now into my third week. I am disappointed in the weight loss so far in 18days only lost 4.4 pounds and that is eating average 600 calories per day, keeping carbs under 80 per day and working out 3-4x per week. I was truly hoping for a jump in my weight loss.  I feel ready to move onto 1.0 after my 4th shot.  the shot itself I don’t even feel it I jsur feel the pressure of the pen kn my thigh which I recommend upper thigh. as for the benefits I cannot see. I am barely pre diabetic 5.7 A1c and this medicine hasn’t caused me to have low blood sugar that I can tell, even with keeping to under 80g carbs per say. So I hope this is helping my pancreas and getting me out of the ore diabetic zone for good. My insurance doesn’t cover and I have the discount savings card from Novo for six months which I understand they stopped for anyone new after 8-16 but I am able to get 5 more month supplies. There is a shortage and I had to call around and luckily found a pharmacy a bit far to fill my 1.0 box. More to follow when i move onto 1.0

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: This is the end of my second week on Wegovy.  I have lost about 7 lbs and quite happy with those results. The first day of injection has been the worse for me accompanied with an annoying headache. I sometimes felt mild acid reflux and nausea that I normally calm with a soda and crackers. I endure dry mouth along with an irritating bitter or nasty taste in my mouth. Other times, I just feel off kilter and can't identify a specific symptom. But I am really concerned about my fatigue which I feltmore the second week.  I noticed only a few people mentioned that side affect. My appetite has largely diminished. (Actually, the joy of craving a particular food and satisfying that craving is done). When I do, eat pretty much anything will do. With busy 12 hour work days, I often don't eat at all.
