I conclude that may be attributing to the lethargy. I have succumbed to drinking pedialyte regularly and intend on drinking more water. I am getting through the day OK but can't wait to lie down when I get home (unusual for me). A few co-workers have commented on my lack of energy and luster, so to speak.  Perhaps Week 3 will be better.  I'm fighting to endure the "cons" for the desired result.  I get married in November and would love to be about 30-40 lbs lighter for the wedding. If I happen to reach that goal, I will probably refrain from taking it and work hard to keep the weight off.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’m currently on my 6th dose at .5mg. So far I’ve lost 11 lbs with no exercise. The needle is very small and I can hardly feel it. I’m injecting into my thigh. Pros: I’m not hungry at all so I have to force myself to eat. When I do eat I eat very little. Cons: I get really nauseated especially on day of injection and day after. The other days are more tolerable. Every now and then I experience some heartburn which subsides with over the counter meds. All in all the drug is working! I can deal with the minor side effects as long as I’m getting great results. Im eating a lot less and losing weight as a result. I will try to incorporate exercise this week to speed up the weight loss. ??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Hi everyone, I am 33 years old and weigh 240. I have been on Wengovy for two weeks and just started my 3rd week today. I have lost 5 pounds since I started the medication. The only side effects I have noticed is gas and that is only a day or two after the injection. (On belly) the injection itself does not hurt. I find that it gives me a bit more energy throughout the day. I do notice that eating sugar or things that contain any sugar like fruit make me nauseous along with over eating. But I still do get very hungry throughout the day. I find that I cannot eat as much as before starting this medication. I have changed my diet and started walking on a daily basis.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: My PCP prescribed this fiord me and finally after 3 weeks my pharmacy got it in.   I am so reluctant to start this after reading the side effects.    I need to loose weight so bad.  Hoping I will get the nerve up to take the first dose!  A ny advice will be appreciated!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started Wegovy 4 weeks ago and lost nothing. Then Pen is irritating because you have to push hard to inject. Wish it worked for me.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am new to this and have only been on it one day. I lost 2.5 over night. Hope it continues. I feel less hungry and have a bit of heartburn but an antiacid helped. I am hopeful for progress toward my goal.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm in Chicago and cannot get a prescription anywhere - I need the second cycle (0.5) but can't get any that or the third cycle.   My doctor gave me the first cycle.  From this forum, seems like everyone is able to get the prescription filled.  Anyone having the same issue?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: The pen to administer is terrible.  Have to push very hard into injection site to get it to click.  If I'm pushing into fat in stomach area can push inches deep with no click triggered.  the clicks are loud and obnoxious, the injection hurts   When to pull away from injection site is not clear because the second click is NOT when to pull away.  if giving on upper arm, hard to see yellow bar. the saxenda injections were SO much easier,  I give the Wegovy pen an D-

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started wegovy in May, I am now about to start my 2.4 mg injections I AM DOWN 33 LBS, no major side effects, just not hungry.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started out on .25 dose and lost 8 pounds in 3 weeks The last 4 weeks I have lost an additional 6 pounds. I am just not that hungry so my portion sizes are way down. And if I overeat I am punished with feeling too full for hours after. I had some nausea and diarrhea the first week. But now no noticeable side effects. This has been a miracle for me. Bumping up the dose to .5 next week.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Just do not feel cravings nor inability to avoid hunger.  Don't understand how, but really don't care.  Week 3 of .25 injections, hope keep moving in same direction.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Sorry to post here, but I am hoping to get advice from those who have started taking Wegovy.  How did you find a qualified doctor to start the process?  Did you just use your standard family doctor or did you locate someone with specific knowledge of Wegovy?  If the latter, how did you find them?  I tried Novo Nordisk, but they were unable to refer to anyone local (St Paul, MN).    Any help would be appreciated.  Thanks.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I am currently on week 2 of the .25 dosage and what I’ve found is that I am simply not as interested in eating as I normally would be, and eat significantly less at each meal. I’ve also found it easier to bypass the candy bowl at work. I’ve made no changes to exercise or to the types of foods I eat, yet I have managed to lose 4 pounds in 1.5 weeks. I did find that if I eat  my dinner too late, I end up throwing it up, but that’s the only side effect I’ve seen. I don’t mind it, because it servesas a behavior modifier. I also seem to have boundless energy, but that may only be coincidental. I’m extremely pleased with my experience.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Just stuck myself today with the week 5 at .5.  Previous four weeks were at .25. Injections have been totally painless.  No nausea.  So unpleasant side effects.  The main effect is that I am just rarely hungry and it does not take much for me to feel full when I do eat.  Only lost a couple of pounds so far.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on Wegovy two weeks now...I started out with the .5 dose since getting the .25 was impossible. My first shot, I did have vomiting about 8 hours later and nausia the first day. However, food intake is way down. The full feeling has really helped me cut out snacking. I am drinking lots of water ( 96 ounces plus a day) and I am sure the first week was a lot of water weight loss, but 8.8 pounds the first week. I have upped my exercise game to ensure I continue the downward trend. No sideeffects so far with the second shot. I make sure I drink a protein drink.I doubt week 2 will be as good as week one, but reading these reviews it seems I am doing really well in just the first week.   For a person that has struggled and stressed about weight gain my whole life, this simple shot has changed my outlook and I do believe lossing the weight is gonna happen. I am super pumped as I take the 6 month journey ( that $25 card) and see where this goes.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just started on my second week of the .5mg dose. I haven't experienced any nausea, vomiting or abdominal pain. The first symptom I noticed was a headache while on the .25mg dose. Second was the decreased appetite and the feeling of fullness after consuming very little. I have also experienced belching, but the most significant side effect has been the overwhelming feeling of fatigue for the first few days after dosing.I started on Wegovy on 7/21/21 after a 3 week delay due to insufficient supply. I have lost 8lbs overall so far. I am happy to continue on the course!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I'm on week number 5 of the wegovy ..the first 2 week's were horrible fatigue nausea diarrhea and gassy had no energy to do anything....my Dr gave me some nausea meds so I wud give myself a shot then take a pill right away and tht helped tremendously!!! Im on week 5 now with the 2.4 dose and just a little fatigue no other symptoms overall i have lost 10lbs!! So I'm very happy and thts with little to no exercise....I do have to force myself to eat thou..im always full...Im also a type 2 diabeticand I have not had to take any insulin or any diabetic meds since I have started this medication...my average sugar are 99 now...sometimes I go as low as 70 and 80's I use the Libre and it gives u an overall of how your sugars are...so far thus is working for me so yeaaaa!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I first started taking this I was sick as a dog. But I started drinking gingerale and it helped tremendously with my nausea. The second week was good still no craving for sweets I lost 7lbs at the end of wk 2. Week 3 I can tell that my craving are beginning to come back and I only lost .4. I will definitely be taking .5 when it's time to switch doses. I'd rather deal with nausea if it means me losing weight in the right way especially with water aerobics and walking with ankle weights.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm 69 and have been overweight since menopause--very happy to have this opportunity.  I took my fourth injection yesterday and have lost 9 # so far.  I'm glad I did not read any of these reviews before starting.  I have had some nausea and fatigue, but I am continuing, and  overall  quite pleased.  I will talk to my doctor next week to get assistance with the nausea.  I have been able to continue my exercise regime even though I'm feeling more tired.   I am planning to do a second month at thesame .25 mg dose as it does not seem likely I will feel good enough on a higher dose.  My appetite has sharply diminished and really only want to eat twice a day--breakfast and dinner.  I am drinking lots of water due to increased thirst, and I have mostly curtailed my evening glass of wine.  I am hoping to continue to lose pounds on the lowest dose.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Started first dose on Thursday around 1pm, by 7pm nausea started and by 9 I started vomiting. The vomiting didn't stop, twice over night, in the morning, afternoon, etc... It's more Saturday morning and I'm still nauseated and still vomiting.  I can't keep down the smallest amounts of water.  I think the level of nausea was under played, when it was prescribed my doctor told me to sip some ginger ale to help.  We are way beyond ginger ale.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I did the first injection (in my stomach). I thought it was tolerable. I had nausea and a headache, but the worst was the fatigue. I did NOTHING for a week!  Extremely unlike me.  It took all of 7 days for the side effects to subside.  I did not do the second week...yet. I did lose 5lbs. I did not have an appetite. I just wanted to sleep. I have read some of the reviews.  I want to try the second dose after a week off from the side effects. I have not, just yet.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started yesterday .25 I am very very nauseous / heartburn I use to take heartburn medicine can I take it with this? or just take Tums?  will it ease up ?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I just started .5 yesterday. I’m down 10 pounds from the first 4 weeks. I was hoping for a greater drop but I’ll take it. Really struggle to get 1000 cal/day. No side effects what so ever. The shot is easy in my stomach (thanks to my fat ??). I take one 400 mg magnesium every night when I’m on a reduced diet so no constipation. My meal portions are so tiny. I try to do little snacks but seriously it is hard to get the calories for nutrition in.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I am a week into starting Wegovy. After reading reviews prior to starting I decided to inject into my thigh. Minimal pain at injection site once injection starts then it clears up. 1st day I had the feeling of overeating and

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I have been on the medication for 6 weeks. I've lost 10lbs. Have cut back my food craving and amount I eat.  Took 2nd week of .5mg was fine for about 6 hour and then I started having nausea, dizziness,fatigue, vomiting, headache, low blood sugar, fast heart rate and insomnia. I will not be taking the medication again. As much as I need help with weight loss it is not worth it. I have been in bed for 3 days and does not seem to be getting any better.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I have been on this for three weeks now.  I have had not much side effects, but haven't lost any weight either.  I am unsure if this is really going to do anything.  Maybe going to the 0.5 will be more effective?  I would love to know if anyone has had the same experience as me ?

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm on day 3  of .5mg and so far I'm very pleased with the results - I'm already down 7 pounds. The main side effect I've had is extreme moodiness, and other lesser side effects are malaise, gassy/bloating and light-headedness. I think the biggest issue I'll have on this medication is eating enough. I have set a timer to eat every two hours a really small snack because I'm just not hungry whatsoever! I will definitely keep posting my feedback and results. I feel very hopeful because I've tried everything to lose weight and absolutely nothing has worked. Thank you.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I'm on week seven at .5 mg.  I've lost 19 pounds.  I started walking on a treadmill as well.  My cravings have been greatly reduced.  Only slight side effects!!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Took my second shot yesterday. Didn't feel this one at all in thigh, first shot in stomach was painful. Side effects not as bad as I was fretting. No nausea! Bad constipation. Some headache and dizziness. Reduced appetite. Definitely not eating as much! Drinking lots of water. Down 5 pounds.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Coming up on a month. I’ve lost 10lbs so far. I have definitely cut my food intake. Feel full so fast! I experience nausea -and bad headaches here and there.Lately been feeling really fatigue (real bad) but trying to push through and drink more water. Barely feel injection and I love that! Will be taking higher dose next week. Hoping the side effects stay pretty minimal! But overall staying hopeful that I can shed all the weight off!

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: Extremely easy to use - barely felt injection if at all. I’ve been taking this for 2 1/2 weeks. Definitely have some constipation and bloating so that has been slightly uncomfortable. No cravings for sweets which was my biggest issue before starting Wegovy. Struggling to eat enough calories. I’ve been like that for the last several years but prior to Wegovy it was always carbs and sweets. I’ve only lost 2 lbs so far so I’m beginning to wonder if it’s even going to work for me ??

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Only my first week. Nausea/vomiting has been difficult. Recommend asking your Dr for nausea meds. Headache only first couple days. And fatigue. Recommend liquid/soft diet first week to help pass nausea and help constipation. Also, SMALL PORTIONS. Shot is easy peasy, no pain! It will take getting used to and figuring out how/what to eat to reduce symptoms. I've lost 10lbs in 6 days. DRINK LOTS OF WATER!! If you're serious about losing weight, the side affects are manageable.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started my injection last Saturday 7/24/2021- my ONLY complaint is that it took me 3 weeks and 4 pharmacies to find the first dose and despite all the appeals from myself and doctor, it will not be covered by my insurance :( I did get the 6 month card and that has been awesome, just hoping in 6 months I will be able to get the meds through insurance pay. I didn't even feel the shot at all, I put it in my upper left thigh- where I dont have much feeling anyway. I did get a slight headache later in the day, but nothing else. I woke up this morning w very little uneasiness to my stomach but it quickly went away. I was expecting the worst so this has been a blessing! I did youtube another person who is taking it and she was the same way and then the upped dosage next in line kicked her butt. I hope that isnt the case for me. I am down 5lbs since I started it, 3 of which happened overnight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took my 2nd injection 3 days ago and so far so good.  My doctor prescribed an anti-nausea medication but I really haven't needed it.  The only side effect so far is constipation. The injection is extremely easy to take and not a bit painful (read the instructions or watch the video on how to give yourself the injection).  My appetite has been greatly reduced on just the smallest dose.  I don't have the cravings for sugar that I had before.  I've lost 4.3 lbs in only 10 days.  I'm hoping to lose 30 lbs overall so this is a great start.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: My first shot was 7/15 second was 7/21. I have lost 9lbs to date. Weighing and measuring my food and monitoring carbs and sugars along with journaling my intake. No alcohol and have not eaten out yet.  The second shot was much easier on my stomach. Has anyone experienced big overnight weight loses? I lost 3 lbs overnight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I started this medication almost 4 weeks ago and will be increasing my dose with my next injection. I have been extremely happy so far  and have only had some very slight nausea and gas. I actually feel full, therefore I am definitely not as hungry and I have lost 7 lbs. The shots do not hurt at all, I can’t even really feel it. I am very optimistic and looking forward to losing more weight.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I’m on been on this medication for 3 weeks and so far so good. Very light side effects. I’m drinking lots of water. I’m not hungry at all. I start my 4th week next Wednesday.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: I took the first injection on a Monday and it’s Friday and I’m still sick. I was vomiting now I’m just nauseous and have fast heart rate and low blood pressure. I’ll never take another one.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: Day one , injected last night , the shot hurts like a mother .  woke up this am with waves of nausea which are a little better now at noon . I have no appetite , forced myself to eat one scrambled egg . Will update progress as we go along but I am optimistic . This needs to work as I am pre diabetic .

Condition: Weight Loss Management for an Obese Person
Textual Review: No side effects. Significant reduction in appetite. Injection simple to administer.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I've been taking this medication for two weeks now. Only side effect is mild nausea a few hours after injection, but no vomiting and it subsides fairly quickly. Makes me thirsty, I drink more water. My appetite is WAY less now and i eat way less, also. Not craving sweets or carbs. Absolute BEST weight loss medication on the market today! Preventative for weight related comorbidities such as diabetes and hypercholesterolemia, etc. The price is way too expensive, but hopefully over time it can beless than $100/mo. With the promotional discount card, it's $25/mo for 6 months max. Without insurance Wegovy and Saxenda are around $1400/mo, ridiculous prices.

Condition: Weight Loss Management for Overweight Person with BMI 27 to 29 and Weight-Related Comorbidity
Textual Review: I started only a week ago.  No side effects but appetite is way less.
